675914080.name: Very photogenic
675914080.author: a TripAdvisor user
675914080.reviewBody: Cute old town area. Easy to walk. It actually was far less touristy and busy than I expected such a colorful photogenic place to be. We were the only native English speaking tourists that we encountered.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

654160385.name: worth a stop in Campeche when you are visiting Mexico
654160385.author: a TripAdvisor user
654160385.reviewBody: The rich colors of the old city, its walls and colonial style provide a charm to relax. An extra is the multimedia video at the facade of the bibiotheca. Perfect to walk around, old colonial houses with relaxing patio, boutique hostels, little churches,

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

652651162.name: Picture Book Perfect
652651162.author: a TripAdvisor user
652651162.reviewBody:
Historic Campeche is too good to be true -pretty coloured buildings, old churches, stone walls, narrow streets, super clean, very very safe.  Yet people live and work here, take their kids to dance lessons and make way for the tourists that are starting to come.  No down side - this is a well preserved lovely old City that’s fun to explore.

We spent 6 days here and I explored every inch of the old town while my husband was fishing during the day.  I found people to be friendly and polite.  I speak little Spanish and most people do not speak English but everyone was encouraging at my efforts to communicate.  Most of all - at no time did I ever feel uncomfortable or unsafe.  Can’t say that about most  places.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

650903185.name: Historical area
650903185.author: a TripAdvisor user
650903185.reviewBody: Definitely worth a visit to all museums, and the 9 Balluartes.  Be sure to take the 5pm bus tour in English and spanish...beautiful sunsets on malecon.  Great restaurants, lots of walking tho and very hot.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

650551501.name: A beautiful colonial city
650551501.author: a TripAdvisor user
650551501.reviewBody:
I didn't venture out of the historic area very much but this is a classic colonial city that has been very well preserved.  The people know they have a true gem and are determined to keep it that way.  It isn't as touristy as a lot of popular places in Mexico which adds to the charm.

The Malecon was undergoing some restoration/improvement while I was there but there was still plenty to see.  There are statues and monuments along the way and on the other side of the street is a very large convention center.  The convention center is of a modern design and doesn't seem to fit in with the rest of the area but that's just the way it is.

I was there in the middle of January and the weather was cooler than I expected for the Yucatan peninsula.  A light jacket is advised, especially in the evening.  It may be the weather but the only people I saw wearing shorts were tourists.  None of the local men wore shorts but it could be just a cultural thing.

If you are looking for a laid back atmosphere with a lot of history and charm, you will find it in Campeche.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

646447394.name: Campeche is a living Museum!
646447394.author: a TripAdvisor user
646447394.reviewBody:
Campeche was designated World Heritage status by UNESCO in 1999 based on "Interchange of values and "Significance in human history". Campeche's well preserved buildings and fortifications are a typical example of a new world Spanish colonial harbour town. The almost 1000 historically significant buildings are found in a 1.8 sq. km. area, of which 0.5 sq. km. are enclosed within a system of walls and fortifications. There are excellent tourist maps detailing these "sites of interest". 
The fortifications, three batteries and two forts, are located outside the walled section.We only managed to get to Fuerte de San Miguel. This fort is about 4.2 km from the Gamma Campeche Malecón, where we were staying. The fort, built in the late eighteenth century, was meant to protect the town against an anticipated attack by the British. It is fully restored and now houses a museum of Mayan art. There was a small entrance fee of 55 pesos. Fuerte de San Jose el Alto, located on the opposite end of town, also has a museum which features a collection of boats and weapons from the period.
There are eight baluartes (bulwarks), defensive bastions, on the corners, all now serving different functions. We didn't go to all of them, but we can recommend the ones that we did. Baluarte of Santiago now serves as the jardin botanico Xmuch' haltun, a nice quiet refuge that highlights about 200 plant species endemic to the region, entrance is 10 pesos each. The Baluarte of San Carlos holds the city museum, and the connection that Campeche has with its "pirate past"! The other bulwark that we made it to, is the largest, Baluarte de la Soledad. It houses the Museo de Arquitectura Maya and features "the Mask of Calakmul. a very beautiful funerary mask composed of jade, shell and grey obsidian, a must see! This is a very nice museum, not large but definitely a worthwhile visit. The signage is also in english. One thing that I had not seen before, was a strip set into the floor, this was meant to be a guide for the visually impaired. A person could use their cane and be guided by this strip to a copy of one of artifacts being displayed and then by touching with their hands get an idea of what it looked like. There was also a "sign" in Braille that explained about the object. Interestingly, we had seen this in other places in town, a good explanation for a very good purpose!
The whole town really is a museum, just outside the Baluarte de la Soledad, is the El Palacio Centro Cultural. This museum shows you some of the past history as it relates to commerce and the connection it has had with attacks from pirates, etc. It is right across from the plaza, and on the weekends, it features a magnificent light show. The openings are shuttered and different moving images are projected on the exterior, showing Campeche's link to the past. It is very well choreographed, the production was designed to fit into the building's architecture, even matching the inclusion of the arches. It is very well done and apparently is one of several light shows shown in the old town. There is also one held at Puerta de Tierra. The Plaza de La Independencia is the centre of much of what happens in the Centro Historico. Indeed, there seems to be something happening here all the time, celebrations, cultural events, etc. On the east side, you will find the Catedral de Campeche, dating from the 16th century. In a courtyard, off to one side, you will find a small museum housing old relics. There is a small entrance fee. Across the plaza, Casa No. 6, a restored colonial casa, showing what life was like for an upper- class Campechano family during prerevolutionary times. You can catch the Transporte Touristico bus here as well. One of their tours takes you to the different barrios surrounding the city walls, and around to several of the old churches associated with them. The Santuario de Guadalupe, a beautiful, yellow church dating from the 1600's is in the 500 year old barrio of the same name. In the barrio of San Francisco is the Iglesia de San Francisco, a church which dates from the mid-1500's. This is where the first Catholic liturgy was offered at the arrival of the Spaniards in 1517. In the barrio of San Roman, the tourist train stops at the Iglesia de San Roman, the home of the Cristo Negro. If you are interested in "history" and "historic" churches, these are just a few of  Campeche's churches. This is a city where history, is depicted and lived in both its old buildings and structures and its plentiful museums!
The past is something that we "live' for, yes, but fortunately, there is much of the present and the future to live for as well. This is no more evident in the activity and events that take place all around the town. As was said, there was always something happening in the square, music, different events, families enjoying the evening. We were staying at the Gamma hotel. From the Gamma Hotel, where we were staying, to the Sea Gate, there was a small mall. Most nights, particularly on weekends. there would be lively music events going on and crowds of people listening and dancing along. You kind of got the idea that this type thing went on all through the year. Why not? The evenings are aways so lovely! We were here in early December, so they were setting up decorations all around town, in particular in the square just outside the Sea Gate. There were several events that took place here, a Pan y Pasteles fair one day. There were booths set up where they were selling breads, sweets, pizzas, etc. A great place to enjoy authentic food, there or take-out. The last night we were in Campeche, there was a big Christmas celebration held here, with lots of families taking part in the festivities. There was much going on, and later on, featured a great firework display. Meanwhile, we were attending a concert in the square, complete with a band, a very talented singer and backup singers. All professional and again, great audience participation, dancing and singing along! Lots happening, people just celebrating life. 
Campeche is not on the "tourist radar', yet, maybe this a good thing, there are "tourists", albeit not many. It is an authentic Mexican town. It is mostly a town for Campechanos, who enjoy living in Campeche, and are justly proud of their city. To quote Lonely Planet', Campeche is a historical fairy tale".
PS, One final blurb. There are many fine eaterys to be found here, and of course, Calle 59 is a good place to start. Here there are many fine restaurants, all offering good food, at good prices. We did not always eat out, but would recommend the following: Patronis Bar, Bavit and our favourite, Ambigu 59. Our favourite coffee place was Cafe Frappisimo, and for treats, a nice little bakery called, "La Nueva Espano". Last but not least, La Michoacana for ice cream. These are all good places, all offering good/variety food at reasonable prices. Enjoy!

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

645474580.author: a TripAdvisor user
645474580.reviewBody: The historic centre of Campeche is very cute and very colorful. It is not as developed as Merida but it has a lot of charm.

639467311.name: A nice full day in Campeche
639467311.author: a TripAdvisor user
639467311.reviewBody: In 1 day you can visit the 2 forts, the only mall, the downtown zone, the prominade (Malec\u00f3n) and in the evening see the light & sound show next to the catedral and there is another at the end of the walled part of the downtown \u00e1rea. Many good restaurants to eat in too.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

638849677.name: Great environment, amazing city downtown
638849677.author: a TripAdvisor user
638849677.reviewBody: We had breakfast on the stree, yes!, right on the street, there is this little -but cooky- restaurant called Chocolater\u00eda de La Mora, almost all dishes are made including chocolate (cacao), we also walked to the City\'s main plaza and ride the "El guapo" bus, having a tour around all the city, truly amazing.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

632020505.name: Colorful
632020505.author: a TripAdvisor user
632020505.reviewBody: You can spend here a few days just to relax and walk through the colorful streets and along the sea. \nThe main square is busy, especially on Sunday\u2019s. We liked it very much and stayed two full days.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

613396358.name: Trip in the Mexican San Francisco
613396358.author: a TripAdvisor user
613396358.reviewBody: A very nice experience in the capital city of Campeche... Colorful palaces and houses, living city, an historical center and a very nice church with a carousel in front of it. And last but not least... Restaurants with mexican tasty food :)

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

612433674.name: Colourful walled UNESCO heritage town
612433674.author: a TripAdvisor user
612433674.reviewBody: The historical centre of Campeche is the old walled city, which is now a UNESCO heritage site. There are lots of colourful buildings and cobbled streets. You can easily walk through the historical old town and explore many shops and restaurants.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

598022942.name: Campeche
598022942.author: a TripAdvisor user
598022942.reviewBody: Walking around downtown it\u2019s a good idea after 4pm, when the sun is less intense, although some shops might close soon. The wall that surrounds  the city is very interesting, specially the history that comes with it, i recommend taking the tour bus, and walking around the 59th street. Also there\u2019s a lightening show around 8, it\u2019s okay, yet not the best.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

588532070.name: Campeche
588532070.author: a TripAdvisor user
588532070.reviewBody: Campeche is one of the prettiest little ports in Mexico. The historic downtown is clean and it\u2019s beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

579224122.name: Stunning place
579224122.author: a TripAdvisor user
579224122.reviewBody: Enjoy the colourful buildings in this wonderful, calm old town, it does not seem to end. Have stroll across the central square and enjoy the views. Not to miss.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

556274240.name: Amazing
556274240.author: a TripAdvisor user
556274240.reviewBody:
The Centro of this historic city is a must. We booked out hotel within the walls. We wanted to be close to the downtown. 
If you happen to outside the walls, be sure to spend a day or two exploring the Centro. It is easy access with Taxis or local buses which drop you at most entrances.
A lot of history packed within these walls.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

555946724.name: Beautiful place to visit
555946724.author: a TripAdvisor user
555946724.reviewBody: Downtown Campeche is a very nice and safe place. It was very interesting to take the legend tour and the pirate show that are really inexpensive. There are lots of restaurants and nice hotels at very good prices. You can take the trolly to take a good look of the city. There was a show at night called Celebrate Campeche that was beautiful.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

544449933.name: Lovely city well restored and magical at night
544449933.author: a TripAdvisor user
544449933.reviewBody: Walking around and thru the plaza is beautiful, especially at night and before the holiday season. The Cathedral is well lighted as well as the surrounding buildings and worth going into at night. The photo shown is from a bar and restaurant on the second floor, see my separate review for this.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

514068316.name: NICE VIEW
514068316.author: a TripAdvisor user
514068316.reviewBody: A QUIET town where one can spend a relaxing and quiet time, however summer here is real hot!! bring a big hat and sun blocker you will have fun!!

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

482791434.name: Great town
482791434.author: a TripAdvisor user
482791434.reviewBody: Great town with less tourists. Walking from east to west and from south to north, so much nice colonial buildings to see.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

481298231.name: Great to walk around
481298231.author: a TripAdvisor user
481298231.reviewBody:
We loved the old city and the different places to visit on the old wall. You need a camera and your wallet. it can be very hot and humid. The streets in some places are very narrow. There are many places to pop into and look around, but few tourist shops. Many many restaurants. The central square is very pretty and the old government buildings and the church are really great to see. Be warned  - it is hot walking around.

One of my favorites was the old church that faces the ocean about five blocks west of the central square. it is the only church I have ever seen with a working lighthouse as part of its original construction. 

The central square is the pick up and drop off point for the trolley bus tours of the old city. While I would like to have taken this ride it became ever more frustrating to do so. We were told at the tourist center that at 5 pm each day the tour was offered in English. When we arrived for the English tour we were told it would be the next day at 6:30. We went back at 6:30 the next day only to be told by the same person that there would not be an English tour as there needed to be 4 people wanting it. Some very helpful Mexicans offered to be our additional English people and we were then told there would need to be 6 people in order for the tour to be in English. Very disappointing.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

478089958.name: Wonderful
478089958.author: a TripAdvisor user
478089958.reviewBody: The whole old city of Campeche is wonderful. Lots of strees with churches, palaces, houses, shops and restaurants.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

469166731.name: We love strolling around the square!
469166731.author: a TripAdvisor user
469166731.reviewBody: People watching, shoe shine, great WiFi to communicate with those unfortunates who were unable to visit the beautiful city of Campeche, buy a coffee at Oxxo or Italian Coffee Company and and listen to the birds at sunrise or sunset.....or stop by for the free nightly entertainment! We had a light show, trove group of 9 guitarists, and a marimba band! Friendly locals willing to offer suggestions on things to do make for a wonderful visit.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

467477974.name: Squeaky clean
467477974.author: a TripAdvisor user
467477974.reviewBody: Having been recently restored as a UNESCO World Heritage site, this is perfectly preserved.  Maybe a bit too much so compared with the more lived-in feeling of Merida, but being only a few blocks in each direction it can and should be explored street by street.  Calle 59 is where most of the best restaurants lie.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

460405910.name: Historic, walkable and exceptionally clean
460405910.author: a TripAdvisor user
460405910.reviewBody: This well preserved historic center (UNESCO designation) features scores of restaurant and shops.  And it is exceptionally clean.  Stroll around and you will eventually come across one of many vendors walking streets selling hats and other souvenirs. The locals are very welcoming.  We enjoyed sitting in the town square and people watching.  One evening we went to the square to watch a wonderful light show projected on the El Palacio, depicting the history of the region.  The sights, sounds and music of the show were exceptional.  It starts at 8 p.m.\n\nWe also enjoyed looking at the historic architecture of the city.  We had a great time staying in and exploring the city within the walls.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

456475862.name: Pretty, Entertaining but Not Creative
456475862.author: a TripAdvisor user
456475862.reviewBody: As in many, many other cities, the actual main downtown street or square is not where you will find the most interesting things.  If you are into run of the mill tourist gadgets, foods and drinks, this is for you.  It is clean, very safe, and people are mostly welcoming.\nIf you want more authentic food though you\'ve got to branch out and away from there.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

453582788.name: One of the most beautiful cities in Mexico
453582788.author: a TripAdvisor user
453582788.reviewBody: Campeche is in my opinion one of the most underrated cities in Mexico. It is just gorgeous and well preserved and it\'s getting more beautiful since it became protected by UNESCO in 1999. The historic center is protected by a wall that has been almost completely restored. Many homes look just as they did many years ago with traditional decor. Walking around gives you a feel that you are back in time. The historic center is very quiet and walkable with excellent restaurants, boutique hotels and museums. The "light and sound" show every night at 8 pm is free and a must in the center square of town; ask for a table (reserve) in the kiosk in the center of the square and have a beer or coffee while you enjoy the 30 minute show highlighting the history of the city.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

448118576.name: Beautiful
448118576.author: a TripAdvisor user
448118576.reviewBody: The houses in this part of town, within the old city walls, are well maintained and extremely beautiful. A great place to stay or walk around. Some streets are closed to traffic so people may eat on the streets in front of the restaurants.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

431501672.name: The Real Mexico
431501672.author: a TripAdvisor user
431501672.reviewBody: I have been coming to Campeche for 34 years. I never get tired of "El Centro". The main square is surrounded by Historical buildings and shops. Of course there are restaurants also. The main feature is the Cathedral. It is laminated at night. Friday and Saturday evening are great times to observe the families enjoying the square. The "El Centro" area is a collage of colors and history!

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

425753604.name: Really enjoyed exploring
425753604.author: a TripAdvisor user
425753604.reviewBody: Campeche\'s historic center is very picturesque and great for exploring the streets and taking in the picturesque pastel buildings.  Very walkable with plenty of cool small shops and restaurants throughout.  Of course the central plaza is the most happening area but all of the streets are interesting and peaceful.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

355366415.name: Nice Place To Hang Out
355366415.author: a TripAdvisor user
355366415.reviewBody: Our 7-year old loved chasing the pigeons in the centro area and there were other little kids feeding the pigeons rice. This area feels safe to walk around alone as well. While I enjoyed this part of the city, overall it didn\'t feel as vibrant as other cultural centers. Of course, it\'s a not miss during one\'s first trip to Campeche.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

351848110.name: charming historic centre
351848110.author: a TripAdvisor user
351848110.reviewBody: at night the charming street restaurants and cafes are ideal for a quiet meal, or choose a sports bar for more lively fun.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

350963340.name: A unique spanish colonial town in Mexico.
350963340.author: a TripAdvisor user
350963340.reviewBody: This unique Spanish colonial town in Mexico was a pleasant place to spend 24 hours. It is not too touristic as yet, so it still has an authentic feel. People are generally friendly. I was under the impression that the town was surrounded by walls, but only two large sections of wall survive. Still impressive though. The area surrounding the Cathedral was of particular note, a good place to spend time.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

349784882.name: Campeche at it\'s finest!
349784882.author: a TripAdvisor user
349784882.reviewBody: I knew that Campeche was a historic, partially walled city - but I never realized how significant and beautiful it is! The historic area is a few square kilometers, with even streets running one direction and odd number streets the other. It is fun and easy to  explore on foot. From the remaining walls and bastions to the food/drink to the beautiful houses, museums and churches, this area has it all!

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

346913705.name: Beautiful District
346913705.author: a TripAdvisor user
346913705.reviewBody: The main square and cathedral is a wonderful place to spend a few hours in the afternoon or evening.     There are vendors but they aren\'t too pushy.    Great for a drink or latte and people watching.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

345996031.name: Lovely old town
345996031.author: a TripAdvisor user
345996031.reviewBody: Beautifully preserved colonial town - largely intact within walls and bastions also mostly intact and many of which can be visited

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

337521816.name: centro Historico
337521816.author: a TripAdvisor user
337521816.reviewBody: This is a section of the Campeche Downtown. A safe place to be walking until the late night. A place to relax and enjoy the time. There are concerts as well as places to eat around this place.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Historico de San Francisco de Campeche

672586083.name: Interesing with 3 museums and the city library in one historic building
672586083.author: a TripAdvisor user
672586083.reviewBody: The 3 museum spaces illustrate the commerce of the city, the growth of the fortifications and navigation. The only awkward issue is the navigation thru the 3 museums, it is not clearly marked as to how to get from one to the other, we made it through exploration only and often being  told we were in the wrong area. When you get to each museum they are well displayed and informative but everything is in spanish so if you do not read spanish be prepared. Still, see each one because they are well worth the time.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

657078929.name: The lightshow is NOT everyday!
657078929.author: a TripAdvisor user
657078929.reviewBody: When we were here (7th of March 2019), the lightshow did not take place. We were told it is only on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Too bad \ud83d\ude14 But the palacio and its surroundings is very beautiful, also at night.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

654203922.name: a must to join this dynamic multimedia entertainment
654203922.author: a TripAdvisor user
654203922.reviewBody: By accident we were at the plaza de independencia. This multimedia show is gratis, but a real recommend. I would say even a must to join. Creativity x originality. All facets of the history come. The richness of the nature with animals above ground, but als the sea life, the Maya, the conquistadores, the pirates, maybe too many maria\'s, the modern times. I am imporessed how a positive feeling you have after this in a great environment of the plaza, togetehr with the many people, locals and tourists, and the different colonial houses and the illuminated cathedral that dominates on corner of the square.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

650595303.name: Great presentation at night!
650595303.author: a TripAdvisor user
650595303.reviewBody: Great museum during the day and wonderful cultural presentation in the evening that can be viewed from the main square seating.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

649423737.name: Great Museum in Center of Town
649423737.author: a TripAdvisor user
649423737.reviewBody: Located on one side of the main square. Museum all about the city and it\u2019s history including the gates. The museum is air conditioned and there are docents to help guide you through the various exhibits. My husband really enjoyed the ship exhibit. They have a large dissected ship in there. The entire room is designed as the hull of a ship as well quite unique. I definitely recommend this museum.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

642713436.name: Sound and light extravaganza!
642713436.author: a TripAdvisor user
642713436.reviewBody: Every night or so they pull down the shades and project this wild sound and light show.  You can watch right from the zocalo.  Quite fun!

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

641674490.name: Fantastic museum and tour
641674490.author: a TripAdvisor user
641674490.reviewBody: We took the museum tour which explains the history of Campeche. It includes some great videos on the foundation of the city, commerce, ships and best of all pirates!\nIt ends on an excellent simulated boat trip aboard a Spanish ship.\nIt is very informative museum and very well set-up. Great option to learn about both Prehispanic and Colonial history of Campeche.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

632440900.name: Light show
632440900.author: a TripAdvisor user
632440900.reviewBody: Very cool light show at 8 pm.\nIf in Campeche do not miss it. Right in the center of old town just some meters from puerta de mar.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

630388876.name: Museum
630388876.author: a TripAdvisor user
630388876.reviewBody: The UNESCO certificate is displayed, I\'d never seen this before so I found that interesting. Worth visiting if you\'re in town.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

612433292.name: Interesting museum - and light show at night
612433292.author: a TripAdvisor user
612433292.reviewBody: The inside of El Palacio Centro Cultural is a museum that describes the history of Campeche.  It\'s quite interesting, and does have some signs in English.  There is a motion simulator of a ship as well.  At night, there is a light show projected on the outside of the building, which you can view from the park.  Highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

610874161.name: Awesome show
610874161.author: a TripAdvisor user
610874161.reviewBody: Located in the central part of town.  You can sit in the Park and watch a great show for free (starts at 8:00)

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

592722042.name: Beautiful light show
592722042.author: a TripAdvisor user
592722042.reviewBody: This was a nice treat one night while my friends and I were walking around the city. We had heard from a few locals that this was worth checking out and it truly was. Now, I would not plan my whole trip around this light show, but if in the area around the time it is showing, take the time and sit and watch. It is worth it.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

584167116.name: Nice Light Show...
584167116.author: a TripAdvisor user
584167116.reviewBody: I had read about the nightly light show projected on one of the buildings in the square and thought it would be worth seeing.  It just so happened that our first night in Campeche was a Monday night.  We went down to the square at 8:00 and nothing.  I thought it must have been a temporary thing and they didn\'t do it anymore.  The next night we were having a drink in a restaurant across the square and noticed they were doing the light show.  We finished our drinks and were able to catch the last ten minutes of the show.  It is really nicely done, set to music and projected on the wide building on the west side of the square.  If you\'re in Campeche, it\'s definitely worth going down to the square, but not on Monday.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

581932029.name: Much better than expected
581932029.author: a TripAdvisor user
581932029.reviewBody: This is a light and sound show in the main cathedral square preformed every night at 8pm and is free of charge. We did not have any great expectations but were really surprised at how much we enjoyed what turned out to be an impressive show.\n\nThe display lasts about 30 mins and if you are in Campeche it would be crazy to miss it, keep an open mind, do not have too high expectations and you might also enjoy it as we did!

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

579222870.name: calm but wonderful city
579222870.author: a TripAdvisor user
579222870.reviewBody: We loved this palace by day and night. not too much information in english though but worth having a look into the museum

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

577447849.name: Loved this show on the buildings of Campeche
577447849.author: a TripAdvisor user
577447849.reviewBody: Its only about 15 minutes but the kids LOVED it, great FREE sound and light show about history of Campeche.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

570861451.name: Don\'t miss the nightly light show
570861451.author: a TripAdvisor user
570861451.reviewBody: 8pm light show nightly, more than worth a visit. Get there a little early to grab a spot away from the idiots videoing it!

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

562600263.name: Great at night on weekends.
562600263.author: a TripAdvisor user
562600263.reviewBody: As everyone said the light show is great and better than Meridia. I like the plaza better too. Cathedral looks awesome at night. Not much going on at waterfront though

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

561593284.name: Don\'t miss the light-mapping show
561593284.author: a TripAdvisor user
561593284.reviewBody: El Palacio is a beautiful colonial building fronting one side of the main square. It houses a library and a museum of Campeche city history. The museum is mildly interesting but suffers by being spread out on both sides of the library with unclear directions for getting from one part to the other. On weekends at 8 pm there is a fantastic light show projected on the facade from the park in the square. This show is much more sophisticated and poetic than any light shows you may see in Merida or at archaeological sites. It is absolutely delightful! On the Friday evening we attended, a very good marimba concert preceded the light show.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

555514943.name: Beautiful building and good museum
555514943.author: a TripAdvisor user
555514943.reviewBody: This museum provides an excellent compact history of Campeche and has good exhibits.  There is a free guided tour with added attractions that you should take even if only available in Spanish

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

553632801.name: Don\'t miss the little museum inside
553632801.author: a TripAdvisor user
553632801.reviewBody: There is a great small museum inside the Palacio Centro Cultural. It\'s exceptionally well done, with multimedia and explanations in flawless English. It\'s about the history of the city and socio-political issues related to it. The museum is free and it\'s well worth a visit. The center also had a fantastic digital show projected onto its facade on Saturday night. It was stunning.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

544123681.name: Interesting museum and terrific light show
544123681.author: a TripAdvisor user
544123681.reviewBody: The museum is free and divided into sections on the history of Campeche, trade in the 17th & 18th centuries, colonization, and historic fortifications.  The light show is shown against the backdrop of the building and can be viewed from the square every Fri, Sat, and Sun evenings at 8 p.m. - it is fantastic!  Do NOT miss the light show if you are in Campeche on the weekend.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

499500008.name: Very nice and is free
499500008.author: a TripAdvisor user
499500008.reviewBody: This is a museum, with the history of Campeche during pre indepencence time, and the pirates, very helpful staff they go the extra mile, comgrats

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

498692796.name: Amazing display on Sunday night
498692796.author: a TripAdvisor user
498692796.reviewBody: Great atmosphere in the sqare opposite the palace. Wonderful display of the Mayan history projected to its walls with music.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

488448280.name: An interesting building to visit - by day AND night - do not miss
488448280.author: a TripAdvisor user
488448280.reviewBody: By day this building houses a modest museum that depicts the history of Campeche township, with a significant focus on the pirate aspects of its background. Spread over two levels, the free museum access includes the second story balcony that runs the full length of the building and overlooks the park and provides great views of the adjacent Cathedral.\n\nBy night this building becomes an integral part of a wonderful sound and light show, Friday through Sunday evenings only at 8pm. From across the street, 6 pole mounted projectors illuminate the entire front of this building for an unexpectedly entertaining and unashamed celebration of this building, and the natural, social and cultural history of Campeche. The images and music are bright, vivid, lively and engaging. After 20 minutes it over too soon, to the applause of all who were watching from across the street in the park.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

484735834.name: Beautiful building mapping show!!
484735834.author: a TripAdvisor user
484735834.reviewBody: I loved the mapping show "Celebrando Campeche", it brought tears to my eyes. I\'m a sucker for traditions and history, and being a mexican I felt so moved by it. It\'s super well done and the building it is projected is kept in the best conditions. \n\nDo enjoy it from the kiosko, the nearest bench doesn\'t get such a good viewing with the square\'s gate in the way.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

475031358.name: Wonderful museum
475031358.author: a TripAdvisor user
475031358.reviewBody:
I've been to many museums, and this particularly, is great. 
Great exhibits in English and spanish, the muséographie is very well done. 
The building itself is magnificent. 
And its free!!!! 
Try to book the guided tour, also free, to have access to the interactive rooms. 
Also a great experience

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

473788519.name: people watching
473788519.author: a TripAdvisor user
473788519.reviewBody: I past by there many times, and there was always something going on - during the day as well a in the evening. This square is also lighted up at night & should be viewed.. It is  great for people watching, for the big trees provide ample shade during the day.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

464854546.name: Wow !!!
464854546.author: a TripAdvisor user
464854546.reviewBody: The sound and light show blew us away. Almost a half hour of gorgeous graphics and sound transform a block-long facade into a wonderland. This alone was worth the overnight stay.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

464622113.name: Don\'t miss this spectecular show!
464622113.author: a TripAdvisor user
464622113.reviewBody: This is a spectacular show on a 100meter wide canvas, the fa\u00e7ade of the cultural center. No language barriers, not a word is spoken. Travel through time with great animation and terrific sound. It\'s for everyone of all ages.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

463599801.name: Its Free
463599801.author: a TripAdvisor user
463599801.reviewBody: This is a nice museum that is in the process of being developed.  It is free and senior citizens provide security and direction.  The theme is on trade in the 17th -18th centuries which was the backbone of Campeche.  A good way to spend an hour as you look at other attractions in the Plaza.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

462053085.name: Sound and LIght show
462053085.author: a TripAdvisor user
462053085.reviewBody: make sure you see the sound and light show here. It is interesting and beautiful to watch. We also enjoyed the museum during the heat of the day.  Cooled off while learning about colonization in this area.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

460420740.name: "Canvas" for the great light and sound show, plus small museum.
460420740.author: a TripAdvisor user
460420740.reviewBody: El Palacio on the town square offers a cultural center featuring a series of small museums.  These museums focus on the city\'s historic fortifications, its commerce in the early days and navigation.  The last featured an extremely detailed model ship cut in cross sections so one could see below deck activities.  In addition, displays on the walls identified the different types of ships used in the day  and their uses. \n\nBut the El Palacio really came to life in the evenings when we were there with a light and sound show projected on the block long building.  It related the history of the city and the region.  With striking graphics and dynamic sound effects, the show was quite spectacular.  One of the high points of our visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

448117358.name: Sound and light
448117358.author: a TripAdvisor user
448117358.reviewBody: This building hosts a small but interesting museum during the day. From Thursday to Sunday there is a sound and light show detailing the history of Campeche that is broadcast on screens across the front of the building. Starts at 8:00. Not to be missed.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

447248765.name: Great!
447248765.author: a TripAdvisor user
447248765.reviewBody: We had a wonderful opportunity to watch the whole light show while walking in the city centrum. Nice surprise! It started at 20 and took approximately 25 minutes. We really enjoyed the whole entertainment!

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

443141606.name: Light and sound show overcomes language barrier
443141606.author: a TripAdvisor user
443141606.reviewBody: Absolutely loved the light and sound show!  Technology and graphics are great and so clever to be able to tell the story very effectively without using any language at all so that everyone can enjoy.  We also really enjoyed walking through the museum and there is a fantastic miniature of the city to the right of the museum (outside) which we probably wouldn\'t have noticed if it hadn\'t been pointed out to us on the town tour we did. We saw 3 light and sound shows while in Mexico and this was our favourite.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

441244815.name: Nice sound & light for everyone
441244815.author: a TripAdvisor user
441244815.reviewBody: At 8:00PM from Thursday to Sunday there is a great free "sound & light" protection over the facade of this building, which is next to the Cathedral. It is really worthwhile. It last about 20 mins. and is plenty of great images synchronized with music, no wording, so you can follow the story regardless of your native language.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

441155870.name: nice lightshow, bit too long
441155870.author: a TripAdvisor user
441155870.reviewBody: Lightshow in the evening was really nice, but a bit too Long. after 15 minutes i thought yeah, now ist enough, make an end

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

426727721.name: Surprisingly great
426727721.author: a TripAdvisor user
426727721.reviewBody: Hadn\'t heard much about the sound and light show but it was excellent, it was informative and entertaining as well, get there 5 mins early to get a good seat!!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

425753181.name: Cool Light Show
425753181.author: a TripAdvisor user
425753181.reviewBody: The light show projected onto this building in the evening is entertaining and I thoroughly enjoyed it.  With not much happening during Campeche evenings it is highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

425661485.name: A great panaramic video on the square.
425661485.author: a TripAdvisor user
425661485.reviewBody: I was very surprised with the technology ...It was quite a show! Worth seeing...and people;e watching!

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

424168788.name: Awesome video mapping shoe
424168788.author: a TripAdvisor user
424168788.reviewBody: At 8pm the city does a great video mapping show on the front of the palacios building at one side of square. Don\'t miss it, it\'s lovely

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

389465146.name: Excellent Interactive Museum!
389465146.author: a TripAdvisor user
389465146.reviewBody:
I dropped into the museum not really expecting a lot but it turned out to be brilliant! There were displays with models of the city and videos explaining its history. The explanations are in Spanish so be careful if you don't speak the language.There are also a couple of display rooms with the navigation room being particularly interesting. At the very end there's a little room where there is a boat simulator which tells the story of a trip from Spain to Campeche.

I found the history to be fascinating and it was an authentic feel for the pirates of the Caribbean. Best of all it was completely free!

There is also a projection show on the walls of the building at night(I think it's on weekend nights but I'm not 100% sure) which is also worth seeing.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

385406078.name: Great base for getting a feel of the city
385406078.author: a TripAdvisor user
385406078.reviewBody: This museum is a great base for getting a feel of the city.  Best of all you can not beat the free admission.  The second floor offers nice panoramic views of the main square area; eg, church, plaza and part of the City Wall.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

370443065.name: do not miss the night light show
370443065.author: a TripAdvisor user
370443065.reviewBody: Check out which nights the show is on as not performed every night .... this is the most fantastic free light show not to be missed whilst in Campeche. Starting at 8pm lasting almost an hour, set to music, the incredible, spectacular show portrays the history of Campeche, scene after scene, ever-changing amazing colourful murals flash and evolve one to another in front of your eyes. Well done and thank you Campeche for such an enjoyable performance.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

358211870.name: Amazing  show
358211870.author: a TripAdvisor user
358211870.reviewBody: This si one of teh best free activities I have seen in Mexico they have a video mapping show that is shown with the Palacio Centro Cultural facade as screen this animated video show is about the history of Campeche simply spectacular runs every day from 8 to 8.40 pm is right across from the cathedral

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

356130908.name: Spectacular light show at night should not be missed
356130908.author: a TripAdvisor user
356130908.reviewBody: The Centro Cultural houses a museum in several distinct parts that each capture some aspect of the long and colourful history of the city and state of Campeche. However, if you don\'t have time to go in the light show that is projected onto the walls of the front facade of the building after dark is sure to leave you in awe. The spectacular projection tells the tale of the history of Campeche from ancient to modern times in addition to local festivals.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

355364466.name: A Light Show and A Nice Museum
355364466.author: a TripAdvisor user
355364466.reviewBody: The light show, starting at 8 pm on Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights, was fantastic.The whole family enjoyed it. It lasted about 30 minutes. The atmosphere was pleasant with several families and couples enjoying the show. We would have gone back another night but it didn\'t work for our schedule. \n\nDuring the day, we went to the exhibits inside the building. It took less than an hour and my two elementary aged kids enjoyed it. The museum wasn\'t as hands-on as I was led to believe by the tourist information desk, but it definitely held my kids\' attention. We particularly enjoyed the big pirate ship upstairs that showed the different compartments, the video in the "ship hold" and the clothing on display.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

353202274.name: Artistic illumination of the history of Campeche
353202274.author: a TripAdvisor user
353202274.reviewBody: On Friday and Saturday evenings there is a free light show that is projected onto El Palacio in the square. It is a 3D movie that is coordinated with various music, and shows the culture and history since the beginning  of time (all in 30 minutes!) It is a must see if you are here over the weekend. Some people sat on the gazebo and ate and/or had drinks during the show. But most just sat on the curb or benches in the park. Excellent job and such a wonderful thing to see.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

352928369.name: unique show
352928369.author: a TripAdvisor user
352928369.reviewBody: Nice museum in an one of the most interesting buildings in town. I enjoyed the evening light and sound show which is quite unique, displayed on the colonial facade.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

352474475.name: History Mseum
352474475.author: a TripAdvisor user
352474475.reviewBody: An interesting free museum which tells little bit about the city\'s history as a port.  The friendly, accommodating staff will take you up by elevator if you have trouble with stairs. Best part is sitting and watching video about how difficult it was sailing here from Spain in the days of pirates.  It\'s in Spanish, like much of the signage, but easy to follow.  After relax with a drink in the attached inexpensive cafe.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

352076044.name: Favorite museum
352076044.author: a TripAdvisor user
352076044.reviewBody: This was surprisingly interesting to us, well worth the time to visit. It will only take you about 30-45 minutes to tour, but it is incredible

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

349776369.name: Beautiful Parque!
349776369.author: a TripAdvisor user
349776369.reviewBody: If you are in Campeche for a weekend night, you MUST go to the park to see the light and sound show! It began at 8pm and lasted approximately 40 minutes. Fun and creative, and great to sit outside and learn a little bit about this historic city.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

339612605.name: A Historic/Educational place
339612605.author: a TripAdvisor user
339612605.reviewBody: This is a place worth saving some time while visiting Campeche. There is a lot of history there. It is very easy to follow through the different rooms. And what makes it even better is the people that work there. There were very professional, courteous and eager to help with a smile. And as we were walking out they were thanking us for visiting their place. I would highly recommend this place.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

337096225.name: Spectacular Light and Sound Show Depicting Campeche\'s History - Every Night at 8 PM!
337096225.author: a TripAdvisor user
337096225.reviewBody:
El Palacio Centro Cultural was a beautiful green-coloured historic arched building located on the north side of Campeche’s central plaza, on Calle 8 between Calles 55 and 57.

Every evening at 8 PM, there is a spectacular light and sound show that is projected onto the historic arched building, lasting for around half an hour. It is completely free to watch and the best viewing spot is from the Parque Principal, directly across from the building. A variety of themes and images depict Campeche’s history, and it was fun, entertaining and interesting to watch. 

On my first evening in Campeche, I just happened to be walking near the central park with some friends from my hostel, when this amazing light and sound show began. It was a unexpected but fantastic surprise! I stayed to watch the entire show, which lasted around 30 minutes or so and I am so glad that I stuck around. It was fantastic and entertaining and I had never seen anything like that before! 

I loved the show so much, that I came back to the Parque Principal on my second and final night in Campeche to watch it again. Even though this light and sound show happens every evening, there was a crowd of people (mostly locals) watching it each time I was there. 

I highly recommend watching this fantastic light and sound show in the evening in Campeche! It was one of the coolest things I have ever seen and it should definitely not be missed.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

316972511.name: history of campeche in images and sounds
316972511.author: a TripAdvisor user
316972511.reviewBody: The images show at palacio centro cultural in campeche is a very nice 30 minutes show of music and images that describes the rich history of this place. It ia a free show that starts at 8 o\u00b4clock.\nI strongly recommend it before or after dinner

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

308622542.name: Campeche\'s History in Light and Music
308622542.author: a TripAdvisor user
308622542.reviewBody: What a fun surprise.  We arrived in Campeche late and tired.  We went straight to our room which faced out onto the plaza.  Next thing we heard music and looked out our window to see the light show.  We raced downstairs and out onto the plaza to get a better look.  We are really glad we did not miss it.  The light show tells the history of Campeche in a fun and interesting way.

address.streetAddress: Calle 8 S/N 57 Plaza Principal, Centro Historico

675276490.name: A challenge to get there, but very worth the effort
675276490.author: a TripAdvisor user
675276490.reviewBody: The road here is long, winding, and unpaved. But if you have a good spotter/guide and some luck, you will see turkeys, coatis, and a bunch of birds and other animals along the way. With some stops along the way, it took us two hours to get there.  \n\nWhat\'s noteworthy about this site once is all the trees left in the middle of the site and its buildings. Other sites have been cleared much more than Calakmul. You can still see the wonderful buildings, but the trees do block some views. Not a problem, just a difference. The site itself is large and just as impressive as the other major sites. It\'s a five star site, but given the time it takes to get here, you could be forgiven if you left this place off your list. But we were glad we went.

664831851.name: Great Mayan Site, but be ready to ride 1 1/2 hours to site
664831851.author: a TripAdvisor user
664831851.reviewBody: If you want to see real Mayan Architecture, then Calakmul is a great site to view.  Lots of buildings and things to see or climb up.  Be careful since there is no railings on any of the buildings.  Surfaces are rough and rugged so wear your hiking boots and long sleeves in case you run into bugs.  Be prepared with lots of cold water to drink so you dont get dehydrated.  Very hot and not lots of shade.  Suggest you go early and not in the middle of the day.

651911870.name: Culture plus Nature
651911870.author: a TripAdvisor user
651911870.reviewBody: Amazing rain forest wildlife with some of the most important  mayan ruins. Nowadays it is a UNESCO Word natural and cultural site

644318325.name: Worth visiting? Who knows!
644318325.author: a TripAdvisor user
644318325.reviewBody: This Maya site which is a World Heritage Site of the UNESCO is really off the beaten track. It is quite far from any of the local towns of the State of Campeche. You have to take a long drive on the main east-west road through Campache and the 62 kilometers to the site a a sinuous and pot hole ridden narrow road to a parking area that is not large enough. In spite of the above challenges it is overrun by tourist that climb  allover the ruins which is sad considering that it is a World Heritage Site that has to be conserved for posterity.

619501265.name: If in the area a visit here is a must
619501265.author: a TripAdvisor user
619501265.reviewBody: We visited with a guide who we were with for a week.  He was an archaeologist so was able to explain the place in detail.  It is a must if you are in the area - don\'t miss out.

607387858.name: Calacmul
607387858.author: a TripAdvisor user
607387858.reviewBody:
The bird’s-eye view picture of Calakmul pyramids printed on the back of a INAH ticket looks so good that one can’t even think of not visiting it. Yet we've seen over 40 pre-Columbian sites in Mexico and Calakmul was the only major disappointment. It has two large pyramids worthy of its status of a powerful ancient city-state, both among the largest in the Yucatan, but other unique features of Calakmul are off limits to visitors. There are a lots of badly deteriorated stelae at the site but that's about it. The murals, friezes, and burial chambers are closed. A guide told me they are concerned that visitors' breath may create dangerous levels of humidity but that seems to be a poor excuse. The murals of Bonampak, Teotihuacan, and Cacaxtla among others are exposed to outside humidity year round. The friezes of Balamku and Becan can be accessed inside the galleries upon request, and the famous masks of Kohunlich and sculptures of Ek Balam are protected from the elements only by thatched canopies. The burial chamber of Pakal the Great in Palenque is open to the public too. So I doubt it's humidity, it's rather bad management hence the one-star. 

The road to Calakmul consists of 60 km of a poorly paved road going from Rt 186 all the way to the ruins. It's quite narrow in spots. It takes about an hour to drive if there's no slow vehicle in front of you, and though you can speed 65-75 km there, be careful not to hit wild animals. There are three payments to be made along the way: at the entry point near Rt 186, at the turn at the site museum, and the regular admission fee of 70 pesos at the site entrance. I don't remember how much it was in total but I think it was around US $10 pp.

If I knew that the murals and frieze cannot be seen I would have skipped it altogether. Considering the time and effort, climbing just the two pyramids is not worth it. We stayed in Xpujil and it took us a little over 2 hours to drive each way and a little over an hour at the site. Waste of time. Visit Balamku, Chicanna, Becan, Xpujil, Hormiguero, Kohunlich, Dzibanche, Kinichna, and Rio Bec instead.

568715712.name: Lots to see and discover
568715712.author: a TripAdvisor user
568715712.reviewBody: The way the jungle reconquered the ruins is great to see. I did the long walk, which took me 3 hrs, and saw spider monkeys on the way. What I liked best is that some sites are that remote that you\'re often the only person around. It\'s fun to climb the many pyramids but you don\'t see much more than trees from up there.

550256838.name: A Must See
550256838.author: a TripAdvisor user
550256838.reviewBody: This place is much larger than Chitchen Itza. The guide said it is not getting its recognition because it is not as advertised and not as accessible. We spent a good hour here as the guide thoroughly explained all the structures, their functions and how they were built and developed at different times of the Mayan existence. There were places for \u201csacrifice\u201d which I did not care for, a stella signifying \u201cwomen power\u201d and lots of story boards that narrates how some of the materials are recycled for usage. That is how Archealogists were able to determine their time horizon. It is worth seeing to learn more of the Mayan culture and history. This place is remote, a few, close to hundred (I think) kilometers from Xpujil. There are no hotels nearby here. I stayed in Xpujil. You can climb the pesamentos

544847309.name: You can climb the pyramids!  Lots of wildlife
544847309.author: a TripAdvisor user
544847309.reviewBody: This is the largest Mayan site in Mesoamerica and is in the middle of the Calakmul Biosphere reserve.  We saw SO much wildlife, including multiple groups of howler and spider monkeys.  This is a big site with several climbable pyramids, including the 2nd tallest Mayan pyramid.  It was more than a  2 hr drive each way but well worth it!  We stayed at Rio Bec Dreams and I\'d highly recommend it.  The owners are Mayan experts and gave us great advice on a route within the site and on climbing the pyramids.  In addition, the accommodations and food are great!  There are no concessions at Calakmul, even at the entrance, so bring water!

493800689.name: Went there with low expectations came out amazed!
493800689.author: a TripAdvisor user
493800689.reviewBody:
We visited Calakmul on our way from Chetumal to Palenque. Here the details:

The way there: although there are "only" 60km from the road 186 to Calakmul you can only drive about 40-50km/hr as there are wild animals crossing the road, the road is narrow for 2 cars and lots of curves. If you find a car coming from the other direction it can get "tight".  The road is through the jungle and we got to see some wild. Great experience to cross through the dense trees. 

Entrance fees: we paid 3 times. The first payment is for the first 20km as this road is part of an Ejido. The 2nd payment is for the remaining 40km, also an institution that charges for crossing through the land. Finally you get to Calakmul and pay the Entrance Fee charged by the INAH (Instituto Nacional de Arqueología e Historia). All together about 170 pesos. 

The ruins: contrary to Palenque in Calakmul there is NOT a single merchant in the entrance. Nobody selling heats, mosquito repellent, food, sandals, or even water. Its just you, the jungle and the 3 guys taking care of the entrance. The place is huge and you will need to walk a lot, there are many different groups of ruins which you pss by while walking and if you pay attention you will see many more ruins still camouflage by the think jungle. This makes it magic, you know you are walking in a place which hides many secrets. We visited many structures, you are allowed to clim all of them and finally we arrived ad this estructura 6 I think. Looks like a tall pyramid but is so steep you cannot see the peak. We climbed carefully, little leg shaking included, just to arrive at "the top", turn around and realize you are above the jungle! From up there we couldn't even see the other many buildings which we had climbed before because they were all hidden in the jungle. It was this feeling like when you clim such a tall mountain that you are above the clouds. Happy of achieving the "peak" I walked around a bit to realize it wasn't over there were another maybe 20 mts up to climb.. and we were above the trees, with only green in the horizon.

In Summary: wonderful impressions fem the top of the pyramids. You can still climb the tallest structures contrary to Chichen-Itza or Palenque and there are no merchants trying to sell you anything.

My recommendation: make the time to stop here while traveling from Chetumal to Palenque or Campeche. This place is still somehow "untouched" and magical.

487585591.name: A long drive from Campeche, but worth it.
487585591.author: a TripAdvisor user
487585591.reviewBody: Monumental ruins only discovered relatively recently so the infrastructure in the vicinity makes it a bit of an endurance test to visit. Interesting historically and tremedous views from the tops of the pyramids - for the energetic. We also saw monkeys and wild pigs in the Zona.

476215512.name: Off the beaten pat, beautiful
476215512.author: a TripAdvisor user
476215512.reviewBody: Big site with especially great nice pyramids. There are also some animals to see along the road to calakmul. We did it with our rental car and we stayed on camping Yaxhe in the park. That way you can go in the park early and you\'ll see a lot of animals: howler monkeys, spidermonkeys, tejones, feasants, opposums, birds, ... (drive slow). Taxi\'s from Xpujil also drive you (50USD) but you will be there only late, it takes almost 2h30 to arrive from X\'pujil.\nThe views amazing. Consider a guide, as notations are not that good on the ruins and there are no mini-guides available.

471487299.name: Amazing pyramids, flora and fauna in the south of Campeche
471487299.author: a TripAdvisor user
471487299.reviewBody: We have visited many Mayan ruins.  All of them offer a glimpse into the past and all are amazing.  The pyramids at Calakmul are very impressive and once you climb to the top you understand the need for tall structures if for no other purpose than to communicate with the closest Mayan city.  Mirador can barely be seen off to the south once you summit the tallest pyramid at Calakmul and from Mirador the Mayans were supposed to be able to see Tikal.  The Mayans skills in architecture, astronomy and farming in an arid land allowed them to prosper for centuries.  \nCalakmul is not close to anywhere.  You have to plan your visit and I would highly recommend a guide.  The sight is not filled with tourists as is Chichen Itza and there are not any services within the sight.  Bring lots of water and any food you need to take the long drive in from the highway and then spend at least three hours touring.  The actual ruins are over a kilometer from the parking area.  Bathrooms are available and a new service area is under construction and should make the visit more civilized if you have not brought the right provisions with you.  Also, take a hat and sun screen.

471164469.name: Quite a haul to get there
471164469.author: a TripAdvisor user
471164469.reviewBody:
As other revewers have said you really have to want to come here, the site is 57 km from the main road. The first 20km or so are on a good road but after that the road becomes narrower and twisty with sections with big pot holes, in addition trees can fall over the road, it is also difficult to see if anything is coming the other way. You will probably see a lot of wildlife along the road and as it probably doesn't see much traffic things tend not to get out of the way so if there are animal on the road you have to stop to wait for them to decide to move, which does give good opportunity for photos.

The site itself is largely overgrown and architecturally quite different to other site we visited. We had assumed that it would be similar to Tikal as that is relatively close but that is not the case.
I would recommend that you download and print a site map before you visit if you can find one as it is difficult to get your bearings and quite easy to get lost. There  are recommended routes and we tried to follow one but soon went wrong as signage isn't so good, As you are amongst the jungle even when next to the overgrown structures you cant see where you are supposed to be going although the paths are in good condition. The site is quite confusing as you cant make out the layout because of the trees, that said however the buildings are spectacular and it is well worth climbing structure 2 for the view but be aware that it is a double pyramid so when you think you are at the top you find there is another one to climb!

Time from the main road to the site is 60 to 90 minutes each way we had a big car so it wasn't so taxing but it may be  more difficult if you only have something small

It was a good visit but there are other sites closer to the main road that   are more impressive and really easy to get to.

467673671.name: Amazing views from on top
467673671.author: a TripAdvisor user
467673671.reviewBody: We enjoyed Calakmul more than Palenque, maybe because it takes more time and effort to get to the former (both are great but there many fewer people at Calakmul).  We were initially a little unimpressed with Calakmul until we stumbled upon the two tallest pyramids. Once on top, we were the only people (we could see one or two people on top of the other) and the view was amazing - probably 100 km in all directions with nothing but Yucatan forest and no signs of civilization.  Memorable!

465101369.name: Just Terrific!
465101369.author: a TripAdvisor user
465101369.reviewBody: This site takes some planning to get to, I can\'t imagine anyone just driving by.  However, it is definitely worth the planning and the trip.  There were very few people there and it is a very large site, so we really had it to ourselves.  Plan for an entire day - 1.5 hours drive each way from the first gate and then a 30-40 minute walk in from the parking area.  Of course, you are going to want to spend a lot of time seeing the ruins and climbing.  Wear sturdy shoes and bring lots of water and food - there is none available.  We had a lovely visit and hope to return soon.

458069645.name: Nice ruins in the middle of jungle
458069645.author: a TripAdvisor user
458069645.reviewBody: It took quite a while to get there as speed limit on narrow jungle road was 30km/h and there were a lot of pot holes to maneuver through. Site itself was interesting with very nice views from top of the pyramids. If you visit here climb up on highest pyramids or you loose most of the experience. We also saw monkey,  tucan and other animals. I would recommend to reserve at least 4h for walking on this site. We had 3h and we walked 7,5km, we had to be fast to reach Xpujil city before dark.\n

448155963.name: Calakmul: one of the great 4
448155963.author: a TripAdvisor user
448155963.reviewBody: You do not know which is the best attractions of Calakmul: the archeological site or the ecological reserve it is. There we saw a beautiful structure called Structure III, the main pyramid, but we also saw toucans howler monkeys, coatis, my wife and my daughter say they saw the back of a version. What is true is that on our way to Calakmul we saw a jaguarundi crossing the highway, and from the top of the main pyramid we saw a asmall montilce that they told us was El Mirador, other Maya site far far away in the middel of many thousand trees.

447109390.name: AMAZING! MUST SEE!
447109390.author: a TripAdvisor user
447109390.reviewBody: Zona arqueologica de Calakmul is amazing place! You really must see it. It\'s beautifull and there are only few tourist there. Much better then Uxmal or even Chitzen Itza! We only regret that we didn\'t take a guide.

438405388.name: This is Worth Seeinf !
438405388.author: a TripAdvisor user
438405388.reviewBody: This was one stop on our 21 day tour.\nWe saw 23 ruins in 21 days and they wee ALL great.\nWe had the site all to ourselves . What an experience

375947990.name: A must for anyone interested in the Mayans
375947990.author: a TripAdvisor user
375947990.reviewBody: Calakmul is a site unlike any other. It is not a site where everything is in front of you. It is not a site where you walk in, look, and walk out. it is not a site where you are bombarded by salesmen at every few meters trying to sell you the same stuff. This is a site where you forget bout time and place. You need about one hour and a quarter to get to the site and you will be there 2-3 hours. You will walk about 6-7 kms and climb structures tat are about 17 stories high. You will feel away from everything you know. And when you are at the top of the structures, you will feel on top of the world, looking down. You will not see one cable, one house... You will see all the way into Guatemala about 35 KMS away. You should even be able to see the top of El Mirador site in Guatemala. Of course, one must not forget the animals. howler and spider monkeys, ocelated turkeys, coati mundi, deer, parakeets, toucans, agoutis, pecaris... This is a major migratory place for birds. \n\nThe site is huge, but you only get to see 5-6% of the whole site. If you go after April, be ready to be hot. Average is around 40C degrees. Mosquitoes will arrive when the rain starts, usually May/June. In the Mayan world, there are a lot of sites that need to be seen. This one tops them all. This place is great for all ages. You will be tired when done.

675277542.name: Okay
675277542.author: a TripAdvisor user
675277542.reviewBody: I\'m not a big fan of cathederals, and this one is dark, pleasant, and modest. There are some interesting old bells in a corner of the courtyard. The new and old mausoleums are also noteworthy.

665382275.name: Beautiful Cathedral
665382275.author: a TripAdvisor user
665382275.reviewBody:
The gem of the city
Is quiet and beautiful
Mass is everyday and usually on early morning or evening
The construction is from stone and ancient paintings
Catholic people will love this place

656092193.name: Beautiful at night
656092193.author: a TripAdvisor user
656092193.reviewBody: Beautiful old church worth seeing at night when it\'s all lit up. In a great location near the park. Seems to be open all the time. Be sure to bring a few pesos for the homeless fellow who seems to be eternally sitting in the doorway holding a cup out for charity.

654158763.name: with the visit don\'t forget the small museum
654158763.author: a TripAdvisor user
654158763.reviewBody: The cathedral is the first in the colonial times. In fact the first one was placed on the plaza de independencia. When you visit this don\'t forget --and a recommend-- is the small museum next to it. It is at the left side small patio. A nice collection of religious prularia. But worth to visit, the Christ, and find the painting of the first Communion in Mexico/Campeche!

638799055.name: Impressive
638799055.author: a TripAdvisor user
638799055.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral with a lovely park right in front. It\u2019s especially impressive at night with all the lights.

638556616.name: Well worth a visit.
638556616.author: a TripAdvisor user
638556616.reviewBody: We called in here and it is a beautiful interior albeit a little sparse given the impressive exterior. It is located on the main square and makes a beautiful backdrop to the evening\'s events in the square.

636393926.name: Magnificent!
636393926.author: a TripAdvisor user
636393926.reviewBody: Beautiful old church. You can walk in and look around. Exterior is excellent for pictures. Right across from the main square and the trolley tours.

632020955.name: Nice building
632020955.author: a TripAdvisor user
632020955.reviewBody: A cathedral like you see them more in Mexico but that doesn\u2019t take away that it\u2019s a great building in the middle of this town. \nIn the evening it\u2019s even more nice when the lights go on. \n

610875596.name: Beautiful Building
610875596.author: a TripAdvisor user
610875596.reviewBody: Located in the middle of Centro, this historic building is a must see.  Beautiful in the day and evening.

594136586.name: Pretty lights at night
594136586.author: a TripAdvisor user
594136586.reviewBody: It\u2019s a cute cathedral but definitely better to view in the evening especially when the street is busy with people after 10pm....

587524937.name: Beautiful!
587524937.author: a TripAdvisor user
587524937.reviewBody: This church is well preserved and a testament to the colonial period of this city. If you are in Campeche you should definitely take the 20-30 minutes to explore this cathedral.

581699197.name: Great cathedral architecture
581699197.author: a TripAdvisor user
581699197.reviewBody: Visiting the cathedral near the Plaza Principal is a must-do on your itinerary. There is also a small museum accessible through a courtyard off the side of the cathedral.

579722817.name: Interesting place
579722817.author: a TripAdvisor user
579722817.reviewBody: Although it seems to be just another cathedrale there are some nice litte places. I liked the cemetery just outside and the bells (one with a hole through it from battles). Checkout the museum as well, worth to have quick look here.

568369107.name: Beautiful cathedral and museum
568369107.author: a TripAdvisor user
568369107.reviewBody: Helpful and friendly museum attendant shared much specific information on the pieces. Of particular interest was the painting of the black Jesus (Not jj Evans version haha)... highly recommend stopping in.

562576117.name: Nice museum also.
562576117.author: a TripAdvisor user
562576117.reviewBody: Exit to left for 20peso museo with some nice religious pieces and old bells. Nice place and cornerstone of the main plaza.

557807457.name: Be surprised!
557807457.author: a TripAdvisor user
557807457.reviewBody:
I'll start with a tip: after you visit the cathedral, exit by the door on the left (as viewed from the entrance). This will lead you to a hidden gem: a very pleasing patio where you can sit and relax. I was there at night and the composition of the religious imagery (a cross, statues), the illuminated church tower, the palm trees, the garden and the moon above it was simply unforgettable.

That said: the cathedral is a quite simple, colonial church, but it looks great from the outside: bright white during the daytime, setting the tone for the main square in front, and illuminated with good taste after sunset. The inside of the cathedral is plain, but looks authentic. 

Definitely worth a visit and some photos.

556269848.name: Beautiful
556269848.author: a TripAdvisor user
556269848.reviewBody: One of the things I love about travelling the Yucatan, is that each city has a city square/park and a beautiful cathedral. This one did not disappoint.  \nThe architecture of this building is simply beautiful. it has a lovely little courtyard to the side where you can sit and meditate. There also lay the tombs. \nA quiet place to just sit and relax if you wish.

551703318.name: Simple yet Beautiful
551703318.author: a TripAdvisor user
551703318.reviewBody: Campeche seems to be a jewel to explore, not much said about it compared to other places in Mexico, but it has a beautiful arquitecture and so much to explore.\nInteresting main square, great restaurants and cantinas and beautiful artisan shops.\nThe square is full of life and from there you can walk to many lovely streets where you will find amazing crafts, don\'t forget to visit the Casa de Artesan\u00edas and you will be mesmerised with the Colours and beautiful art.

544450214.name: Lovely Catedral started in the 1500s
544450214.author: a TripAdvisor user
544450214.reviewBody: Beautifully maintained and well lighted inside and out. Go twice, during the daytime and then at night, well worth it.

541264263.name: Nice cathedral but there is one better (ex-temple)
541264263.author: a TripAdvisor user
