541264263.reviewBody: From outside it is icon of the square, really nice church which has inside interesting massive silver altar. But from historic view is for me personally better other church nearby: Ex Templo de San Jose. Now is market inside but from outside it  is really nice.

522918658.name: One of the places to visit while in Campeche
522918658.author: a TripAdvisor user
522918658.reviewBody: One of the places to visit while in Campeche, and when crossing, walking thru the old city, you will find yourself in front of this Cathedral, go in and learn a bit more of Campeche.

514067015.name: Campeche a singular town filled with enchanted places Cathedral is one
514067015.author: a TripAdvisor user
514067015.reviewBody:
Dedicated to our lady of the Conception, located within the walls of the fortified city of CAMPECHE , declared Cultural Patrimony of the Humanity. It is the main church of the Diocese of the same name, seat of the bishopric. It is located in front of the Constitution Square of the city. The rank of cathedral was granted in 1895 by Pope Leo XIII.

It is a baroque style building with features of the neoclassic, famous for sheltering in its interior figurines of sacred art, highlighting a monument called "The Holy Burial" that represents a coffin with the figure of Christ and that during Good Friday is carried by The main streets of the city

500940282.name: lovely and quiet
500940282.author: a TripAdvisor user
500940282.reviewBody: we were a little less impressed with the cathedral than others as we have been spoiled by those in europe, south america etc. this one was a touch plain though the chandeliers were not something i was used to and they made it a bit interesting

499500526.name: In the Z\u00f3calo
499500526.author: a TripAdvisor user
499500526.reviewBody: You ha e to see it too at night, because is nice with the lights, in the interior is simple compared to another catehrals that i have seen

491965727.name: Beautiful setting in main square
491965727.author: a TripAdvisor user
491965727.reviewBody: Wonderful and bright, the cathedral dominates the main square and is light and airy inside.  \n\nWorth seeing, I observed a mass and it was very inspirational.

490800905.name: A Definite Must If You Are in Campeche
490800905.author: a TripAdvisor user
490800905.reviewBody: Visiting the Main Square in Campeche requires a visit to this historical church.  It is beautiful inside, and has a great organ/choir loft.  But do not stop at the sanctuary.  Go outside and view the memorial garden area, as well as the church historical area.

489719344.name: Nice cathedral, nothing spectacular
489719344.author: a TripAdvisor user
489719344.reviewBody:
After traveling south east from mexico city i felt kinda let down by Campeche.
Not to say its not a nice city, but it doesnt have the same vibrancy that ive seen so far.
Puebla, Oaxaca city both had better cathedrals and the city square was vibrant and buzzing with locals.
Campeche really felt like a museam with little life or spark.
Perhaps that view will change as i head further east and encounter the over touristy parts of the peninsula.

486229897.name: Total jewel
486229897.author: a TripAdvisor user
486229897.reviewBody: Campeche was a wonderful highlight. We had just stayed in Merida and been a bit underwhelmed by it so we\'re not very optimistic about Campeche but we\'re delighted by jewel coloured houses, lovely main square, great restaurants and really nice artisan shops. We would happily have stayed a couple more days.\n

484970599.name: Beautiful Historic Cathedral
484970599.author: a TripAdvisor user
484970599.reviewBody:
Campeche is a real gem. it is so quiet compared to some of the other cities in Yucatan and surrounding provinces and you sort of get an touched or unchanged vibe when you are relaxing around the city. 
The cathedral and central square are the heartbeat of city life. It is quiet as I said but not dead. It has a lovely energy to it.
The cathedral has an ornate, beautiful facade and makes for a great place to visit.
The interior is huge yet welcoming, ornate yet down-to-earth as it is full of locals just going about their day calling in to say a few prayers. It's great o see a working cathedral rather than just an ornamental one!
Beautiful icons, art and architecture and we really enjoyed our visit.

482790973.name: Nice cathedral
482790973.author: a TripAdvisor user
482790973.reviewBody: Located in the middle of this world heritage site town. Beautiful view from the main square in the late afternoon. Inside nothing special.

478089042.name: Very nice
478089042.author: a TripAdvisor user
478089042.reviewBody: Very nice cathedral in front of the main plaza. The interior is beautiful and the outdoor is also very nice both at day and at night.

476639061.name: Charming
476639061.author: a TripAdvisor user
476639061.reviewBody: This cathedral makes the main square of Campeche a must-see place! Incredibly interesting the history about its two towers, one for spanish conquistadores and one for locals. I suggest you to get a ticket (100 pesos) for a tour (1hour) organized by the tourism association departing from the square in order to visite the city.

473785596.name: The church is rather plain  on the inside
473785596.author: a TripAdvisor user
473785596.reviewBody: A quick look inside is all that is needed; however at night when the church is lighted up is another story. It is must see then. the church is situated next to the main square. the best view is from the outside

471906411.name: Wonderful piece of structure
471906411.author: a TripAdvisor user
471906411.reviewBody: This cathedral stood out on my trip through the beautiful city.  It has so much charm and fit so well with how this city has been built.  \n\nA definite look and see on your walking tour.

469523479.name: nice
469523479.author: a TripAdvisor user
469523479.reviewBody: it s good to see city one think it s fast visit no expensive  you need to see that and know the historic

465410423.name: Beautiful cathedral, centrally located
465410423.author: a TripAdvisor user
465410423.reviewBody: I love the cathedral and the park surrounding. I watched the free cultural show. On that evening there was a band playing beautiful music making my stay memorable.

463703430.name: Very impressive fascade!
463703430.author: a TripAdvisor user
463703430.reviewBody: Really enjoyed this cathedral. Amazing design and architecture. Every town/city has one, but this one is definitely worth a visit.

462457647.name: Wonderful
462457647.author: a TripAdvisor user
462457647.reviewBody: Not the biggest cathedral I\'ve ever seen, or the most decorated one, but when in Campeche definitely worth a visit!

453494048.name: Traditional Cathedral
453494048.author: a TripAdvisor user
453494048.reviewBody: Very nicely preserved Cathedral that continues to offer services throughout the day. Not as big as the one in Merida but nice.

453166610.name: Lovely
453166610.author: a TripAdvisor user
453166610.reviewBody: This was absolutely stunning. I would highly suggest making a trip to this cathedral if I\'m in Campeche.

448116902.name: Good
448116902.author: a TripAdvisor user
448116902.reviewBody: This is a pleasant cool church to visit. At night it is lit and is quite beautiful. Easy to access as it is on the main square.

447507857.name: Only from the outside
447507857.author: a TripAdvisor user
447507857.reviewBody: This is a cathedral poorly decorated in the inside.\nHas a nice view at night.\nAt day it looks also pretty.

446487742.name: Simple place but a must
446487742.author: a TripAdvisor user
446487742.reviewBody: This is the must important chuch in the city so you must be here, is a very simple place but the history inside makes it very attractive, you will find inside some old bells and also an old ashes place, the oldest one I found was one from 1844. In front of this cathedral you will find a city tour

444438968.name: Breathtaking
444438968.author: a TripAdvisor user
444438968.reviewBody: I can\'t even imagine how they pulled this off in the 1600\'s.  Place is huge!  Solid silver alters and pulpit are amazing.  Slabs of gold gilded mahogany were unbelievable.  Make sure and get back at night when its lit.

443356174.name: Catedral in center
443356174.author: a TripAdvisor user
443356174.reviewBody: This catedral is located on main square of the City. It is nice but nothk special. If you find yourself in Campeche, you will probably not miss this place coz it is on main square

441244155.name: Beautiful cathedral
441244155.author: a TripAdvisor user
441244155.reviewBody: Magnificente building with great history. Worth to visit it twice, at day light and by night. In the park in front of the cathedral (Z\u00f3calo) you can take the Turi-bus, which is worthwhile.

438116037.name: Beautiful catedral
438116037.author: a TripAdvisor user
438116037.reviewBody: The  fa\u00e7ade of the catedral of Campeche is from of worked stone with two levels marked off by two grooved pilasters. The San Francisco Church in Campeche was established in the 16th century although the current building dates from the 17th. The church marks the spot where the first mass was held on mainland America.

425768304.name: Visit to the Catedral
425768304.author: a TripAdvisor user
425768304.reviewBody: The Catedral is beautiful, and the focal point of the Main Square in "El Cento". it has great historic significance dating back to the founding of the city. The Clock tower was a gift by the People of Spain to th people of Campeche for protecting Spain\'s interest in the "New World".

425752821.name: Impressive at night
425752821.author: a TripAdvisor user
425752821.reviewBody: Pretty church facing the main plaza.  It is very impressive late at night.  I never went inside as they were having mass when I passed but from a quick peak inside it seemed nice.

405852256.name: Looks good
405852256.author: a TripAdvisor user
405852256.reviewBody: A very nice church dated of XVI century, has a nice altar at the center covered with laminated gold, has a pretty good garden of meditation

394330142.name: Beautiful Historic Cathedral!
394330142.author: a TripAdvisor user
394330142.reviewBody: The Catedral de Campeche sits on the city square opposite the Casa 6 museum. It\'s hard to miss as the two spires are visible from any high point in the city. It is open daily. Free admission for tourists and attendees to services and often used for weddings and quince\u00f1eras. There is a gift shop on the right side and several souvenir stores close by.

385303852.name: Nice cathedral in the city center
385303852.author: a TripAdvisor user
385303852.reviewBody: Nice church cathedral in the city center.  Be sure to visit the church courtyard, cemetery and museum all of which are adjacent to the the cathedral.

381248914.name: Wonderful at night!
381248914.author: a TripAdvisor user
381248914.reviewBody: Very simple inside but fascinating, especially when the sun goes down. Cute little hidden garden inside. Worth a visit!

364713963.name: Nice church
364713963.author: a TripAdvisor user
364713963.reviewBody: Great church at the old city Campeche town square. Nice looking architecture. Enjoyed relaxing in the city park.

357139328.name: Beautiful building
357139328.author: a TripAdvisor user
357139328.reviewBody: View it by night, and visit during the day. Great interior. Door of mercy in the year 2016. Step out in the little courtyard halfway on the left. It breathes history.

355060545.name: impressive durng the night
355060545.author: a TripAdvisor user
355060545.reviewBody: impressive just when it is lighted - during the night. Interior is nothing specia - just another big mexican church. Surprisengly empty even during some service... But if you are around it is worth to step in.

352391258.name: Beautiful pueblo
352391258.author: a TripAdvisor user
352391258.reviewBody: I was amazed by how clean the pueblo\u00b4s square was, (I am mexican and I come from one) it seems like a very civilized town. The catedral is a must see, has the arquitecture of the typical cathedrals in Mexico\u00b4s towns.

352142323.name: A classic old cathedral with a nice museum
352142323.author: a TripAdvisor user
352142323.reviewBody: The cathedral dominates the plaza area (day and night) and it is worth a visit. The inside of the cathedral is not highly decorated and most of the gleaming surfaces are not what they seem (e.g., the shining "silver" is actually tin!).  This was done for a very pragmatic reason -- the church was a favorite for marauding pirates.  Having said that, there is an attached museum (small admission fee), where you can see some of the treasures of the cathedral\'s history, including lots of statues, old tomb stones, and even a relic of the cross.  Definitely worth a visit!

351092606.name: Beautiful Cathedral
351092606.author: a TripAdvisor user
351092606.reviewBody: When visiting dont miss the light and sound show in the zocalo Fri, Sat, and Sun nights.   There is also a new mueseum which opened march 2015 in the yellow government building!

350648938.name: Beautiful Illumination at Night
350648938.author: a TripAdvisor user
350648938.reviewBody: Take a stroll around the inside of the cathedral to view the many statues and ornamentation. It is quite well preserved.The outside is beautifully illuminated at night and can be viewed from the main square. You can\'t miss it.

347632121.name: The cathedral is a real highlight
347632121.author: a TripAdvisor user
347632121.reviewBody: This cathedral is steeped in history, it is beautifully preserved and open for everyone to visit and enjoy the fantastic tiles and statutes.

345995563.name: Lovely colonial cathedral
345995563.author: a TripAdvisor user
345995563.reviewBody: Don\'t miss the opportunity to stroll round this lovely baroque cathedral if you are in Campeche.  It is also illuminated at night, making a fine focal point for the main square.

343718455.name: Strange
343718455.author: a TripAdvisor user
343718455.reviewBody: In the main  square it promisses the solemnity of a Temple.\nWhen You enter, given the heat even In the evening, all the doors ( main and laterals) are opened and so the Temple mingles with the street. The Temple is outside and outside is In the Temple. In a secondary chapel you may see a religious service going on and next to it people selling things.\nThe south american surrealism.

342146540.name: Beautiful Cathedral by day and nighttime
342146540.author: a TripAdvisor user
342146540.reviewBody: The Cathedral is located in the main square and it gorgeous to see both in daylight and nighttime.  It\'s beautifully lit up at night and there\'s a lot of action going on in the square,  Lots of nice restaurants overlooking the Cathedral.  Did a city walking tour the following morning and I got to visit the Cathedral and it\'s stunning inside and it\'s filled with history.

340609675.name: It looks great during the day and even better at night!
340609675.author: a TripAdvisor user
340609675.reviewBody: This is a beautiful cathedral and one of the landmarks of Campeche. It is one of the ley attractions of the walled historical city which can be visited by foot or via a kind of tram system!

337691927.name: A pleasant View
337691927.author: a TripAdvisor user
337691927.reviewBody: the Cathedral is located across from the park. You can also find a museum and places to eat. A place to relax and enjoy the ambiance.

337066571.name: Beautiful and Impressive Cathedral Overlooking the Pleasant and Peaceful Treed Central Plaza!
337066571.author: a TripAdvisor user
337066571.reviewBody:
I visited Campeche’s cathedral on numerous occasions during my two day stay in the city. 

The Catedral de Nuestra Senora de la Purisima Concepcion is located on Calle 55 between Calles 8 and 10. 

The cathedral was a huge and impressive building with beautiful architecture. In the evening and nighttime, the cathedral was lit up beautifully. I got an amazing view of the cathedral in the evening from the restaurant Casa Vieja de los Arcos, which had seating on the balcony of an historic building overlooking the central plaza and cathedral. 

The cathedral overlooks Campeche’s central plaza. The park and plaza was small, pleasant and quiet during the day. It was surrounded on all sides by well-maintained colourful historic buildings. There were lots of beautiful shade trees and plants, as well as seating throughout the park’s pathways. I enjoyed resting and relaxing in the peaceful and calm atmosphere here. The park seemed to be the perfect gathering/meeting place for the locals to hang out and chat with each other. 

I recommend checking out the cathedral and the plaza when you are in Campeche!

334945567.name: Great cathedral from colonial days
334945567.author: a TripAdvisor user
334945567.reviewBody: Whatever ones feelings may be about colonialism here is a statement of intent from the Spanish. This is the religion. It shouts at you in a manner that is impressive and commands attention- no I am not a catholic. MXP 5 for use of clean toilet in courtyard. 30 mins is enough but very impressive.

598892562.name: two hour \u0131s there
598892562.author: a TripAdvisor user
598892562.reviewBody: I liked the museum a lot, I recommend it. since the income is at a low price and the guides are very professional. I like that it is accompanied at all times. I like the province and the ecolog

address.streetAddress: Calle 30 A un costado de la glorieta de la artesana.

570815254.name: History, culture, ecology and art
570815254.author: a TripAdvisor user
570815254.reviewBody: History, culture, ecology, art, human rights, all this promotes the museum that is a little hidden in its location, the guides especially Jorge and Alez are super attentive, answer any questions and try, this formidable, is clean and sure the very large parking lot, to be in such a small town is a great museum

address.streetAddress: Calle 30 A un costado de la glorieta de la artesana.

465580849.name: Culture and tradition
465580849.author: a TripAdvisor user
465580849.reviewBody: A very interesting museum, to spend 1 hour, have nature, history, culture and tradition, highly recommended

address.streetAddress: Calle 30 A un costado de la glorieta de la artesana.

641634001.name: Trip to the Dolphins
641634001.author: a TripAdvisor user
641634001.reviewBody: Isla Aquada is about a 2 hour drive from The city of Campeche. It\u2019s located on the lagoon side and it is where we were able to get the boats for the Dolphins.

579220158.name: only when passing by
579220158.author: a TripAdvisor user
579220158.reviewBody: on our way from villahermosa to palenque we passed this laguna. We enjoyed a boat tour for bird viewing and met some dolphins, really nice. besides that, not worth to stop here.

555412205.name: Isla Aguada Dolphin view
555412205.author: a TripAdvisor user
555412205.reviewBody: Isla Aguada has an incredible natural view of the dolphins at its natural habitat. Yo can view birds and the dolphins, you can go to a small island with shells and swim in the sea and at the Laguna de Terminos

553970120.name: Not worth the time
553970120.author: a TripAdvisor user
553970120.reviewBody: Went there to watch dolphins on January, there were more boats searching and following than dolphins, we only saw 3, and no closer than 40 feet.  Then you go to a small island that you can walk around in less than 30 minutes and back.   Maybe on other dates there are more dolphins, if you\'re not sure you can skip this.

541249020.name: Unless you want desolate..
541249020.author: a TripAdvisor user
541249020.reviewBody:
My partner and I planned to do a day trip to Isla Aguada from Campeche in search of dolphins that are said to inhabit the area of Isla Aguada and Cuidad Del Carmen. 

Although the drive was scenic along the coast, the scenery was somewhat depressing, as there was abandoned cabanas and buildings along the beaches throughout the drive. Let me say that I am not opposed to 'quiet', but there were literally no other people on any of the beaches, which weren't even that nice, with lots garbage littered about and strong smells of sewage and rotting garbage. 

Once we actually reached the Isla, there didn't seem to be much of anything for the public. We did come in 'off' season (November 16), but even restaurants complete with signage seemed complete deserted or even abandoned. 

We made it about 15 kms from Cuidad Del Carmen before we gave up and turned around. We read that one would have to pay a local fisherman or seek a boat to tour for dolphin sightings, but quoted just under 900 pesos just didn't seem worth the trouble, although I would consider seeing dolphins in the wild a once in a lifetime opportunity. We decided we would be better off to do an actual dolphin tour in Cancun than go any further on this 'Island'. 

The positives of the day trip was a scenic drive along the water. Perhaps we might've had better success had we reached Cuidad Del Carmen but the feeling of being the only tourists in the area was surprisingly not the greatest feeling. We were also warned by a Campeche local that crime is high in the area, as it is an area known for oil patches and a lot of workers have been apparently out of jobs. 

If you want to feel like you are the only person on an abandoned not-so-island, then look no further.

482791716.name: Superb beach
482791716.author: a TripAdvisor user
482791716.reviewBody: No hectic and simply perfect to enjoy the wonderful beach and amazing sea view. Not easy to get there without rental car.

456919253.name: Fabulous
456919253.author: a TripAdvisor user
456919253.reviewBody: Loved it quite & clean , perfect for traditional relaxation summer Mexican place . Surrounded with sea & trees everywhere

449425499.name: This very flat island forms together with two peninsulas the northern boundary of the Laguna de T\u00e9rminos.
449425499.author: a TripAdvisor user
449425499.reviewBody: You have to pass this Island if you wish to take the scenic route from southern Mexico to the Yucatan peninsula.The road follows the sea quite a lot and you also get nice views of the lagoon. Pelicans are seen in great numbers and there are plenty of other birds. You can get nice shrimps and other seafood at little restaurants, if you don\u00b4t mind a very rural setting.

422544263.name: Good place just for a stop
422544263.author: a TripAdvisor user
422544263.reviewBody: Its a good place to take some nice pictures in a quick stop, even stay for a weekend if you pretend to do the tours that the place offer. Nice sightseing.

417056909.name: Isla Aguada awesome place
417056909.author: a TripAdvisor user
417056909.reviewBody: I love this place. We had the opportunity to see dolphins and enjoyed the small Island we stopped for swimming. People are very nice.

403721304.name: Nice place to go to see a beautiful sunset
403721304.author: a TripAdvisor user
403721304.reviewBody: I got some of the best pictures on my trip to Mexico at Isla Aguada I arrived just before the sunset

398110457.name: Hidden little paradise, nice people too.
398110457.author: a TripAdvisor user
398110457.reviewBody: My husband and I were driving around and saw this beautiful water and followed it to a few restaurants. We had seafood and drinks on the beach 5 different times during our month stay in Cd Del Carmen. We met some great people and had a wonderful time. Took some gorgeous pics.

358281930.name: Stay in ciudad del Carmen!
358281930.author: a TripAdvisor user
358281930.reviewBody: Isla aguada was desolate and unless you\'re planning on paying over a thousand pesos a night for a place, extremely unhospitable for travelers. Freedom shores was cool for camping and the management was lovely, but I wouldn\'t recommend the town for young backpackers.

285662739.name: Perfect
285662739.author: a TripAdvisor user
285662739.reviewBody: A great place in  Campeche!! good seafoods cheaper and very nice. The place is way to go Merida yucatan

258877330.name: free-living dolphins
258877330.author: a TripAdvisor user
258877330.reviewBody: after asking around where the dolphins are, we finally go to the fisherman who offered us a two hours tour for 900 pesos. first we drove to a mangrove with a lot of different big birds. then they tried to spot the dolphins with no luck, but when we stopped on an island, somebody called him and told him where they are.\nWOW! we found a group of more than 7 dolphins and this seams to be normal as they live here all year round. one even jumped and one was very curious! amazing experience.

675277013.name: Okay but no better
675277013.author: a TripAdvisor user
675277013.reviewBody: It\'s hard to compete in a world filled with genuine world-class Mayan buildings. The city wall isn\'t in the same league. Not extensive, and only medium views from the top. Still, it\'s something to see if you are wandering the city.

671929882.name: Amazing piece of history
671929882.author: a TripAdvisor user
671929882.reviewBody: So this is one of the 4 gates the city had to protect themselves from pirates. Now there are only 2 standing. The one in the picture is La puerta de tierra (Gate to the land) and Puerta de Mar (Gate to the sea); each right in front of the other, across the whole town. You can walk the top of the wall for a magnificent view.

669422410.name: Enchanting
669422410.author: a TripAdvisor user
669422410.reviewBody: What a wonderful area!  The wall wraps around the colourful streets and is steps from the malecon and ocean. \n\nSo many wonderful photo ops and so much exploring to be done inside the wall.

664832325.name: The wall is very interesting with several arches to walk through
664832325.author: a TripAdvisor user
664832325.reviewBody: Check out the walled city of Campeche.  Very interesting brass sculptures of fisherman along the inside of the wall.  Lots of shops to wander in and restaurants to eat at.

663765332.name: love this place
663765332.author: a TripAdvisor user
663765332.reviewBody: This trip to Campeche was incredible. I stayed @ a hotel near the center, where I could go for a walk through its colorful streets, the weather was perfect - not hot, sunny. Every cafe, every house, every restaurant has its charm. Food is amazing here as well and prices are very reasonable.

662990185.name: Another brick in the wall
662990185.author: a TripAdvisor user
662990185.reviewBody:
In the middle of town you have the possibility to step up the old city wall of Campeche. 
Please do not expect something really spectacular as the wall is what is it: A wall!
For sure, the historical background is interesting and you find some helpful information as well. They also put some pirate stuff in front of the wall to underline how the past looks, maybe more interesting for kids. 
We mostly enjoyed to walk on top of the wall while having a great view over Campeche. 
Beware it’s hot! Take your hat and water.
Further there is just one entry. So the distance you walk along, you also have to take back. 
It was funny to ring a big bell so that the lady from the cashier counter let us out. 
So overall it is not a wrong choice, enjoy the view 

660049507.name: Baluarte de Santa Rosa
660049507.author: a TripAdvisor user
660049507.reviewBody: Baluarte de Santa Rosa is one of several stops along the perimeter of the old city. Free entry. A nice courtyard & the top has a bell, watchtower, & what appears to be a toilet up high? I know, not your typical thing to mention in a review, but I wonder why one is here, but not at Baluarte San Carlos for example, or many other similar fortifications.

657168854.name: Look for Baluarte San Carlos
657168854.author: a TripAdvisor user
657168854.reviewBody: The best museum around the wall is the Baluarte San Carlos near the south west corner of the walled city. It is free and has signs in Spanish & English. There is very interesting information about the pirate history of Campeche (also debunking a few myths). \nYou only need 30 minutes to 1 hour explore here - but well worth the time.

654158295.name: yes enjoy for a later afternoon
654158295.author: a TripAdvisor user
654158295.reviewBody: A nice entertainment for the late afternoon, or early before teh noon; In the mid day it is too hot! Especially the part with the pirates is enjoyable when you visit with your younger kids.

648327125.name: Watch out for the pirates
648327125.author: a TripAdvisor user
648327125.reviewBody: The city wall surrounding old downtown is the reminisce of one of the first cities in Mexico after Cort\u00e9s. Constantly sacked by pirates, the wall gave means of protection for the city. Though many parts are missing it shows what this city must have been like. Would\u2019ve loved to see more museum like information.

647911184.name: An okay activity
647911184.author: a TripAdvisor user
647911184.reviewBody: We walked the route late in our stay so we had already been to most of the good museums and bulwarks. What was new to us (pirates) was pretty uninspiring but we didn\u2019t have to pay for it so why not look? It was a hot day. Sstaying in shade was challenging. The longer we walked the busier it got so it became less enjoyable as we went along.

645112562.name: Fun to stroll around
645112562.author: a TripAdvisor user
645112562.reviewBody: This is a quick trip but fun to go up the wall - and also a good view. There is also a museum on the one side which is also worth a visit.

638877638.name: Walled city in Mexico
638877638.author: a TripAdvisor user
638877638.reviewBody: this is a great little city very clean, welcoming people and fun centro area.  You are free to roam around the wallsand take photos

636368134.name: Great VIEW from the top!
636368134.author: a TripAdvisor user
636368134.reviewBody: Fantastic old, old wall around the city to protect from previous pirates. Each area of the wall has now been turned into something different, museum, botanical garden, light show, etc.

636280682.name: Great for history
636280682.author: a TripAdvisor user
636280682.reviewBody: Fabulous museum and a lovely old wall, we were a little disappointed it wasn\u2019t bigger but we walked the whole city and other parts of the wall as well this is worth doing as there is a larger section further on around the city.

633142360.name: Colorful historic district
633142360.author: a TripAdvisor user
633142360.reviewBody: The city has done a nice job of preserving the wall and the homes and  businesses have joined in.  It is very nice.  Plenty of small cafes and restaurants.\nWe will most likely go back and spend more time in this pleasant town.

632021340.name: Historic
632021340.author: a TripAdvisor user
632021340.reviewBody: Great to see that such an old city wall still exists over all those years. Outside the wall you will find a completely different city.

630389476.name: Good to walk around and on
630389476.author: a TripAdvisor user
630389476.reviewBody: Took a few hours to walk around, on and visit the museums on route and the botanical garden. It was really good. On a Thursday there is a spectacular light show. It\'s very cheap, not really that spectacular and all in Spanish which we don\'t speak but we loved it all the same.

610874984.name: A good show
610874984.author: a TripAdvisor user
610874984.reviewBody: The show lasts about an hour (starts at 8:00) and the cost was $60p.  Entire show is in spanish but still worth seeing and easy enough to follow along if you do not speak spanish.

610869280.name: Good show
610869280.author: a TripAdvisor user
610869280.reviewBody: (Starts at 8:00 in the evening),  even though it is in Spanish (only), we were still able to follow along with

602165224.name: Ring the Bell!
602165224.author: a TripAdvisor user
602165224.reviewBody: Great Views from the top of the wall.  Ring the Pirate attack alarm bell over the sea gate.  You don\'t have to hit it hard for a loud sound.  Great views from there.  The museum underneath is Free too.

601826633.name: Nice to see
601826633.author: a TripAdvisor user
601826633.reviewBody: It was very hot when we visited Campeche. We crossed the wall when we walked to the see. It is nice to see.

601640320.name: Cultural Must
601640320.author: a TripAdvisor user
601640320.reviewBody: If you are interested in historical events this is a place you must visit. A $15 pesos fee to access the top of the wall and have a view of surrounding streets at downtown. Parking is a little bit challenging, for you have to do so on nearby streets and spots are limited. Beautifully lighted for a night stroll without dealing with the heat during the day.

594112711.name: An easy stroll through a beautiful town!
594112711.author: a TripAdvisor user
594112711.reviewBody: The old city walls are a must see while in Campeche.  From the old main gate you can see the seaside gate, so it\'s not very big.  They have a nice depiction of the wall and the town inside the gate.

591412516.name: Cool views and a touch of history
591412516.author: a TripAdvisor user
591412516.reviewBody: This was my husband\'s and my third trip to Campeche, but the first time that we discovered you can actually walk on top of the old city wall. Entrance is 15 pesos (less than $1 at current exchange rates), which gets you access to three small rooms with museum displays, and also to the sloping stone ramp that leads to the top of the wall. From there, you can walk for several blocks, looking out over rooftops and checking out the cannons that are still perched in the baluartes above. The displays are admittedly pretty uneventful, although learning about the pirates of yore is somewhat interesting. But for less than a buck, it\'s well worth the ticket price just to see Campeche from a fresh angle and get a glimpse of the city\'s rich history.

589760557.name: Story inside each baluarte
589760557.author: a TripAdvisor user
589760557.reviewBody: Walking along the wall you will find treasures in each baluarte: botanical museums, pirate stories, etcetera. There are some access points to walk on top of the wall and have a magnificent look of the city.

584643859.name: Walled  cities are fascinating and this is no exception
584643859.author: a TripAdvisor user
584643859.reviewBody: This city wall is no longer complete but it apparently had the sea just outside its main gate but the sea is further away now. It is strongly built with a museum inside part of the wall if you wish to walk the wall.

583741142.name: Very interesting
583741142.author: a TripAdvisor user
583741142.reviewBody: We came upon a section of the wall by accident and then found a little museum all about it. It was well worth the small entrance fee to be able to walk on top of the wall, get some history of the place and then visit the dungeon.

581697363.name: Fascinating history
581697363.author: a TripAdvisor user
581697363.reviewBody: The history of the walled city of Campeche is fascinating. It\u2019s a UNESCO world heritage site definitely worth seeing.

579725425.name: Remarkable for a Mexican city
579725425.author: a TripAdvisor user
579725425.reviewBody: The city wall is an impressive architectural element with quite big impact on the architectural layout of the old centre. Compare with other city walls in the world it is a pity that quite some parts have been torn down. People noticed now and are taking care which is good.

577953862.name: Good for a walk around the old city
577953862.author: a TripAdvisor user
577953862.reviewBody:
I did the fuul loop of the old city and old city wall. Firstly the wall doesn't go all the way around. My guess would be 60%. It's a decent walk so I suggest not doing it in the heat around the middle of the day.

I started at Baluarte de San Pedro and worked my way clockwise. You pay 15 Pesos at this point to see a small pirate etc museum and get access to this stretch of the wall. Note you can't get off the wall at the far end so you have to double back and then retrace your steps, which makes for a long walk.

At Baluarte de la Soledad paid another 45 Pesos to see a small anthropological museum and access this section of wall. This really wasn't worth it but it's only a few dollars.

Views if the old city and the new one for that matter are good from the wall.

572890834.name: really cool
572890834.author: a TripAdvisor user
572890834.reviewBody: this place was really cool. i didn\'t know mexico had a pirate problem in the old days but that\'s what they put this big old wall up. we think of pyramids but mexico has a lot to offer with colonial history as well.

571564772.name: An important part of Campeche history !
571564772.author: a TripAdvisor user
571564772.reviewBody: Tired of Pirates ransacking your city, build a wall, which Campeche did !  Maybe not on the top of your visit list but it is well worth a look.  They are even restoring parts of it, versus tearing it down.  Check it out.  Enjoy! Skippyfrizz !\n\n

566452565.name: Amazing !
566452565.author: a TripAdvisor user
566452565.reviewBody: I sight to behold.A good portion of the original wall that surrounded the city of Campeche is still intact built by the Spaniards to protect from invasion of pirates such as `Blackbeard\'.A must see for history buffs !

562575781.name: Nice views.
562575781.author: a TripAdvisor user
562575781.reviewBody: A must if in town. Nice views and get some history in the small museum.  Very interesting history in this town.

560903636.name: Nothing special
560903636.author: a TripAdvisor user
560903636.reviewBody: They\'re old and not particularly interesting. There are a couple of museums in various sections. One had some historical items. Interesting if you like old weapons and pirate lore. Another museum was closed for 5 days. Campeche, in general, is a work in progress.

560538185.name: Don\'t miss the evening presentation
560538185.author: a TripAdvisor user
560538185.reviewBody: Campeche is one of a few walled cities where original walls still exist.  A walk about is interesting and unique.

559930724.name: Keeping pirates out since 1686
559930724.author: a TripAdvisor user
559930724.reviewBody:
Campeche and pirates go hand in hand, and no visit to this city would be complete without a visit to the Old City Wall that served as a fortification against pirate attacks during the 17th century.  

We started our visit at the Baluarte de San Francisco (bastion of San Francisco), which houses a tiny museum that chronicles the stories of some of the pirates that found their way to Campeche both before and after the wall was built.  This makes for some fascinating reading, though as a native Spanish speaker I'm warning you that if you don't read Spanish, you may just want to skip the museum altogether.  The exhibit has English translations, but they're not very good.  

Whether you visit the museum or not, from the base of the bastion you can walk up to the top of the wall that connects the San Francisco, San Juan, and Santa Rosa bastions.  It was already dark when we visited, so we had to rush through unfortunately.  Though we got to walk the length of the wall, we didn't visit the ground level of either the San Juan or Santa Rosa bastions, which I believe house other small museums.  The night time walk made for a nice stroll, but I would recommend visiting while it's still light out so that you can take your time exploring the wall.

559835857.name: Impressive remnants of old walls
559835857.author: a TripAdvisor user
559835857.reviewBody: The city of Campeche has done a commendable job of restoring and maintaining the remnants of its old city walls.  Like so many other walled cities, especially in Europe, many parts of the walls were demolished to make way for trollies, new streets, or to make room for development, i.e., more housing or commercial edifices.  What remains in Campeche is still pretty impressive, though.  Well worth a look.

556976119.name: Interesting
556976119.author: a TripAdvisor user
556976119.reviewBody: Visted around here with a local so im not sure what information i am missing, but what an intriguing city.

556269335.name: Awesome!
556269335.author: a TripAdvisor user
556269335.reviewBody: Really enjoyed the Old Cit Wall. You can tour the pirate cave down below, then you get to walk the wall.\nIt was fun walking along this amazing piece of history and imagine how it would have been for people 500 years ago. It is incredible to see what they built and were capable of with so little for tools back in the day.\nA definite must when in the city.

555513055.name: There are many parts to Campeche Wall
555513055.author: a TripAdvisor user
555513055.reviewBody: The wall has a number of Bulwarks to visit. Must see are San Carlos, Santa Rosa, and San Francisco. The others are fun if you have time.

553968865.name: Make sure you read about the pirate history
553968865.author: a TripAdvisor user
553968865.reviewBody: Campeche was a big trading port and back then  the sea reached the wall.  To make it a better experience, make sure to read about it and the many known pirates attacks on the city.

551643880.name: Great place to explore
551643880.author: a TripAdvisor user
551643880.reviewBody: We loved the museum displays and learning a bit about the history and pirates of Campeche. The kids (and adults!) had a blast walking around the wall at dusk, getting a new perspective on the city and imagining times gone by.\n\nWould have been nice if English versions were available.

550248294.name: Everything is Close - Historical
550248294.author: a TripAdvisor user
550248294.reviewBody: This is a very historic town. There are many structures to see that symbolize their significance and existence in their own time. There are some boards for story-telling. Some walls of some buildings were a meter thick. From churches to administrative buildings and handicraft stores, you can enjoy a nice walk.  It seems like a reminder of strong and indestructible architecture and a reminder of their talented building abilities.

544450955.name: mostly intact and  it really encloses the old city but for a few places
544450955.author: a TripAdvisor user
544450955.reviewBody: We really did not know what to expect but this had to be a hugh endevor for the spanish to build these very thick walls and gates into the old city of Campeche. They are well restored much like many of the walled cities of europe. The sea gate is impressive when walking down Calle 59 since it centers on the street. At the opposite end of Calle 59 is the land gate. Several other gates, forts and towers are around the fortifications, all well lighted at night.

544124651.name: Interesting museums
544124651.author: a TripAdvisor user
544124651.reviewBody: We spend a morning walking along the path of the wall (much of it is missing) and visiting the museums located in the old forts.  One museum showed Mayan stellae.  Others showed the city fortifications, pirates and defenders, art, etc.  If you want to do this, get a map of the historic district that shows the locations of the forts or baluartes. Some have small fees and others are free. They were all worthwhile., and I highly recommend doing this if you like to walk.  Some are closed on Mondays.

542726284.name: Great way to spend a few hours
542726284.author: a TripAdvisor user
542726284.reviewBody: You get to walk, climb a bit, enter a few tiny museums and have great vistas of the city, the gulf, the reclaimed lands, and more generally it was a good way to learn a bit about the city because  officials at each baluarte are happy to impart their knowledge of history.

541264546.name: City walls of Campeche
541264546.author: a TripAdvisor user
541264546.reviewBody: Nice and massive walls with preserved gates. You can go on that walls and make a photos of city. There is entrance fee.

538066878.name: It\u2019s a must see
538066878.author: a TripAdvisor user
538066878.reviewBody: On our last day in Campeche we decided to do this to pass a few hours. Big mistake. We should have done this the first day we were there. So much history, three small areas with artifacts. Go see it, allot at least an hour or two. Great photo opps. It is really a must see!

523106367.name: interesting!!
523106367.author: a TripAdvisor user
523106367.reviewBody: Every night at 8pm they do a pirate show at one of the main gates unfortunately it is all in Spanish. However as part of the show They take you up on to the wall so you get to walk a small part of the wall at night. The night views of the city were really beautiful especially the churches. I can\'t remember the price of the ticket but it wasn\'t expensive you can buy the ticket at the gate,

514383366.name: Interesting
514383366.author: a TripAdvisor user
514383366.reviewBody: We visited 2 out of 5 open small museums...20 pesos per adult. One on history of campeche and one really well presented on Mayan architecture, glyphs etc after this on our way to calakmul which is a great preparation. Also the views from the wall is magnificent and the small model of the town is interesting

514067772.name: Interesting wall to see
514067772.author: a TripAdvisor user
514067772.reviewBody: as all the city one can find very interesting walls that used to be part of a fortress that kept the town guarded from PIRATES

512976686.name: Very nice view back in time
512976686.author: a TripAdvisor user
512976686.reviewBody: We went there with the family to see how the city was protected from the buccaneers from all over the world trying to robb the valuaties from the Spanish colonialists. The fac that the wal is stil intact is great. The details of the wall are also great to see. However as teh city has gewoon over the past centuries, parts of the wall had to come down and other parts were rebuild. Therefore the authenticity of the walls has become less. Nevertheless it is still unique to have such an example of fortification of a city vivid today !

500708334.name: Nice place to travel in time
500708334.author: a TripAdvisor user
500708334.reviewBody: Is amazing what can be discovered just walking, to simple view is just an old door (without door) and a stone wall, but the magic: is accessible to walk up the wall, see the city and discover how was the view of guards when they protected the city watching pirates in the sea, there is a museum too, cost?  Already of 2 dollars

499497790.name: Beautiful
499497790.author: a TripAdvisor user
499497790.reviewBody: This is why that Unesco fine this place historic ... Has every thing is a chamed that Porfirio D\u00edaz Had turn down some parts of the wall... But that is part of the history

493714553.name: Beautiful Ancient Walls
493714553.author: a TripAdvisor user
493714553.reviewBody: So charming and beautiful. We stayed 3 days inside the walled city. It is wonderful. An active city center for citizens and one really nice pedestrian street. \n\nThe walls are so much fun, provide great views and transport you to the time when they were needed.

490801329.name: A Must See if in Campeche
490801329.author: a TripAdvisor user
490801329.reviewBody: There is such rich history in Campeche, and a lot of it has to do with the ancient walled city.  If you are visiting Campeche then you MUST visit the Old City Wall.  Views are excellent from the top of the wall and there are great museums to see in the base of the wall.

484969276.name: Really Enjoyable Walk
484969276.author: a TripAdvisor user
484969276.reviewBody: We loved Campeche, such a quaint historic little city and while still very much on the tourist trail, totally quiet, unspoiled and free of crowds. The walls are a great way to start your exploration of the town, they help orientate you and give you a great first impression.\nWe had a really enjoyable stroll along the ramparts. The old town centre is so rustic and welcoming.\nA really good way to spend and hour or two.

484735399.name: The night show is a bust. They shouldn\'t charge for it
484735399.author: a TripAdvisor user
484735399.reviewBody: I\'m passionate about history, and love historical re-enactments. So when we learned they have one at Puerta de Tierra, I didn\'t hesitate to pay the $60 pesos for it. \nThe whole thing is run by 4 teens, looks like. They are and behave SUPER young. The explanation of the architecture is given through a loudspeaker with the most monotone voice. About the re-enactment, although the voice off narration is very interesting, the actors are inexperienced and are not motivated. Looks like this is a joke for them, you can hear them over the microphone laughing and telling jokes, and throwing stuff at each other (specifically the prop cannon balls), when they shouldn\'t be. \nImmature and childish behavior overall. But enjoy the scenery and architecture. THAT is what is worth.

484200679.name: Need to understand Spanish for light and sound show
484200679.author: a TripAdvisor user
484200679.reviewBody: We visited at night for the light and sound show. We understand Spanish pretty well and particularly enjoyed the second half hour of the visit which was a history of Campeche with commentary, lights and acting. First half you go up on the walls with a guide which gives a nice view but the talking I could have done without. Don\'t bother at with the light and sound show if you don\'t understand Spanish well.

482790716.name: World heritage site
482790716.author: a TripAdvisor user
482790716.reviewBody: Beautiful town with thousands of photo motives. We visited the town on Sunday afternoon. Very less people could be seen and perfect light for taking best photos.

481276762.name: The pirate show is not that great, but the views of the old city at night are worth the price.
481276762.author: a TripAdvisor user
481276762.reviewBody: We had been told not to miss the show at night. Unfortunately the show is in Spanish. There really is not much of a show. The best part is to be able to view the old city from the top of the wall and you can only do this at night if you pay for the show. it takes about 1 hour. If you want to do something touristy or have an hour to kill,then this may be for you. Otherwise save your money.

480333337.name: A piece of history
480333337.author: a TripAdvisor user
480333337.reviewBody: Build against pirates and what is left (about 30%) is very well preserved. \nWish access to top level could be open all time,

478088855.name: Very nice
478088855.author: a TripAdvisor user
478088855.reviewBody: Great fort walls surrounding the old city of Campeche. Very interesting to visit the different doors and "baluartes" (fortresses)

475969512.name: Beautiful place
475969512.author: a TripAdvisor user
475969512.reviewBody: Excellent to walk to eat to drinks and for a good family time !! I love campeche ! A happy place in mexico

473789588.name: amazing wall
473789588.author: a TripAdvisor user
473789588.reviewBody: It is great to see things being preserved, although there are only a few section of the city wall left. However, they have been nicely redone. By visiting one of the museum you are able to walk on the wall.

473615090.name: nice place
473615090.author: a TripAdvisor user
473615090.reviewBody: I\'ve spend one day in this town and i was not disappointed. There was so much to see, with lovely colours on the houses inside the walls. Lovely little square, shops and things to see. Worth a 1-2 day visit.

471905241.name: I felt like being in another world.
471905241.author: a TripAdvisor user
471905241.reviewBody:
I took a day trip to this town and was not disappointed.  There was so much to see, with lovely colours on the houses inside the walls.

Calle 59 was great to walk on.  I went through the market and came back through the walls on 51.  Lovely little square, shops and things to see.

Worth a 1-2 day visit.

469523378.name: pretty nice view
469523378.author: a TripAdvisor user
469523378.reviewBody: it s very nice to see it s start in downtown and you see that and it s impress you need to go there for sure

468890653.name: Campeche: a place with charm and history
468890653.author: a TripAdvisor user
468890653.reviewBody: When I arrived at Campeche City I was surprised to see what is left of the stone wall that surrounded it and also protected it from pirate attacks. The wall has two doors: sea and land door. A small museum is next to the land door and there you come to know that the city suffered ten or eleven attacks of pirates. Of course, Drake and Morgan were present in that list. The museum also tells you that a group of pirates captured two Franciscan priests near the city . They asked ransom for them, but no one paid, so the pirate ship sailed into the sea with its prisoners. It happend that a storm sank the ship and the only two survivors were the priests. But while you decide what is the real history of the place, you can walk by its old streets and take a look at the cathedral. You can also take a look to the color by which the old houses are painted and by closing your eyes for a minute think you can also see you youself in that place under the heat of the sun in  the late XVIII century talking to Mr.and Mrs. Perez (Smith) before opening the wooden door of your house.  You can also go to visit the two forts that are both side of the city: Fuerte San Miguel and Fuerte San Jos\u00e9, which were built in the late part of the XVIII. There you can see their old and useless cannons that threatened pirates and other enemies of the time. But if you want something real of this world that is marvellous then go to have lunch at Marganzo. Oh, my God, there I asked for the fish of the day with a special sauce of \u201cflor de calabaza\u201d (sauce of pumpkin flower?) with a glass of w\u00e1ter of chia combined with pineapple. Uf, that is something wonderful to eat and drink. Or if you like more modern and more traditional place to eat sea food then you can go to Pirigua and ask for their fish with green (parsley) sauce. Here and there you can order shrimps, octupus and baby shark. I enjoyed very much the place because I was not only in an old well preserved city, but I was also in place where you can take a tour to visit important Mayan archeological sites that are somewhat close such as: Edzn\u00e1, Hochob, Dzibilnocac, El Tabasque\u00f1o and other places. Campeche City is a place full of charm and history.

467477208.name: Cartagena-lite
467477208.author: a TripAdvisor user
467477208.reviewBody: Those who have been to that Colombian city will feel some familiarity here.  Entrance via the Puerta de la Tierra gives access to some lovely city views and some insight into how Campeche was defended from pirates.

465639610.name: Restored city
465639610.author: a TripAdvisor user
465639610.reviewBody: Campeche is nicely restored , clean, safe and not overwhelmed with tourists. a welcome destination after the usual touristy spots

465409596.name: Great Wall of China ?
465409596.author: a TripAdvisor user
465409596.reviewBody: I enjoyed walking here with some history thrown in.  It was such a mysterious link that I ended up in my hostel unexpectedly.

463711877.name: Really interesting history.
463711877.author: a TripAdvisor user
463711877.reviewBody: Definitely lots of history in this colonial center. A wall built around the entire old city center in the 1600\'s complete with forts and towers on the corners. Very impressive and easy to walk.

463611916.name: City wall
463611916.author: a TripAdvisor user
463611916.reviewBody: The city wall is well preserved and a great attraction.  There is a play and movie depicting the founding of the city and it\'s evolution to today.\n

463599502.name: Pirate defense
463599502.author: a TripAdvisor user
463599502.reviewBody: This wall surrounds the whole of the colonial city which is a UNESCO World Heritage site.  It is very walkable, but beware Campeche is really hot; take lots of water.  Lots of history here and a good guide really helps.

461936744.name: Worth a wander
461936744.author: a TripAdvisor user
461936744.reviewBody: It is worth allowing a bit of time to wander around as it is not only the city walls and gates, but you will also see some lovely old properties.

460430095.name: Great cantina
460430095.author: a TripAdvisor user
460430095.reviewBody: After visiting the earth and water arches, there is a great cantina at the top end of calle 59. When you order a beer you get a table full of local snacks! Yummy! Shrimps looked great and will make it back to have some. Well worth the stop in.

460400449.name: Walking through history
460400449.author: a TripAdvisor user
460400449.reviewBody: We walked a majority of the wall that was accessible.  Several of the Baluartes or bastions that were erected to protect the city from marauding pirates now contain small museums chronicling life behind the wall.  One in particular, Baluarte de San Francisco, featured graphics and text noting pirate activity and attacks on the city over the years.

459814716.name: Shiver me timbers!
459814716.author: a TripAdvisor user
459814716.reviewBody: We visited mainly for a view of the old town from the walls. However, entry is via the museum within. Small charge. The current exhibition is about pirates and piracy with some quaint but just about understandable translations from Spanish to English. It takes no more than fifteen minutes to do that bit.\nViews from the ramparts are mediocre but, if you work at it, you can get some reasonable shots of pastel coloured houses.

459459194.name: Old city wall
459459194.author: a TripAdvisor user
459459194.reviewBody: Awesome to see.  The old city is very clean with lots of r stair ants and hotels.  Walking is relatively easy and shopping is great.

458732479.name: Nice Walk and Museums
458732479.author: a TripAdvisor user
458732479.reviewBody: There are 2 sections to the wall which are open to the public.  The Sea wall Baluarte is free to the public to walk on.  There is a nice museum inside the Baluarte for which there is a small fee.  There is a small fee for walking on top of the Land Wall which also includes a modest three room museum.

455777909.name: Walked the wall
455777909.author: a TripAdvisor user
455777909.reviewBody: Nice experience to visit the sites and walk the walls. We entered via the museum and found it gave you a feel for the old days.

455468031.name: If you come from Quebec, you won\'t be impressed
455468031.author: a TripAdvisor user
455468031.reviewBody: Of course, if you come from an old walled city like Quebec, this is not that impressive but it is still worth the history and the commitment to keep part of it standing.  Of course, of the whole wall only a small portion remains.  What is particularly interesting is the mixing of old and \'new\'.  Old rock walls around new swimming pools or hotels.  Great to keep as much of what is left as possible.

453494661.name: Great to walk
453494661.author: a TripAdvisor user
453494661.reviewBody: Campeche is one of the few cities in Latin America that has a wall to protect from Pirates. Its been reconstructed and you can walk around it and worth the effort. Recommended

451314227.name: Not a Great Wall..
451314227.author: a TripAdvisor user
451314227.reviewBody: The wall doesn\'t go far however it is interesting to see that inside many of the "restored" buildings are actually vacant and derilict

449950951.name: Walled old cities are rare in the Americas
449950951.author: a TripAdvisor user
449950951.reviewBody: The old city with its walls is charming and for the Americas rather rare. You might call it the" Cartagena de Indias" of North America, although there is a big gap to that sensational place. Still you can have a nice evening or two, with cultural events, museums and some good seafood. I suggest to choose a Htel in or near the walled city.

448116565.name: Good views and nice breeze
448116565.author: a TripAdvisor user
448116565.reviewBody: The city wall can be accessed from several of the forts in the wall. Both have small museums and offer limited walks along the top. Well worth the small entrance fees.

447506566.name: Little to see
447506566.author: a TripAdvisor user
447506566.reviewBody: It is the \u00a8Entrance from the city\u00a8 of the wall. Nothing much to see, except for the architecture and some canons.

445107532.name: Fun to walk on top of the wall
445107532.author: a TripAdvisor user
445107532.reviewBody: We walked it just as it was getting dark.  Nice views of the sunset and church towers lit up.  At that time of night we had to walk back to where we entered (not far from the "Land Gate"), as the other end was closed. Small fee to walk it, which includes a small museum.

444437127.name: Amazing
444437127.author: a TripAdvisor user
444437127.reviewBody: Joked with the tour guide that the wall had probably been built long ago because they expected Trump and wanted to keep him out.  This thing is impressive.  Twenty feet tall and at one time circled the whole city.  Well preserved, you\'ll see it every where you go in town.

441243879.name: Back to Colonial times
441243879.author: a TripAdvisor user
441243879.reviewBody: I enjoyed very much the visit of the Old Downtown, which is surounded by this impressive city wall. Is a trip back in time to the time of the pirates. Is worth visiting the several "Baluartes" (old buildings at wall\'s corners), particularly that of La Soldedad, which houses a wonderful museum with Mayan sculptures.\nWe also took the night "sound & light" tour at Puerta de Tierra, which shows you the history of the city.

438405382.name: Fun to do
438405382.author: a TripAdvisor user
438405382.reviewBody: Our hotel was only a block or so away and it was frn to walk on the wall.\nThere was something  to see at every corner of the wall in old town.\nThere is a great Pirate  museum right on/in the wall  with a dungeon !

437159501.name: Great
437159501.author: a TripAdvisor user
437159501.reviewBody: Excellent , lots of History in this city, pirate history was impressive , friendly staff , tour was great for $ 120 Mexican pesos.

425752647.name: An old wall
425752647.author: a TripAdvisor user
425752647.reviewBody: You\'ll see it while wandering around the main area. There is a couple spots you could go to the top and walk for a bit but I didn\'t partake.  Interesting history and its nice some of it is still around.

421914623.name: Great place to get an overview
421914623.author: a TripAdvisor user
421914623.reviewBody: Nice museum about pirates, but more special the walk on the old city wall. It is impressive and gives you a feeling of the history. Unfortunately it is not complete anymore, but a walk where possible offers nice views over the city. Very recommendable \ud83d\ude0a

417629712.name: Take a walk along this charming historic wall
417629712.author: a TripAdvisor user
417629712.reviewBody: Campeche city is a small beautiful colonial city. Walk along the wall to take some great photos and view the city from above. A quiet no hassle city you can relax in.

417113972.name: just visit it!
417113972.author: a TripAdvisor user
417113972.reviewBody: Beautiful old town. However weird not to see the locals! The government pushed them outside the wals not to bother th tourists!!! Sad... So, dont be afraid to go behing the wals and see around the real Campeche! So much fun in the ocal market! Bananas are excellent there! :)

414679259.name: Great view
414679259.author: a TripAdvisor user
414679259.reviewBody: Definitely worth to visit and have a walk on top of the wall for just $15. Great spot for pictures. Can get hot during the day, so don\'t forget to bring some water!

405094444.name: Yes, it is indeed a wall
405094444.author: a TripAdvisor user
405094444.reviewBody: It\'s a wall. It\'s not that high, and it\'s not that long. But he history of Campeche is likely to be different if it hadn\'t have been built to keep out marauding pirates and attackers. So, simple wall. I respect you. Keep walking away.

401629543.name: Just interesting.
401629543.author: a TripAdvisor user
401629543.reviewBody: It is an interesting show explaining the life of Campeche under the constant siege of pirates, and the perils of their people and the Crown of Spain to defend it. There is a small promenade on top of the wall and then, to finish, a sound and light show that is a little too long.

400803863.name: UNESCO World Heritage
400803863.author: a TripAdvisor user
400803863.reviewBody: The old city of Campeche is a UNESCO World Heritage protected site. If you like to know how pirates used to live in the Caribbean and the times of the haciendas this is the place to go. The wall is pretty much intact form 500 years ago

394508567.name: Meh
394508567.author: a TripAdvisor user
394508567.reviewBody: Bits of wall. There\'s a tiny museum in one bit. Was worth the admission for the five minutes of air conditioning.

390268598.name: Pirates of the Caribbean!
390268598.author: a TripAdvisor user
390268598.reviewBody:
The city walls are really cool and compliment the historic feel of this colonial city. The walls were built to protect Campeche from continuous pirate raids by the likes of the infamous Henry Morgan and Campeche's arch nemesis Laurens de Graaf. 

I paid $15 mxn to go up onto the walls just down from the Puerta de la Tierra. You can walk along them and get a feel for the history while also taking in some great views of the city. At the bottom there are a few small museum rooms which are also quite interesting. There are other parts of the wall  which are accessible and have museums throughout the city.

From Thursday to Sunday at 8:00pm there's a show on at the Puerta de la Tierra which costs $60 mxn. It's a bit weird to be honest. The guides dress up in old  costumes and take you through the gate and up on to the wall, explaining the different features. It's interesting enough but a wee bit dull. They then take you back down and sit you to the left of the gate and play a video while the guides act out parts of it. In the first place it's difficult to pay attention to both the video and the actors at the same time. Secondly, the video is ludicrous! It gives a really simplistic history of how there were Mayans here and then the Spanish came and invaded them. After a while they got it on and that's how Campechanos (people from Campeche) were born. Then the pirates came so they built walls and stopped the pirates and everyone lived happily ever after. In a strange way it was entertaining but I think that's because it was so stupid that it was amusing.

387059886.name: Beautiful Historic Place
387059886.author: a TripAdvisor user
387059886.reviewBody: The Campeche Old City Wall is not just any wall, but the oldest standing walled city in Mexico. It holds the old town which is impeccably maintained which one can overlook from atop of the wall. It is without a doubt a jewel in the Yucatan Peninsula.

385300867.name: Awesome views from every corner
385300867.author: a TripAdvisor user
385300867.reviewBody: The Old City Wall is fortunate enough to have little museums near each entrance.  Each museum had special characters and touches.  Great for taking a daily stroll in the historic city center.

381248163.name: Nice walk on the walls and cute little museum
381248163.author: a TripAdvisor user
381248163.reviewBody: Cute. Half an hour tour through the little museum dedicated to pirates and a sun splash walking on what remains of the white walls of the city.

377883057.name: Prettiest City in Mexico
377883057.author: a TripAdvisor user
377883057.reviewBody: My major regret about my trip to Mexico was that we arrived late in Campeche and most things were shut. The city walls enclose the old colonial town and manage to help maintain a wonderfully historic air to the place. The walls were erected to keep the likes of Henry Morgan and Francis Drake out and if you have a good imagination you can transport yourself back a few hundred years to where pirates roamed the Caribbean .\nYou could easily spend a pleasant day roaming around inside the walled city.

372403428.name: easy to walk to
372403428.author: a TripAdvisor user
372403428.reviewBody: Part of the history of Campeche along with other sections of the wall within walking distance of our hotel.\n

371316531.name: Interesting
371316531.author: a TripAdvisor user
371316531.reviewBody: We walked around exploring the old city wall and found it interesting but not overly fascinating. Some of the balustrades require payment which if you went into all of them could add up to be a costly day. Nonetheless, something to occupy your time, get exercise & discover the edges of town.

370553698.name: Impressive
370553698.author: a TripAdvisor user
370553698.reviewBody: First night in town and lite up at night it is impressive. Great strolling in the classic windy gulf breeze. Join the locals and enjoy

369889998.name: Gates of Campeche
369889998.author: a TripAdvisor user
369889998.reviewBody: Historical Campeche is registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.  Typical of Spanish Colonial architecture Campeche was protected by a stone wall which 3/4 of it is still walled. The wall is exactly what it is, a wall and is interesting to look at from a historical standpoint.  You won\'t need to spend much time here

364713600.name: Interesting
364713600.author: a TripAdvisor user
364713600.reviewBody: Old city wall and the Baluartes completes the Old City Campeche. We enjoyed walking around the hexagonal old city.

361813614.name: Nice place to visit
361813614.author: a TripAdvisor user
361813614.reviewBody: Campeche is very nice town on the edge of the Golf of Mexico. Historical town with many places to see and visit. Great food. Old city wall is part of it

361012986.name: Great in day time. Don\'t do sound and light show
361012986.author: a TripAdvisor user
361012986.reviewBody: Sound and light show really bad. First part no English. Second part on screen with sub titles so bad and not understandable English at all.

359176769.name: Storm the wall!
359176769.author: a TripAdvisor user
359176769.reviewBody: An easy way to spend a couple of hours in the historic centre. The wall is now fragmented but most parts are accessible, the Land Gate (Puerta de Tierra) is particularly well maintained and offers light shows on some nights. I would suggest visiting the wall earlier in the day to avoid the heat.

358601687.name: The \u201cOld City Wall\u201d of Campeche.....!
358601687.author: a TripAdvisor user
358601687.reviewBody: The \u201cOld City Wall\u201d of Campeche City, is a wonderful place to visit....., moderate easy walking, with ramps for wheel chairs around the main streets, and easy access to most points of interest...! The city has a good variety of places to eat and drink! Many of the old homes in the \u201cOld City Wall\u201d, have been converted to hotels of different price ranges...., You must do your homework! In order to get the true flavor of you must sample the many regional dishes....., there is even a small restaurant in the center of the main park.

357651834.name: nice views
357651834.author: a TripAdvisor user
357651834.reviewBody: the wall gives an unique look of old city. It is worth to climb it, which is possible at some parts, even for free. You can get special vews from the wall. Dont go at the hottest part of the day - there is almost no shadow...

356128039.name: If you haven\'t visited the wall, you haven\'t really been to Campeche
356128039.author: a TripAdvisor user
356128039.reviewBody: The old city wall is THE defining element of the city of Campeche, and encapsulates its historic centre. Most of the wall has been restored and and in many places it is even possible to climb up the baluartes (bulwarks) that flank its corners.

355361216.name: Nice Walk Around the City
355361216.author: a TripAdvisor user
355361216.reviewBody: We started at the main square and walked along the old city walls. There were several museums (some free) and two different places to walk along the wall. The guides were interesting and enjoyed telling us about the history. It took us about 3 hours to do this, including the museums, and a stop for ice cream.

352223323.name: Go see them and go to the museum at the fort
352223323.author: a TripAdvisor user
352223323.reviewBody: Great historical info, beautiful views from the top of the wall and handicapped accessible. The museum is free at the San Carlos Baluartes.

352114422.name: Over restored in places, but well worth the walk.
352114422.author: a TripAdvisor user
352114422.reviewBody: The walls were not as complete as we were led to believe by our guide book, but still worth a walk around.

351846405.name: probably unique in Mexico
351846405.author: a TripAdvisor user
351846405.reviewBody: we visited in the early evening as it was getting dark and the views of the dimly lit streets were lovely

351093535.author: a TripAdvisor user
351093535.reviewBody: This wall surrounds the historic center.  Great picture spot!  Several small museums located in Various places throught the walls.

350646117.name: Fine Preservation
350646117.author: a TripAdvisor user
350646117.reviewBody: Sections of the old city wall are well preserved and there are some small museums along side it. This is well worth a visit. You can see most of the original town from the walk along the wall. On the day we were there we were the only people walking. This is a great place to let your imagination run wild.

348951320.name: Old city is amazing!
348951320.author: a TripAdvisor user
348951320.reviewBody: About 2 blocks off the male con is an entrance to the old "Walled" portion of the city. It has shops, bars, restaurants, boutique hotels, etc. and is absolutely stunning! Very clean and quaint! It was totally decked out for Christmas and a wonderful place for a stroll.  We even happened upon a wedding in progress in the big cathedral on the main plaza that was fun to watch!  I\'d go back in a heartbeat as we were only passing through for 1 night on this trip.

347628405.name: Great example of ancien tcity wall
347628405.author: a TripAdvisor user
347628405.reviewBody: The Old City wall is very well preserved, you can walk around the town to see it, taking in the town as you go.

345561255.name: A lot of cool history
345561255.author: a TripAdvisor user
345561255.reviewBody: The original wall was built by the invading Spaniards after defeating the Mayans. A large portion is still up with a couple of museums along side. A must see while in the area

345467809.name: Nice walkabove Campeche
345467809.author: a TripAdvisor user
345467809.reviewBody:
It is the town wall of the UNESCO world heritage site, fortified old town of Campeche.
Easy access from Calle 59 and costs only 15 Peso.
It is a nice walk around the town with good views from the top.
(Only downside: just one accesspoint, so you would need to walk all the way back again- which is not too far.)

345074070.name: Fine bastions
345074070.author: a TripAdvisor user
345074070.reviewBody: We accessed all the bastions that were open (two were closed) in a circuit of the old town. Very enjoyable two hour stroll. The maritime museum gives a good view of the history.

342155289.name: Walk on top of the wall...
342155289.author: a TripAdvisor user
342155289.reviewBody: You can pay 20 pesos to go on top of this very old wall and walk around on top. They have some old cannons up there but its interesting to just be up there and see the sights. Its very old. Also when you are done you ring a large bell and they open the door and let you out.

340533439.name: Great museums hidden in the baluartes!
340533439.author: a TripAdvisor user
340533439.reviewBody: The history of the wall is interesting in itself, but the museums inside the baluartes make it much more of an attraction. I especially like the museum of Mayan architecture and the museum about the city\'s piracy history both located on the sea-side portion of the wall.

340466635.name: glad the town saved some of it!
340466635.author: a TripAdvisor user
340466635.reviewBody: much of the wall was demolished and used for paving as happened in many spots around the world. what is left remains impressive. tracked down a few of the gates/ bastions. and a garden. the traffic didn\'t bother us, as mentioned in other comments. an interesting unesco town, which appeared fairly prosperous, thanks to pemex arriving in the 1970\'s.

340357924.name: Unique
340357924.author: a TripAdvisor user
340357924.reviewBody: Only 3 or 4 cities in the Americas still have intact city walls.  Very safe and clean within these walls.

339033265.name: The old city\'s charm is being hidden behind new develpments on the malecon
339033265.author: a TripAdvisor user
339033265.reviewBody: The core of Campeche is European in feel with its grand cathedral and cobble stone streets.  The areas close in to the core are brightly painted and the utility wires are all underground,  There is nightly entertainment in the square in the shadow of the cathedral which you can watch from there or while eating on a balcony adjacent to it.  A new feature is a huge animated video presentation done against one of square\'s larger buildings which is configured to take advantage of the buildings contours, nooks and crannies.  It and some of the other modern effects within the city\'s walls seem to be well thought out and are a genuine local experience, abeit modern.\nCampeche\'s malecon is several kilometers long and stretches along the waterfront far beyond the boundaries of the walled city.  It is reached by crossing a four laned modern well lit thoroughfare on marked crosswalks or at intersections.  It is a wonderful place for an evening stroll with street performers and police on segways.  Tourists from outside of Mexico do not seem to come in droves to this place or Compeche, so it feels relatively authentic.  That is ... sad to say, except for the casino and large retain box stores and malls that are taking over the area east of the walled city on the malecon.  Their bright lights and noisy facades seem to be trying to imitate the brashness of North America\'s "strips".  Perhaps that is what Mexican tourists want, but for us seems unnecessary and driven more by $ than culture.  It is unfortunate the powers that be did not put architectural controls on this area to prevent it from overwhelming the old city it is beginning to swallow.

337004894.name: Lovely and Well-Preserved Wall Surrounding the City with Great Views - You Can Walk Along the Top of the Walls!
337004894.author: a TripAdvisor user
337004894.reviewBody:
Campeche is a unique city because it is one of only a few cities in the world that is surrounded by a stone wall. The entire historic centre of Campeche is surrounded by a tall, lovely and well-preserved wall and it was originally used to protect the city against pirate attacks. 

I visited the wall on the afternoon of November 26th as a solo traveler. 

The wall is linked by various entrances known as baluartes. You can climb up stairs to the top of the wall and then stroll along certain sections. 

I climbed the steep ramp at the Baluarte San Francisco (Calle 57 at Calle 18) on the south side of the city, which led to a large open area on top of the wall with cannons and a bell. From there, I walked along a portion of the narrow stone walkway on top of the wall (only certain sections of the wall are open for walking and I had to turn around to go back down the way I came) up until the Baluarte de San Juan. The views of the colourful buildings in the historic centre and the tall cathedral, were absolutely stunning. 

The stone wall around the city is tall and huge and I enjoyed walking alongside it at the ground level as well.
