It was interesting to see the Puerto de la Tierra (on the south side of the wall), which is an opening in the wall serving as the land gate into the centre of the city. There was a huge cannon inside the walkway through the gate. 

Some of the Baluartes had small museums or gardens inside them that you could visit for a small entrance fee (Baluarte San Francisco has a small pirate museum; Baluarte de San Carlos houses the small Museo de la Ciudad about Campeche’s history; Baluarte de San Pedro houses the Museo y Galeria de Arte Popular which highlights Campeche’s indigenous handicrafts and has exhibits of regional folk art; Baluarte de Santiago has the Jardin Botanico Xmuch’haltun which is a botanical garden with native plant species; and the Baluarte de Nuestra Senora de la Soledad houses the Museo de la Arquitectura Maya). 

I visited the Museo de la Arquitectura inside the Baluarte de Nuestra Senora de la Soledad, located at Calle 8 and 57, on the north side of the wall. The entrance fee was 39 pesos. The museum contained exhibits with collections of artifacts from Mayan ruins in the Chenes, Rio Bec and Puuc regions. The displays were in both English and Spanish. The museum was very interesting and I enjoyed reading about the history of these ancient ruins, the various architectural styles, the meaning of various Mayan symbols and their writing system, and how the Mayans lived. 

After visiting the museum, I climbed the ramp to the top of the Baluarte de Nuestra Senora de la Soledad. Similar to the Baluarte San Francisco, there was a large open area which then narrowed into a walkway along the wall in both directions. From here, I was rewarded with a different but just as beautiful view of the Gulf of Mexico on one side of the wall and the cathedral, central plaza and historic centre on the other side. 

The Puerta del Mar was the opening in the wall known as the “sea gate,” located at the corner of Calles 8 and 59. From this opening, there was a well-maintained paved path that lead to the Malecon walkway along the Gulf of Mexico coastline, which was absolutely beautiful. 

During the entire time I was exploring these Baluartes and strolling on top of the walls, I was completely alone with no other people around. It was such a relaxing time in a quiet atmosphere. I definitely felt like the old city wall and the baluartes were a hidden gem in Campeche! 

Walking along the top of the wall while admiring the gorgeous views of the surrounding city as well as exploring a few of the baluartes was a very enjoyable experience for me! It is definitely something worth doing when you are in Campeche!

335970674.name: A hidden gem in the Yucatan Peninsula
335970674.author: a TripAdvisor user
335970674.reviewBody: I was looking for a quick weekend getaway from Merida and struck gold with this one.  It is far away from the touristy Cancun beach scene and shows a more authentic side of Mexico, rich in history and easily done in a day, on foot.  It is also near to some of the more interesting (less touristy and more accessible) ruins.  Definitely worth a trip.

335808267.name: Great example of a fortified colonial city.
335808267.author: a TripAdvisor user
335808267.reviewBody: The main street running through the center of the old city is ave 59 Leads right out to where the dock was. City looks great at night. The archaeological museum is well worth a look.

335725994.name: Interesting place
335725994.author: a TripAdvisor user
335725994.reviewBody: Located in the city centre where everything is very beautiful. This is a must when you visit campeche

334944696.name: Lovely city walls well preserved
334944696.author: a TripAdvisor user
334944696.reviewBody: North America has few walled cities- Quebec being the obvious example. Here is another and you are off the tourist trail here hence able to enjoy the real Mexico with reasonable prices as well. Wonderful walk .

334924695.name: Old wall
334924695.author: a TripAdvisor user
334924695.reviewBody: Old city wall amazing next to beautiful hacienda we were able to walk on top of the wall amazing view of the  city

328082161.name: AMAZING!
328082161.author: a TripAdvisor user
328082161.reviewBody: Amazing, beautiful, with forts in each corner, similar to the Cartagena one.  Inside its walls, there\u00b4s all the ancient part of the city and the Cathedral.  There are also coffee shops, restaurants and chocolate shops.  Located in front of the ocean.  The problem here is that locals blew away half of the wall to build a boulevard.   Totally worth to visit.

327687997.name: Historical location
327687997.author: a TripAdvisor user
327687997.reviewBody: There is a part of the city inside the wall.  Very interesting.  There are many nice restaurants and bars in the walled city.

327642691.name: A good site
327642691.author: a TripAdvisor user
327642691.reviewBody: An interesting site reminding us how the fort would have looked like. \nThe most interesting is the jade mask on show.

314371236.name: Well maintained
314371236.author: a TripAdvisor user
314371236.reviewBody: The wall around the old city was made to protect against the pirates.  However it took so long to make that when it was finished the pirates had gone also.

312092572.name: Worth a visit
312092572.author: a TripAdvisor user
312092572.reviewBody: The old city walls are well kept and more interesting than those at Merida. It\'s well worth to spend a bit of time around them if you\'re in the area, but they are not a "must see" in Campeche. The coolest thing is the Botanical garden that is located in one of the old bastions

308619221.name: History Brought to Life
308619221.author: a TripAdvisor user
308619221.reviewBody: The walled city of Campeche has an interesting history.  The history is told at the museums along the old wall.

303060591.name: Good walk to get your bearings
303060591.author: a TripAdvisor user
303060591.reviewBody: A good walk to get your bearings around the city - some interesting points along the way, and a reminder of the \'bigger Campeche\' when you go outside the walls for a short time

300615206.name: very nice Old Town
300615206.author: a TripAdvisor user
300615206.reviewBody: Nice tour of town with the little round-city train. The old town is really very nice with all these coloured houses.

294175300.name: Remnants of the City that was Sacked in 1663
294175300.author: a TripAdvisor user
294175300.reviewBody:
It's just remarkable to see the remnants of the old wall of Campeche. Several hundreds of years ago this city was sacked by buccaneers such as Henry Morgan and co.! 
The old city wall is quite a remarkable remnant. 
Of course the other sights of Campeche are just walking distance from this location. You just have to see the Cathedral of Campeche which is a very picturesque sight in the evenings and at night. 
Also the Municipal Council Building is quite nearby - it is painted deep yellow and has architecture reminiscent of the 1600 and 1700 Spainish Colonial era

292160244.name: Great before/after dinner activity
292160244.author: a TripAdvisor user
292160244.reviewBody: We went to land gate at 8 to see the Pirate Show, as it was explained to us. The tour was great, it was fun seeing the wall all lit up. Everything was in Spanish, but it\'s not really necessary to understand what\'s going on. It\'s pretty none the less. Video at the end of the tour is subtitles in English. My friend was in a boot cast and managed the tour, although we had to help her get up the wall walkway in the beginning so a bit of mobility is required.

284171086.name: Colourful
284171086.author: a TripAdvisor user
284171086.reviewBody: The whole city is very colourful, the main pedestrian street is dotted with lovely and fun statues. Great seafood restaurant, can\'t remember the name but board out front says \'best shrimp in the world\', highly recommend this restaurant.  Gardens in centre of town have bands playing and a great light show, showing the history of Campeche.

283014353.name: Great visit to Campeche
283014353.author: a TripAdvisor user
283014353.reviewBody:
We stayed at Hotel Socaire (super nice hotel for a great price) for 8 nights and had a great time. We we here because my nephew was getting married at the Hacienda Uayamon (beautiful place). We spent several days just walking around within the walled city. You do not need a car unless you venture out. They have done an amazing job restoring the city and wall. Hacienda Puerta Campeche is another super nice hotel, we had a very nice dinner there. We ate at Hotel Casa Don Gustavo once for breakfast and once for dinner and it was great and the service was great to. All of the Baluartes are worth a visit and you can walk on the wall in a couple of sections which offers a nice perspective on the area. In the evenings Calle 59 comes alive with table all out in the street (now a pedestrian/art area).Chocol Ha is a must visit, try the hot chocolate with chilies it is really good. Best on a cold night. Try Gambuca Cafe on Calle 57 between 12th & 14th, it is right across from Hotel Socaire. We had a great breakfast there several mornings. There are some nice shops within the walled city. Everything was very clean, lots of "tourist police", security cameras, we felt very safe within the walled city. Everyone was very friendly. The front desk staff at Hotel Socaire all spoke very good English it was kind of hit and miss everywhere else, but we were fine with our broken Spanish. It was fun to visit the open market just outside the west wall, very colorful with piles of Habanero chili peppers, fruits, vegetables and meats. 

We rented a car through Easy Way, they no longer have a Campeche office, but a driver brought the car down from Merida for us and it worked out great. Driving tips, make sure you know where you are getting gas. There is not much available off the main highway. We drove though several police check points and did not have any problems. If we were stopped they just asked where we were going and waved us on. Do carry your passports, my son who was traveling with cousins was stopped and they wanted to see everyone's passports. My nephew had a couple of run ins with the police in Cancun. Avoid driving the secondary roads at night, too many bikes, scooters, tuk tuk type vehicles with little to no lights. The highway was pretty good unless it is pouring down rain and then it is a little hairy, as drainage is not always the best. My cell phone service is TMobile and it worked great, even though it was on roaming. My GPS/google maps worked far better than I expected and we were driving in some remote areas. Even when I lost the tracking I still had the map and could follow along and then I would get enough service and it would catch up.

We visited Baluarte de San Jose El Alto just to the north of the walled city. They are still working on the exhibits, but it is worth a visit to see the lay of the land.

Visited Edzna, the closest Mayan ruins to Campeche well worth the drive. Only a couple other tourist there, not a lot of information there so study up before you go.
Visited Uxmal farther north, much bigger and better preserved than Edzna, missed the Chocolate museum close to the ruin so we could get to some cenotes. Visited one in the little town of Peba. No lighting, but nice swimming hole, I think they charged 10 pesos. Not much of anything else there. Then we stopped at Cenote San Ignacio in Chochola and that was nice, with lighting, clean bathrooms to change. It is pretty well signed from the highway. The cenote is very deep. We ate that night back in Campeche just north of the old city is a string of thatched roofed restaurants on the water. I can not remember the name maybe Eges Kalkini our waiter was Bismark and he was super nice. He didn't speak much English, but gave great service and the food was great too.

Day trip to Celestun, boat ride out to see the Flamingos.  It was a lot of fun even if it was not the season, we still saw a lot of Flamingos for us. We also saw an alligator and lots of other birds. Have dinner out on the beach after the boat trip. We ate at Pampanos and it was very good. That was also the nicest beach we saw.

Also took a drive to the south, made it as far as Sabancuy. Didn't see anything too exciting, just explored.

Overall a great trip! Everyone was very friendly.

281768786.name: Wonderful museum with artefacts
281768786.author: a TripAdvisor user
281768786.reviewBody: Walking the wall was awesome. As I love history  I was in my element!  The museum was just about to close so I had to rush around it. I am from Scotland and it was astounding to read about the scots brigades and pirates who sailed into Campeche\nI hope to visit again next year and depend more time.

277395370.name: Not the castle-wall you\'d expect
277395370.author: a TripAdvisor user
277395370.reviewBody: This isn\'t the chines wall, mind you. And the wall is only partially intact. The main-gate to the east is accessable with a tour (only in spanish) that comes with a short walk and a lights-show. You are better off wandering around it on yourself to take it in together with the town that has some appeal in itself.

275669137.name: Good restoration
275669137.author: a TripAdvisor user
275669137.reviewBody: We enjoyed being on the wall because it was a neat way to see the  city - it gave us our bearings because we went there as soon as we arrived. It wasn\'t long into the restoration so we couldn\'t walk too far.  They\'re doing a good job of the restoration, so in the future it will be amazing to walk along.

270154128.name: Lovely walled city
270154128.author: a TripAdvisor user
270154128.reviewBody: We stayed here for 2 nights on a 28 day Central American trip. Though only part of the walls are still in tact, you can easily imagine what a fortress of a city it was in it\'s heyday and a real target for invaders and pirates. It\'s a pleasant city to stroll around.

268353436.name: Living history opens a window to the past
268353436.author: a TripAdvisor user
268353436.reviewBody: The Campeche city wall is an amazing glimpse of the city\'s past. Standing on top of the wall (above the museum), gazing out to the flat, dark Gulf of Mexico, you can imagine seeing approaching gunships and steeling yourself for battle.

267800969.name: A lot of history in these walls!
267800969.author: a TripAdvisor user
267800969.reviewBody: The walls were built starting in 1686 as a way to protect the city from marauders making Campeche the only walled city in Mexico. Only sections of the wall are intact as well as the two gates - one facing the sea and one facing inland. You can walk on sections but it closes at 5 pm.

266517751.name: Interesting
266517751.author: a TripAdvisor user
266517751.reviewBody: The view from above is good. Do take a tour guide to understand the importance of the city wall during "pirate times". There is also a pirate show at night to entertain for a reasonable price.

265171751.name: Historic wall
265171751.author: a TripAdvisor user
265171751.reviewBody: Campeche is a city that has a wall that used to protect it from pirate attacks. During the spaniard conquest Campeche was one of the main ports of entry and many ships came here to take good to Europe. That\'s why the wall was so important to protect the city from attacks

264038736.name: A place to view and experience
264038736.author: a TripAdvisor user
264038736.reviewBody: Plesently surprised of the overall experience, very well kept and manteined, clean, and not just a simple wall but with many activities and things to see and do, the Tourist information office next to puerta del mar was very helpful, and I recommend to visit all the Baluartes and inside and outside of the wall

262279241.name: Mexico 2015
262279241.author: a TripAdvisor user
262279241.reviewBody: very interesting overview of the city--go early in morning or just before it closes to beat the heat

261646870.name: Nice to see
261646870.author: a TripAdvisor user
261646870.reviewBody: Campeche itself is a city worth seeing - the Old Town looks amazing, which small building and vivid color. The city wall offers nice walk with pleasant view. In the evenings between Thursday and Sunday (I think) at the main entrance to the old city there are animations, during which actors show defence of the city from the pirates and take you int the tour on the walls (it\'s paid, but not too expensive). Afterwards you watch a short history movie. A word of waring though - whole presentation is in Spanish - only movie has English subtitles. Still - nice experince to use a bit of imagination:)

257174048.name: Pretty but no History to be Learned
257174048.author: a TripAdvisor user
257174048.reviewBody: Thanks to UNESCO, the various restored wall sites are interesting to look at but there are no meaningful plaques that share or explain the fascinating history of Campeche - a disappointment if you like history and understanding why things are the way they are.

256975611.name: Short and Sweet
256975611.author: a TripAdvisor user
256975611.reviewBody: It is a perfectly restored wall, perhaps it has never looked so good! It\'s about 50m long. Nice views. Short and Sweet!

255454351.name: Great History All Around
255454351.author: a TripAdvisor user
255454351.reviewBody: Walking the old city wall you can feel the history of Campeche and really understand (in a limited way) what it was like to live there way back when. We loved how the history was celebrated and the architecture preserved throughout Campeche.

255112309.name: Interesting
255112309.author: a TripAdvisor user
255112309.reviewBody: It is difficult to review a wall!  This suggested topic from trip advisor but I don\'t know what you say about a Msyan wall.

252650776.name: Good Day Trip
252650776.author: a TripAdvisor user
252650776.reviewBody: We enjoyed visiting the wall and walking thru the colonial city.  Inside the walls it has a very European feel and like one of the other reviewers mentioned, outside it feels like Mexico.

251204446.name: pirates!
251204446.author: a TripAdvisor user
251204446.reviewBody: campeche is a unesco world heritage site. a restored fortified wall is part of it. beautiful walk to the gates where you can see the cannons and a model of a pirate ship. clean and pretty and the mouter part of the city is very different to this beautiful part . worth a short visit

251122845.name: Nice Puerta del Mar and Puerta de Tierra! Nice lighting at night!
251122845.author: a TripAdvisor user
251122845.reviewBody: Nice Puerta del Mar and Puerta de Tierra! Nice lighting at night! You can walk down Calle 59 from one end to the other ... super cool with nice bars and restaurants (and Chocol Ha) and admire the wonderful historic fortifications of the this old city!

246750863.name: A real Sense of History
246750863.author: a TripAdvisor user
246750863.reviewBody: This fortified wall has been nicely restored and it is easy to get a feeling for what it must have been like to live in Campeche in colonial times.  It also gives an interesting perspective on the old and the new city.  Outside the walls the city looks like a lot of other Mexican cities today...inside all the colonial buildings have been restored and polished.  Both are part of what makes Mexico such a pleasure to visit.

241496249.name: Impressive
241496249.author: a TripAdvisor user
241496249.reviewBody: Just to be near this area, it makes you travel back to the pirates times. \n\nTo walk around them it is impressive. They are working around this areas but still is amazing!

237912340.name: City wall
237912340.author: a TripAdvisor user
237912340.reviewBody: Is an impressive wall that covers most of the center of Campeche, giving you an idea of how it was originally the city.

236208374.name: Seven baluartes to explore
236208374.author: a TripAdvisor user
236208374.reviewBody: The Nuestra was built to protect Puerta del Mar. The San Carlos presumably was used as a military prison, it even has a dungeon! The Santiago is the youngest, completed in 1704. The baluarte San Pedro is situated across from the lovely Iglesia de San Juan de Dios near the mercado principal. Baluarte de San Francisco is at the Puerta de la Tierra and the wall continues on to the baluarte de San Juan. The first one houses a decent museum and you can also get up onto the wall for some spectacular views. If you have to pick just one I would recommend that.

234227167.name: Hurry up before it\'s "restored"
234227167.author: a TripAdvisor user
234227167.reviewBody: Campeche has wonderful old colonial buidings and extensive remains of the old city walls. I wonder how UNESCO feel about the current "renovations" going on in the town. They seem to be knocking down everything old and rebuilding it in modern concrete. If you see an old part, photograph it, quick!

232705561.name: Visit soon before they concrete the lot!
232705561.author: a TripAdvisor user
232705561.reviewBody: The parts of the wall that are original and the small museum are nice but the authorities are intent on \'restoring\' most of the walls using 21st century materials and techniques and in some areas (particularly the northern walls near to the main square) are completely rebuilding the walls from scratch. Imagine Hadrians wall in the UK rebuilt with concrete and modern day materials and you get the idea! Completely pointless exercise and the reason I left the city 5 days early and won\'t return!

232211974.name: Excellent Pirate walk and show
232211974.author: a TripAdvisor user
232211974.reviewBody: the "Puerta de Tierra" is located downtown opposite to "Tierra de Mar" which surrounded the city against pirate attacks. It is worth the visit for 1 dollar you pay per person. \nWalk to the far end and you can have really nice pictures. There is a show at night from friday to sunday, I believe. We were not able to watch it as it was raining that night. \nInside the place you can find a small museum with the story of several pirates that attacked Campeche and how the locals deffended themselves.

231046483.name: Interesting
231046483.author: a TripAdvisor user
231046483.reviewBody: A small museum, but all in Spanish so my interest was limited. Enjoyed the few period pieces, mainly the pistol collection. The wall itself has been re-built and the sea used to be very close. I would say it is worth the small price of admission.

227164831.name: Worth to visit and take a walk
227164831.author: a TripAdvisor user
227164831.reviewBody:
The place where Tripadvisor indicate (19.824668, -90.568675) is Fuerte de San Miguel. I am not sure the attraction "Old City Wall" means all of the "Walls" in Campeche or not.

The Walls that I had visited were Puerta de Mar (went through calle 59 then arrived Puerta de Tierra). The night view of the Puerta de Mar's walls are beautiful. 

There are many restaurants and coffee shops on calle 59(walkway for tourist). Take a walk on calle 59 at afternoon is recommended. 

There is a Pirate exhibition in Puerta de Mar at that time(Dec 2013).

226984089.name: Excellent colonial place
226984089.author: a TripAdvisor user
226984089.reviewBody: The only wall in Mexico to protect a city from pirates. There are two gates left, and the original towers in place.

222293354.name: very beautiful colonial city
222293354.author: a TripAdvisor user
222293354.reviewBody:
within the wall everything chances,
Lovely small streets filled with bars and restaurants.
Many beautiful churches, of which th eKathedral on main square and the black Jesus church, are a must to see when you go here.
Best place for drinks is 59 street which bursts of bar etc with live music

216305792.name: a very well restored wall
216305792.author: a TripAdvisor user
216305792.reviewBody:
beautiful restored wall 
views of  the city that is still being restored
pleasant museum like rooms
well worth an hour of your time

212454394.name: Wander around
212454394.author: a TripAdvisor user
212454394.reviewBody: Well worth having a wander around the old city (UNESCO site) and the city square, cathedral- Opposite the cathedral is a museum/house set up the way it used to be. well worth a visit.

205464472.name: Have to pay to walk on the wall...
205464472.author: a TripAdvisor user
205464472.reviewBody: We weren\'t going to pay to see a very similar museum to ones we\'d already seen just to walk very briefly on top of the wall. Save your money.

202690263.name: Sad to say everyone winds up here. Just skip the pirate museum.
202690263.author: a TripAdvisor user
202690263.reviewBody: There is construction going on around the walls. From the walkway above we could see they were working on a soon to be pedestrianised area which looked to be awful. They were using floor tiles that one would use in their home, the kind that have that faux flagstone look. The kind that are lethal when wet. Seems they could have put more thought into things. The walk around the old wall was so-so. The views are not good. I thought they would look out to the water, but they do not. However the walls are free for now. You must skip the pirate museum. It was only 10 pesos but it was truly bad.

201924076.name: All closed
201924076.author: a TripAdvisor user
201924076.reviewBody: Being renovated so saw nothing. Has to be done we  suppose but we chose the location on purpose. Tourist office in square unhelpful and lady disinterested.

201581762.name: Worth visiting
201581762.author: a TripAdvisor user
201581762.reviewBody: How well the old walled part of Campeche has been maintained. Go at night and see how the locals enjoy their town.

200211979.name: Major construction
200211979.author: a TripAdvisor user
200211979.reviewBody: Although still great to see, many sections are closed for at least the next several months due to major renovation. Will be very special when completed. This includes the archeology museum being closed. Still highly recommend this marvelous walled city.

197513713.name: Interesting For a Quick View
197513713.author: a TripAdvisor user
197513713.reviewBody: Nice to stroll by while you are exploring the town. But wouldn\'t go out of my way just for this. You can catch it during your other sight seeing adventures.

195946651.name: Campeche
195946651.author: a TripAdvisor user
195946651.reviewBody: As i cant do an overall review of campeche, i will do it here. The walls are great, mostly for the views. Several of the museums are nice (some are closed right now) especially the two forts (san jose and san miguel). The baluartes are nice but overrated. The colonial town itself is incredible, and i list it with Palenque, Uxmal, and Cozumel as the reasons to come to the mundo Maya in mexico. This is one of if not the best collection of colonial architecture in Mexico, and i believe it to be on par with Antigua, Guatemala for beauty and quality (i think antigua has better restaurant and bars though). Overall, beautiful town, worth 2-3 days.

193388360.name: Great views
193388360.author: a TripAdvisor user
193388360.reviewBody: Great views across the whole old city.  Note, tickets are sold from information desk in archway (there are no signs at the wall entrances to tell you this).  Cost of 10 pesos is good value.  Ringing the big bell to alert attendant that you want to exit is fun!

191103609.name: Good views.
191103609.author: a TripAdvisor user
191103609.reviewBody: For less than a dollar you can climb the ramp and walk along the newly updated wall around the city. The views are great and some of the history is cool. I wish there could have been a bit more historical info.  Had to find details about when some of the history took place. A guide in English would have been helpful.

189153102.name: Beautifully maintained
189153102.author: a TripAdvisor user
189153102.reviewBody: The old town part of Campeche is truly remarkable. It has been preserved beautifully. The buildings are in good repair, keeping with the historic value as well. A photographer\'s paradise. Very CLEAN City

187864508.name: Cool near the pretty town square
187864508.author: a TripAdvisor user
187864508.reviewBody: It was neat to see the remnants of pirate times. Campeche is a busy city with a lot of traffic. But walking is easy on the ocean front promenade.

186859506.name: Charming
186859506.author: a TripAdvisor user
186859506.reviewBody: We had a great time wandering through the streets - the houses were colorful, the main plaza vibrant with locals enjoying the day and there no mobs of tourists following a guide. There is a small museum at one end of the plaza opposite the cathedral with a couple of rooms filled with antiques.\n\nIf you get a chance, do spend a couple of hours wandering the streets or even better, spend the night - we did and we were totally relaxed for the next leg of our journey.

186386461.name: Better look inside the wall
186386461.author: a TripAdvisor user
186386461.reviewBody: The wall is ok, but the view outside is not very nice. Better look inside to see the nice houses. Most parts were closed during my visit. No idea why...

184193730.name: Conquistador Franchise Arquitecture
184193730.author: a TripAdvisor user
184193730.reviewBody: When you travel around the caribbean rim, you will find many\nsimilarities as to "walls". Cartagena, Havana, Campeche etc, but still a nice touch, mostly restored and then stroll down Calle 59 \nwhich is becoming a tourist oriented pedestrian zone, but still very laid back.

176183161.name: Fantastic Place
176183161.author: a TripAdvisor user
176183161.reviewBody: The whole city is amazing. Have you seen "Pirates of the Caribbean" ? well - this is it - the same as it was 300 years ago, wonderfully preserved. This aint DIsneyland: real people live here.

170289855.name: Walked on top of the wall, great view
170289855.author: a TripAdvisor user
170289855.reviewBody: We visited the Mayan museum at the gates, and climbed the wide staircase to the top of the walls.  Excellent sea view, and fun to imagine the soldiers lining the walls defending the city from pirates.  Great fun!

166837273.name: Lovely old historic area
166837273.author: a TripAdvisor user
166837273.reviewBody: It\'s a great place to take photos. The locals are not too sure how they feel about construction to restore the wall, but with the weather the new areas will age rapidly. There is really little to say that would be negative about an old historical site. The only negative might be the attempt to capture the pirate theme by placing mannequins in costume. I found these easy to ignore.

165718201.name: Pirates Stopped Here
165718201.author: a TripAdvisor user
165718201.reviewBody: Four large sections of the wall are at times open to visitors and in one place are undergoing major restoration. It really adds to what makes Campeche a quite interesting place to visit.

163510640.name: Wonderful historical feature
163510640.author: a TripAdvisor user
163510640.reviewBody: I love that the street has been closed off between the two puertas.  It would have been nice to see more activity on Calle 59, although the weather was rainy during our visit, so maybe there is normally more...  I loved the pirate display at the puerto del Tierra, but it WAS a bit hokey.  Still it is a wonderful bit of American history.

162456627.name: A lovely way to end the day
162456627.author: a TripAdvisor user
162456627.reviewBody: We went for a lovely stroll around the wall around sundown, there was a few great photo opportunities including the horse and the angel wings.

161095661.name: This town is a real gem
161095661.author: a TripAdvisor user
161095661.reviewBody:
When in Ycatan try to pass by Campeche, you wont regret it. The old city in between the walls is super. It is beautiful, safe and has a nice atmosphere. It is also a good hub for activities and it has a large modern shopping center too, next to a nice malecon. 
The walls are a great plus and there are activities taking place or museums inside. I visited the one about mayan archeology, which is worth its entrance fee if you do not know much yet about mayas. 

Go for it, before it is Cancunized!

161013070.name: Walked completely around the city along the original fort walls
161013070.author: a TripAdvisor user
161013070.reviewBody: The city is within the borders of the fort walls and is a nice morning walk of 1-2 hours. The Baluartes are the bastions and many have been converted to museums, most with free admission. You can enter the dungeon where the pirates were imprisoned, and walk up on top of the wall and shoot a cannon!   Just kidding-they don\'t work anymore! There are two original entrances to the city, which are the Land and Sea Gates. Some sections of the wall are being restored. Campeche is a definate place to visit. A lovely city with so much history.

160395600.name: Campeche\'s Wall Keeps History Alives
160395600.author: a TripAdvisor user
160395600.reviewBody: When you visit Campeche by all means see the old city within the walls-- it\'s beautiful and easy to appreciate.  But you can enjoy the wall itself: there\'s a wonderful sound and light show at the Puerta de Tierra (Land\'s Gate) and during the daytime you can visit some of the museums and shops in the baluartes.  Plus, you can appeciate a wonderful perspective of the city just by walking on top of the wall.

159958722.name: Preserved History
159958722.author: a TripAdvisor user
159958722.reviewBody: Try walking the around the wall, youll get to see all of its beauty and also the baluartes which link some of its sections. The baluartes are home of some of the cities museums and botanical garden. Also try the light show at Puerta de Tierra at nights, it tells the history of the city and the pirate attacks

147608610.name: Old City Walls Campeche
147608610.author: a TripAdvisor user
147608610.reviewBody: It is a very nice place just to stroll along, and see what was once there. In the middle is the old gate entrance to the town, and either side are a couple of modern day statues relating to the older times, well worth a visit

145268912.name: Old City Wall
145268912.author: a TripAdvisor user
145268912.reviewBody: Very interesting history stories here. Walled city still excavating ruins from underground in some areas. Great photography and history buffs, pirate stories and so on.

144933194.name: Good fun - nice views
144933194.author: a TripAdvisor user
144933194.reviewBody:
When we stayed in Campeche visiting the Old City Wall was on our to-do list. Not far from the Main Square you'll find these old walls. Easily reached by foot in a matter of minutes.

Best is to start your visit at the "Puerta de Tierra", the biggest Entrance/Gate (there's also a lightshow here on some nights - for a small fee).
Right next to it you can get up on the walls and it only costs a few peso (there's also a small museum included in the fee where you'll get learn more about the walls history). Once you're up you'll get really nice views of the lovely City.
There weren't many visitors on the day we went there. So there was lots of space for us to stroll around a little and good opportunities for pics.
Altogether it's not that big, but it's a nice historical thing to see. If you have an hour or so you really should come and have a look.

Wanna know more about my trips? Check my profile where you'll also find my website with more info about my travels.

675800142.name: Nice surprise
675800142.author: a TripAdvisor user
675800142.reviewBody: We had Edzna totally to ourselves while we visited. It was a nice difference from the over-commercialization of Chichen Itza. It took about 2 hours to go through.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

675275126.name: Another wonderful Mayan city
675275126.author: a TripAdvisor user
675275126.reviewBody: It\'s really hard to describe these large, wonderful Mayan cities. They are all wonderful to visit and to wander through. The plaza here in particular is just spectacular. Not to be missed if at all possible.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

672640748.name: Very well preserved place
672640748.author: a TripAdvisor user
672640748.reviewBody: It doesn\'t have many monuments in comparison with others, but it\'s quite worth to be seen. It\'s also quieter, because there are less people. Entrance is very cheap.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

664457259.name: Campeche to Edzna by collectivo
664457259.author: a TripAdvisor user
664457259.reviewBody: The Collectivos to Edzna drive every 15-30minutes from the corner Calle Nicaragua & Calle Chihuahua. The Price is 40 Pesos per Person and much cheaper than using a private car or booking the trip with a tour!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

663763990.name: Magical
663763990.author: a TripAdvisor user
663763990.reviewBody: for some reason i love to visit ruins, i believe its because there is so much history and energy when you get to those places. Edzna was not different, the place is amazing. It is very well taken care of, the guide explained everything to me in detail, the place is simply incredible. The access road is in good conditions, it\'s about 1 hour of travel. If you are in Campeche or in the area, it is worth visiting

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

659159698.name: Wow!  Amazing pyramids
659159698.author: a TripAdvisor user
659159698.reviewBody:
It took little less than 1 hour from Campeche city.  Some parts of the roads we took were under construction.  

The ruin is free to enter on Sunday if you are Mexican national; otherwise it’s 60 pesos.  

There is bathroom and vending machines in the entrance.  I recommend to take plenty of water.  

We took two boys (7 and 5 years old), and they were so excited to see iguanas and pyramids.  We spent good 1 hour in the main pyramid area.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

657989587.name: Agree - stunning and deserted
657989587.author: a TripAdvisor user
657989587.reviewBody: When you hear what Chichen will be like (and that it\'s confirmed when you get there) it is amazing to visit Edzna where there was (for us) about 5 other people and you find yourselves in the middle of an enormous Mayan temple appreciating the scale and wonder (something more challenging at Chichen). The carvings and detail are better at Uxmal and Chichen but this was something we\'re glad we saw.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

655418961.name: Stunning and deserted
655418961.author: a TripAdvisor user
655418961.reviewBody: A huge and interesting site. We engaged the guide and it was well worth it to appreciate the varied architectural styles. Take water.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

654158087.name: A must do in Campeche, piece of authentic culture heritage
654158087.author: a TripAdvisor user
654158087.reviewBody: This is a must do! take come water with you. Original and authentic place. Not overcrowded (as some other); enjoy relax and flash back into teh times of the Mayas. The preclassic and classic period. Wonders of their architecture talent. Enjoy also the different legends on the ball plays..In the old times the colors much have been so bright that the common people much have believed the king was god..

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

651414578.name: Easier than it looks
651414578.author: a TripAdvisor user
651414578.reviewBody: We are older travellers but got there easily by collectivo which leaves from behind the Mercado Principal on the hour. 40 mxn for the one hour trip to the site car park and pick up is from there too, on the half hour. Take lunch; there are lots of shaded spots. Good signage in English so we didn\'t use a guide although there was one who offered his services. It\'s an impressive site, not on the scale of Chichen Itza, but because the coachloads aren\'t there and the souvenir sellers aren\'t either it feels as though it\'s a fresh discovery. Climb the walls if you\'re able. The effort is worth it.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

649042071.name: A must to do
649042071.author: a TripAdvisor user
649042071.reviewBody: It was our fifth or sixth Maya place we visited and we recommend it totally. Bring enough time with you - it\u2019s such a great experience. One of the best places I\u2019ve ever seen. We had a fantastic guide and I think watching such a big area means it\u2019s better to have a guide. I read so many things before we went there and then I had Arthur, our guide, and I felt like I didn\u2019t know much.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

647908191.name: Wonderful
647908191.author: a TripAdvisor user
647908191.reviewBody: We arrived early and had the place almost to ourselves. The one hour drive was well worth the effort. The grounds are spotless, the banos are welcome, the lack of guides was liberating, the English on the panels was very helpful, and the ability to climb some (most) of the structures was physically demanding and awe inspiring. This was an excellent way to spend a morning. Go. You won\u2019t regret it.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

647657030.name: Not to be Missed!
647657030.author: a TripAdvisor user
647657030.reviewBody: I have a winter home in Merida, but was visiting Campeche for the weekend with a friend. Me made a last minute decision to visit Edzna before we returned to Merida, I am so glad we did. I had not even heard of these ruins until the day I visited, but I thought they were fantastic, probably now one of my favourites, and I have visited many, including Uxmal, Tulum and Chich\u00e9n Itz\u00e1. Even on a Sunday it was not crowed, very quiet and peaceful and I have tons of photos with zero people in the shots. Keep an eye out for small pieces of broken pottery on the ground while you are walking I saw quite a few when I was there.They are widening the road on the way to Ednza, so there is some construction along the route, I hope that doesn\'t mean the tour buses will start going there soon, I think that would be a shame. If you are in the area you should definitely make the time to visit. I will be recommending Edzna to everyone I know.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

645206622.name: Not Crowded Edzna
645206622.author: a TripAdvisor user
645206622.reviewBody: Did Edzna 11 jan 2019 , 9am. When i arrived 1 small group with a guide were, passed them and had the place to myself for most of an hour. Ruins are very good but not huge. The highlight was the gran acropolis, you cannot climb this but can everything else. The viejs hechacera, old sorceress, was closed, not sure why. Collectivo from Campeche was on Calle Chihuahua, near Nicaragua. Leave every hour, takes an hour. Pick up and drop off along the way so do not expect punctual. $50MP. Drop off and pickup in the carpark. $60MP to enter.\nTotally recommend if you are in Campeche.\nSpeaking of you could do this in the morning and see Campeche in the afternoon, then the 60min trolley ride at 5pm , allin a day if short on time.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

643174582.name: Huge!
643174582.author: a TripAdvisor user
643174582.reviewBody:
It was a surprise!!
Its impresive! Its very interesting, and very well kept.
There are guides you can hire at the spot.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

639293722.name: An Excellent "Ruin"!
639293722.author: a TripAdvisor user
639293722.reviewBody:
You come to Campeche City, mostly to see this excellently preserved Spanish colonial city, but you can't leave without a visit to the ancient Mayan city of Edzna. The site was inhabited as early as 600 BC and abandoned in the 16th century. It was discovered in 1907 and excavation was started in 1958. In 1986, Guatemalan refugees were hired by coordinating agencies to help with the excavation, restoration and maintenance of the site, this was sponsored and funded by various international agencies. The most remarkable features of the site include the main temple and the ball court, located in the plaza. There is a display, under cover, which features different images modelled in stucco. They are well preserved and still retain their original colours of red, blue-green and black.
Edzna is approximately one hours distance from Campeche. To get there you can book a tour, Kankabi OK Tours located on Calle 59 seems a good choice. Here you can get the full meal deal, or just take transportation, the quoted cost was 479 pesos pp. We hired, Luis, the taxi driver who had delivered us to our hotel, Gamma Campeche Malecón. Luis's services, on his business card, is listed as "Nueva Generacion", offers tours, both in the city and to outside locations as well. Luis is a very friendly, personable man, interested in communicating to his guests in spanish, and also very eager to improve on his english. For only 900 pesos, you can enjoy your own personal guide, and if you wish, can also arrange to visit additional venues. You can reach Luis at 981.169.3173.
There was road construction happening on the way out to Edzna, otherwise, it is a pretty straight forward journey there. There is a bit of an interpretive centre where you buy your entrance fee, which only cost us 60 pesos each. The washrooms, modern, are in a separate building and there is only a vending machine where you can purchase drinks and snacks. So if you desire something more substantial, bring your own or be prepared to go to a nearby town. The grounds are well kept and the walking is flat and easy. The sights are well marked and include interpretive signs that include english. There is pretty much free access to the ruins, so if you desire you can climb up for a "better view". The main temple is an exception, and there are others where you will not be able to, because of bad conditions. When we visited, there were not many people, I believe that this is usually the case, unfortunately, this cannot be said for the mosquitoes. I have seen and been in worse, but they still are bad, so don't forget to bring your mosquitoe repellent! The evacuated site is not huge, I would think that two hours to explore should be enough.
The Yucatan has a great many Mayan sites and Edzna is certainly one worth visiting.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

638798724.name: Excellent day touring Edzna
638798724.author: a TripAdvisor user
638798724.reviewBody: Wow, we really enjoyed our day here. We did a day tour to the area with Kankabi\u2019OK tour company and Alfredo was our guide. He was very knowledgeable and we couldn\u2019t have asked for a better experience.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

636370407.name: This place blew me away
636370407.author: a TripAdvisor user
636370407.reviewBody: Apart from Cambodia I have never seen such a spectacular set of ruins, the structure is so vast it is unbelievable definitely worth the drive, loved it loved it loved it.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

635472523.name: Wow, amazing site
635472523.author: a TripAdvisor user
635472523.reviewBody: Had never heard of Edzna but went to Campeche with a buddy of mine that  grew up there.  He and his  brother took me to see it.  Absoluely amazing, in the middle of the jungle is this huge site with building that I have no idea how they were made.  It is just astounding to see the structures close up and what manpower it must have taken and how long it must have taken to complete. Vary, very interesting and worthwhile to see.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

630320381.name: Incredible place! Easy to get to from Campeche
630320381.author: a TripAdvisor user
630320381.reviewBody:
Mind-blowing structure! Covers a huge plaza area, the Pyrimid is huge. It's very well kept, no hawkers, hardly any one else there when we visited. Interpretation boards are good enough and in English. Some fantastic carvings in stone to be seen as well as the complex layout of the place and buildings. 

Very easy to get to from Campeche, you don't need a tour. Colectivos leave from near the market place on Chihuahua Calle. The people there will put you on the right collectivo. The bus will drop you off at the ruins entrance of you let him know where you are going. The last bus back is at 3pm. You have to wait on the main rd for that not the site entrance. The buses are every 30 mins.

The journey took us 45 mins one way. Costs less than half the price of an arranged tour.

Brilliant ruins, a must visit if you're in Campeche.

We spent two hours, maybe three at the site.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

628984717.name: Excellent Ruins
628984717.author: a TripAdvisor user
628984717.reviewBody:
Getting to Edzna:
We visited Edzna using the Colectivo.  Catch the bus on the east side of the main Campeche market (Mercado Pedro Sainz de Baranda). Its off the second street east.  The first street Calle Costa Rica has the market upper floor parking lot ramp.  The next one is Calle Nicaragua.  Follow Nicaragua a short distance to Calle Chichuahua.  The colectivios will be on the corner.  The service starts at 7 AM and runs every hour.  To ensure a seat on the next bus, be there 45 minutes ahead or you will be left behind or potentially have a really uncomfortable seat.  The buses are air-conditioned but don’t count on keeping cool.  Seats to the front are cooler.  The trip took 1 hour.  We missed the 9 AM bus as we wandered the mercado too long so we were first on the 10 AM.  The road off the freeway to Edzna is being widened and re-paved.  Its a very bumpy ride.  The bus will drop you off, and pick you up right at the park entrance.  You pay the $40 Pesos fee when you exit at either end of the ride.
The Park:
The park entrance fee is $60 Pesos.  They have no site maps.  There is plenty of signage around, with English for background.  There are two areas available for viewing.  The Grand Plaza is the one to go to.  Its nearest to the park reception and where you will spend most of your visit.  The other area, the Sorcerious, about a 10 minute walk further, has little of the site overburden removed so not much to see.
The Grand Plaza is worth the visit.  There were maybe 6 others visiting at the same time (Saturday), so crowds are not here.  You can climb around all the site except for the Grand Acropolis - Cinco Pesos.   We were actively on site for 1.5 hours and felt that was sufficient.  There are no services at the park except for washrooms.
The colectivo arrived to pick us up just before 1 PM.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

626755582.name: A spacious opening for light!
626755582.author: a TripAdvisor user
626755582.reviewBody: This beautiful piece of history is wonderful to explore. I stood in the middle of the huge central area on the lush green lawn and when I clapped my clapping was echoed loud and clear.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

620277082.name: Amaizing
620277082.author: a TripAdvisor user
620277082.reviewBody: Amaizing, breathkaing, best of all there are very few tourist visiting, so you have the whole place to yourself, great photos.  A little out of the way but well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

610873619.name: Great Ruins
610873619.author: a TripAdvisor user
610873619.reviewBody: Easy to get to (about an hour from Campeche).  Beautifully maintained site.  The structures at this site are huge.  Worth seeing..

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

606534043.name: Edzna
606534043.author: a TripAdvisor user
606534043.reviewBody: Edzna is a grand site. Its grandeur is the best seen from the steps of Nohoch-Na across the Great Acropolis and at the Acropolis itself. Climbing the Building of the Five Stories is prohibited unfortunately.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

604692996.name: Amazing place to visit.
604692996.author: a TripAdvisor user
604692996.reviewBody: The road is very quiet and there is no gas station or stores to buy snacks or water. Be prepare in advance before you leave the city. It is a two way traffic road, so, be careful. I am not sure if there are Tour Guides there, I ask at the entrance but no one could say anything about it. So, be prepare yourself with information.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

598830780.name: One of the best ruin sites on the Yucatan Peninsula
598830780.author: a TripAdvisor user
598830780.reviewBody:
Of all the archaeological sites that we have seen over the years, this place rates as one of the best.

Founded at around 600 BC this site grew to be the biggest in the state of Campeche, after Calakmul. It boasts numerous well preserved structures, the most impressive of which is the main temple located at the plaza. Built on a platform 130 feet (40 meters) high, it provides a wide overview of the surroundings and incredible photo opportunities.

This is a ruin site that has to be on everyone's list of things to do near Merida. Simply breathtaking.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

598148751.name: Wonderful
598148751.author: a TripAdvisor user
598148751.reviewBody:
This archeological site is a bit out of the way, but completely worth your while.
Wonderfully well preserved.
Can visit during a day trip either from Mérida, or campeche city.
Later on we had a late lunch at the wonderful hacienda Uayamón.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

594112019.name: Edzna
594112019.author: a TripAdvisor user
594112019.reviewBody: Get hear at 9 AM and you\'ll have the place to yourself!  We loved this site and overall enjoyed it more than Chichen Itza.  We used guide from Kankabi OK Tours from Champeche and had a faboulous experience.  You\'ll need 2-3 hours on the site and there aren\'t any restaurants available to pack a lunch and some bottled water.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

592721280.name: Breathtaking!
592721280.author: a TripAdvisor user
592721280.reviewBody: This is an amazing place to go and see. The ruins are well maintained and the trip from Campeche is not too long. Plane to spend about 2 hours here. It will be warm so make sure that you plan accordingly. Wear close toed shoes and bring tons of bug spray! You\'ll need it!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

585491949.name: Pleasant tree lined stroll which then reveals stunning ruins.
585491949.author: a TripAdvisor user
585491949.reviewBody: We found it to be quiet with few visitors, so you could, with a little patience get photos without people in them. Although a rather smaller site it has some great buildings, especially the pyramid of the five stories that is worth the climb to view. It has its own huge courtyard plaza that is not immediately discernible at first. Best with a guide.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

582938467.name: Impressively calm
582938467.author: a TripAdvisor user
582938467.reviewBody:
This was the third Mayan archeological site we visited (after Ek Balam and the famous Chichen Itza) and we both thought it was the most magnificent. The site is not enormous but it is very nicely kept. You can the main building (with room openings and other evidence it once was inhabited, like benches and beds), intricate facade pieces in it’s original color, unearthed masks on the walls... We took a guided tour at the ticket office. We could sense our guide, Juan’s, enthusiasm of the Mayan history and the grandeur of the civilization, their daily life, rituals and beliefs. He spoke good English, which for us, with barely any knowledge of Spanish was a treat! 
I am sure without his guidance we would have never noticed this many details, nor would we have learned about the Mayan rituals and customs. He took his time answering any additional questions we had. 
The most impressive of all is the calmness of the site as there was probably only around 20 other visitors there, although it was a Saturday. 
It was fairly easy to get to by an hour colectivo ride from Campeche (which cost us 160 pesos altogether). We chose this option because the taxi or tour ride would cost around 1000 pesos, excluding the entrance, which we thought was slightly overpriced compared to what we paid for the whole day trip to other two sites.  
Definitely worth the visit and Juan is highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

581696673.name: Awesome Mayan ruins
581696673.author: a TripAdvisor user
581696673.reviewBody: The Mayan ruins at Edzna are a must see! The site is quite large with lots of different ruins. One of the best reasons to go here is that it isn\u2019t over-run with tourists like other Mayan ruins in the Yucatan peninsula such as Chichen Itza. Strongly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

581461163.name: Interesting site almost empty
581461163.author: a TripAdvisor user
581461163.reviewBody: A nice woodland walk suddenly opens up to reveal some great ruins, and nobody else around!  Well worth visiting, less than an hour\'s drive from Campeche.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

577958090.name: Really liked walking around the place
577958090.author: a TripAdvisor user
577958090.reviewBody:
I've been to plenty of the big sites in Mexico and while they all have their attractions Edzna is one of those you get a good feel about.

The entrance fee of 60 Pesos gets you into a small museum on site as well. I spent 1.5 to 2 hours strolling around which included going to the Old Sorceress, a stand alone pyramid which is overgrown and a 5 to 10 min walk from the main group of buildings.

There's a vending machine which drinks and snacks there but not much else. So suggest you bring water and whatever else you need.

The place also has by far the biggest iguana population of all the sites I've been to.

To get there you can drive or take a tour but you can also go by collectivo however some of the posts about this are a little unclear. The collectivos do leave from  Calle Chihuahua but it's not the section near the market. That is a narrow section of the street that's full of market stalls. Calle Chihuahua dog legs at Calle Nicoragua and the collectivos are on the opposite side of Calle Nicoragua to the market. They also aren't labelled Bonfil they actually have Valle de Edzna on the sides. It costs 40 Pesos to get to Edzna. The collectivo drivers will either drop you at the road to Edzna (about 400m up this side road) or if they are looking for more fares will go up to the gate. On the way back best to walk to the main road and flag down a collectivo as they don't always go to the Edzna gate, depends if they want more fares. I only had to wait 3 min but can't guarantee that will always be the case.

Definitely worth going to.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

577687710.name: very good
577687710.author: a TripAdvisor user
577687710.reviewBody: Interesting and with great anthropological value, I found many mosquitoes and other insects , the entry price is e bit expensive..

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

571563388.name: Edzna Rocks !
571563388.author: a TripAdvisor user
571563388.reviewBody: Dear Friends, If you are anywhere near Campeche and you want to check out an awesome Mayan ruin, Edzna will bring a smile to your face !  It is not so commercialized.  Very peaceful location and the restrooms are very nice !  Bring your own water and food, as there is no restaurant.  You may be thinking that Edzna is a small ruin !  No, it is huge, with many levels still standing !  Put it on your list of must sees ! Enjoy ! Skippyfrizz !

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

570860390.name: A must if you are in Campeche
570860390.author: a TripAdvisor user
570860390.reviewBody: Jump into a Collectivo for this, 45 pesos each way. We went early afternoon one day. Car park looked busy on arrival. Only saw about 15 other people inside, fabulous. Make sure you check out the old sorceress, an unrestored temple down a grassy track. Some idiot was there with a drone but buzzed off quickly enough!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

568667095.name: Impressive, yet empty
568667095.author: a TripAdvisor user
568667095.reviewBody: We had a well-informed guide with us for our visit to Edzn\u00e1. He introduced us to many aspects of this Mayan site that we might have missed on our own. The masks in particular and their symbolism were impressive. Yet during our two hours at the site, we saw at most 20 other people. Perhaps this dearth of visitors is why there are so many iguanas (some of them huge) and birds. A magical place.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

566949014.name: Very Impressive Site, Convenient to Campeche City
566949014.author: a TripAdvisor user
566949014.reviewBody: Edzna is a relatively recently excavated site with some very impressive ruins including a five story structure.  It is conveniently close to Campeche City (about one hour away) and most enjoyable of all is the fact that it is very little visited compared to the big sites in Yucatan state!  Well worth a half a day.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

566651759.name: Excavated less than 50 years ago
566651759.author: a TripAdvisor user
566651759.reviewBody: This more recent ruin is clean and nicely landscaped. It isn\'t huge, but has plenty to see. The reception desk sells a diagram of the site for 10 pesos, and admission is 60. It is free on Sunday\'s.  Archeologists are still working on the back side of the main pyramid. If you plan on climbing, look for the blocks set diagonally, like half steps, and walk right up them. The steps are otherwise very high. I\'m not sure this is original, or added during reconstruction. I\'ve never seen those before and am happy my hubby noticed them. The front stairs form arches underneath in the platforms and are visible from the side view.\n\nThere are 2 beautiful masks under a thatched roof off to the side, so make sure you walk over to see them.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

564063319.name: Superb Less-visited Mayan Site
564063319.author: a TripAdvisor user
564063319.reviewBody: While a little off the beaten path, Edzna is now one of my favorite Mayan sites in the region. The ruins are well-restored, and the configuration unusual (if you are a Mayan ruin junkie like I am). I especially appreciate the lovely proportions and slightly assymetrical balance of the central plaza area. Only water is in a vending machine near the entrance, no food available. Bring your own. And, as always, be sure to have sun screen and mosquito repellent with you.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

561551934.name: Quality experience without tourists
561551934.author: a TripAdvisor user
561551934.reviewBody: This is not on the beaten track.  A visit here is a quality experience because you can really feel the history and spirituality of the place without hundreds of tourists.  I was there on a weekday about 9:00 with a private guide and with maybe 10 people on the entire site.  There is no real written information, so if you can arrange for a guide to take you privately, you will learn what you are actually looking at; otherwise, I would recommend that you buy a book about the site before you go.  LP\'s explanation is not worthwhile.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

560342822.name: Amazing!
560342822.author: a TripAdvisor user
560342822.reviewBody: I knew I would be impressed by this Mayan ruin by the pictures I had seen but I was not prepared by how awesome it really is. It is not as big as Chitchenitza , as noisy, as commercial as overrun by tourists like myself. EDzna is serine, set in a park like setting with green grass and shade trees around. I saw only a few other visitors on this sunny afternoon. The scope of what was built all of those hundreds of years ago with none of the modern technologies we rely on today boggles the mind. The Mayan were engineering geniuses and incredibly hardy people to have constructed this temple city under these climatic conditions?

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

559830501.name: Majestic Ruins
559830501.author: a TripAdvisor user
559830501.reviewBody: We were staying at Hacienda Uayamon nearby, so coming here was a no-brainer.  Easy to find and relatively compact in a neat, well-groomed park-like setting.  Not as impressive as places like Uxmal, Ek Balam, or Chichen Itza, but still worth the trip if visiting Campeche.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

559103685.name: Spectacular
559103685.author: a TripAdvisor user
559103685.reviewBody:
We took the colectivo (public bus) from Campeche to the Edzná ruins yesterday and they were absolutely fantastic. There were only two other tourists there during the time we were and it felt like we had the ruins to ourselves! The scale of the buildings is awe-inspiring and the layout makes it so easy immerse yourself in how life there must have been. It was really worth the trip and I'd really recommend it as a day trip for anyone visiting Campeche. 

As a side note, in case you're interested, the way we got there was hard to find online: we went to the Puerta Terra in Campeche where members of tourist information are located. We asked for a map and info on how to get a colectivo to Edzná which they were quick to help with. Colectivos leave once and hour, on the hour, from a stand on a little street called Chihuahua a short walk from Puerta Terra. The colectivo should cost 40 pesos per person (£1.50 / AU$2.70 / US$2). It takes somewhere between 40-60 mins. We were told we'd be dropped at the top of the road to the ruins but our driver was lovely and dropped us in the carpark. He told us that he'd be returning that way in 1.5-2 hours and that he'd collect us if we liked or we could walk to the top of the road and wait and that the last colectivo would be at 5pm. It worked out perfectly - we got the bus at 12 noon and were back in Campeche at 3:40pm having had a brilliant time and having spent a grand total of 140 pesos each (60 to get in and 40, each way, on the colectivo).

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

558901786.name: Edna rocks, in silence
558901786.author: a TripAdvisor user
558901786.reviewBody: The weather was cool, even in the Yucatan, and it seemed like a good opportunity to see Campeche without soaking my shirts. Spent my first day exploring the old walled city, awesome,  then the next morning I drove East a half hour or so to the archeological site of Adzna. The place was deserted, I swear I felt a tingle of excitement as I wandered the immaculate grounds letting my imagination create scenes from a thousand years ago. Eventually, of course, a few additional visitors arrived. But, for that first hour or so, I felt like I was back in the 70s when I first started exploring the ruins of the Yucatan. I will make the effort to return.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

555503980.name: Edzna is a must see near Campeche
555503980.author: a TripAdvisor user
555503980.reviewBody: Edzna is only 45 minutes from Campeche (you can even get there by a taxi). The site is magnificent and small enough to explore in a couple of hours.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

553631918.name: Not to be missed
553631918.author: a TripAdvisor user
553631918.reviewBody: This is an amazing site. It\'s one of the oldest Mayan sites in Yucatan. It\'s easily accessible from Campeche, and yet there were maybe 10 people there during our visit. Highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

551126563.name: Just Wow
551126563.author: a TripAdvisor user
551126563.reviewBody: We were only in the area for 10 days over the Christmas holiday with time to see just three ruins, due to other adventures.  As disappointing as that was, Edzna compensated in spades.  This site is so spectacular that we really felt deeply connected to the history and culture of the Mayan people.  So, if you only have time to visit one or two, THIS is the one to see.  Open, accessible, peaceful, and complex.  Fascinating!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

550415167.name: Great ruins
550415167.author: a TripAdvisor user
550415167.reviewBody: Beautiful ruins. A short walk through the forest to arrive there but worth the 1.5 hour drive from Campeche. Also be sure to get a tour guide. There are some hidden gems in the ruins that are worth being explained.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

549855976.name: Beautifully well kept
549855976.author: a TripAdvisor user
549855976.reviewBody: We visited the site in a couple of hours, and were amazed with the intensity of the views, as well as the magnificence of many of the buildings.\nEven if it\'s super hot, it\'s a very important landmark of the area, so it\'s a must see!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

544299969.name: Amazing Grand Plaza
544299969.author: a TripAdvisor user
544299969.reviewBody: We are ruin junkies and we loved Edzna!  It\'s not crowded and we spent several hours poking around the site.  The Grand Plaza has an acropolis you can climb to get a great view of the platform with the temple and other buildings.  You can climb the steps up the platform, which is huge (24 ft high and 512 ft square) with temples on 3 sides.  The Temple of 5 Stories is very impressive with a temple and intact roof comb on top of the 5 stories.  The temples on either side are fun to explore, and around the side of the platform on the north side is a small area hidden away, called the Puuc Patio - we had fun finding it! Edzna is about an hour from Campeche City and well-worth the trip!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

541263271.name: Nice Ruins
541263271.author: a TripAdvisor user
541263271.reviewBody: Nice  and big ruins with interesting acoustics. Also as Palenque. One of the top we visited in Mexiko. Entrance for 55 mxk per person, good parking place, many mosquitos.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

541123396.name: Interesting, amazing, positive, cultural
541123396.author: a TripAdvisor user
541123396.reviewBody: Consider to get the services of a professional teacher or touring guide who are at the main office of the Archaelogical zone

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

529918241.name: Edzna ruins
529918241.author: a TripAdvisor user
529918241.reviewBody: Thoroughly enjoyed looking round the site. Was nice and quiet. The large ruin was closed off so you couldn\'t walk up it. Watch out for the mosquitoes will need repellent. We spent about two hours there. Our hotel arranged for a driver to take us there and back was about a 45 minute drive. Would recommend going!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

522918080.name: Either you are here because of Edzna or you should
522918080.author: a TripAdvisor user
522918080.reviewBody: Either you are here because of Edzna or you should be, so do not leave without visiting this important archeologic place. You will not forget it and you need some alf day, at least, for it.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

501409182.name: Impressive
501409182.author: a TripAdvisor user
501409182.reviewBody: Edzna is a bit off the beaten path and not overly commercialized or packed with tourists.\n\nIt is a large site with grand structures and requires some walking.  If you go in June DO NOT go without repellant.  The mosquitos will attack you in swarms if you ever stop moving.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

494714126.name: beautiful
494714126.author: a TripAdvisor user
494714126.reviewBody: i love visiting arqueological sites and Edzna is worth it, don\'t expect big crowds as in Chichen or Tulum which makes it a lot more enjoyable.. beautiful sites..

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

484201051.name: Impressive Acropolis
484201051.author: a TripAdvisor user
484201051.reviewBody: There are bigger and grander sites in Mexico but this is well worth a visit if you are nearby thanks to its incredible main building which, even as people who have lived in Mexico for 2 years, we were impressed with. Very very hot so come suitably equipped.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

482777840.name: First time in campeche and edzna
482777840.author: a TripAdvisor user
482777840.reviewBody: Great archeological site. So many buildings.\nWell worth the 55 pesoes admission. Impressed my husband !\nWish we had a tour guide.....

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

481275046.name: As ruins go it is about avaerage, but worth the trip if you are in Campeche.
481275046.author: a TripAdvisor user
481275046.reviewBody: We toured the ruins on a Sunday when it is free for Mexicans and Permanent residents. it opens at 8 am everyday and takes about 90 minutes for a good leisurely tour. Unfortunately you are unable to climb the main pyramid. There are no people selling trinkets and trash to tourists and the only drinks available are from vending machines. Recommend good sturdy walking shoes and a hat. You can take a backpack in so best to bring your own drinks.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

473491692.name: Beautiful site booming with history.
473491692.author: a TripAdvisor user
473491692.reviewBody:
Really enjoyed my time here and could have easily have spent a few more hours looking around! 

Some of the Mayan architecture can also be entered which is amazing!

Could easily consider doing it again and definitely hold it up as one of the most interest Mayan areas (Tikal being the obvious 1st place).

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

469523258.name: wonderfull
469523258.author: a TripAdvisor user
469523258.reviewBody: it s nice to see it s not far and not expensive    you need to go there believe me it s a lace to see  good

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

469029768.name: Wow
469029768.author: a TripAdvisor user
469029768.reviewBody: Be there when it opens and you can wander alone for hours.....just amazing.  Highly recommend staying at Hacienda Uayamon which is only 30min away

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

468101329.name: You can get to spectacular Edzna by local bus from Campeche
468101329.author: a TripAdvisor user
468101329.reviewBody: There is an inexpensive, local bus you can take from Chihuahua street near the market. Just remember that you have to walk back out to the main road (not far) to come back to Campeche. The sound and light show is "okay" but that\'s because the story is only told in Spanish (it is a Spanish speaking country).

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

468065865.name: Great Mayan  site
468065865.author: a TripAdvisor user
468065865.reviewBody: A large site with lots to see. Some interesting structures. Not that busy in February. Need to give the place half a day.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

467476758.name: Maya glory
467476758.author: a TripAdvisor user
