467476758.reviewBody: There doesn\'t seem to be a way of getting there by public transport so I went on a small group tour.  It\'s a well preserved and pretty impressive site, and well worth climbing the Acropolis for the best view.  It was nice to visit a site with no more than about 20 other visitors---apart from some idiot that tried to destroy the peace by flying a drone.  Strongly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

467398031.name: Great short trip from Campeche
467398031.author: a TripAdvisor user
467398031.reviewBody: Great site, few tourists.  Not quite as spectacular as Chichen Itza but you don\'t have the thousands of Cancun day trippers and just as many vendors to disturb your enjoyment of the ruins. \n\nSee my answer in the Q&A section with regards to public transport to the site.  Catch the collectivo on Chihuahua at Calle Nicaragua near Mercado Principal.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

467064991.name: What an incredible place!
467064991.author: a TripAdvisor user
467064991.reviewBody: Visited here today. Went early (it opens at 8am). There was literally only me and one other visitor there. I felt so privileged, it was such an amazing place. So calm and relaxing to stroll around and absorb it all. And all for the price of a cup of coffee also!\n\nWOW!!!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

465584535.name: Architecturally superb
465584535.author: a TripAdvisor user
465584535.reviewBody: A huge Maya site, the fringes of which are still being excavated.  Very few people there during our visit. No site museum worth mentioning, but some of the buildings are spectacular, especially the \u2018Acropolis\u2019. The only site plan was disappointingly vague, and there are few descriptive plaques offering any explanation of what you are looking at. A small plan and handout in English would be useful, and need not be expensive - admission is cheap (MXN 55).\n\nTip. If travelling by car from Campeche, and using a GPS, check your route before you set off. There is a short route, about 50 km, and another that is about 80km

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

465099545.name: Beautiful!
465099545.author: a TripAdvisor user
465099545.reviewBody: Edzna is worth the trip.  It is a very open and well excavated ruin, and there was hardly anyone else there.  It is magnificent with some unique architectural details.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

464854039.name: Tranquil
464854039.author: a TripAdvisor user
464854039.reviewBody: This extraordinary site can be visited without crowds or vendors. Paths are clearly marked, parking free, and the best part is the signage in Mayan, Spanish and English. Don\'t miss the masks with visible paint. And I loved reading that Guatemalan refugees were hired to clear this site.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

463599142.name: A really nice site
463599142.author: a TripAdvisor user
463599142.reviewBody: This is a really nice site and it is even better with a good guide.  A mix of restored and un-restored construction.  Amazing acoustics. Take 2 hours to visit.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

460965404.name: get there earily!
460965404.author: a TripAdvisor user
460965404.reviewBody: Hotter than hell later in the day. You can not climb on the large monument, but the restoration is nice, and there are no hassle people on the grounds!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

459816966.name: Chichen where?
459816966.author: a TripAdvisor user
459816966.reviewBody: This site is not only much quieter than Chichen Itza but also gives a much better idea of what the whole site was like when occupied. The main temple soars above a large square surrounded by stepped areas. There are elevated vantage points affording photo opportunities of the complete layout. Set in the middle of a wooded area. More than its fair share of iguanas.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

458731768.name: Well worth a half day
458731768.author: a TripAdvisor user
458731768.reviewBody: We got a driver and guide  for a day trip to Edzna and Xtampak.  These two were good for a short day tour.  Edzna is a large site with only a few restored structures principally around the main square. Getting to and from Edzna would be a challenge without a driver.  If you have some familiarity with Mayan cities and know the various influences (Bec, Puuc, etc.) you could probably visit this site on your own if you had transportation arranged.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

458175985.name: I had the ruins to myself
458175985.author: a TripAdvisor user
458175985.reviewBody: OK, I didn\'t actually have the ruins completely to myself, but I counted 8 other people there! It was great! You\'re allowed to climb on all of the ruins, except for the main, big 5 level one. It was super cheap to get in as well! Make sure that you bring water, as the site is totally empty! Also bring a hat, the sun was really strong there!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

457548433.name: One of the best Mayan sites to visit!
457548433.author: a TripAdvisor user
457548433.reviewBody: My partner and I went to a few different Mayan sites during our trip around the Yucutan peninsula, and Edzna was one of the best. We had a place almost to ourselves and had an excellent local guide. Although a smaller site than others we visited, the temples are still impressive and the lack of tourists made this place stand out. Recommended!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

457182901.name: Fascinating site to visit!
457182901.author: a TripAdvisor user
457182901.reviewBody: Edzn\u00e1 is a small site of Mayan ruins about half an hour from Campeche. We took colectivo to the site for $40 pesos per person (one way), but the departure point was a bit tough to find. I recommend getting good directions before venturing out! The ruins were great\u2014much more impressive than we expected, with several large structures, including El Edificio de Los Cinco Pisos. There were a few other people visiting, but not many. Visitors are allowed to climb most buildings. There are iguanas everywhere, too, and they\u2019re great fun to watch. We spent a couple of hours wandering through the Gran Acropolis and then made our way back to the entrance to wait for the colectivo, which comes about every half hour. There\u2019s a machine near the entrance that dispenses fruit juice and soda for 12 pesos apiece. We saw no vendors hawking anything, although there are a few items for sale in the reception area. We really enjoyed our time at the site!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

455921857.name: Don\'t Miss This One.
455921857.author: a TripAdvisor user
455921857.reviewBody: Smaller Maya site, but plenty to see. We were there on a Sunday and had the entire zone to ourselves. Huge structures, iguanas, great for kids to climb around, plus the whiole sweep of Maya history. The site dates from 800-1000 A.D. An hour and a half drive from Campeche.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

455898835.name: Absolute gem
455898835.author: a TripAdvisor user
455898835.reviewBody: Forgettable day walking through those beautiful ruins. The main reason it\'s one of my absolute favorites is that there are no people around almost all the time. When we were there in the morning, its was literally just us two and the sunrise. Stunning.\nLots of big lizards and beautiful colorful birds around.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

454127159.name: Good tour, very interesting!
454127159.author: a TripAdvisor user
454127159.reviewBody: In Edzna you can enjoy 7 different architectural pyramids, 7 different styles! Very interesting, worth going. You must bring your own water and eat before or after your visit, they do not have a store, they only have a soda machine that takes only pesos!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

454079795.name: Fantastic
454079795.author: a TripAdvisor user
454079795.reviewBody: Toured Edzna by myself as my wife was fighting a cold. Took the combi from town to and from. The site is well maintained and the small 10 peso visitor guide does the trick. Easy to walk the site. Make sure you have good shoes, a hat and lots of water. To get the combi back to Campeche you have to walk out to the highway (a couple of hundred yards, not far) and wait. They will stop and pick you up. Much better than other sites we have visited- see it at your own pace, it is not crowded and well explained.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

452756541.name: The right size ruins to get aquainted by the Maya culture, without the crowds
452756541.author: a TripAdvisor user
452756541.reviewBody: Worth to go.  amazing ruins, with very well preserved stones covered on a site exhibit and the open city and piramids.  Extraordinary and majestic, without the crowds of other Mayan cities.  Nice to spend a morning there.  Do not miss to get to the main plaza by climbing some step stairs

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

452467722.name: Go before it is even more discovered
452467722.author: a TripAdvisor user
452467722.reviewBody: Wonderful place that has yet to be fully discovered by tourists so you often have the place to yourself.  We did.  Not off the beaten path thought, easy to find and good road to it.  A guide may help as there is a lot to see one doesn\'t understand but if you read about it on-line prior to coming here you can do your own tour.  Nowhere do they have signs saying they don\'t accept dogs on leash but they don\'t.  Our dog had to stay in the car while we visited.  Very interesting to think they are the precursors of Chichen Itza, much more well known site further norht.  Very compact so easy to see in less than 2 hours, including time to take pictures and have a snack.  Did not attend to the evening light show and cannot comment on it other than to say it has been going on since the 1980\'s.  Anything that lasts that long in Mexico has to be good.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

450664692.name: Best Ruins
450664692.author: a TripAdvisor user
450664692.reviewBody: Having now visited over 5 different archeological zones in Mexico I can safely say Edzna is one of my favourites. We went early and had the whole place to ourselves for over 2 hours-a rarity these days. If you enjoy visiting sites without the hordes the tourists or people trying to sell you things Edzna is a MUST!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

450076450.name: Highly recommended!
450076450.author: a TripAdvisor user
450076450.reviewBody: If you\'re in the area and have a car, definitely stop at this well preserved (and not super crowded) Mayan ruin! We were driving from Campeche to Uxmal and stopped on the way - very glad we did. You will be able to walk around the site in 1-2 hours. The main palace is exquisite and and has unique architecture. The grounds are well kept and most of the main buildings have signs in Spanish, English, and Mayan. Well worth it!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

449751123.name: Edzna is unusual and very impressive
449751123.author: a TripAdvisor user
449751123.reviewBody: Edzna is an easily accessible important Mayan archeological site fairly near to the city of Campeche. The style is rather unique and the layout is very impressive. \nIts uniqueness makes it a must for archeology fans, but its easy access and great beauty make it a very rewarding visit for anybody.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

448155456.name: Edzna\u00b4s elegance
448155456.author: a TripAdvisor user
448155456.reviewBody: The Maya architecture can be full of details and symmetry, In my opinion Edzn\u00e1 has little details, symmetry in its structures and what makes it special for me it has lots of elegance. If you like stucco huge masks, the ones that you find in Edzn\u00e1 are very well conserved. They told us that the two stucco masks represents the sun (a young sun that corresponds to the east mask,and an old sun that makes reference to the one of the west or to where the sun is old and almost dying), and they are smaller that the masks that you find in Kohunlich. You also ahve the idea that the stais of the main structure of Edzn\u00e1 can only be used by walking in them as the Maya must have done: whith elegance and a huge sense of dignity, as if you were walking to a place in which all gods and few mortals were allowed,

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

448116030.name: Great
448116030.author: a TripAdvisor user
448116030.reviewBody: Went here in a private vehicle with several others from Campeche. Very nice site, well organized, and instructive. There were very few people at the site, which was in contrast to Palenque.  No hucksters and not much commercial activity at all. Bring water and a hat. The site is hotter than the city.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

447109046.name: Amazing place! Must see!
447109046.author: a TripAdvisor user
447109046.reviewBody: Zona Arquelogica Edzna is amazing place! You really must see it. It\'s beautifull and we were almost the only tourist there. Much better then Uxmal or even Chitzen Itza! And the entrance fee is onny about 50 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

445732971.name: Very interesting place to visit
445732971.author: a TripAdvisor user
445732971.reviewBody:
The place is well maintained, you can see the ¨new¨and old acropolis.
Amazing architecture, you can here everything on the grades, without the need to speak out-loud.
The pyramid is beautiful, and different from the ones in Uxmal and Chichen-Itza.
Also you can see the ¨Masks¨

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

445720378.name: Yes please
445720378.author: a TripAdvisor user
445720378.reviewBody:
Impressive site. I love they way the sites on the Yucatán peninsula handle visitors. Well organized and Edzna was no exception. 
What I liked most was the reveal as you walk past the open plaza and beyond the trees just around the corner you get your first glimpse of the huge pyramid that dominates the site. 
Also I really like the low key feel there. We visited with a couple
Of tour busses but some of the time we were nearly alone at the site so we took some great photos. We spent about an hour and a half there and loved it. 
Only down side is getting to the site from Campeche. We took a couple
of wrong turns. I suggest a good map and GPS.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

445706415.name: Stunning Mayan Ruins
445706415.author: a TripAdvisor user
445706415.reviewBody: Got there early in the morning and had the place to ourselves;  dew still on the grass and sunshine streaming low through the trees onto the ruins - unforgettable!  Nice to be able to climb the monuments, and thus a good pairing with Chichen Itza. Loved the gargoyles!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

443058928.name: Another great Mayan site
443058928.author: a TripAdvisor user
443058928.reviewBody: About an hour\'s drive from Campeche lies another great Mayan site, which you can explore without encountering huge crowds.Again, you can climb the pyramids and temples on this site without hindrance and enjoy fantastic views. You can buy a small guidebook for a few pesos.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

441243196.name: Amazing archeological site
441243196.author: a TripAdvisor user
441243196.reviewBody: Edzn\u00e1 is such a fascinating mayan archeological site!!!  We were impressed with the site, visited the different pyramids and places and enjoyed the visit very much. As a mexican citizen, I feel proud of the good conditions of this site (as good as any other INAH\'s archeological site I have visited).

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

441176027.name: Quiet, peaceful and just for yourself
441176027.author: a TripAdvisor user
441176027.reviewBody: This place is beautiful, and to my surprise was pretty much empty, we had the place just for us... Very well preserved, its worth it to drive 45 minutes from Campeche to visit this site.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

441156148.name: great (annoying mosquitos)
441156148.author: a TripAdvisor user
441156148.reviewBody: we were here really early, so nearly no visitors. after chichen it was another world to have this ruins for yourself. only negative Thing were the mosquitos

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

441016904.name: Beautiful
441016904.author: a TripAdvisor user
441016904.reviewBody: A magnificent place. The ruins are amazing, the grounds beautiful, wonderfully kept. It is a magical place.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

439936871.name: Fantastic ruins
439936871.author: a TripAdvisor user
439936871.reviewBody: Avoid the crowds of Chichen Itza and Palenque, and have this great place almost to yourself. An easy drive from wonderful Campeche. We found a guide helpful. Transport with guide a reasonable 500 pesos (children much less).

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

439507747.name: The Best day Yet
439507747.author: a TripAdvisor user
439507747.reviewBody: I booked  a taxi through my hotel  ( Rodolfo   Elite Taxi  ) and spent half a day  exploring this magical place,  climbing up and down the Pyramids , and learned so much..i could go on and on it was awesome...

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

438577690.name: One of my favorites
438577690.author: a TripAdvisor user
438577690.reviewBody: This site is relatively small and accessible but not heavily visited.  It is between Merida and Campeche.  Do visit if you are in either city.  You will not be disappointed.  The site visit will be significantly enhanced if you go with a guide who is knowledgeable about ancient Maya life and history.  I recommend having mosquito repellent on hand in case they are out when you visit.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

438405803.name: One of the Best
438405803.author: a TripAdvisor user
438405803.reviewBody:
This was one stop out of 23 on our 21 day tour
It was worth the time to get there .
Do not miss it . Every site is different but we were amazed
to see how similar the were also. Makes you humble !

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

437655871.name: Not world famous but very good
437655871.author: a TripAdvisor user
437655871.reviewBody: Although not a well known site Edzna has a very large Mayan Acropolis and a number of pyramid structures that are impressive and well worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

437166971.name: Peaceful
437166971.author: a TripAdvisor user
437166971.reviewBody: We arrived in the late afternoon. The prize was reasonable, but the only downside was that there was no guide available. On the other hand we got to imagine our own story about the ruins with the information there was about each building and what we already knew about the mayans. There were maybe 10 or 12 other people visiting so it was very quiet and peaceful. But it\'s a pretty big site and it\'s very well kept. They also have a light night show but we couldn\'t stay for it.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

437160445.name: Great
437160445.author: a TripAdvisor user
437160445.reviewBody: Excellent trip, the pyramids and the city are impressive,  very hot and lots of walking,  take water bottles and hat to protect from sun. \nOne section of the city next to a temple the temperature dropped 20 degrees,  unknown results.\n

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

436976089.name: Impressive site
436976089.author: a TripAdvisor user
436976089.reviewBody: Well restored impressive site. Definitely worth a visit. Easy to get to, decent facilities. The signage could be better and I would really like to see some information on function of the buildings as well as the architectural heritage info.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

435419913.name: Worth it
435419913.author: a TripAdvisor user
435419913.reviewBody: We\'d seen a lot of the Mayan Ruins in the Yucatan and we were a bit concerned we were gonna get all \'ruined\' and disinterested if we kept it up but every site seems to offer something more. Edzna is a cheap and easy morning out from Campeche and well worth it even if you have seen your share of ancient Maya. Get a combi from calle Chihuahua for 40 pesos each way. 45 minutes there. 55 Peso entry. The site is pretty compact with alot of cool stuff in a relatively small area. You get a real sense of the ancient city centre and can definitely image the cities height of power from the impressive central buildings.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

430181052.name: A real marvel
430181052.author: a TripAdvisor user
430181052.reviewBody: Being a local and having visited many of the Mexican ruins I find this a marvel, beautifully restored and in beautiful jungle setting and almost empty during weekdays

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

430122529.name: Amazing site
430122529.author: a TripAdvisor user
430122529.reviewBody: Easily accesed from Campeche by colective, Edzna was one of my favorite ancient sites in Mexico. I was surprised that there were very few tourists there when I was there, but that made it even better. I cannot properly describe the feelings that this site evokes, something I\'ve noticed not just in me, but in others as well. Easy to fall in love with the mysterious ancient sites of the Mayas and its past after you see this ruin. The main temple complex could blow you away!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

429956741.name: A stunning place with hardly anyone there
429956741.author: a TripAdvisor user
429956741.reviewBody: These ruins were every bit as impressive as Chichen Itza with one huge difference - there was no one there. They really are worth visiting - the 5 storey temple is superb, although you can no longer climb up it.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

425768902.name: Visit to a Mayan Ruin
425768902.author: a TripAdvisor user
425768902.reviewBody: Edzna is about  40 min. trip from the city of Campeche. It is a well restored (still in progress) Aruelogica site. .\nTake insect repellant...It is in the jungle.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

422770570.name: Had the place to ourselves!
422770570.author: a TripAdvisor user
422770570.reviewBody: A great day out and an easy trip from Campeche. We were there about 9.30am and had the entire place to ourselves so it was very tranquil. Well worth a visit - you probably need a couple of hours there to enjoy all it has. Take water though it is very hot.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

422157280.name: My favorite Mayan ruins
422157280.author: a TripAdvisor user
422157280.reviewBody: Edzna is my favorite Mayan ruin because it is so neat and compact. When you climb the main stairs into the courtyard you get a sense of what it felt like to live there. We saw 2 other people there, plus hundreds of iguanas. Very well maintained,  but bring insect repellant. Oh...no vendors will be there!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

421915306.name: Impressive
421915306.author: a TripAdvisor user
421915306.reviewBody: Edzna is an amazing archeological site, a huge area with impressive buildings and green areas. We arrived early in the morning and were the only visitors for the first hour. The tour guide Evaristo explained us very detailed the history of the place (in Spanish) and let us take all the photos we wanted to. Definitely a place you should plan to visit if you are going to Campeche o Merida.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

400825355.name: One of the best ruins I\'ve been too
400825355.author: a TripAdvisor user
400825355.reviewBody: So Edzna is not one of the most famous archaeological sites known to Mexicans or foreigners but It is definitely one of the most beautiful with great historic background. It is also very well preserved

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

398951882.name: One of the more intriguing sites, and nearly empty.
398951882.author: a TripAdvisor user
398951882.reviewBody: Ednza is large and much of it is quite well preserved.  It\'s also a fairly recent excavation, so there are relatively few people afoot, and there are elements of it that inspire the Indiana Jones imagination in all of us.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

398890887.name: Ezdna the site of the Maya water engineers and an amazing place to start Maya road travel
398890887.author: a TripAdvisor user
398890887.reviewBody: It\'s an amazing place to visit just near Campeche entering the jungle and as a start to all Maya "countries" you can find there some unusual Maya place with atypical constructions based on water collection facilities. \nLess crowded that bigger sites as Tulum or Chichen Itza, you will need water, a good hat and a lot of mosquito repellant as it has long walks to see different stages of their civilization, from a preclassic "Acropolis" and "Juego de Pelota" to the main temple with "curve" constructions and floating stairs. \nHiring a guide is a must to know all the details of the site, as is quite different from other Maya places, and you will also help ecnonomically local Maya descendant people as there is no shop or restaurants or other type of commercial places, this is quite low cost, less than USD$30 for a tour of one hour.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

397694714.name: Relaxed Maya ruins to visit
397694714.author: a TripAdvisor user
397694714.reviewBody: The maya ruins are among the best well preserved of the dozen sites we visited in campeche, yucatan and quintana roo. One of the best things is that there are no crowds or lines like when one visits the overrated Chichen-Itza or Tulum. It is about half hour drive from Campeche city. Make sure you carry insect repellent, water and optionally an umbrella. Open 8AM to 5pm in summer.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

395235408.name: Good places to visit with calm.
395235408.author: a TripAdvisor user
395235408.reviewBody:
Edzna is an amazing place to visit with calm. It is an extended area with long walk paths in the middle of the jungle. 

Good thing about it is that Edzna is not a crowd places like Palenque or Chichen-Itza. It is also very close to Campeche city any Taxi can take you there. Also there are many touristic agencies that offer trips there. Just were bugs repellent, because it is very necessary there. 

I rented a car and was very useful, easy and cheap.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

394509210.name: Worth the drive
394509210.author: a TripAdvisor user
394509210.reviewBody: An excellent, quiet site off the tourist track. Do bring insect repellent and plenty of water as there is no shop.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

394123114.name: is a most if you are visiting Campeche
394123114.author: a TripAdvisor user
394123114.reviewBody: This site is really beautiful and you really can enjoy it, not many people around, has no market around like in Chichen Itza and is just beautiful. Worth to visit more than others.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

392038269.name: Amazing ruins
392038269.author: a TripAdvisor user
392038269.reviewBody: Incredible Mayan site with great access to the ruins. You can drive here on your own if you have a rental car, no need for a tour if you aren\'t interested in that. Be prepared for hot sun and lots of bugs.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

385404525.name: Amazing!
385404525.author: a TripAdvisor user
385404525.reviewBody: Recommend booking this tour though El Tucan Tours!  Incredible, breath taking, stunning, full of history with amazing views!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

375203851.name: Semi hidden and worth the trip!
375203851.author: a TripAdvisor user
375203851.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I had rented a car and drove from Merida to Campeche (also totally worth a visit) and on our second day we took a 45 minute drive to Edzna. It\'s an easy drive especially with google maps and there were taxis in the parking lot so I\'m sure a driver can be arranged. \n\nOnce there it was fantastic. You can climb on the ruins and get some amazing views. Also when we were visiting there were MAYBE 15 - 20 other people. It\'s quiet and the lack of crowds compared to palenque or other ruins nearby is rereshing. Highly recommend!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

372507092.name: luz y sonido
372507092.author: a TripAdvisor user
372507092.reviewBody: We went for the evening luz y sonido show at Edzna, and I was entranced by the \'energy\' of this archeological site, and would like to return to see it during the day as well!  It is a more remote, quiet site, and so you feel like you step back in time. The story (Spanish) and show was well done.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

372404138.name: A site to visit!
372404138.author: a TripAdvisor user
372404138.reviewBody: We asked for advice at the tourist information booth in the Parque de independencia about transportation to the site. Within 15 minutes an official tour guide picked us up and drove us to Edzna pointing out landmarks, mango and papaya trees along the way and telling us about the economy of Campeche.The site is amazing... only 3 other people were there.. many opportunities to climb various structures. A Must See!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

361014429.name: Wonderful quite site
361014429.author: a TripAdvisor user
361014429.reviewBody: Loved the site as it is very quite and lots to see. Only problem is finding shade as it was 40 degrees.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

359175440.name: Private atmospheric tour
359175440.author: a TripAdvisor user
359175440.reviewBody: The afternoon we visited was during a huge downpour so we had the place all to ourselves. Despite getting wet, the rain enhanced the experience and added to the atmosphere. The main plaza in particular was spectacular and they permit climbing on most structures. This is one of the lesser visited Mayan sites but it deserves to be more popular, it\'s within an easy distance (less than an hour) to Campeche.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

359033454.name: Worth the drive out from Campeche
359033454.author: a TripAdvisor user
359033454.reviewBody: The drive takes a while, but you go through some interesting towns.    The site itself seems well managed and the runs are quite beautiful.     We live in Merida and have enjoyed many of the ruins in Yucatan.     The style of the structures in Edzna is quite beautiful as is the large collection of recovered buildings.       Wonderful photo opportunities.     \nDo bring your own water!  Also a hat/sunscreen for sunny days is a must.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

356178633.name: stunning
356178633.author: a TripAdvisor user
356178633.reviewBody: We were there around noon. We were the only 2 persons there. I don\'t understand why? It is a stunningly beautiful site. I highly recommend it

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

352145820.name: An amazing combination of architectural styles
352145820.author: a TripAdvisor user
352145820.reviewBody: This is a wonderfully restored site with some unique and varied architectural features, given the longevity of its habitation (around 600 BC - 1500 AD).  What makes it special is how they actually mixed styles on the same structures (e.g., Classic Period structure decorated with Puuc features).  The site is easy to get around and there are some amazing vistas from the area of the government offices.  It is easy to get to from Campeche, making it a must see.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

352115220.name: Fantastic
352115220.author: a TripAdvisor user
352115220.reviewBody: Of the five Mayan sites we visited this was our favourite. Spectacular (perhaps not as much so as Chichen Itza) but so quiet. There are no towns nearby and so no hawkers and there was a total of 6 people on the site (though we where there fairly early). It had a great atmosphere. Fantastic.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

351206815.name: Less visited but worth going
351206815.author: a TripAdvisor user
351206815.reviewBody: This archeological site is not big but very impressive with one pretty high temple and a couple of smaller ones. While you are walking around, you can also admire some inhabitants taking sunbathes or just crawling around - iguanas! \nTo get there, ask at the tourist information at the zocalo near the cathedral for transportation options. You will take a combi (mini van) from the market area beyond the city walls; just ask for "combis to Edzna". The combis go every hour, and the last one to get to Edzna to return to Campeche is 4 or 5pm. If they tell you differently at the tourist info, they are wrong. We went to verify the hours at the combo station beforehand.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

347631686.name: Wonderful views
347631686.author: a TripAdvisor user
347631686.reviewBody: Well preserved fort, easy access and wonderful to see the ruins in their natural habitat, there are good relics on view and friendly staff.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

347441472.name: You can still climb some of the temples here
347441472.author: a TripAdvisor user
347441472.reviewBody: We were surprised to find such a wealth of temples with so few people there. You can wander around the large area more or less as you please.\nIt would have been helpful if there had been more information about the original inhabitants there though.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

346696632.name: Well worth the journey.
346696632.author: a TripAdvisor user
346696632.reviewBody: Get the collectivo from the market area (Ave Chihuahua, easy to find, just ask). Also lots of OK food stalls in the market if you need to buy fruit or have breakfast first. They run every 30 mins, 40 pesos each way. The site was almost deserted. Lots of buildings/temples so in a way easier to get a sense of what it was like than at eg Uxmal. \nShould be a half day trip if you set off at a reasonable time. \n55 pesos entry fee. Free if you are over 60 and mexican!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

346206311.name: Collectivo to Edzna
346206311.author: a TripAdvisor user
346206311.reviewBody: We stayed in Campeche and took a Collectivo. They depart from street Chihuahua, close to the corner of Calle Nicaragua (GPS 19.8421952, -90.531865). If you can\'t find it, ask the drivers of other Collectivos, they know best where to go. You need the ones heading to Pich or Bonfil, but every driver knew which ones are heading to Edzn\u00e1, so we just asked directly for that. We took the one at 7am, which dropped us of at the gate right at 8 o\'clock. The ride was 40 Pesos each. For the way back we got picked up by a Collectivo on it\'s way to..somewhere else and the driver told us to just jump in because there wouldn\'t be another Collectivo going the other way (back to Campeche) until he would have turned around and pass by again. We got in and it was a good thing, because it secured us seats in the otherwise near full van. The longer ride didn\'t effect the price.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

346091006.name: Really worth seeing!
346091006.author: a TripAdvisor user
346091006.reviewBody: It is not that far from Campeche, about 45 minutes, and away from crowds. If you don\'t have a car, take a taxi, it is not that expensive, but don\'t forget to negotiate the price. Round trip is the best opinion. The complex is very well maintained and we were lucky to have no other people visiting the center. \nObs. Probably the driver will want to take you to Fort San Miguelon your return to Campeche. The fort itself is pretty normal, but I found the exhibition very interesting, specially the detailed written information.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

345704599.name: Stunning!! A must see, but NOT in Campeche!
345704599.author: a TripAdvisor user
345704599.reviewBody:
This site is amazing, huge.
It is a must see. A wider area with highlight Grand Acropolis.
BUT: Do not get confused, it is in the state of Campeche, but NOT in the city Campeche, from there it is over an hour drive!
And it is very empty, even on a Sunday only a handful people there.
Still: Go there :-)

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

345195756.name: Undiscovered and uncrowded
345195756.author: a TripAdvisor user
345195756.reviewBody: Chitz\u00e9n Itz\u00e1, Tul\u00fam, Uxmal, all very beautiful, all very crowded.  As we walked into the ruins at Edzn\u00e1, we saw one other couple and a small group in the distance.  My friend and I just separated to take it all in, each on our own.  No souvenir hawkers, no noise from other people.  You must experience at least one of the Mayan ruins this way!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

342161093.name: Enjoyed the visit.
342161093.author: a TripAdvisor user
342161093.reviewBody: 45 minutes from Campeche. Paid 350 pesos each ( for 2 of us ) for a private car to and from the site. spent about an hour walking around

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

340319432.name: Must see!
340319432.author: a TripAdvisor user
340319432.reviewBody: We hired Daniel of El Toucan tours to take us to the site. He was our driver and guide. Extremely knowledgeable and good driver. We learned so much. This site is off the beaten path and is an hour drive from Campeche but well worth it! As a result admission was 45 pesos, and there was only 5 other cars in the parking lot!.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

337085402.name: Beautiful, Impressive, Quiet and Off the Beaten Path Ruins! Edzna is a Hidden Gem in Campeche!
337085402.author: a TripAdvisor user
337085402.reviewBody:
I visited the Edzna Ruins during the morning of November 27th with three friends that I had met at my hostel in Campeche. 

We took a local colectivo (shared shuttle van) from Calle Chihuahua (one block east of the Mercado Municipal, just outside of the city’s walls) where they were lined up. We had to wait about half an hour before the colectivo had enough people to leave. It took us about an hour to get to Edzna from Campeche. The colectivo cost 40 pesos each way (80 pesos total for the round trip). We were dropped off in the parking at the entrance to the ruins and the colectivos returning to Campeche picked people up in the same parking lot every hour, on the hour. We only had to wait about ten minutes after we finished exploring the ruins before a colectivo showed up. The entrance fee for Edzna was 52 pesos. 

The ruins site at Edzna was fairly compact but was large and consisted of a lot of structures. They were all unique, beautiful, impressive and very well-preserved and restored. 

After entering the ruins, we walked along a lovely, peaceful and pleasant path through the jungle which soon opened up to a large grassy courtyard called the Gran Plaza. There were some interesting ruins in this area (the Central Ceremonial Group and Platform of the Knives). I enjoyed climbing to the top of the Nohoch-Na, which was a very long platform consisting of stone steps. The views of the entire ruins site from the top of the Nohoch-Na were amazing! 

Directly across from the Gran Plaza was the Gran Acropolis, which was a large platform with a grassy courtyard surrounded by structures on all sides. It was accessed via a set of wide stairs. 

The Temple of Five Stories was the focal point and the most impressive structure at Edzna. This five-tiered temple was massive and the architecture was beautiful! It was amazing to think that people actually built such a large structure years ago and that it is still standing today. While the front of the temple was incredibly restored, the back of the temple remained completely covered and engulfed in the thick jungle. Unfortunately, it was prohibited to climb the temple. On one side of this temple, stood the much smaller Northwest Temple and on the other side was the House of the Moon temple. Both of these structures could be climbed via the steep stairs. I climbed both and enjoyed admiring the views of the other ruins from the top. 

I visited the Ball Court next, which was situated close to the Gran Acropolis. From there, I explored the Small Acropolis, just south of the Gran Acropolis and the Ball Court. There were a few interesting structures in the Small Acropolis called the Temple of the Relief Stairways, Structure 419-2, and the Temple of the Masks. 

We were able to climb and touch almost all of the ruins, except for the massive five-tiered palace. 

There were no crowds during our visit to these ruins and after a small children’s school group left, we were completely alone and had the entire site to ourselves, which was wonderful. The atmosphere was so calm, peaceful, and serene which made for a relaxing environment to leisurely wander and explore these ruins. We spent about two hours at the ruins. 

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience visiting the Edzna ruins. Although they are lesser known and further off the beaten path than many other ruins in the Yucatan, they are definitely very deserving of a visit. Edzna is a hidden gem in Campeche that was well worth exploring!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

336656319.name: Edzna
336656319.author: a TripAdvisor user
336656319.reviewBody: Edzna one of  main reason to go to campeche  one of the most beautiful ruins we were there on Sunday  . Sundays are  free for Mexicans if you\'re  going  get there  early  cause it is hot lots of mosquitoes  be prepared

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

335971776.name: Phenomenal ruin on the Yucatan Peninsula
335971776.author: a TripAdvisor user
335971776.reviewBody: No crowds - I would say there were easily less than 50 people at this site.  They allow climbing on all of the ruins - nearly nothing is off limits.  There were no hawkers of chachki, quite and beautiful.  The ruins themselves were in excellent condition.  I could have spent an entire day there but was on my way back to Merida from a trip to Campeche.  Plan a full day if you can - well worth it.  I found it to be better than Chichen Itza by far.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

335813982.name: Great ruins very accessible
335813982.author: a TripAdvisor user
335813982.reviewBody: I really wish I could have gotten here about 1200 years ago. Considering my late arrival things were still in pretty good shape. These are the closest ruins to Campeche and you owe to yourself to check these out. Chances are it won\u2019t be overrun by other tourists unless it\u2019s around the holidays. Lots of well-meaning Iguanas lurking in and around the structures. They will happily eat any fly\u2019s or mosquitoes you direct their way. They seem to be in charge of House of the moon. The House of the moon over looks the gran acropolis and provides a nice place to climb up and imagine you were there during the glory days. This is an easy drive from Campeche and there is bus service from Campeche as well.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

335699366.name: all to ourselves!
335699366.author: a TripAdvisor user
335699366.reviewBody: after 5 wonderful nights at the Westin Lagunamar in the cancun area, we rented a car and drove the 6 hours to Campeche, through Merida. went through 2 tolls, 260 pesos and 152 pesos. good road, very little to see through much of the drive as the jungle grows right up to the road and the whole of the yucatan is quite flat. so be prepared for driving through a long green tunnel for hours! one can stop at the towns of valladolid along the way, or izamal, which we did. there are also police roadblocks along the way, looking for drugs and contraband and are there for our protection, i read. i found their appearance intimidating, which i suppose is the point. we were either waved through, stopped and asked where we were going and once we were asked for our passports. the edzna ruins are about 60 minutes outside of the town of campeche. took at bit to sort ourselves out leaving campeche and figuring out which way to go, but once we did that the signage is good. as is the road. driving through the villages are always hard, to see the poverty and garbage, all part and parcel of travelling. the fresh laundry drying in the yards and clean clothes of the children\'s school uniforms show their hard work. as do the attempts at painted rock walls and planted shrubs and trees along the main roads. the ruins were discovered in 1907, and excavations started in 1986. we walked about 5 minutes from the parking lot after paying the entrance fee, through a treed area. there is a drink dispensing machine on site. and banos. the grounds are large and only a handful of people there! plus a few iguanas! turned cloudy when we arrived otherwise it would have been quite hot as the whole area is open with no tree coverage. the main open area is the plaza and the largest structure is a combination of a pyramid and a palace. quite striking. one is able to climb up the stairs of this main structure and get a feel for its size. on our return, we took a different route back as we carried onto merida. one could continue on east and then north from edzna and take in the ruins in the puuc region and see 4 ruins there and further north to see the uxmal ruins. we did that 4 years ago and found uxmal to be more impressive than chicken itza, and far less crowds. always wonderful to see sights in other countries that are so different from where we live.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

335563878.name: Unknown little gem
335563878.author: a TripAdvisor user
335563878.reviewBody: These ruins are not well-known, but they totally deserve a visit. The site is not too big, but there is a main "plaza" with big temples, fairly different from the other ruins in the peninsula. Access is cheap, visit is about 1-2 hours

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

333592506.name: Beautiful Ruins without the Crowds
333592506.author: a TripAdvisor user
333592506.reviewBody: Edzna is a larger ruin located about an hour outside of Campeche. The site is spread out and includes a number of well preserved or restored ruins. The main pyramid is large and overshadows the whole complex. Unfortunately, you cannot climb it, but its still impressive to walk around. If you\'re looking for a Chichen Itza type Mayan site, but without the crowds of tourists, then I highly recommend Edzna.\n\nBring your bug spray. Plenty of mosquitoes to fight off.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

327643186.name: A treat as the introduction to old Mayan world
327643186.author: a TripAdvisor user
327643186.reviewBody: It was both thrilling and a treat to visit this place. There were very less people and the ruins were pretty well preserved. I would recommend this as the start of your Yucatan trip.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

325967571.name: Very impressive
325967571.author: a TripAdvisor user
325967571.reviewBody:
We visited the site on a hot November morning. We went with Kankabi OK tours who provided transport for us - they were very helpful and worth it for us as we were only in Campeche for a short time so didn't want to wait for a collectivo. 

Edzna is very impressive! We loved it. Went in the morning and only 4 other people there. Can climb onto the monuments. 

Away from the main site is another clearing (500m walk along a path) - we climbed this monument and had a spectacular view of the jungle and also edzna's main site amongst the trees - steep climb but recommended.

Take mosquito repellent!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

323938646.name: A must see when you go to Campeche
323938646.author: a TripAdvisor user
323938646.reviewBody: Its only 40 minutes from Campeche City. A Perfect example of the Mayan classical period. Very well preserved and a magnificient construction. Bring water and a lot (a lot) of mosquito repellent. Try to visit early in the morning.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

317867234.name: Great Way To See Mayan Ruins And Avoid Crowds
317867234.author: a TripAdvisor user
317867234.reviewBody: Slightly more off the beaten path then Chichen Itza - Edzna is a beautiful complex that was nearly empty when we visited during the week in February.  Its an easy drive from Campeche and highly recommended if you are nearby.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

311919764.name: Edzna was a fantastic archeological site. Quieter than Chichen Itza.
311919764.author: a TripAdvisor user
311919764.reviewBody:
We were taken by Alfredo of Kankabi OK tours to Edzna. His English is fantastic ( he also speaks Italian). He was very informative, found shade whilst telling us the history surrounding Edzna. He also advised us beforehand to bring mosquito repellent ( all year round), which was worthwhile advice.

At Edzna, you are allowed to climb on most of the monuments. There are no crowds, just you your guide, and your imagination of a bygone era.

Alfredo's knowledge and passion for his subject, made him a wonderful guide. 

We rounded off the day with lunch at Playa Tortudas.

Campeche and Edzna are very worthwhile. The Tourist Information guide in the town centre, couldn't do enough to help, he called a taxi, negotiated the fare, and insisted he stand in the street, waiting for the taxi. We visited the Forts around Campeche.

Campeche is delightful, with friendly people.

Definitely worth putting on your itinerary.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

302335635.name: Apocolypto Awaits
302335635.author: a TripAdvisor user
302335635.reviewBody: Edzna is an archaeological zone about 50 kilometers from the city of Campeche, Mexico in the Yucatan Peninsula. The site is comprised of many pyramids with the largest at its center.  Although its much smaller in scale, Edna contains much of the grandeur of larger archaeological zones such as Uxmal, Chichen-Itzan or Palenque.  The site is not over run by vendors trying to sell you things unlike the others.  The movie Apocolypto was filmed there as well.  Be sure to bring some snack and fluids with you as there are none to buy at the site which is located in a remote setting away from any town or village.  Catch a collectivo van from the corner near the Market.  Just ask someone if you can\'t find where they are located.  Say Donde esta collectivo a Edzna.  Someone will point the way.  You\'ll get dropped off at the entrance to the site when you arrive.  When leaving, walk back to the road and wait for any collectivo coming from the opposite direction from which you arrived.  be patient as it may take a while.  Falg is down and return to Campeche. Hope this helps

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

284064781.name: Cultura Maya amazing
284064781.author: a TripAdvisor user
284064781.reviewBody: Awezone place, Maya civilization great people, 45 minutes front Campeche city, the wall city, do you have to visit, good meal, clean city and very nice people, i love this city

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

270170792.name: Superb
270170792.author: a TripAdvisor user
270170792.reviewBody:
We visited here on a 28day Central America trip. The site of Edzna is a bit out of the way for most travellers. We visited it on a day trip from Campeche. The site is noticeably quieter than many other Mayan sites we visited. There was only one other car in the car park.

The ruins cover quite an easily accessible area, though it was +40C when we visited, though shade was plentiful. The ruins are impressive. We were also shown a Mayan elevated road with an impressive archway. It's across the road from the main site entrance and would be easily missed without a guide.

You can climb some of the structures, but yuu need to be careful. Some of the stones were loose and the climb both up and down can be steep - not for the faint hearted - I loved it, but it was way too hot.

This is an impressive site and well worth the effort to visit.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

268059495.name: Worth Visiting
268059495.author: a TripAdvisor user
268059495.reviewBody: If you are stopping in the vicinity of Edzna I would recommend visiting it. It is one of the quieter Mayan ruin sites so if you get there early enough you may have it to yourself. The ruins are well preserved, it is a reasonably small site though so it doesn\'t take too long to get round. Watch out for all the butterflies in the car park too!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

267973670.name: Impressive!
267973670.author: a TripAdvisor user
267973670.reviewBody: Edzna is a lesser known Mayan site that is off the beaten path so it doesn\u2019t get the same traffic as many other sites. In fact, there aren\u2019t even any shops or vendors hanging around. Not a single one. We walked in to find the site completely deserted, which is amazing given that this site is as impressive as any other. \n\nSome of the structures are open to climbing like the Great Acropolis and House of the Moon (which gives impressive views of the Five Story Pyramid). The plain in front of the Acropolis has the best example of the White Roads - the raised limestone roads that the Mayans built to join the cities. There is also a ball court and a lot of iguanas.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

265689399.name: Not Uxmal but still worth a visit
265689399.author: a TripAdvisor user
265689399.reviewBody: Edzna  is not as big as some of the better known Mayan ruins but that means the crowds aren\'t as big. When we visited our group was the only one there, so we had the place to ourselves, so no difficulty getting pictures without extras.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

265281594.name: Worth a Visit
265281594.author: a TripAdvisor user
265281594.reviewBody: As others have mentioned, it is not the most spectacular of the Mayan ruins in the Yucatan (e.g., Uxmal is much more impressive/expansive), but a visit here is well worth the trip esp. if you are in Campeche. The structures are impressive, yet need some more attention/reconstruction. There are wide open space which are pleasant to walk through and you can scale most (but not all of the structures). The views from on-high are very nice as well. Enjoyed our trip here.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

260080362.name: If you love Mayan ruins, this is one of the places you should visit...
260080362.author: a TripAdvisor user
260080362.reviewBody: The photos do not describe the beauty of this place. In addition to been inside the jungle (not as much as Calakmul), this place is less than an hour drive from Campeche and has several structures that are worth viewing. Bear in mind that there are no restaurants in the site. You may visit the Hacienda Uayamon the same day you visit Edzna, and you may have lunch there. It is an expensive restaurant (for Campeche standards), but they have excellent typical food, and some other international dishes if that is what you wish.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

258238160.name: Worth a Visit
258238160.author: a TripAdvisor user
258238160.reviewBody: Edzna is not the most spectacular Mayan ruin we have been to but we thoroughly enjoyed the visit. The site is well restored with some interesting temples and pyramids.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

256803800.name: No crowd at all!!!
256803800.author: a TripAdvisor user
256803800.reviewBody: If you\'re taking the Mayan route you must stop at Edzna. There are no crowds or people trying to take pictures here just go there and enjoy the walk to these amazing ruins. You can get a guided tour for about 100 pesos if you want.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

255113597.name: Fabulous
255113597.author: a TripAdvisor user
255113597.reviewBody: These ruins are way larger than I thought they would be.  I thought I had been to all of the major ruins but I was ignorant of the archeology in the state of Campeche.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

252655129.name: Impressive Mayan Ruins Without the Crowds
252655129.author: a TripAdvisor user
252655129.reviewBody:
This was our first visit to a ruins suit and we were blown away.   It's about an hour away from Campache and pretty impressive site.  It's no where as big as Uxmal, but there weren't the crowds either.  Lots of good photo-ops without being photo bombed by strangers.  There are several ruins in the main plaza to climb up and explore. The main temple is really impressive, but it was the only building that was roped off.  

One note, it was incredibly hot and humid when we were there in Sept.  Bring water!  There is a small gift shop and a beverage vending machine, but there is no where else nearby to get food, drink or gas.

Our friends came to see the light show and there was not one that night even though one was schedule.  It might be hit or miss during the off-season.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

251138358.name: Excellent ruins off the beaten path!
251138358.author: a TripAdvisor user
251138358.reviewBody: Excellent ruins off the beaten path! We arrived and we were one of only 8 ... count them 8 people in the entire complex of ruins.\n\nNot crowded at all. The ruins were also well kept with decent signage. The main elevated pyramid was large and ornate. Really cool!!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

247780734.name: Incredible
247780734.author: a TripAdvisor user
247780734.reviewBody: Huge mayan ruins with large grass lawns. Thousands of iguanas crawling all over the place. The best part, nobody else was there!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

247694286.name: Good Start for My 1st Mayan Ruin!
247694286.author: a TripAdvisor user
247694286.reviewBody: I have seen Mayan ruins on TV and wanted to actually see and touch one.  Edzna was a good start.  It was in the Yucatan jungle relatively but not far from Campeche. It was small enough to tour in a couple of hours and know that you have been to a real Mayan ruin.  We went during the day but I saw pictures with the temple in lights at night.  It was worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

235969662.name: Amazing architecture
235969662.author: a TripAdvisor user
235969662.reviewBody: Mayan culture has always fascinated me. The various styles of architecture and grandeur, the stories of the games the slaves played for the royal entertainment, the impressive size of the sites and innovative ways of collecting and storing water along with the brilliant delivery systems. Edzna is one of the largest I have seen and it showcases a few unique features such as arches and slopes to maximize the collection of rainwater. The Big Lord\'s house, the main structure, is about 40 meters high and has an impressive 5 stories. It reins over the plaza and the ball court and was situated so that it would provide its lord with the first rays of the sun. There is also an incredible echo between the buildings. You can hear folks talk from the opposite side. I guess that\'s one reason one of the 3 translations of Edzna is echo house. Definitely a must see but be prepared for the mosquitos!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

232211454.name: Hidden treasure
232211454.author: a TripAdvisor user
232211454.reviewBody: Close to Campeche city, this archaeological site is really a hidden treasure in the Mayan jungle. \nA short 30min drive through the mountains with scenic views and driving through small towns. \nWe did not do the light and sound show at night but during the day you can really appreciate the big buildings in the city. Do not forget to go to the back of the main square, to see the color still on the walls.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

226934681.name: Beautiful pyramid
226934681.author: a TripAdvisor user
226934681.reviewBody:
I had visited some archaeological sites like Palenque, Monte Albán(Oxaca), Tulum, Templo Mayor(DF), Piramide de Malinalco, Piramide de Sol y Luna(Teotihuacán) and etc. They all have their own distinguishing feature.(Well duh...they are all famous ruins.)

Edzna is not a big ruins but its main square pyramid: Building Five Storeys (Edificio de los cinco pisos) is beautiful. Worth to visit.
I didn't visit night show of Edzna. I will take a look next time.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

222529923.name: Nice and quit Maya site
222529923.author: a TripAdvisor user
222529923.reviewBody: We have visited a few Maya sites (palenque, nakum, yaxha) and this Edzna site is very nice and quit. It is also named the city of the echo\'s because there is a great acoustic. Another interesting element is the underground irrigation

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

219881783.name: Amazing night show
219881783.author: a TripAdvisor user
219881783.reviewBody: Amazing historical site awww enough enhanced even more with a night visit sound and light for even more impact. Great!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

216304918.name: my favorite ruins
216304918.author: a TripAdvisor user
216304918.reviewBody: you truly feel like Indiana Jones exploring these remarkable ruins\n\ndon\'t skip these! both of our children voted these their favorite of all the big name ruins we visited

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

213932649.name: A great place to visit when you are in Campeche
213932649.author: a TripAdvisor user
213932649.reviewBody: This city from the classic Mayan era is amazing. A five stories building in the middle of the city is an amazing example of the mastery in architecture from this incredible culture. Try to go early and get there before noon, the heat is very intense. After that take time to go to Uayamol Hacienda

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

206735925.name: Our favorite ruins site in the Yucatan area of Mexico
206735925.author: a TripAdvisor user
206735925.reviewBody: Arrived mid-afternoon. Hot outside but tons of wildlife around including 15 species of birds and literally hundreds of Iguanas. Loved the fact that we had the place almost entirely to ourselves. Wonderful trip out there and very authentic!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

201943797.name: Great site
201943797.author: a TripAdvisor user
201943797.reviewBody: Got there early and had the place to ourselves. You can climb the pyramids and get fantastic views, lots to explore, fantastic faces carved, a small ball court too.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

199272471.name: A very interesting half day trip from Campeche to a impressive quiet site
199272471.author: a TripAdvisor user
199272471.reviewBody: We just about had the place to ourselves to see this very interesting site with our excellent guide - wander around the site\'s impressive structures in complete solitude - much of the ruins are still under the adjacent  vegetation. Enjoy

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

196577623.name: Can be done independently - and is super worth it !
196577623.author: a TripAdvisor user
196577623.reviewBody:
The site is beautiful and magical because it is sufficiently off the beaten track to be completely empty. The 5 level palace is very much on par with its more famous counterparts with the added benefit of silence and majesty,

Practical tips;
* can be reached with collectivo / combi from the Campeche market (sourth side, just outside the walls). You are looking for the bus to Pich and can ask to be dropped off at the ruins. Very nice experience with super friendly people 
* Have plenty of water with you both for the wait at the market (it is very warm !) and because there is hardly anything at the ruins themselves
* you will be able to grab a collectivo back exactly where you get dropped off. We turned up at 4.20 hoping to catch a 4.30pm that never was but were picked up at 5.00pm. In fact that combi drove through the Edzna parking lot honking away for any late runners. There are also quite a lot of people leaving the ruins by car so hitchhiking is an option for guys (or brave / careless women traveling alone which I certainly don't recommend)

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

196375812.name: Beautiful, well worth the visit.
196375812.author: a TripAdvisor user
196375812.reviewBody: One of my favorite ruins, the site is clean, no vendors allowed, the silence is impressive, the design and especially the fact that all the water they had came from rain water makes it still more interesting, especially in the arquitectural design to help collect rain water. The site was actually worked on by refugees from Central America, especially Guatemala during the wars in their countries and funded by UN and Euorpe so that these refugees could have work to support their families.  We took a sandwich and sat in the shade admiring the ruins and enjoying the peace found there.\nExcellent guides, worth the trip.  Besides take time to stay in Campeche, what a fantastic city.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

195947664.name: Edzna Ruins
195947664.author: a TripAdvisor user
195947664.reviewBody: I would give this site 4.5 stars if i could. I actually appreciated it more than the states biggest site, Calakmul. The site is fairly compact, it only takes 1-2 hours to see, and is very majestic. The main Acropolis there is very beautiful, photogenic too. I would definentely put aside a morning for edzna if you spend more than a day in campeche.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

195620983.name: Beautiful Ruins outside Campeche
195620983.author: a TripAdvisor user
195620983.reviewBody: Edzna was under an hour from Campeche, and we loved it.   It was uncrowded, and gave you time to quietly explore this little city.   The main temple is over 68 meters in height, with a Crest on top that would be at home in any modern art display.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

195222883.name: Impressing and no vendors/tourits
195222883.author: a TripAdvisor user
195222883.reviewBody:
I arrived here on a sunny sunday morning at 09:00 and was the first one in.

The sights of the structures and jungle are impressive. The best thing is its very calm and there are no vendors at all. At around 10:30 the first other tourits came dripling in. I spent about 2 hours there.

Just take a collectivo from Campeche (just 35 pesos), ask around a the Mercado to find them.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

192874368.name: Quiet place away from touristic crowds
192874368.author: a TripAdvisor user
192874368.reviewBody: Rather interesting for visiting with some unique remnants like Red Masks temple ruins. The absence of people makes it possible to take your time and familiarize with the remnants of the Maya city. If it is on your way it is worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

190814663.name: Beautiful Mayan Ruins
190814663.author: a TripAdvisor user
190814663.reviewBody: Took a recent trip to Edzna after a stay in Campeche. The roads to get there are very rough. But the ride was totally worth it. Beautiful huge ruins. You are able to climb up almost all of them. Most of them are still very well preserved. There were only a few other families there when we arrived so we could go through each area by ourselves and take photos without photo bombers. :) If you are in the area I think its well worth the stop! and its only $40 pesos to get in!

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

186848646.name: Serenely beautiful
186848646.author: a TripAdvisor user
186848646.reviewBody:
We stopped by Edzna on our way from Campeche City to Palenque. Other than our guide, my wife and I, there was another couple in the site the entire time we were there. Bring insect repellent as you are in the middle of the jungle and the mosquitoes are everywhere.

On the way in, there is a reproduction Mayan hut that serves as a museum to display some of the better preserved steles.

You cannot climb the main structure called the Temple of the Five Stories, but there is the smaller Temple of the Moon right beside it which you can and provides fantastic views of the surrounding area. 

Be sure to look for the Temple of the Masks. This building has two stucco masks of the sun god representing sunrise and sunset with remarkable details and the paint is still intact.

On the way out, our guide led us to another trail that leads to some sort of warehouse where they store steles found in the site. Most of them are broken pieces, but there is one that is still intact with fine detailed carvings.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

186558122.name: Edzna/Campeche and its spectacular Mayan ruins
186558122.author: a TripAdvisor user
186558122.reviewBody: The archaological site of Edzna is located in the middle of the jungle some 35  miles (about 60 km) and a one hour drive from the port town  of Campeche on the Yucatan Peninsula. A visit to the ruins is best combined with a visit to  the town which also happens to be the capital of Mexico`s state of Campeche. Edzna happens to be one of the oldest Mayan developments and dates back to 600 BC although it did not turn into a major Mayan city until 200 AD. Next to Calakmul Edzna is the most important Mayan site in the state of Campeche which covers large parts of the western and southern parts of the Yucatan.\n\nEdzna is best known for its spectacular Great Plaza consisting of three beautifully preserved Mayan constructions including above all the unique Edzna Acropolis with its impressive five story pyramid initially constructed from the 7th century  onwards on top of another wide platform known as the Platform of the Knives. While the entire excavated portion of the site seems relatively small compared to Chichenitza, Uxmal or Calakmul Edzna will be remembered for its sheer beauty. Another structure at Edzna worth mentioning is the Temple of the Masks which is known for its two  especially well preserved  stone masks. The two large stucco masks only excavated during the 1990ies along with the buildings of the Great Plaza  even show some of its original color and are among the most important findings of the entire site. What we saw at . Edzna to us was truly breathtaking. If one has little time it may be possible to visit the site in less than two hours.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

185586290.name: Uncrowded peephole into an ancient world
185586290.author: a TripAdvisor user
185586290.reviewBody:
