From what I am told, Uxmal and Chichen Itza are better preserved, but at Edzna we literally had the whole place to ourselves, seeing other visitors only as we were leaving.   We startled several iquanas who thought they had the place to THEMselves.  The ruins here are still in good enough shape to envision how people lived in this ancient city, which is the best part of visiting a place like this.  I highly recommend it.

Bring bug spray, it's the jungle.

There are few if any developed areas nearby, but there is a vending machine that sells cold drinks and snacks.  The bathroom facilities are clean and modern.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

178256612.name: Another Wonderful Mayan Site, Well worth a Visit
178256612.author: a TripAdvisor user
178256612.reviewBody:
We made a excursion from Campeche to visit Edzna, we left early and it wasn't a long drive.  I had seen a photo of the pyramid in one of our travel books with people on top and was looking forward to climbing it, but they don't let people climb it anymore.  A minor disappointment, I'm sure the view from the top would have been cool.

I don't know if it was an off season thing, but we had the place to ourselves.  We got there when the place opened, spent a few hours walking around and never saw another soul.  I have to admit, I liked it.  We sprayed down before we entered the park, but the bugs didn't seem too bad.  

We've enjoyed every Mayan ruin site we've visited and Edzna is definitely worth a visit, especially if you are in or near Campeche.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

166552945.name: Great ruins but remember moscito repellent
166552945.author: a TripAdvisor user
166552945.reviewBody: The site is great but there was a lot of moscitos as there recently had been rain. The trip was done by a collectvo from market in the direction of pines. The return was also collectivo and there was a old lady selling water and soda at the "bus stop". A good start to the day.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

161095066.name: One of the bigger ones that is easily approachable
161095066.author: a TripAdvisor user
161095066.reviewBody: Although not the grandeur of Chichen Itza or Kalakmul, Edzna is worth a visit for who likes temples ( and iguanas ). With a collectivo in magnificent Campeche you are there in an hour (35 pesos). The site is well maintained and the buildings have large dimensions. I was there in low season at 11 am and had the place to myself. Although you are not allowed to go to the top of the highest building, you have good views from on top other buildings. It is hot there, as everywhere else in this season. Bring mosquito repellent. \n\nIf you have a car, go for Kalakmul or Uxmal. if not possible, this is a great alternative that you can do without tour operators.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

161017793.name: Well manicured site, great guide
161017793.author: a TripAdvisor user
161017793.reviewBody:
We heard the site would be busy on a Sunday so arrive early (Sunday is Mexican national free pass day for archeological sites).  We arrived on Sunday at 8:30am and were the second car on site!  We didn't see another couple for another twenty minutes so we had the site to ourselves.  It didn't start to get visibly busy until around 10:00am.  We were glad we arrived early. 
The guide that was great.  Senor Perez.  Well worth the $20.00.  After the tour, they showed us some pictures of friezes that were closed to the public from Edzna and Calakmul, some old pictures prior to restoration and some solstice pictures.  A nice added touch.
The site is well manicured which we appeciated in contrast with Calakmul jungle setting.  Both have their merits.
Our guide told us the the temple of five floors (the highest/main building/pyramid) has been closed for climbing for two years.  Although we wished we had gone here two years ago, it wasn't a total shame as we were climbing up the biggest structures in the Mayan world at Coba and Calakmul before and the pictures that we took didn't have a 100 people traipsing up and down the stairs (Coba).  What I did find was a shame was the fact that we couldn't view whatever is housed underneath the plastic and palapa rooves midway up the temple as those rooves are obviously protecting something neat from the elements (stucco reliefs,friezes).  We had a great time here, it was well worth the effort for the particularly old Mayan site.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

159948041.name: even if you\'ve visited other Mayan sites, you\'ll love this one!
159948041.author: a TripAdvisor user
159948041.reviewBody: I can\'t specify that Edzna is unique, for there are hundreds of Mayan ruins around the peninsula.  But this is one of my favorite places - the central 5-story pyramid (unfortunately closed for climbing) is a stunner, and the scale of the other buildings evokes some sense of the importance of spectacles in the Mayan world - consider, e.g., the number of people who could sit on the tiered steps of the long building astride the plaza in front of the Grand Acropolis group.  Note that the sound-and-light show is only on weekends (121 pesos).

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

157993261.name: Amazing site near Campeche
157993261.author: a TripAdvisor user
157993261.reviewBody: If you get along, probably on a trip from Merida down to Palenque, you should stop in Campeche and use the time for a visit of Edzna. The main pyramid with the door openings is unique and impressive. When I was there it was not possible to buy water, so better you bring a bottle with you. I prepared a description with several photos in my Blog. You are welcome to visit: http://templeplaces.com/location/america/edzna-campeche-mexico/

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

156167719.name: Magnificent Ruins that are rarely visited
156167719.author: a TripAdvisor user
156167719.reviewBody:
Edzna is a well restored site of a large Mayan city. It has a VERY impressive central pyramid on top of a huge plaza called the Gran Acropolis. There are four other smaller structures around the plaza. You can not climb up the big pyramid any more, but you can go up on the other temples. There are also some other well restored structures such as Nohochna ( the long house), the ball court, the temple of the masks (which has two well preserved stucco masks of Mayan gods), and Pequeria Acropolis (the small plaza).

 Iguanas are all over the site

Edzna was nearly deserted during our visit at midday. Yes, it was quite warm there, but we had beautiful blue skies which look good in the photographs, and the bright sun means there are no mosquitios. This was quite a neat place to explore and I am so glad we visited.

Admission was 46 pesos each

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

151911884.name: I have visited 20+ Mayan Ruins, Edzna is one of my favorites!!
151911884.author: a TripAdvisor user
151911884.reviewBody: If you are in Campeche, you must make Edzna one of your stops! The main Pyramid is one of the most unique and visually appealing that I have seen. The upper acropolis is a very impressive. The preserved Masks offer a wonderful glimpse into a past time. They do offer a light show, but I don\'t know the details.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

148523418.name: Beautiful ruins, very interesting
148523418.author: a TripAdvisor user
148523418.reviewBody: A very enjoyable day at these ruins. There are fantastic sculptures and buildings you can climb with a view over the site. There\'s enough vegetation to provide some shade, and when we were there it wasn\'t too crowded.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

148053900.name: Majestic Mayan ruins
148053900.author: a TripAdvisor user
148053900.reviewBody: This place is not that well known, but it should be, it can be compared among big touristic sites such as Chichen Itz\u00e1 or Monte Alb\u00e1n... But this is not crowded at all and with such amazing sights of this Mayan acropolis... if you\'re in Cpeche this site is a must

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

146053387.name: Very Impressive
146053387.author: a TripAdvisor user
146053387.reviewBody: Edzna is well worth a visit. It\'s a pretty large site with a massive main temple and vast courtyards. You really get a sense of how a Mayan city was laid out and how different areas interact with each other. If you go to Edzna early and you have a car, stop by Hacienda Uayamon for lunch. You\'ll see signs along the road.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

145422486.name: Excellent Mayan Site with Giant Temple
145422486.author: a TripAdvisor user
145422486.reviewBody: Edzna ruins are southeast of Campeche off Highway 261, well signposted. Short section of small road from the intersection near Nohyaxche to the site. Cost is 46 pesos, free parking at entrance. Main site is a few hundred meters walk through the forest from the entrance on level dirt walkways. Site includes several large pyramids and the massive Temple of the Five Storeys in a grassy open area, well maintained. All pyramids can be climbed except Five Storeys. Buildings are large but with not much decoration left but there are some stelae in a modern building near the entrance and some masks under an awning at one temple. The Western Group of structures including the House of the Old Witch pyramid was closed to the public on our visit as well as areas to the left and behind the Five Storeys structure. Only a few visitors. Toilets but no refreshments.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

145271043.name: Edzna Ruins
145271043.author: a TripAdvisor user
145271043.reviewBody: Very interesting to visit Edzna Ruins. They offer an interesting night show. Be warned it gets chilly in the evening and you will be sitting on stones (part of the ruins) so make sure you are warm enough. Perhaps take a small pillow or coat to sit on. Also they will offer to spray you with mosquito repellent and I recommend that even though every part of me was not so keen the mozzies were hungry. About an hour drive from Campeche. This was part of my overall business trip so not sure on the details such as cost etc.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

144070317.name: Vestigios arqueologicos de Edzna
144070317.author: a TripAdvisor user
144070317.reviewBody: Archaeological remains, highly recommended ... stay totally amazed at the great Mayan culture, Give yourself some time to do a wonderful tour and travel ACROSS time this paradise in the middle of the jungle, something out of the ordinary, not the classic place for ordinary people, is for those who want more,

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

136422664.name: Worth a side trip from Campeche
136422664.author: a TripAdvisor user
136422664.reviewBody: When I visited Campeche recently, it was very busy.  I asked for a tour to Etzna (also spelled Itzna), but was told by the hotel staff that the tours were fully booked.  I reluctantly made arrangements for a private tour (around 500 pesos), but when I waited for my escort in the morning, he didn\'t show up.  I was determined to go, as it is off the beaten path and I was afraid I might not have the opportunity again to visit.  After several inquiries at the hotel about public transportation, I was told that there was a combi (shared van) I could take.  The hotel manager helped me find the (air-conditioned) combi, which cost about 40 pesos for the <>45 minute trip.    At Etzna, I hired a guide for 150 pesos (one hour).  I would recommend going on your own because it was easy and much cheaper than a tour.  You can make arrangements for the combi driver to pick you up at Etzna; otherwise you have to walk to the main road and wait.  There was no water or food available, so remember to bring along your water.  One of the good things about going to Etzna is that it is not crowded, and the quiet adds to the atmosphere of this well-taken-care-of archeological site.  Unfortunately, I was not able to attend the Light and Sound production held Wednesdays through Sundays in the evenings from March through October.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

125159791.name: No longer allowed to climb main pyramid
125159791.author: a TripAdvisor user
125159791.reviewBody: After uxmal and oxkintok, edzna was just right. If you are in the area this is a great 1-2 hour trip. The kids loved climbing from one structure to the other, but the 5 story pyramid is now roped off. There are a good amount of signs on the site in English and Spanish so you can get a little history without a guide book. At 45 pesos for adults and kids free the price is right. There were 5 others cars in the lot so we had this great ruin almost to ourselves. The roads are good leading to edzna and it was a 4 min walk from the lot to the site.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

122498113.name: A must see if you are on the Road to Ruins
122498113.author: a TripAdvisor user
122498113.reviewBody:
We stopped here for a couple of hours on a ten day circuit tour by rentacar out of Cancun. Unlike Chisza Itza and Uxmal, there are not large productions, entryways, throngs of tourists or even vendors.  They apparently get single bus tours once and a while, but even one of these was there you would not be hard pressed to find solitude on this very different archaeological site of about 40 acres. In particular, the Building of the Five Stories or Palace is quite distinct from other Mayan ruins.  Some say that it is a combination of all of the styles used by this culture over a 3000 year period, crowned with something a little different.  The site contains several other structures and, of course Mayan ball courts.  It is relatively well signed and the grounds are very clean.  

For the record, virtually all Mayan sites visited by tourists in Mexico were largely restored by the Mexican government using the labor of refugee Mayans fleeing the wars of Guatemala in the 1970s and 80s.  Their craftsmanship is obvious and perhaps an indication of these quiet people's on-going respect for these signs of times past.  It will be interesting to see how many visitors of Mayan decent visit these and other (perhaps still hidden) sites in 2012, the final year of the Mayan calender which dates back to Aug 13, 3114 BC.

A slightly more developed and visited site that is equally unheralded is ek Belam, about 2 hours out of Cancun on the road to Rio Lagartos ( also a nice place to visit for its bio-preserve).

I would have given this a 5/5 had the resident attendants not been so slack on the periphery of the property.  While the main grounds were very clean, the parking lot had trash strewn around the bush next to it.  This is not unusual for Mexico (or anywhere these days), but it is different from anything I noticed at the more visited sites.  Usually the attendants appear to take pride in their locations, perhaps because of good management practice, or maybe, at the smaller locations, because tourists recognize their efforts with the occasional tip.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

122290645.name: Very nice Maya ruin located near Campeche
122290645.author: a TripAdvisor user
122290645.reviewBody: This ruin is very nice to visit if you\'re traveling to the city of Campeche. I\'ve visited the site 2 times in the past and to me, the Temple of Five Levels is one of the most beautiful in the entire Yucatan Peninsula. Most tourists never visit a remote ruin such as this, but if they do, they\'re glad they did.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

97660367.name: My favorite archeological site in all of Mexico
97660367.author: a TripAdvisor user
97660367.reviewBody: Edzna (pronounced eetsnak) is, by far, my favorite site in the whole country, it is a couple of miles from the highway so you have it almost just for yourself when you visit, it is very well preserved considering it isn\'t a major tourist attraction. It has very beautiful buildings and scenery, well placed information regarding the constructions, history and Mayan way of life. The entrance fee is ridiculously low (4 USD) and has well distributed parking spots. This is a breathtaking, beautiful and interesting place that you ABSOLUTELY MUST visit if you are in the Rivera Maya, even if it isn\'t close to Chichen Itza or Cancun or other major attractions, trust me, it is well worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

94743726.name: Worth the Side Trip
94743726.author: a TripAdvisor user
94743726.reviewBody: We read that Edzna was worth a visit after touring Uxmal and they were correct. There were a few lesser ruins between Uxmal and Edzna that we were able to see from the road but we did not have time to stop. Edzna was a little out of the way on our drive from Uxmal to Palenque but we were really glad that we decided to visit. After walking for a distance through the woods we followed signs that led us to a huge opening and then we were able to start to appreciate the beauty of this place. Although it is not as densely built up as some of the other ruins, the vast openness of the Gran Plaza was very impressive. We climbed several pyramids and there were some beautiful views of the surrounding structures. Don\u2019t expect anything on par with Chichen Itza, Uxmal or Palenque, but this site was still very much worth our time.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

53627630.name: Best Mayan Ruin
53627630.author: a TripAdvisor user
53627630.reviewBody:
Of all the ruins I've visited in the Yucatan, Edzná is my favorite.  It has the perfect combination of size, well restored ruins, and smaller crowds to make the visit completely worthwhile.  You get the complete package.  On one hand, everything is very well taken care of.  On the other, there were very few visitors when I was there (February 2009) and Dad and I really got to feel like we were the only people at the site.

Edzná also has a laser light show one evening a week.  Although we did not get to attend, it is well spoken of.  Additionally, the way the ruins are set up, there is an amphitheatre-like seating area that will give visitors an excellent view of the main complex above them.

Edzná is also quite close to Campeche city, which was also the most welcoming and fun of the modern towns we visited while on the Penninsula.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

24736831.name: Must see when you are in Campeche
24736831.author: a TripAdvisor user
24736831.reviewBody:
One of the highlights of our visit to Campeche was an excursion to the Mayan ruins of Edzna. The are located about forty minutes from Campeche city.  We had a rental car, so we were able to go there on our own, but there are tours offered from the hotels if you don't have your own transportation.  

When we arrived there was hardly anyone else there.  It is always a plus to be able to explore ruins without hordes of tourists around.  By the time we left, a couple small tour groups had arrived, but nothing that would distract from the tranquility and majesty of this site.

Edzna was the most important city in the area during the Classic Period of the Mayan civilization (well over a thousand years ago.)  A quite extensive area of the ceremonial center has been excavated and restored.  At the center is a vast plaza.  On one side is a very long structure called the Big House.  The entire length of the building is a staircase which leads up to the remains of rooms where the government of the city was probably conducted.  Across the plaza from the Big House is a huge raised platform on which numerous temples were built.  The most impressive is the so-called "Five Story Building" which was a combination palace and pyramid.  It's style is rather distinctive from other Mayan pyramids.  At each level there are many rooms and on the temple at the top there are the remains of a roof comb.  You can't go into the rooms, but you can climb the central staircase to the top.  The view is very impressive.

If you venture a little way from the plaza you will find the remains of a structure covered with a thatched roof with some well preserved masks of the Sun God.

Edzna may not be as big as Chichen Itza, or boast the incredible stone mosaics of Uxmal, but it definitely deserves a couple hours of your time if you are in the area.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Edzna, Carretera 180 entronque con la 188 Se localiza a 55 km de la ciudad de Campeche

675915402.name: Not huge, but well done
675915402.author: a TripAdvisor user
675915402.reviewBody: This was much better than I expected. We stopped their as an afterthought on the way to Edzna. The fort is well restored, colorful and photogenic. Each room housed artifacts on different topics pertaining to the local area...everything from the geography to the area\'s pirate history. There were also several interactive exhibits which my kids loved.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de Campeche Fuerte de San Miguel

675279727.name: Not big but very worthwhile
675279727.author: a TripAdvisor user
675279727.reviewBody: This isn\'t the biggest museum ever, and that\'s a plus. A small museum is a better option for me than one that takes all day to walk through. I\'m happy to see somethings, but I don\'t want to see everything. Anyway, this place filled my bill. Steles and other artifacts nicely displayed and explained. Every features for blind visitors. The exquisite jade mask is the big enchilada here.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de Campeche Fuerte de San Miguel

664845853.name: Fort building with museum inside
664845853.author: a TripAdvisor user
664845853.reviewBody: If you like old forts, then this may be for you.  The old fort has a moat and mounted cannons on the side of the hills.  This fort overlooks the water and has a great view into Campeche.  The museum has each room with a collection.  The best piece is a large boat rudder which looks like a greyhound with a snake wrapped around it.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de Campeche Fuerte de San Miguel

650902469.name: museum and fort
650902469.author: a TripAdvisor user
650902469.reviewBody: Drove all the way out to see the fort and Calakmul Mask but it\u2019s closed for renovations until April (even tho website says opened) so mask has been moved to museo de Arquitectura Maya in the historical district.  Definitely worth going there to see it.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de Campeche Fuerte de San Miguel

612433883.name: Historical fort with museum - must see
612433883.author: a TripAdvisor user
612433883.reviewBody: This is one of two main historical forts that were built near the old walled town of Campeche.  It is now a museum and definitely worth visiting.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de Campeche Fuerte de San Miguel

610886167.name: Worth visiting!
610886167.author: a TripAdvisor user
610886167.reviewBody: Lots of Mayan history and cultural information.  There are 7 or 8 different rooms with various Mayan artifacts along with the fort and spectacular views.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de Campeche Fuerte de San Miguel

604699442.name: Just impressive!
604699442.author: a TripAdvisor user
604699442.reviewBody: I loved being there. The place has a lot of history! The visit is 100% worth it. I took several nice pictures from the sea.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de Campeche Fuerte de San Miguel

601638738.name: San Miguel\u2019s Fort and Museum
601638738.author: a TripAdvisor user
601638738.reviewBody: A piece of history from 1770 not to be missed! The fort is perfectly maintained and it has eight different exhibit rooms with Mayan pieces from several Campeche\u2019s archaeological sites. My teens were impressed by the history of this fort which is part of our cultural inheritance. Entrance fee is $55 pesos, there is free parking lot and restrooms.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de Campeche Fuerte de San Miguel

565859108.name: Good small museum
565859108.author: a TripAdvisor user
565859108.reviewBody: Located outsite (4-5km) of campeche. You have to drive by taxi or car. It is a small museum, but it has a good exhibition of maya artifacts. The description is mostly in spanish, but it is worth to visit.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de Campeche Fuerte de San Miguel

559838055.name: Well preserved fortification and small Mayan artifacts museum
559838055.author: a TripAdvisor user
559838055.reviewBody: Well worth the short trip from Campeche centro.  Although a small fort compared to the Spanish forts in Cartagena or San Juan, it is still a nicely preserved edifice and also contains a small, but nice Mayan museum.\n\nRecently renovated bathrooms/banos.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Arqueologico de Campeche Fuerte de San Miguel

673542864.name: Impressive ruins
673542864.author: a TripAdvisor user
673542864.reviewBody: The chican\u00e1 ruins are impressive Rio Bec style ruins, with a wonderful temple whose entrance resembles the mouth of a jaguar, symbolising the entrance to the netherworld. Definitely worth visiting.

667306478.name: Explendid Mayan Ruins
667306478.author: a TripAdvisor user
667306478.reviewBody: This wasn\u00b4t my primary destination, esplendid stone stalaes, its a must, very much like the rest, ruins with great jungle surroundings. Very well preserved piramids. It just takes like one hour to get to see all the site.\nChildren  dont pay and mine loved the place.

664834982.name: Check out the Chicana mayan ruins
664834982.author: a TripAdvisor user
664834982.reviewBody: If you like Mayan architecture then check out the Mayan Ruins. Make sure you have enough cold water to not get dehydrated.  Take good hiking shoes and be careful with the rough / rugged terrain.  Be careful if you try climbing one of the structures.

660425889.name: Great Monster Mouths
660425889.author: a TripAdvisor user
660425889.reviewBody: This is a smaller site, but I really enjoyed it. It\'s worth stopping by if you are in the area for Calakmul. The highlight is the great "monster mouth" building.  There was only one other couple here when I visited, so you\'re free to explore and take as much or little time that you want, but it doesn\'t take very long to explore the site.

644318773.name: Worth a visit!
644318773.author: a TripAdvisor user
644318773.reviewBody: This Maya site is very close to the small town of Xpuhil and more than worth visiting, especially because it has a temple that is a very good example of the Mayan Rio Bec style.

634996488.name: You have these ruins practically for yourself
634996488.author: a TripAdvisor user
634996488.reviewBody: Compared to places like Chich\u00e9n-Itz\u00e1, Uxmal, Palenque, etc., this is a haven of peace, a real oasis of tranquillity. It\'s more easy to experience the special character of a Mayan site in a place like this. Ruins are both beautiful and with easy access.

607362931.name: Chicanna
607362931.author: a TripAdvisor user
607362931.reviewBody: Chicanna is thought to be a area outside of Becan where the city elite had their suburb residences. The root of this belief is the rich decorations and ornaments of its buildings. The best preserved of them is the House of the Serpent Mouth which the name of the site is derived from. Climbing the structures is impossible due to the state of preservation. The site isn\'t large, should take about an hour to see it. Btw the spelling should be ChicaNNa, double N.

592517875.name: Nice Mayans ruins
592517875.author: a TripAdvisor user
592517875.reviewBody: You follow a path and you can see the ruins and also monkeys flying in the trees (at the start of the visit)\nNot many tourists at all\n

568718790.name: A must if you\'re in the region
568718790.author: a TripAdvisor user
568718790.reviewBody: I didn\'t regret going and enjoyed the easy roundtrip through the ruins. What you\'ll definitely want to see is the open mouth gate. It\'s unique in style and degree of conservation.

566509162.name: One of 3 Sites in Same Area
566509162.author: a TripAdvisor user
566509162.reviewBody: Chicann\u00e1 is a small site with few visitors, but with interesting structures, including one entranceway that looks like the open mouth of a jaguar. It\u2019s conveniently very close to the main Highway 186. This is a good site that can be done along with Xpujil and the larger Becan all in one day. Trying to do these three sites and then driving all the way to Calakmul in the same day would not work well. It\u2019s best to see Chicann\u00e1 and the other sites in the area like Xpujil and Becan on one day, then driving to Calakmul on the day before or after. Gas is available about 5 miles east in the town or Xpujil, so fill up since there\u2019s nothing else to the west for almost 100 miles. And as always with driving in remote parts of Mexico, bring lots of bottled water.

517818246.name: Chicanna ruins a must
517818246.author: a TripAdvisor user
517818246.reviewBody: On our way from Rio bec dreams we stopped at Chicanna ruins. We had it all to ourselves. Gentle walk around theories which had exquisite carvings one of the best we saw. Do not skip these.

480370961.name: First class mayan pyramid
480370961.author: a TripAdvisor user
480370961.reviewBody: Great great mayan site with excellent site infrastructure and information boards. Top photo motive ideally in the late afternoon.

478088364.name: Not to be missed
478088364.author: a TripAdvisor user
478088364.reviewBody: This is a very small archaeological site, but it has a building that must not be missed. It\'s a small building with an open mouth of a jaguar and some other kind of animal. To get into the building you must go thru this mouth. Simple wonderful

446288856.name: Better than Xpuhil, not as good as Becan, next to road
446288856.author: a TripAdvisor user
446288856.reviewBody: Pretty neat place, the name means \'Mouth snake house\'.  Two hours max.  Would choose this site over nearby Xpuhil but Becan is a better site IMO.  There were some minivan tours the day I went which surprised me.

443072642.name: Easily viewed small Maya site
443072642.author: a TripAdvisor user
443072642.reviewBody: These ruins are just across the road from the Ecovillage Resort and well worth a visit of an hour or so. The layout is very flat and there are just 7 structures to see, all  quite close together.

376553558.name: A well taken care of site.
376553558.author: a TripAdvisor user
376553558.reviewBody: Chicann\u00e1 is a smaller Mayan ruin that is well taken care of. It has several excavated structures, with Structure II having a beautiful facade. There were very few visitors touring the site when I went. The cost was only $50 (pesos).

267867192.name: This archaeologist was surprised!
267867192.author: a TripAdvisor user
267867192.reviewBody: I rolled into Chiccana not quite knowing what to expect and a bit tired after several bigger sites that day. When I saw the monster maw doorway I said, out loud, "WOW". If you are in the area there is no reason not to go. Smaller than some of the nearby sites but, whatever, look at that doorway!

259954865.name: A nice little site
259954865.author: a TripAdvisor user
259954865.reviewBody: This was easy to get to and interesting. It was very close to where we were staying. Even though it was small it was still impressive,

241753338.name: The mouth of the serpent, this costrucci\u00f3n is magnificent and wonderful environment.
241753338.author: a TripAdvisor user
241753338.reviewBody: Practically next to the road, this set of ruins in the jungle are in sight, the senses and a call for the defense of nature a gift.\nThey are part of a huge set amid the forest of Calakmul.

216370456.name: Awesome
216370456.author: a TripAdvisor user
216370456.reviewBody: We spent 7 days in the middle of Campeche and were abel to visit the area without hurry.  This site is well maintained and little visited by tourist busses.  \nIf you enjoy traveling back in time and allowing your imagination to expand, this is a perfect place.

160313656.name: A Fabulous, Accessible Mayan Site
160313656.author: a TripAdvisor user
160313656.reviewBody: Amazing architecture, very close to a nice eco lodge.  We hired some of the "child guides" to show us through this site-- the boys knew what they were talking about and made sure to show us some of the highlights that a casual visitor might miss.

156991634.name: Insight into Mayan history
156991634.author: a TripAdvisor user
156991634.reviewBody: A fascinating (if a little gruesome) and intriguing insight into the restored Chicanna ruins. Only worthwhile if visiting on a guided tour to fully appreciate the buildings and intelligence behind the architecture.

155212860.name: Small site of Mayan ruins that is well worth a visit
155212860.author: a TripAdvisor user
155212860.reviewBody: Chicanna is a small site of Mayan ruins. It is thought that it was a retreat for nobles, thus it was more of a Mayan resort than a fully functional city. There are five or six buildings that have been excavated and restored. They display a \u201cRio Bec\u201d style of architecture \u2013 meaning they have towers and elaborately carved facades. The doorways of two of the structure have impressive \u201cMonster Masks\u201d in which the jaws of a stylize monster are shown open around the doorway. The Mayan king would appear in the door of the temple, standing within the jaws of the Monster. This doorway throught the mouth of the monster symbolized the connection between the real world and the spirit world.\nChicanna is small and level, you can easily walk through the whole site in an hour. We took longer because we spent time photographing and reading all the posted signs. \nChicanna is easy to reach \u2013 just a few kilometers off of the main road. Admission was 42 pesos, so it is well worth checking out.

150115308.name: Off the beaten path and well worth it
150115308.author: a TripAdvisor user
150115308.reviewBody: I hadn\'t really envisioned what these ruins used to look like - how they had originally been decorated - until Chicanna. There is still color on some of the moldings and even a pictograph on one of the outside walls. This place was unbelievable. If you visit, stay at Rio Bec Dreams.

145623434.name: Shady Walk to Monster Mouth at Mayan Ruins
145623434.author: a TripAdvisor user
145623434.reviewBody: Chicanna is a compact site just off highway 186 just west of Xpuhil, well signposted. There are four main groups of structures with a nice pathway leading counterclockwise to each group. To see all the structures is a walk of about 1-2 kilometers through the trees. One building has 2 towers at the ends, while another has a huge monster mask doorway in pretty good shape. My friend saw a tapir and some monkeys. Cost was 42 pesos with free parking at the entrance. Toilets but no refreshments.

136077885.name: nice ruins in shady forest clearings
136077885.author: a TripAdvisor user
136077885.reviewBody: Although the building are not up to Uxmal or Chichen Itza, Chicanna is a very nice Mayan site in the Xpujil area. It is very close to Route 186 and has nice trails through attractive forest. We were most impressed by the overall detail of the carvings and the stunning Serpent\'s Mouth, for which the site is currently named. We saw a good variety of birds here, including toucans, and one can easily see other ruins in the same day. A very easy drive from lodgings in Xpujil.

673542321.name: Archeological site with amazing  stucco friezes
673542321.author: a TripAdvisor user
673542321.reviewBody: This is a smaller site very near Calakmul (about a mile west on the Esc\u00e1rcega-Chetumal road). Smaller is a relative term, of course, there are at least 3 centers to visit in this compound, including the well-preserved, exquisite stucco friezes.

664832804.name: Great Mayan Ruins
664832804.author: a TripAdvisor user
664832804.reviewBody: Check out the Mayan architecture found at the Balamku site.  Be prepared to walk alot and have good hiking shoes. Take lots of cold water so you don\'t get dehydrated.  Rough terrain and uneven ground found everywhere.

663557925.name: Balamk\u00fa
663557925.author: a TripAdvisor user
663557925.reviewBody: The frieze, is the most relevant monument made of patterned and polychrome stucco, with a height of 1.75 m. and a length of 16.80 m., elaborated between the years 550 and 650. The scene represents an allegory of the order of the universe with figures of snakes and jaguars. Of great iconographic richness, reading in detail reveals the complex conceptual world of the ancient Maya.\n#balamku #calakmul #frieze #maya #mexico #campeche #archeology #jungle

660426479.name: Fantastic Frieze
660426479.author: a TripAdvisor user
660426479.reviewBody: There\'s really only one thing worth seeing at Balamku, but it is one wonderful thing. It\'s a huge painted stucco frieze now inside of the principal building here, which used to be on the exterior, but got built over. Great monster mouths!  Balamku is very close to the main road turn off to Calakmul.  If you come all this way for Calakmul, there\'s no excuse for missing Balamku.

607194775.name: Balamku
607194775.author: a TripAdvisor user
607194775.reviewBody: If you intend on using GPS type in "Zona Arqueologica de Balamku" to find the place. Otherwise it\'s easy to see signs to it from Route 186.\n\nThe site isn\'t big but the main attraction there is the frieze. It\'s great. The viewing platform is pretty narrow to take a good picture so have your wide-angle lens ready. The frieze is hidden inside the pyramid behind a locked steel door so you have to find an attendant to let you in. The site doesn\'t seem to be a popular with visitors. We were the only ones there around 11 am.

566564719.name: Another Convenient Mayan Ruins Stop Along Highway 186
566564719.author: a TripAdvisor user
566564719.reviewBody: If traveling along Highway 186, Balamku is a convenient stop just north of the highway. It\u2019s a medium sized site so it doesn\u2019t take more than an hour or two. If driving along 186 it\u2019s possible to see Balamku, Becan, Chicann\u00e1, and Xpujil all in one day, and save the more extensive, time consuming Calakmul for the day before or day after. Always bring lots of water and gas up at either Escarcega if coming from the west, or Xpujil if coming from the east since there are no gas stations for the hundred miles between those towns.

562377496.name: Get there before they close it!
562377496.author: a TripAdvisor user
562377496.reviewBody: Balamku is a small site basically across the highway from the entrance to the Calakmul ruins/preserve, and is a must-see before or after your Calakmul excursion.  The highlight is a large frieze  inside a locked facility.  Roughly 15m wide and 8 high, with much detail and coloring still present.  Our guide told us that despite the protective enclosure, its condition has declined due to human breath and intervention, and the expectation is that it will be closed to the public (as have been so many other attractions in other sites, e.g. Chichen Itza and Palenque tombs).

550766271.name: Very Nice - Smaller
550766271.author: a TripAdvisor user
550766271.reviewBody: After our trip to the Zona Achaelogical, we thought we were not coming here because the group requested to visit the Museum. Unfortunately, the museum was closed and we had spare time before we head out to the Murcielagos (bat cave). So we stopped here. The entry was 40 pesos. It is a much smaller ruin but it is well preserved. The one main attraction is the one in the center with all its carves. Guard did not allow anyone to take a picture. It would have been dark anyway. We did not stay long but it was a nice extension for places to see.

544125728.name: Large, well preserved frieze on the way to Calakmul
544125728.author: a TripAdvisor user
544125728.reviewBody: We loved Balamku. The 55 ft. long frieze is remarkably well preserved because it is in the Temple of the Jaguar. You can see the claws on the seated jaguars and pick out other animals, like a toad. The security guard will let you into the Temple to see it.  There was no one else there, and we enjoyed the rest of the ruins also.

478090241.name: Wonderful
478090241.author: a TripAdvisor user
478090241.reviewBody: Small archaeological site but with a wonderful building with a great frieze with lots of stucco figures.

465099093.name: Fantastic Frieze!
465099093.author: a TripAdvisor user
465099093.reviewBody: This site is easy to visit.  The most impressive thing to see is the carved Mayan frieze.  It is in excellent condition and is surprisingly intact.  It is necessary to have someone unlock the room for you - it is upstairs at one of the main pyramids.  Definitely seek the person with the key - and we tipped him as well.

450296640.name: Archeological zone
450296640.author: a TripAdvisor user
450296640.reviewBody: Interesting place in the jungle\nNot crowded place, very romantic and close to caramkul - worth to visit both places in the same day - to caramkul you need to have car or transport - open from 8-14.30

334906725.name: Totally worth an hour if you are visiting Calakmul.
334906725.author: a TripAdvisor user
334906725.reviewBody: It only takes a little while to see. As the other reviews say the carvings are totally worth seeing.

303062863.name: The sculptures inside the buildings ...
303062863.author: a TripAdvisor user
303062863.reviewBody: This is a relatively small site, but only a couple of kms off the main road - it has what a lot of other Mayan sites have, but it also has some painted sculptures that other sites don\'t have and they are truly amazing. To think of their history, how they have survived and to see the colour still intact is wonderful. The site only gets about 20 visitors a day, so you will also have a peaceful visit!"

274706159.name: great little excursion
274706159.author: a TripAdvisor user
274706159.reviewBody: Small Maya ruins with outstanding sculpturework.\nThe site itself is small and its main attraction is sculptural freeze in the middle of the pyramid. Amazing experience.\nVery good to combine with Calacmul visit.

267866306.name: Tiny sight but WOW what a mask.
267866306.author: a TripAdvisor user
267866306.reviewBody: If you are in the area there is no reason not to dip in to Balamku. Small, of course, compared to the hulking Becan (relatively) near by but the frieze is super amazing. This archaeologist was impressed.

262764179.name: A small site but well worth seeing
262764179.author: a TripAdvisor user
262764179.reviewBody: Balamku is not very far from Calakmul and even though it is a smaller site it is well worth visiting. There are some impressive structures at this site and a very unusual carving within a locked area. You will need to ask at the entrance for someone to unlock the door to the area that contains the carving. The structure at the back end of this site is where you will find metal stairs that lead to the locked door. This area is quite serene and we enjoyed having the site to ourselves for the duration of our visit. This site is open daily from 8:00 a.m.- 5:00 p.m. There are facilities near the entrance. There are no food or drinks for sale on site. Current cost for admission is 39 pesos per person.

258790879.name: Don\'t miss this site
258790879.author: a TripAdvisor user
258790879.reviewBody: Balamku is very conveniently located to Cakakmul (just north of highway 186 and several miles west of Calakmul) and can be seen on the same day. It is a very small site and the architecture is not what you are there to see. You are looking for is a beautifully preserved, 17 meter long, stucco frieze in the Temple of the Jaguar. Filled with figures of frogs, crocodiles, jaguars and monster masks. Originally displayed on the exterior of a building, a later building was built over it and thus preserving it. Get the caretaker to unlock the gate and he will also explain some of the iconography.

247235098.name: A little gem in the Calakmul Biosphere
247235098.author: a TripAdvisor user
247235098.reviewBody:
Only a small area of Balamku has been excavated, but the stucco freize that was discovered in 1990 is not to be missed. 

Balamku' frieze depicts a rich scene of Mayan gods, animals, and men that is distinctly different from those found at any Mayan  sites in the region. 

The frieze is located under lock and key in a reconstructed chamber on the side of the main structure. 

Ask the archeological site attendant to unlock the chamber door for you. Two of us were the only visitors at the site, so the attendant allowed us to linger in the chamber as long as we wanted. 

Don't forget to tip the attendant like I did. 
I learned afterwards that it is customary, so I didn't begin to tip everyone until later on our trip to Mexico. My heartfelt apology to the kind attendant at Balamku.

241495766.name: Incredible ruins
241495766.author: a TripAdvisor user
241495766.reviewBody: It is amazing that you can climb the ruins and get to see the murals inside of the main one. \n\nIt\'s worth the visit. It is far from Campeche.

234185851.name: Wrong
234185851.author: a TripAdvisor user
234185851.reviewBody: Since this site is located approximately five hours from Campeche, it is not properly listed as a Campeche City attraction. It should be listed as a Xpuhil attraction or an Escarcega attraction.

216371656.name: No Words
216371656.author: a TripAdvisor user
216371656.reviewBody: Balamku was rediscovered in 1990 and has not suffered the surgery of earlier excavations.  It is a gentle and well preserved site with only about 8% explored.  It is unique in that it has the largest preserved fresco in the Maya world found to date.  Access is restricted and you must have one of the guardians unlock the door to enter.  \nIf you have the opportunity to visit this site do yourself a favor and don\'t pass it up.

201590864.name: Mayan ruins with a spectacular stucco frieze
201590864.author: a TripAdvisor user
201590864.reviewBody: Balamku is one of the Mayan sites situated on Hwy 186 (along with Xpujil, Becan, Hormiguero, Chicanna, etc.). Situated in the jungle, the site is small but features some very nice stucco friezes, maybe the best in the Mayan world, including a 55-foot long one dating from AD 550-600. Unfortunately, the walkway along the frieze doesn\'t allow you to take good pictures and there is no way to stand back far enough to get the whole frieze in your lens. Nevertheless, if you\'re interested in Mayan art, Balamku is definitely a good place to visit.

176275621.name: Spectacular frieze and lots of monkeys
176275621.author: a TripAdvisor user
176275621.reviewBody: Stopped off here briefly en route to Calakmul. The frieze was very interesting and well preserved (make sure you ask for the door to be unlocked!) but did not hold the attention of our children for long. However we were lucky enough to see a troop of Spider monkeys playing in the trees above the path back to towards the entrance; they stayed there for a while and we watched them for ages.

165059890.name: Beautiful frieze inside a pyramid
165059890.author: a TripAdvisor user
165059890.reviewBody: Located very close to the main road and also to the road leading to the ruins of Calakmul. Well worth the stop The main reason to go to this site is to see a very large frieze still with some of its colors that they put inside a the pyramid to preserve it,. You also to get feel what it is like to be inside a pyramid. Very few pyramids are open to the public.

161920162.name: Just absolutely amazing
161920162.author: a TripAdvisor user
161920162.reviewBody: A 55 foot long stucco frieze is what makes this an amazing site.  If you visit this site for no other reason, you really should see this frieze.  The fact that original colors are still evident and the detail that exists will make your visit worth the time that you took.

160837354.name: $3.00 per person plus tip for an excellent stucco frieze
160837354.author: a TripAdvisor user
160837354.reviewBody: There are better sites in the area!  If you arrive not expecting the majesty/history of Calakmul, you will not be disappointed.  We beelined it to the temple housing the frieze, were awed by it for 20 minutes and took off.  Less than an hour spent.  The frieze is excellent and when you consider that you only paid 3 bucks to see something that amazing, how could you leave disappointed?...(you would leave disappointed if you couldn\'t get the door unlocked.  It would be better if the signs explaining the frieze were in English...)

159946049.name: a must-see if the Calamkul area
159946049.author: a TripAdvisor user
159946049.reviewBody: Protected by a strange concrete shell, the stucco statues in the interior of one of the temples show the Maya belief in the city Lords\' linkage of the surface and underworlds.  Tip the man who unlocks the gate 20 or 30 pesos, and be transported to another reality.

154870403.name: Balamku is unique and impressive
154870403.author: a TripAdvisor user
154870403.reviewBody: Balamku is just off the main highway, and it is pretty small, so it only takes an hour or two to see the whole thing. But Balamku is still worth visiting. During recent excavations, archaeologists discovered an impressive stucco frieze inside Structure I of the central plaza. To deter looters, the frieze is locked behind a gate, but a worker will unlock the door for you and wait patiently while you examine the marvelous artwork. \nThe frieze is about 65 feet long, and is full of Mayan iconography - toads, crocodiles, jaguars and kings. You are not allowed to use flash photography, but enough daylight streams in through the skylight that my pictures turned out nicely. This frieze is so well preserved! Definitely worth a look.\nAlso saunter over to the pyramid of the South Group. You can climb it and have a look around.

149099598.name: Small but Great place
149099598.author: a TripAdvisor user
149099598.reviewBody: Its a small pyramid, well located and Its a must if you go to Calakmul. If you go to Calakmul i recomend you use the toilet here, is the last "decent" one you will find for miles.

148590465.name: Small, but memorable site
148590465.author: a TripAdvisor user
148590465.reviewBody: There are three major structures on the site: a Gate, a Temple and a small Pyramid. The pyramid is a bit off the main path so it\'s easy to miss it. The climb is easy and the view quite rewarding. The gate is less decorated than the one in Chicanna. The temple has a fabulous friese, but you have to ask the gardian to open the door, because it is inside, on the left side of the building. The ruins are conviently located just a few km away from the main highway, but watch for the potholes.

146254135.name: Quiet and interesting
146254135.author: a TripAdvisor user
146254135.reviewBody: The Mayan ruins here are nothing like the scale of others on the peninsula but what is interesting is the beautiful frieze which was found in the Temple of the Jaguar inside one of the pyramids. The caretaker will take you in and tell you about some of the images on the frieze...in Spanish. This was a worthwhile stop off away from the crowds of some of the larger sites.

145624014.name: Interesting Mayan Frieze But Not Much Else
145624014.author: a TripAdvisor user
145624014.reviewBody: Balamku is just off of highway 186 a few kilometers west of the main turnoff to Calakmul. There is a shady walk of a few hundred meters to the first structures and between the three groups of structures. The site has only a few unexcavated structures but one of them contains the largest piece of intact Mayan frieze. A concrete room has been built around the frieze. It is very dark to protect the artwork with only a few small holes in the walls and ceilings, none of which allow light to directly hit the frieze. No flashlights or flash cameras are allowed so you must wait some time to adapt your eyes to the light before you can see the details which are impressive. The room is always locked so you must get a caaretaker to unlock it and stand guard while you look. Cost was 35 pesos with free parking at the entrance. Toilets but no refreshments.

140697296.name: amazing friezes at modest ruins
140697296.author: a TripAdvisor user
140697296.reviewBody: We stopped at Balamku in the early afternoon, after visiting Calakmul in the morning. This worked well, since, Balamku is very close to the Calakmul turnoff. The overall impression of Balamku is a fairly standard set of ruins spread across a wooded site, with an interesting mixture of architectural styles. Looking back at my photos, there are fairly impressive buildings, but I may have been spoiled by visiting Calakmul earlier in the same day! The resident caretaker found us quickly, after we entered the site, and after a quick tour of the ruins, he opened the locked entrance to the friezes (we of course tipped him afterward).  The enclosed friezes of various animals and the Mayan cosmology are what make Balamku really special, and are definitely worth seeing. This site is about 1 hour west of Xpujil, and can be combined with other of the numerous Mayan sites in the area. It helps to know at least a little Spanish to converse with the caretaker

654159676.name: not special during the day, but a must for great sunset
654159676.author: a TripAdvisor user
654159676.reviewBody: During the day there is not mcuh to see or to do. But when the sun goes down in the sea. Then it is the best place! enjoy toegtehr with the plicans when the sun sinks in the water..

646461199.name: A walk along the Gulf!
646461199.author: a TripAdvisor user
646461199.reviewBody: We were staying at the Gamma Hotel, just across from the Malec\u00f3n. This was a very nice spot to be, you had the view of the water and you had the cool sea breezes. The Malec\u00f3n probably stretches about for about 3.5 km., the whole width of the city. It is a very pleasant walk along a broad, even pathway, alongside the walking path there is a bike lane as well. There is a grassy boulevard between it and the 180, which follows it on the one side, This is a divided road, no worries though, not so terribly busy or noisy. It is a pretty walkway, there are a number of monuments depicting different historical events. This is a good place to walk and use as jumping out spots to go see the different areas of the city. The older, historical city, of course, follows the water. We had spent the afternoon at the Liverpool Mall and walked back to our hotel along the Malec\u00f3n, about a 30 minute walk, This is a particularly pretty walk to be doing in the evening. The temperature is wonderful and the sunset spectacular! \nNote: There was construction going on right across from the Gamma, improvements and upgrades. Most of the Malec\u00f3n seemed to be unaffected, though.

642713715.name: A Great Stroll
642713715.author: a TripAdvisor user
642713715.reviewBody: A walk down the malecon is one of the nicest things to do in Campeche.  You can walk for miles, seeing fishermen and eating in nice restaurants.  Nice and cool when it\'s hot!

636368636.name: Beautiful view of the sea
636368636.author: a TripAdvisor user
636368636.reviewBody: Explore the water view along this seaside path. Wear your hat! Hot in the sun. Enjoy the local fishing boats.

610878151.name: Nice waterfront walk
610878151.author: a TripAdvisor user
610878151.reviewBody: Enjoyable place to stroll, you will not find shops or vendors here.  There is a large section under construction

561590289.name: Sea, sky, and a breeze
561590289.author: a TripAdvisor user
561590289.reviewBody: Oe of the charms of Campeche is its seaside location, and the Malecon is an excellent place to experience it. In addition there is usually a breeze to carry away the city\'s heat. Outside the Puerta del Mar there are pedestrian crossings across the highway; the cars actually stop! The Malecon includes separate paths for walkers, joggers, and bicycles so everyone can move at their own pace. Residents as well as tourists come to the Malecon; it is a great place for people watching, and of course for enjoying the sunset.

556697682.name: Must See.
556697682.author: a TripAdvisor user
556697682.reviewBody: This place has an upscale European  feel to it , sit on the sea wall and watch the sunset ! Great place to walk  or jog ,so clean.

550247334.name: All in a walking distance
550247334.author: a TripAdvisor user
550247334.reviewBody:
A fairly new progress, the roads coming to town are pretty much all torn down. They are expanding and building new, better and wider roads. After a few minutes of drive into this torn path, you will pass by the malecon to your right. 

I took a day tour from Merida that was supposed to return but I opted to be dropped off here as it is my next destination. We arrived close to sunset and you can see the reflection of the fading sun into the horizon. Sunsets are great everywhere, a beautiful part of the day. 
We ate lunch at a nearby restaurant. My hotel is about 10 minutes from here and I was dropped off. I took advantage of the remaining day and took a walk. It is about 10 minutes for me to get to Malecon, took a short walk into the sunset and enjoyed the closing of the day. There are separate paths according foot traffic and bikes. You can stay here long or just a few minutes. Enjoy some of the statues, passers-by or sit on a bench.

544447786.name: walk along the Bay of Campeche
544447786.author: a TripAdvisor user
544447786.reviewBody: Walking path and bicycle path along the shore, quite,long, but well layed out and planned, some old cannons, great sunset views though.

499368844.name: Nice city
499368844.author: a TripAdvisor user
499368844.reviewBody: First .... I Was told that Was an ugly place, no thatS a li\u00e9, But the wall of the fort mostly destroy mano years a go, only lef ar\u00e9 few building and certain wall But is not like Cartagena, lovely place

589759372.name: Watch out for pirate attacks to the walled city!!
589759372.author: a TripAdvisor user
589759372.reviewBody:
We stayed in Campeche for one day visiting downtown. The walled city is a beautiful colonial place with lots of things to do and visit, you can take the streetcar which will take you to the most interesting places. 

There are also some museums in the wall's baluartes, there you will learn about the pirate attacks Campeche suffered in the past and you can walk on the wall in some access points.

To end a wonderful visit you can eat seafood on some of the restaurants along the pier and take a nice wall feeling the sea breeze.

556936903.name: Exceptional colonial town
556936903.author: a TripAdvisor user
556936903.reviewBody: Walking along the streets of Campeche is a rewarding and unforgettable experience. Huge houses, patios hidden behind doors and windows, colorful walls, and in some places a sidewalk that is about a matter above the street level. Of course some houses are in bad repair, but the place is wonderful anyway.

556275030.name: Not to be missed
556275030.author: a TripAdvisor user
556275030.reviewBody: Loved walking this lovely city. Lots of history in this lovely small but bustling city centre.\nMake sure to do both day and evening visits.

499369613.name: Lovely
499369613.author: a TripAdvisor user
499369613.reviewBody: Nice city, restored area, lot of historic content, small city, you con walk, just like 10-15 blocks , a must

471908489.name: What a wonderful find!
471908489.author: a TripAdvisor user
471908489.reviewBody: My friends said you must go to see this city and boy were they right.  From driving into the city and seeing their beautiful malec\u00f3n to their massive monuments, there is much to see in this city.

460437988.name: History inside the walls
460437988.author: a TripAdvisor user
460437988.reviewBody:
Walled off to protect the city from pirate raids, this historic center provides multiple opportunities to absorb the history of the city.  Many of the baluartes or bastions that were built at various locations along the wall now provide small museums detailing the history and development of the walled city.  You are also able to walk several areas of the ball.

The historic center itself provides excellent examples of the old architecture.  And the historic center extremely clean and free of debris.  Walk along Calle 59 is which open for pedestrian traffic, and you will have your choice of scores of restaurants and shops. 

Stroll to the town square.  Pick a park bench under a shade tree.  And people watch as you relax a bit.  On the weekends, go to El Palacio, also on the town square to see a light and sound show projected on the block-long building.  It is quite spectacular, depicting the history of the city and region. It begins at 8 p.m.

Just outside the walled city is a very nice Malecon, where you can walk, jog, or ride a bike along the sea front.

453581062.name: Beautiful City
453581062.author: a TripAdvisor user
453581062.reviewBody: Campeche is one of few cities in Latin America that are walled to protect them against invasion or Pirates. It has been reconstructed and can really appreciate how people lived here over a hundred years ago. It\'s fun to get up and walk through the wall and appreciate the historic center\nRecommended

671909349.name: Small but very well displayed
671909349.author: a TripAdvisor user
671909349.reviewBody: A small museum half a block from la "puerta de Mar" or gate to the sea. It has several original pieces of Mayan history. It was also designed for the visually impaired with Braille signs and touchable replicas

664833693.name: Great small museum of Mayan artifacts
664833693.author: a TripAdvisor user
664833693.reviewBody: Check out this great find of a small museum with Mayan Artifacts. The Jade mask is beautiful. The stella and other artifacts are very well done and displayed.  Well worth the cost to view the artifacts.  Great find next to the city wall.

657989581.name: The finale was impressive
657989581.author: a TripAdvisor user
657989581.reviewBody: Small, but interesting little museum with a good explanation of the different Mayan styles of carving (more than the actual architecture). Shame that the finale (jade mask) was explained only in English..\n\nOh yes, and the security guard clipping his toenails on the museum floor was an interesting sight...

655199175.name: Stunning jade mask
655199175.author: a TripAdvisor user
655199175.reviewBody: A beautifully curated small collection of Mayan engravings with clear explanations of the language and symbolism. The jade mask is simply stunning and again a very clever visual explanation of the various components. This is a must see

650903864.name: Museum
650903864.author: a TripAdvisor user
650903864.reviewBody: This was a surprise as the Calkumal Mask and History is being housed here until the Arqueologia museo is renovated.  Very interesting.

642713618.name: Architecture?
642713618.author: a TripAdvisor user
642713618.reviewBody: Not a lot of architecture, but some nice things including a jade mask from Calakmul that is worth the price of admission.

640417820.name: The Mayan Archeology of Campeche.
640417820.author: a TripAdvisor user
640417820.reviewBody: The museum is located as part of the City wall near the Main Plaza. There was a wonderful exhibit of Mayan Jade jewelry as well as carved stone reliefs.

639651284.name: A Quintessential Must!
639651284.author: a TripAdvisor user
639651284.reviewBody: Baluarte de la Soledad houses the Museo de La Arquitectura Maya which features the Mask of Calakmul, a very beautiful funerary mask composed of jade, shell and gray obsidian. The museum brings together artifacts from four Mayan regions, Peten Norte,, Rio Bec,  Chenes and Pec. This is a very nice museum, not large, but definitely a worthwhile place to visit. The signage, which gives detailed information, is in both spanish and english. Also, one thing that I have not seen before, was the effort made for the visually impaired. There was a strip set into the floor, this being meant to be used as a guide. A person could use their cane, and be guided by this strip to a copy of one of the artifacts being displayed. Then by touching the copy with their hands, get an idea of what it looks like. There was also a "sign" in Braille that explained about the object. We had seen this strip in other places in town as well, the good explanation for a very good reason. \nAdmission is only 45 pesos. It is open martes a domingo, 8:30-17:30 h.

639043891.name: Mesmerizing
639043891.author: a TripAdvisor user
639043891.reviewBody: Once you step in front of the Jade Mask, you have to pause everything around and just let yourself be mesmerized by the beauty of the beautiful Maya art.  So worth the trip.

629976595.name: Worth a visit - jade mask is amazing!
629976595.author: a TripAdvisor user
629976595.reviewBody: You don\'t need more than an hour at this museum as it\'s small but it has some very interesting items within it which are very well explained in English (and Spanish of course) so you see some great things but also get a deeper understanding due to the information. There are a number of stone carvings all of which are very interesting and a jade death mask which is just amazing but the explanation in English really brought this to life. If in Campeche this place is worth an hour of your time.

598893851.name: 1 hour is there
598893851.author: a TripAdvisor user
598893851.reviewBody: A good museum if you did not have anything to do. he needs better attention\n\n1 hour is here to tour it is in the city of Campeche

587524720.name: Hidden gem!
587524720.author: a TripAdvisor user
587524720.reviewBody: The is a great museum with some very cool and very old maya artifacts. They have an excellent display in 3 different rooms and you can also walk up the ramp and explore the old wall. The views from the wall are epic and you can see the city from a unique vantage point. It\u2019s only 45 pesos to get in and the exhibits are in the A/C.

561591767.name: Deepen your understanding of Mayan ruins
561591767.author: a TripAdvisor user
561591767.reviewBody: This museum is mostly about the architectural details--carvings and hieroglyphics--of Mayan ceremonial sites, although it does have some information about larger-scale layout and construction of Mayan cities. It houses steles and carved panels from several sites along with interpretive drawings and explanations in Spanish and English of their meaning. For me the explanations had just enough detail to convey a sense of the sophistication and evolution of Mayan culture without overwhelmimg.

555551204.name: Excellent Mayan Pieces
555551204.author: a TripAdvisor user
555551204.reviewBody: This is a small museum located in Baluarte de Soledad (I actually left it out of my baluarte list because I forgot this is one).  The explanations of the pieces is very good, with drawings that help you identify figures in the worn away stone pieces.This is worth the time to see.

544448106.name: It really needs a little more exhibits
544448106.author: a TripAdvisor user
544448106.reviewBody: Whie what is here is quite interesting, you just feel like you need a little more to make this a very good or even great exhibit.

516817871.name: Small but perfectly formed
516817871.author: a TripAdvisor user
516817871.reviewBody:
This museum is great because not only does it have a lot (relative to its small size) of carved Mayan stellae and columns, but they are all accompanied by panels showing the carvings in more detail and explaining what each symbol or aspect of a figure symbolises. 

We really love reading the information about the artefacts so this was great for us; many of the museums we've visited whilst we've been in Mexico have had a lot of objects but without the detailed information that really allows you to engage with them. We've had this same experience at a lot of the ruins we've visited so it was really wonderful to get the explanations of a lot of what we've seen, here in this lovely museum. 

You should also make sure to go up the ramp to the right of the entrance - you can walk up to the roof of the old fortress and from there go along the city wall.

499499433.name: There ar\u00e9 better ones
499499433.author: a TripAdvisor user
499499433.reviewBody: Is small, they will explained part of the local Mayen history, But u can see better if you go directly to de sourse and they ar\u00e9 impresive

483985565.name: Give me More
483985565.author: a TripAdvisor user
483985565.reviewBody: I Just cant get enough  of the Maya history and architecture, and it is so well presented in this museum,friendly staff too...

478089561.name: Good small museum
478089561.author: a TripAdvisor user
478089561.reviewBody: Very small but interesting museum. Some Mayan stelas and excellent exhibition of the jade masks and items found in Calakmul tombs.

476217180.name: good starter before going further exloring the regions maya-ruins
476217180.author: a TripAdvisor user
476217180.reviewBody: We considered this museum as very interesting about the architecture, before venturing out exploring palenque - calakmul en Tikal. We already did some ruins (chichen en ruta puuc). Descriptions are in spanisch though and englishc translations are somtimes inaccurate.

470701690.name: Compact and full
470701690.author: a TripAdvisor user
470701690.reviewBody: A must before visiting some of the surrounding ruins, especially if you didn\'t have the chance to visit other Mayan museums like the one in Merida.  It helps explain a lot and some of what you see has been taken from the sites in this area so there is a connection to where you\'ll visit if you see some ruins like Edzna, Uxmal, etc.

465579655.name: Beautiful
465579655.author: a TripAdvisor user
465579655.reviewBody: I really like museums, the history of the natives may\nGreat culture, do not miss the Yucatan peninsula is magic\nbeautiful. In an hour you travel

457409739.name: Little bit disappointing
457409739.author: a TripAdvisor user
457409739.reviewBody: We stayed in Campeche for about 2.5 days and we went to the museum. We were a little bit disappointed because we had higher expectations. You could just walk through the museum and read the signs and look at the stone statues. Not a \'must see\' but it was nice to see.

454080906.name: Well Worth a Visit
454080906.author: a TripAdvisor user
454080906.reviewBody: Small museum, inexpensive and well laid out. The explanations are excellent. Visited prior to seeing Edzna and it helped understand some things. Great little museum

398952525.name: Small, but well curated.
398952525.author: a TripAdvisor user
398952525.reviewBody: The six rooms of the museum are oddly assembled to accommodate the seventeenth century city wall they\'re housed in, but the exhibits themselves are really quite good.

375938914.name: Small, limited, but well worth the visit
375938914.author: a TripAdvisor user
375938914.reviewBody: The museum is located in a fort just on the outskirts of the historical downlown of Campeche. Yes it is small, It is not the Museum of Anthropology. Yes it has only a few artifacts. But it feels private and what is has is well presented, it is in a restored fort well above the sea. It is apart fro everything, it is quiet and secluded. This is what makes it nice. Unlike the Museum of Anthropology, you do not get overwhelmed. Everything does not seem to look the same after a while. Some of the artifacts that are in all the brochures are in this museum, especially the jade masks.\n\nI really enjoyed my short visit there and I highly recommend it to anyone that is staying in Campeche, more so if you have visited Calakmul and some of the surrounding archaeological sites. Plus you get the bonus of visiting a fort from the past.

356133144.name: Small and informative
356133144.author: a TripAdvisor user
356133144.reviewBody: This small museum located next to a section of the wall facing the sea is fairly informative for its size. However, when viewed in comparison to other larger museums in the state and the region its limited displays can prove to be a slight turn off. Nevertheless, it makes for a good introduction into ancient Mayan history and culture.

352152230.name: An excellent place to view antiquities from the surrounding Mayan city sites
352152230.author: a TripAdvisor user
352152230.reviewBody: The museum is housed in one of the walled city bastions and is blessedly air conditioned.  It has a great cross-section of architectural styles represented in the various architectural elements that have been recovered from cities like Edzna.  It is especially gratifying to see elements that are so well preserved after visiting the sites and seeing the severely deteriorated architecture and adornments there.  Definitely a place to go!

348442578.name: make the time!
348442578.author: a TripAdvisor user
348442578.reviewBody: our airbnb unfortunately did not suit us, so we only had a short evening and morning visit in the colourful unesco city of campeche, the capital city of the state of campeche. there are 1000 heritage buildings in the city. on the morning of our exploring, i popped in here, quite impressive. very well maintained and looked quite new. a small museum, large pieces on exhibit, explanations for each piece. as we only had a few hours to view the town, i didn\'t do justice to this place. it is worth the stop. near one of the towers/bastions, all sights enclosed within the old colonial spanish walls of the city. from here we continued onto the ruins of edzna, an easy 30-45 minute drive away.

357656278.name: best for kids
357656278.author: a TripAdvisor user
357656278.reviewBody: It is nice to see the walls during the night. The show is interesting but more oriented to kids... Nice place for an evening walk in to the past....

264033933.name: Walking through history
264033933.author: a TripAdvisor user
264033933.reviewBody: Well planned, nicely narrated, interesting nighttime activity if you want to know more about the history of the walled city.

217349040.name: Enjoyable and entertaining walking tour
217349040.author: a TripAdvisor user
217349040.reviewBody:
"Vive la Leyenda" walking tour is a great, enjoyable, and entertaining way for knowing the rich history that the downtown of Campeche has. 

This tour is operated mostly by college students doing their internship, therefore, they print a youthful spark in it. 

Do not miss it, it's really worth it.

666045300.name: If you are nearby, go see it
666045300.author: a TripAdvisor user
666045300.reviewBody: It\'s an ok experience, so if you are nearby, go see it. The entrance fee is not high and it\'s a lovely place.

655199834.name: Worth a quick look
655199834.author: a TripAdvisor user
655199834.reviewBody: 5-5 rooms from the colonial era (many of which can be seen from the street). Twenty minutes enough to see.

655085448.name: Great glimpse into past era
655085448.author: a TripAdvisor user
655085448.reviewBody: It was great to get a look behind closed doors to see how the elite once lived in this area. The rooms were filled with period furniture and artifacts, and the architectural details were very interesting. Pictures and information about the people that lived there allowed my take an imaginary trip back in time. Very well done and entrance fee was minimal.\n

654159325.name: Nice to see how the rich lived end of 19th century
654159325.author: a TripAdvisor user
654159325.reviewBody: Nice little place. Also enjoy to take a small rest in the patio. The furniture is showing how the rich lived here in end of 19th century. Yes the rich ones. As in Europe.. Don\'t forget to stop at the litle boutique art shop. some nice handcrafts to buy

653271928.name: Beautiful old home
653271928.author: a TripAdvisor user
653271928.reviewBody: Cost was 20 pesos pp. Gives you a great sense of what old homes were like here as well as what is behind many doors here in Old town Campeche. Was a fairly quick visit. If you felt like lingering you can sit and enjoy the central patio area open to the sky. Two small shops are inside with artisan products as well as a book store. There are also bathrooms available.

650595638.name: Another interesting museum!
650595638.author: a TripAdvisor user
650595638.reviewBody: Nicely done re-creation of early colonial home with many period furnishings.  Little library and gift shop that were closed during our visit.

638799637.name: Nice to see if your in the area
638799637.author: a TripAdvisor user
638799637.reviewBody: Definitely a nice demonstration of how the wealthy use to live. There was not an issue with money here. They have done a nice job to recreate how the rooms would have looked at that time in history

636368477.name: Restored historic home
636368477.author: a TripAdvisor user
636368477.reviewBody: This was a interesting view of the inside of a historic home. A cooler place from the sun to explore Campeche. Bathroom inside.

630388712.name: Colonial House
630388712.author: a TripAdvisor user
630388712.reviewBody: We spent 20 minutes looking at the house which was fairly interesting. If you\'re in town and nothing else to do it\'s worth dropping in for a look.

598656109.name: Nice to see
598656109.author: a TripAdvisor user
598656109.reviewBody: We visited this place, because my friends grandfather lived here.\nIt is nice to see how people lived then.

581698331.name: Beautifully maintained historic home
581698331.author: a TripAdvisor user
581698331.reviewBody: Casa Num\u00e9ro 6 is a beautifully maintained historic home. It\u2019s interesting to see how the people of Campeche lived how the various rooms were decorated.

581464822.name: Open all week long !
581464822.author: a TripAdvisor user
581464822.reviewBody: Just about everything in Campeche is closed on Mondays.  Only 20 pesos admission and interesting enough, nice Moorish style arches in the courtyard.

565862886.name: Charming!
565862886.author: a TripAdvisor user
