565862886.reviewBody: We were walking around the historic district of Campeche in the early evening and recognized Casa No. 6 as a museum that might be of interest of the colonial past. We were so happy that we took the opportunity to enter the museum. The furnishings were reminiscent of several haciendas and mansions of the period. It was a self guided tour and we enjoyed it. We had a couple of questions about the home and asked the young woman at the front desk. She spoke English very well and showed us her favorite places in the house. She really brought to life the family and their lifestyle. She showed us aspects in the kitchen and garden that we had missed. We are grateful for her time and knowledge as it gave us an even greater appreciation of \u2018this period of time.

565857776.name: Unexciting
565857776.author: a TripAdvisor user
565857776.reviewBody: The house is located directly in the center. You pay 20 mex$ per person. You can visit 2-3 rooms with a ragbag of some old furnishings. A quick unexciting pleasure. You can skip it, while visiting campeche.

560343103.name: A glimpse into the past
560343103.author: a TripAdvisor user
560343103.reviewBody: A very interesting glimpse into what it must have been like to live as a wealthy person in Campeche a hundred years ago!

559677752.name: Old style living
559677752.author: a TripAdvisor user
559677752.reviewBody: A little museum exemplifying how people lived here in the pirates and sail boats time. \nIt is a quaint place and will be surprised how well people lived at that time, but you will also thank the gods for new, light and casual ware we use today

556938179.name: Unremarkable
556938179.author: a TripAdvisor user
556938179.reviewBody: You pay very little to visit Casa no. 6, and I think out may not be worth the price. It is a large colonial house, like many others in Campeche. It was decorated with furniture that does not add to the ambience - I found it made the place look almost fake. \n\n

555518304.name: Good Example of Upper Class Cmpeche living
555518304.author: a TripAdvisor user
555518304.reviewBody: Located at the central square, there are a number of period rooms to see.  The kitcheinteresting too.n and patio in the back are

544449350.name: How the wealthy lived
544449350.author: a TripAdvisor user
544449350.reviewBody: This is a restored Casona, or large home, on the main square of Campeche. Furniture of the period are in the restored rooms and help complete a picture of life in Campeche in the 1800s. This will not take very long to go thru but is well worth the $20 peso entry fee.

544124841.name: Beautiful old home
544124841.author: a TripAdvisor user
544124841.reviewBody: Casa No. 6 is on the main square and is an 18th century house with period furnishings - very interesting to see how the well to do lived.  The fee is 20 pesos.

517821066.name: Very interesting
517821066.author: a TripAdvisor user
517821066.reviewBody: Really nicely done up like they lived 18th century. Spanish colonial living,liked the kitchen, library, and patio.

512965164.name: Nice museum
512965164.author: a TripAdvisor user
512965164.reviewBody: We went there to kill the time before our return to Cancun. The admissie is only MXP 20 and therefore worth going. The rooms are all very nice decorated though what surprised me and my children is, what time erna is this museum trying to tell. The house is teh oldest hous in town, but a lot of displayed items are of teh 19th or 20th century. That is confusing.

499498860.name: Its a museum
499498860.author: a TripAdvisor user
499498860.reviewBody: Is part of the historic place of Campeche, from the richiest or one of it, and His they lived, in si de the CAD amurallada

482778170.name: Quick little stroll through the house
482778170.author: a TripAdvisor user
482778170.reviewBody: Interesting to see how the well-to-do lived.\nIt seems like it would comfortable to live there.\nWorth the 20 pesoes admission for a 20 minute visit.

473787004.name: historical home
473787004.author: a TripAdvisor user
473787004.reviewBody: The house had lovely  furniture of which some can be seen from the street when the shutters are open. Like so many houses it ha an open court yard. Some of the description in the  rooms are in English. Like so many museums in the area  the entrance fee is minimum.

471907621.name: A small, yet interesting peek into Mexican culture
471907621.author: a TripAdvisor user
471907621.reviewBody: Off the beautiful square, I went into to take a peek into the cultural leftovers of their olden days.  I enjoyed seeing how the well to do lived and what fabrics were used for their furnishings.

470562170.name: Tiny museum
470562170.author: a TripAdvisor user
470562170.reviewBody: It\'s a nice little getaway to escape the crowds and heat of the main plaza. The museum is tiny. They obviously did their best but all in all it\'s nothing special.

466593904.name: Very interesting, excellent location on the main square
466593904.author: a TripAdvisor user
466593904.reviewBody: Very interesting little museum right on the main square, excellent starting point for a day in the city.  Beautifully set up, excellent descriptions for each room.  There is also a very nice book store (only Spanish tests but a surprisingly broad selection!)

463600051.name: Colonial Wealth
463600051.author: a TripAdvisor user
463600051.reviewBody: This is a nice restored old house.  It is huge and it is only half of its original size.  Nicely restored to when the rich and the famous lived on the plaza and controlled the economy of this trading city.  The house is also a government information centre

460425113.name: Interesting glimpse into home of the wealthy
460425113.author: a TripAdvisor user
460425113.reviewBody: It is worth a brief visit to see the rooms decorated with many furnishings from the past, providing insight into how the wealthy lived. With its high ceilings, ornate decorations and located on the town square, the property obviously was home to a very wealthy family.  We enjoyed seeing the primitive kitchen setup.  The visit is inexpensive and takes very little time.  Worth a viewing.

459819527.name: Nothing better to do?
459819527.author: a TripAdvisor user
459819527.reviewBody: An eclectic collection of everyday items from various eras that will occupy - just about - fifteen minutes of your time. Vaguely interesting. The courtyard is quite photogenic. I\'m struggling to find the required number of characters to complete this review.

454081709.name: Worth a Stop
454081709.author: a TripAdvisor user
454081709.reviewBody: Gives a good idea of life in Campeche for the wealthy in years gone by. Well laid out and inexpensive. Does not take long to do a walk through.

453246345.name: Traditional Home
453246345.author: a TripAdvisor user
453246345.reviewBody: This is how well to do people in Campeche used to live 100 years ago. The house is immaculate and will take just a few minutes to walk around. Right acroos from the main plaza. Worth visiting

452468204.name: Could use a little bit more enthusiasm
452468204.author: a TripAdvisor user
452468204.reviewBody: Went there because they advertized the making of hot chocolate the original way but they said they no longer had that event.  It is common to have things advertized that no longer exist in Mexico but even though we are used to that it is always disappointing.  Very quick 5-6 room tour with little informationg but nice site.  The staff was less than enthusiastic by our presence.  A bit of a cooler place to hangout on a warm afternoon.

449956925.name: Great museum
449956925.author: a TripAdvisor user
449956925.reviewBody: This is a great museum where you can see how the rich people from the 19th century used to live in the colonial time in Cozumel. The house is beautiful with antique furniture and a nice atmosphere

448118136.name: Nice
448118136.author: a TripAdvisor user
448118136.reviewBody: See how the people of Campeche furnished their houses and lived. The wealthy people, who could afford a mansion on the main square.  Very nicely conserved and restored. A trip back in time.

444440283.name: Nice stop
444440283.author: a TripAdvisor user
444440283.reviewBody: This is a very convenient stop being right on the square.  Period items were all well presented and preserved.  Well worth the 20 peso admission.

441155541.name: 3 or 4 stars, cheap but a bit boring
441155541.author: a TripAdvisor user
441155541.reviewBody: We couldnt decide if 3 or 4 stars, but cause it was a bit boring it gonna be only 3. entrance fee is only 20 Pesos, but you cant see much more than you already saw from the outside

439508543.name: Worth  a visit
439508543.author: a TripAdvisor user
439508543.reviewBody: Its all on one floor , a chance to step back in time ..it was the residence of one of the founding families

428892002.name: A glimce into 19th Century life in Colonial Mexico
428892002.author: a TripAdvisor user
428892002.reviewBody: Casa No. 6 is located on the main Square in "El Centro" of Campeche. It is furnished as it was in the mid 1800\'s. The high ceilings ... Bedrooms...office...open court yard... Patio off the Kitchen. A very authentic reproduction of life  of the privileged....and it was free!

425172338.name: Lovely
425172338.author: a TripAdvisor user
425172338.reviewBody: It\'s super cheap to get in and there\'s some really lovely furniture and clothing etc to look at but it takes about 15 minutes to go round. Descriptions in both Spanish and English though which was good! Cute little shop which we didn\'t go in but there looked like there was some cute stuff. Worth it if you\'re looking for something to do in Campeche and you want to know a little about how people lived in Mexico at that time (1800?)

385513012.name: Worth a visit
385513012.author: a TripAdvisor user
385513012.reviewBody: This is a pleasant little museum that is worth calling in to as you\'re passing. It\'s quite small but cheap to get in and gives an insight into the privileged lifestyle of the Mexican upper classes in days gone by. It\'s a lovely building in its own right to.

385407169.name: Great museum!
385407169.author: a TripAdvisor user
385407169.reviewBody: This museum is great for seeing what a typical house was like back in the days.  The admission is very minimal.  There is a nice gift shop and book store to end your visit here.  Located right in the city center.

363601695.name: Cute little mueseum!
363601695.author: a TripAdvisor user
363601695.reviewBody: For 20 pesos this is a cute little muesum in the center providing a feel of the upper class in Mexico.   It has some interesting period pieces and its fun to see the layout of a typical upper class home of the era.  Maxium time is probably half hour.   Cute little gift shop...

357655510.name: back to the past
357655510.author: a TripAdvisor user
357655510.reviewBody: It is nice to see how old colonial houses looked like from the inside. Nice visit for a change, especialy on a rainy day....

355363121.name: Great Quick Stop - Info in English
355363121.author: a TripAdvisor user
355363121.reviewBody: My family of four (two elementary kids) had an enjoyable time at Casa No. 6. Initially, the kids were complaining that I was dragging them here, but they enjoyed looking through the rooms and asked many questions. The information in English was nice too. I recommend a quick visit for families. I believe we paid 15-20 pesos per adults. Kids are free.

346697162.name: Small but worth a look
346697162.author: a TripAdvisor user
346697162.reviewBody: Right on the main square. Gives you a good sense of what a well to do family lived like. About half a dozen rooms with the inevitable shop.

345463318.name: Nice typical/traditional case in the center by the plaza
345463318.author: a TripAdvisor user
345463318.reviewBody: This is a nice small museum and worth the 1.- USD/EUR entrance. You wont stay long but get a good idea about the living of wealthy people some time ago.\nTripadvisor only offers "average" and "very good" - I would place it in the middle, but worth a visit.

345284762.name: Worth the 20 pesos admission.
345284762.author: a TripAdvisor user
345284762.reviewBody: This is an old mansion directly across from the town square in downtown Campeche. It has furniture and items that are a mix of original and reproductions. It\'s a quick self guided tour that is a nice break from shopping.

345074664.name: Worth a  detour from the square
345074664.author: a TripAdvisor user
345074664.reviewBody: A few nicely furnished late nineteenth century colonial rooms - nothing special, but it\'s right on the main square of Campeche

340534127.name: Small museum
340534127.author: a TripAdvisor user
340534127.reviewBody: This museum was much smaller than I expected. There were three rooms set-up with antique furniture from the colonial era. The descriptions about the rooms/decor were minimal. It only takes 30 minutes or less to see the whole museum. There is a bookshop and gift shop inside.

340358358.name: Good way to see how people lived
340358358.author: a TripAdvisor user
340358358.reviewBody: This place is very well taken care of and worth the modest entrance fee.  Good place to cool off as well.

325694665.name: Nice and small museum
325694665.author: a TripAdvisor user
325694665.reviewBody: It was nice to visit this "casona" (big house) and to appreciate the life style of high society families in Campeche from seventeenth to nineteenth centuries. Also, they have a small library and a souvenirs store.

321275495.name: A Windows through time
321275495.author: a TripAdvisor user
321275495.reviewBody: What a great place, and what a wonderful way to not only capture colonial life ( granted from the richer perspective ) but it allows your mind to imagine life as it was them. \n\nWell worth the small entrance fee

307885650.name: Good look back at the history of Campeche
307885650.author: a TripAdvisor user
307885650.reviewBody: A pleasant half an hour spent gaining a greater understanding as to what life was life way back when. Rooms well laid out, lovely view of the square and a good gift shop with items from local artisans

294577881.name: Camoeche culture, great example of how life was dine here
294577881.author: a TripAdvisor user
294577881.reviewBody: Great way to see how old Campeche was, this place is built with local furniture and decorated exactly how our grand parents used to live, yet another "must see" places when visiting Campeche

283256107.name: Beautiful home
283256107.author: a TripAdvisor user
283256107.reviewBody: Interesting history.  It\'s a beautiful home right on the central square.  Includes lovely furniture and artefacts.  Cheap entry and well worth a visit

269560325.name: Great place for quick stop
269560325.author: a TripAdvisor user
269560325.reviewBody: Great stop while walking around the historic center. Only takes about 20 mins to see and read everything, but worth the 20MX. Beautiful house, well restored.

267141435.name: Nice historical house
267141435.author: a TripAdvisor user
267141435.reviewBody: You can look in the windows as you walk by on the plaza, but the admission is so cheap that you should pay to go inside. The rooms are well done, with interesting historical information. Explore the center courtyard, the shop with great chocolate, and the garden in the back.

266040895.name: Not so big and not so special
266040895.author: a TripAdvisor user
266040895.reviewBody: Nice but in 15 minutes you have seen it. Do not take a guide because you risk he will explain every little pot just to fill the time...

256975144.name: Little to see
256975144.author: a TripAdvisor user
256975144.reviewBody: The rooms looked like many of the hotels we\'ve seen in central America, tired and dusty! You could see most of it through the windows in the street!

252576817.name: Interesting museum although not special
252576817.author: a TripAdvisor user
252576817.reviewBody: Definitely an interesting museum that gives you an idea of how the colonial houses were. It\'s a bit small but there are explanations everywhere. It is worth a visit given the small entry fee

241495947.name: Nice museum
241495947.author: a TripAdvisor user
241495947.reviewBody:
It's a small museum but you can see what it was the life of Campeche back then. 

Amazing furniture and what i loved the most was to see the kitchen and the old dresses. 

There is also a small store with cool things to buy.

240845033.name: Very ,very  small...watch outfor the surly girl on the door!
240845033.author: a TripAdvisor user
240845033.reviewBody: While this is a great restored house, it is so small, that you can see it all from the front windows in the street. The unfriendly girl at the entrance, tries to give the wrong change, and waits to see if the \'tourist\' has noticed before correcting the short change..no smiles and no apology.

234175622.name: Fascinating
234175622.author: a TripAdvisor user
234175622.reviewBody: This building is a restored house of what the buildings in the historic district looked like after the Spanish settled there in the mid 1500\'s and is absolutely worth a visit. Entry fee is only 20 pesos and gives an insight into history.

644316723.name: A jewel
644316723.author: a TripAdvisor user
644316723.reviewBody: The Hormiguero ruins are not well known and not publisized as they should be. It is off the beaten track but not that far and easy to get to from the town of Xpuhil. Even though its main attraction is only the main temple, this is a magnificent example of the Maya Rio Bec style! Worth seeing? Yes!

607446869.name: Hormiguero
607446869.author: a TripAdvisor user
607446869.reviewBody: It\'s a nice little side with just a few structure a couple of which are in the process of restoration. The main temple is a Rio Bec style edifice with well preserved ornaments. I think the admission is free. No climbing allowed.

544849718.name: Beautiful site - no one there
544849718.author: a TripAdvisor user
544849718.reviewBody: Hormiguero is a small site with just a few excavated ruins.  The first structure has a great monster mask and other decoration.  There is also a temple with Chac masks on the corners. There are some good trails into the jungle. Hormigureo is 35 km, about 45 minutes from Xpuhil.  If you have the time, this is worth it!

465100404.name: Remote but Great
465100404.author: a TripAdvisor user
465100404.reviewBody: It\'s necessary to go down a road that is very slow and probably very difficult in the rainy season (we were there in the dry season).  The challenging bit of road is not too long, so it\'s not too bad. The ruin is definitely worth the drive, and has some unique architectural details even in the Rio Bec style.

446288312.name: Off the beaten path for sure
446288312.author: a TripAdvisor user
446288312.reviewBody: Three excavated buildings but other jungle covered mounds everywhere.  2/3 buildings are quite cool.  Admission is free, nobody else there.  You need to drive about 2kms down a jungle shrouded \'trail\', past the bajo and nature trail parking area to the dead end, the rest of the approach is paved.  The guy at admission was very nice.  Super secluded ruins that are only worth the effort if you\'ve got some time.  The best in the area is Becan.

376557237.name: Small, but worth the trip!
376557237.author: a TripAdvisor user
376557237.reviewBody: Hormiguero is very small \u2013 really only two excavated structures. It was definitely worth the trip, however. Both structures have a couple of the nicest facades I\'ve seen in the area. The site was free when I was there, and there were no other visitors. Once you get closer to the site, the road turns into a two-track. Just keep going!

247239020.name: Worth every  bump and pothole along way
247239020.author: a TripAdvisor user
247239020.reviewBody:
If you are not in a hurry to go to Calakmul, try to make it to El Hormiguero. The site is so dramatic and fascinating that it is totally worth the efforts to get there. 

The monster mouth entrance alone will make you wonder why many more people would not visit this fantastic site. 

Only one other car was in the parking area when we arrived. We were eating lunch in our car when the site attendant came to check out why nobody went to the entrance. That's how few visitors he sees. Only two more visitors arrived while we were there.

Getting there is not as bad as I had anticipated. The turn off from the main road is in the center of Xpujil. The road is paved for nearly 20 km. The remaining ~ 3 km. is a narrow 1 car dirt road into the jungle that our compact rental car could negotiate without problem.  

Don't miss it.

234186210.name: Wrong
234186210.author: a TripAdvisor user
234186210.reviewBody: Since this site is located approximately five hours from Campeche City, it should be listed as a Xpuhil attraction or an Escarcega attraction.

201593054.name: If you like Monster Mouth buildings, this place has them!
201593054.author: a TripAdvisor user
201593054.reviewBody: Hormiguero is a rather large (though not daunting) Rio Bec-style site which especially features the famous Monster Mouth entrances. These are fantastically decorated friezes depicting Itzamna, the terrible Mayan god, Monster of the Earth...A door represents its mouth, and the upper friezes represent its eyes and eyebrows; the bottom sill is decorated with curved stones, representing its teeth, the side friezes represents its ears, etc. Fantastic stuff. The Mayans believed that one who entered by the door (the mouth, remember?), actually entered Itzamnal\'s body and therefore, the entrance to the underworld.\nUnfortunately, the road to Hormiguero is REALLY terrible with hundreds of potholes and broken asphalt, making the trip there pretty harrowing. Yet, for Mayan ruins fans, it\'s hard to pass up!

198067192.name: Hormiguero, a masterpiece
198067192.author: a TripAdvisor user
198067192.reviewBody: On October 2012 we contacted Nicolas of Ka\'an Expeditions to take us to visit the ruins of Calakmul. On this occasion, march 2014, he took us to Hormiguero. I was expecting some stylized archeological ruins, some high towers and maybe a pyramid. We saw a huge main building whose front part has a magnificent facade. I do not know if an enormous door decorated the facade or if the facade decorated the door. Please, see the attached photos and judge by yourself.

161925944.name: Beware!!  Searching out and finding ruins like this can be contagious
161925944.author: a TripAdvisor user
161925944.reviewBody: The Chenes style monster mouth doorway is what you visit this site to see.  This is one of the most impressive buildings that you will see in the area.  There is nothing like this at Calakmul.  The site is a little off the beaten path, but well worth the drive, IMHO.

160314750.name: Extraordinary Stonework
160314750.author: a TripAdvisor user
160314750.reviewBody: The location is a bit removed, and the site itself isn\'t very large.  However, the architecture and stonework are extraordinary, and the Earthmonster gateway is a jewel.  Well worth going out of your way to see these ruins.

155297591.name: Hormiguero, put this on your list of Mayan ruins to see !
155297591.author: a TripAdvisor user
155297591.reviewBody: Another great Mayan ruin you will enjoy seeing. If you like Mayan ruins, you will love this nice medium sized ruin,too. We haven\'t missed any of the Chen/Rio Bec Mayan ruins. Enjoy ! Skippyfrizz

154869090.name: Well worth visiting
154869090.author: a TripAdvisor user
154869090.reviewBody: We visited Hormiguero in February of 2013. The road is a 7 km dirt road, but it was in good condition. We had no problem driving there in our little rental car. Do not be scared off by reports of terrible road, it is easy to get there in dry weather.\nBecause the site is so rarely visited, it was free. But that doesn\'t mean it isn\'t worth seeing.\nHormiguero has two well preserved buildings, Structure II and Structure V. Both buildings have well preserved monster masks with elaborate facades. It is fun to stand in the doorways, which are the jaws of the god, and pretend to be a high priest communicating with the spirit world. During the Mayan era, these masks would have been elaborately painted and most have been truly impressive. It only takes a couple hours to visit Hormiguero, so if you can squeeze in a visit, I highly recommend it.

148589906.name: Long trek but fabulous ruins
148589906.author: a TripAdvisor user
148589906.reviewBody: It\'s very hard to get there, but the ruins are definitely worth it. There are two structures: a Palace and a Temple behind it. The palace is smaller than the one in Xpujil, but much better preserved, with two towers instead of three. The decorations are as amazing as in Chicanna. The temple has the most intricately decorated tower I have ever seen. The road to get there is arduous. It\'s 20 km from Xpujil and the first 13 km are perfectly comfortable. But the last 7 km were the toughest I have ever seen - first gigantic potholes on a paved road, then a dirt road and finally a narrow path through the jungle where no two cars could ever pass each other (fortunately there were no other cars). A jeep (which I had) is highly recommended.

650904576.name: Underwater museum
650904576.author: a TripAdvisor user
650904576.reviewBody: This was a referal from a lady we met un the bus that they now have a display of many underwater artifacts that has been recovered.  No where does the website make reference to it so we took our chances.... well worth the visit and 50 peso taxi ride to get there.  Enough English to understand the discoveries.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Historico de San Jose el Alto

649233962.name: Underwater archeology
649233962.author: a TripAdvisor user
649233962.reviewBody: The fort/museum is in a hilltop right in Campeche, with an amazing view of the area. Though it\u2019s not big, it\u2019s nicely set, with multimedia, recovered artifacts from sunken ships and it\u2019s bilingual. Worth the trip.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Historico de San Jose el Alto

640417347.name: Trip to see the Nautical arqeology of Campeche
640417347.author: a TripAdvisor user
640417347.reviewBody: The museum is located at the top of a large hill overlooking Campeche. and the sea. It is an easy Taxi ride from your hotel. A good deal of Nautical history is there and a nice view also.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Historico de San Jose el Alto

612435009.name: Historical fort and museum
612435009.author: a TripAdvisor user
612435009.reviewBody: This historical fort was built outside the walled town of Campeche. It is now a museum and also offers great views of the coastline.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Historico de San Jose el Alto

610313109.name: Ecxellent and bilingual
610313109.author: a TripAdvisor user
610313109.reviewBody: What do you do with an old fort?  Especially when you\'ve got an almost-identical one on the other end of town?\nIn this case, Mexico installed a unique museum of underwater archaeology.  You will see artifacts from sunken galleons and pirate ships, but also things found in the underground caves and cenotes of Yucatan.  It is all presented and lit beautifully and practically all in both English and Spanish.\nThis is NOT walkable from Centro!  Take a taxi (or figure out the local buses).

itemReviewed.name: Museo Historico de San Jose el Alto

604700949.name: Pure history!
604700949.author: a TripAdvisor user
604700949.reviewBody: When visiting this place, take in consideration to enter into a neighborhood with a very tiny streets and very steep too. But once you get to the top, you will enjoy the beautiful view off the city and the sea as well. Nice place to visit.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Historico de San Jose el Alto

672587086.name: Interesting old church which houses the "black christ"
672587086.author: a TripAdvisor user
672587086.reviewBody: Simple, old, barrio church which is in use daily as a place of worship. The black christ is much larger then we expected, almost life size, and lighted very well.

649233552.name: Beautiful and modest
649233552.author: a TripAdvisor user
649233552.reviewBody: The church is not as big and sumptuous as I imagined but it\u2019s very well kept and preserved. The image of the black Christ is beautiful and unique.

640424267.name: Campeche\'s Cristo Negro.
640424267.author: a TripAdvisor user
640424267.reviewBody: Iglesia de San Roman is as its name implies, located in one of Campeche\'s original barrios, San Roman, an easy walk from the Centro Historic. This small church is well known for being the home of the "Cristo Negro". This icon, carved in Italy and brought to the church in the 1570\'s, is well worth coming to see! \nAside from El Cristo Negro, the church is in itself worth a visit. It is one of a number of old and historic churches in Campeche, outside, its simple architecture accentuated with a single bell tower. Inside, the interior is brightened up by stained glass windows and the carved, inlaid altar pieces, in the centre of which El Cristo Negro is displayed. I think what I find most appealing about the style of these Franciscan churches is their simplicity, they retain a certain degree of dignity. Campeche has a number of these fine, historic buildings!

612435409.name: Old church with the "Black Christ"
612435409.author: a TripAdvisor user
612435409.reviewBody: This is the church in Campeche that houses the "Black Christ", carved from ebony wood. It is a famous crucifix and there are stories of the miraculous journey of how it arrived at Campeche after being crafted in Europe.

592723760.name: Worth a look
592723760.author: a TripAdvisor user
592723760.reviewBody: This church is very pretty and it has a black jesus. The campechanos are very proud of this church and we had a local who brought us here. I liked it and definitely enjoyed seeing something different than what I would be used to seeing in a church, but I would not make it a point to go out of my way to come here. Don\'t get me wrong, it\'s beautiful, but a little bit removed from the city center.

642713841.name: AMAZING!
642713841.author: a TripAdvisor user
642713841.reviewBody: One of the nicest Mayan ruins in all of the Yucatan!  Be sure to go here, but you have to have a car.  The Palacio is one of the most amazing buildings in all of Mayalandia.  You will probably be the only people here, we were.

itemReviewed.name: Zona Arqueologica de Santa Rosa Xtampac

571096767.name: Great place but difficult to reach
571096767.author: a TripAdvisor user
571096767.reviewBody: Our tour included Edzna and Santa Rosa. Most of the arqueological sites around this region are fantastic with a lot to see and learn. Unfortunately they are not prepared for handycaped and have very limited services. You need to carry your water, toilet paper, soap, etc. and be prepared to walk a lot and in some cases long distances. In Santa Rosa you need to walk up the hill.... but if you can do it, do it!... it\'s worthy.

itemReviewed.name: Zona Arqueologica de Santa Rosa Xtampac

566936777.name: OMG!
566936777.author: a TripAdvisor user
566936777.reviewBody: OMG! From the drive that felt like the never-ending story,  16km from main highway then another 18km on a pitted single lane road to arrive upon a large level parking area (we were the only visitors). "Welcome" was spelled out in white painted stones from the friendly keeper. You have to experience an eco-toilet, but do your research first! \nEverything was clean and tidy for being so remote. Then OMG, the treacherous trek up a steep pathway made of roots and boulders and loose stones! Wear supportive shoes. And finally OMG there before you is a well reconstructed site with plenty of shade and Spanish moss hanging from the trees. It was so nice to experience this sacred place all to ourselves. Not a huge as the more popular ruins, but we\'ll worth the effort to get there in the hot Mexico sun. This is one of our new favorites!

itemReviewed.name: Zona Arqueologica de Santa Rosa Xtampac

566931156.name: Xtampak
566931156.author: a TripAdvisor user
566931156.reviewBody:
If you drive to Xtampak from Uxmal down Rt 261 your GPS will most likely route you the shortest distance making a left turn onto a dirt road some 7-8 south of Bolonchen. Don't yield to temptation. Continue south for another 15 km until you see a sign to Xtampak and make a left onto a paved road there. Although initially pretty good it, too, turns into old asphalt peppered with potholes after the first 5-6 km, so I can only imagine how bad the dirt road is. 

The site is quite remote so chances are you will be the only one there. The path from the ticket booth is somewhat strenuous but the site itself is flat.
 
 
OT: I stopped writing reviews on TA since past summer as TA editors, being the morons that they are, deleted some of my reviews for not adhering to their standards even though some of those reviews were marked as helpful by other TA readers. But of course TA editors in their infinite wisdom know better what's helpful. So from now on I will write reviews only when I think the info may be important and helpful to other members. Sorry for making you reading my rant.

itemReviewed.name: Zona Arqueologica de Santa Rosa Xtampac

544295497.name: About 2 hours from Campeche City
544295497.author: a TripAdvisor user
544295497.reviewBody: Santa Rosa is a fairly large site which was a regional capital and part of the Calakmul group.  The palace is impressive with 3 levels and many rooms, but climbing the stairs is not allowed. There are several other courtyards and a long, narrow passageway between buildings - kind of an alley. There was hardly anyone else there. We had a car and combined Santa Rosa with Hochob and Tabasqueno - a long day.

itemReviewed.name: Zona Arqueologica de Santa Rosa Xtampac

458499426.name: A very old site.
458499426.author: a TripAdvisor user
458499426.reviewBody: The site of Xtampac dates back to the late/middle pre-classic period (350 BC).  Although the original name of the site has been lost, Xtampac means \'old walls\'.  The architectural style is both Chenes & Puuc.  This is an old (and historically significant) site, but due to it\'s location (away from major tourist centers), it is not seen by many tourists.

itemReviewed.name: Zona Arqueologica de Santa Rosa Xtampac

444434994.name: Well worth the extra time
444434994.author: a TripAdvisor user
444434994.reviewBody: This ruin is well off the beaten track but worth the extra 2 hours it takes you to get there.  There will be no one else there, always a plus to me.  It will take about an hour to see.  Excavated buildings are in great shape.  Lots of painted pot shards laying everywhere as well as partially knapped flints and grinding stones, also a big plus.  Wish I would have put on my tennis shoes for the walk up to the ruin, probably a quarter mile but gets steep and rocky in places.

itemReviewed.name: Zona Arqueologica de Santa Rosa Xtampac

385409849.name: Pristine, Remote and Amazing!
385409849.author: a TripAdvisor user
385409849.reviewBody: Recommend booking this tour through El Tucan Tours.  It is hard to get to, out in the middle of nowhere, but well worth it!  Given that very few people have visited here, the ruins are in great shape and it is a step back in time!

itemReviewed.name: Zona Arqueologica de Santa Rosa Xtampac

670769062.name: Simople, small botanical garden inside the walls of a fort
670769062.author: a TripAdvisor user
670769062.reviewBody: This garden is located inside the walls of one of the forts built into the walls of the city. Nice, quiet place with mainly local plants and trees and birds. Cost is 10 pesos.

660050412.name: Quaint
660050412.author: a TripAdvisor user
660050412.reviewBody: Quaint garden in the city plus mini fish pond.  A welcome use of space in the city. 15 pesos for a 5 min stroll. Nothing super interesting but I did enjoy it.

654159880.name: nice little oasis of plants
654159880.author: a TripAdvisor user
654159880.reviewBody: Small place; but good to read your book. So escpae for half hour from the hectic and sunshine of the day. Under many palms and also a little art collection is shown.

653275239.name: Nothing too special
653275239.author: a TripAdvisor user
653275239.reviewBody: 15 pesos for entry. It\'s mainly trees that seem to be generally healthy. Perhaps it\'s the time of year. Definitely not as lush and well tended as other botanical gardens by a long shot. It\'s basically just a little oasis of greenery and shade that will take you all of 2 minutes to walk through if you go slow. Bathrooms are available.

649233289.name: Quiet environment
649233289.author: a TripAdvisor user
649233289.reviewBody: It\u2019s quite cheap to enter and that is exactly what you get. It\u2019s small, it doesn\u2019t have a ton of plants but it\u2019s quiet and peaceful. I wouldn\u2019t say it\u2019s a must.

602659092.name: Serene spot
602659092.author: a TripAdvisor user
602659092.reviewBody: This place invites to life reflection, a peaceful sense of life itself, music is relaxing and creates the perfect insight. Beautifully preserved, my teens loved it.

561588944.name: Quiet green space
561588944.author: a TripAdvisor user
561588944.reviewBody: This small walled garden is a pleasant escape from the heat and bustle of Campeche\'s old city. There are no flower beds but many mature trees shading the walkways and a few benches to rest on. Most trees and some bushes have signs with scientific and common names. In a corner I found interesting free pamphlets about Campeche and its history that were not available at the tourist information kiosks.

544125069.name: A little oasis in the city
544125069.author: a TripAdvisor user
544125069.reviewBody: This is very small but well done.  The entry fee is 15 pesos, and there are benches to sit and rest in the cool shade. It\'s located in one of the old forts that made up part of the city wall.

501407300.name: Small But Peaceful
501407300.author: a TripAdvisor user
501407300.reviewBody:
This garden is very small (about 1/4 of one block) but is a peaceful and shady respite from the summer heat of Campeche.  There are small rope swings you can sit in and listen to the breeze in the trees.  

And at 15 pesos, a little over $1, why not!

Insider tip:  they have restrooms, so that can be worth the price of admission under certain circumstances.

485460612.name: Would not recommend
485460612.author: a TripAdvisor user
485460612.reviewBody: The pictures they use for advertisement are completely different, I wish it looked like that. Plants are just ok and you can walk all around in two minutes. Not worth the money nor the time.

483982412.name: Place to Escape the Heat
483982412.author: a TripAdvisor user
483982412.reviewBody: On a late hot and humid afternoon this was a perfect place to go into to escape from the heat , birds , a small water feature, lots of trees and plants and a place to sit and  enjoy the old castle walls ..

481293699.name: Costs about 1 peso per minute if you walk slow. $15 peso per person.
481293699.author: a TripAdvisor user
481293699.reviewBody: The old structure it is in is in many ways more interesting then the gardens. There needs to be much more but there is little space. This place is tiny. Highlight for us was the largest traveler palm we have ever seen. if you are walking by and need a shady break it is a good choice. Catching a cab to see this is a waste of cab fare.

473787735.name: small
473787735.author: a TripAdvisor user
473787735.reviewBody: I was told before hand that it was small, but it did not thing it would be that small. However it is lovely presented. On a hot day it provides welcoming  shade. There are a few benches for relaxation. For less than $! it is OK

470608153.name: Tiny
470608153.author: a TripAdvisor user
470608153.reviewBody: This is a very small botanicus garden, but if you\'re passing by or want to escape the city\'s noises and heat this garden is worth an (1/2) hour or so of your time.

464859118.name: Only if you\'re walking by...
464859118.author: a TripAdvisor user
464859118.reviewBody: This interesting structure needs more plants to fill in between the trees. If you\'re a botany specialist, the names of the trees would be interesting to know. Otherwise, I wouldn\'t consider this a destination. So tiny I can\'t imagine what this space could be used for - unless there\'s a future need to store ammunition!

460428679.name: Tiny oasis in the city
460428679.author: a TripAdvisor user
460428679.reviewBody: Gurgling water, a small pond and a few benches where you can sit under the shade of various plants and trees and relax for a few minutes.  But we really wanted to get to know some of the flora of the region.  This tiny botanical garden did a nice job of putting up signs to identify the plants.  We took photos of the leaves of the plants and trees, then took a photo of the identifying markers.  Now all I have to do is translate the names.  Worth a brief visit if nothing else but to enjoy the shade and tranquility.

455468539.name: Small but cool
455468539.author: a TripAdvisor user
455468539.reviewBody: A little shade, a little pond, a small space to relax in between all the various things you visit in a day in Campeche.  Yes, very small for the price but we are all for supporting anything to do with plants, environment, participation in the outdoors.  Some of the main plants were, unfortunately, not labeled.

445433534.name: Very small for the entrance price
445433534.author: a TripAdvisor user
445433534.reviewBody: I would not recommend visiting the botanical garden in Campeche.\n\nThe garden is housed in an old tower, and although very atmospheric, I don\'t consider that there is enough to see to justify the M$ 15 entrance fee.

441245042.name: Nice Baluarte to visit
441245042.author: a TripAdvisor user
441245042.reviewBody: Without being a "must-see" place, it is worth to visit if you pass by. You may have a moment to rest under a nice trees\' shadow.

439935946.name: Small
439935946.author: a TripAdvisor user
439935946.reviewBody: Really pathetically small and not worth even the 15 peso entrance fee. Despite a heavy rain the previous day, the plants looked desiccated.

425662450.name: Great Botanico Garden.
425662450.author: a TripAdvisor user
425662450.reviewBody: Close to the square in a corner of the Old Wall! The plants are huge ...what we have as house plants ...some are trees!

394320011.name: Small but beautiful botanical gardens in Campeche
394320011.author: a TripAdvisor user
394320011.reviewBody: Several pathways wind around the small gardens and pond inside the baluarte. You could easily see it all in an hour or if needing a quiet place to relax, or read you could stay for hours. A perfect outing for young children. Many kinds of plants, fish and flowers to identify.

388783565.name: Tiny!
388783565.author: a TripAdvisor user
388783565.reviewBody: Although the garden itself is quite attractive and is nicely set within a small fort, it is absolutely tiny. It takes about two minutes to see everything. The $15 peso charge was worth it to get to use the toilet. It\'s nice to see if you\'re passing by, but I wouldn\'t go out of my way to visit.

371003716.name: worth a peep whilst in Campeche ...
371003716.author: a TripAdvisor user
371003716.reviewBody: The small botanical garden is set within one of the surviving bastions of the city walls, which in itself makes it a nice historic place to visit. \nWell maintained with a variety of tropical and indigenous plants, small ponds and fountains it is a really enjoyable peaceful place to visit. \nAs i said it is quite small and only merits a 30 minute visit, entry fee 15 pesos but worth it to support the upkeep and opening of this little gem in Campeche.

356132219.name: Small but somewhat overpriced
356132219.author: a TripAdvisor user
356132219.reviewBody: This small botanical garden, while well maintained and containing a good representation of the regional flora is, in my opinion, entirely worth the entrance fee. Nestled behind a section of the local wall this tiny garden can be walked around in about 5 minutes and while it might make for a welcome respite from the day\'s heat, does not necessarily count as "must-see" item within the city\'s wider list of attractions.

352927774.name: TOO SMALL
352927774.author: a TripAdvisor user
352927774.reviewBody: Small botanical garden is interesting just because it is set in a small fortress! Attractive look from the outside, but from the inside it is just to small for a reasionable visit... Although well maintained and organized.

340719470.name: 1 of many stops.
340719470.author: a TripAdvisor user
340719470.reviewBody: we only had a morning to wander about campeche, as our airbnb lodgings didn\'t suit us. so after an eve and overnight stay, we explored the town before heading out to merida, with a stop at the ruins of edzna first. the guide book states there are 250 species of tropical plants in this garden, which i obviously didn\'t appreciate. the walled in garden is situated in the baluarte(bulwark) de santiago. as others have mentioned it is a bit quirky, with it\'s many ceramic animals etc. small garden as in teeny. well taken care of. i wouldn\'t go out of my way to find it, however it was on along the way, so we popped in. we were able to use the bano, a bonus when walking about exploring!

266517522.name: Strange place...
266517522.author: a TripAdvisor user
266517522.reviewBody: Very tiny. The guy of the entrance was taking pictures of me all over my stay, pretending not to. Unfortunatly his camera had a flash. What is going on there?

255631907.name: Worth risking your life to get to this little green gem
255631907.author: a TripAdvisor user
255631907.reviewBody: As Botanical Gardens go, this must be one of the smallest and quirkiest, tucked away as it is inside a rather small bastion in the old walls of Campeche; and it is very awkward to get through the whirling traffic to reach the door.. However it does provide a blessed patch of cool greenery  and seats which give rest for tired feet as well as some lovely plants -, not to mention a hilarious add-on to the CCTV system (I won\'t spoil the joke by telling what it is).

675278709.name: Nice, lowkeyed plaza
675278709.author: a TripAdvisor user
675278709.reviewBody: Central plazas often give you a good sense of a town, and this was the case in Campeche. The plaza is pleasant, low-keyed, and not crowded at all. Several major buildings face the plaza, inlcuding the cathederal.

670770672.name: Heart of the old city
670770672.author: a TripAdvisor user
670770672.reviewBody: Beautiful plaze to set and watch the life of Campche. Large trees shade the cast iron benches beware the pigeon droppings from them though. The cental kiosk houses tourist info and tickets for the trolleyride around the city, 100 pesos and approx. one hour of a excellent view thru the city.

649424017.name: Center of Town
649424017.author: a TripAdvisor user
649424017.reviewBody:
Drove 2.5 hours to Campeche, the walled city. It was definitely worth the drive. The streets within the walled part of the city are extremely narrow. Parking is definitely difficult to find. There are lots of stores and restaurants as you stroll through the streets. All the buildings are painted bright colors. We viewed the sea gate and main guardhouse.

Independence Square with the beautiful cathedral and the pavilion in the center. Very family-friendly.

640213198.name: The sum of the "Square" is culture!
640213198.author: a TripAdvisor user
640213198.reviewBody:
Much of what happens in Campeche seems to take place around the Plaza de la Independencia. The square, which features a large gazebo, where the tourist info booth is located, dates back to the mid 16th century. It is a place where the community seems to gather, indeed, you can get your shoes shined or just sit and watch the world unfold. In the evenings, there are different events taking place here.We were here the first week of December, the beginning of FICH Festival Internacional 2018, an annual affair that takes place every year. These free events happen around town and significantly in the Plaza. On our last night here, the Campeche Orchestra, backed up by talented singers, played their lively music to a very enthusiastic crowd.
Also, every Friday, Saturday and Sunday night , there is a 30 minute light and sound show, depicting Campeche's history, projected on El Palacio Centro Cultural, very spectacular. 
Must sees around the plaza, include Santa Iglesia Catedral, located on the  east side, Casa No. 6, a restored colonial casa, is on the west side and if you desire a tour of the city and the surrounding barrios, you can take Transporte Touristico, This pleasant, open- air tourist bus is located on the south end. For 100 pesos p/p, you can take a tour which takes you though the old town and the barrio of San Francisco, along the Malecon, to the barrio of San Roman and back to the plaza. Among the buildings that you will see are Iglesia de San Francisco and the Iglesia de San Roman, where you will make a short stop.This small, beautiful church features the Cristo Negro. This tour is very much worthwhile.
The Plaza de la Independencia is centrally located, you cannot avoid coming here to visit.

556275391.name: Busy yet peaceful
556275391.author: a TripAdvisor user
556275391.reviewBody: A great place to sit and people watch. Walk through the buildings and a get a good feel of days gone by and how people used to live.\nThere always seems to be a lot going on, but yet it remains peaceful.

501455583.name: The center of all
501455583.author: a TripAdvisor user
501455583.reviewBody: Here starts all in the historic center in Campeche, ciudad amurallada, restaurants, the cathetral, etc.. Beautiful city

490801983.name: A Must Visit if going to Campeche
490801983.author: a TripAdvisor user
490801983.reviewBody: Basically this is the "center of it all."  After visiting the Malecon in Campeche, you must go here.  You experience a lot of the history of Campeche by visiting this location.

478091107.name: Good starting point
478091107.author: a TripAdvisor user
478091107.reviewBody: This is the best point to start the visit to the City of Campeche. The park is beautiful and is very interesting to see the people walking by.

471909558.name: Love this place!
471909558.author: a TripAdvisor user
471909558.reviewBody: I finished off my walk in the mercado and came around the corner to see this lovely place.  Lots to see and so many beautiful old homes to look at.  \n\nThe sculptures were very interesting and I took some time to enjoy the sights here.

460442195.name: Quite a bit to see and do at the park
460442195.author: a TripAdvisor user
460442195.reviewBody: Take a stroll here.  Find an empty park bench under a shade tree.  And prepare to people watch.  There is actually a lot to do in and around the park.  Of course a visit to the main cathedral is a must.  Across the square from it is Casa 6.  A brief walk through here provides an idea how a wealthy family lived a 100 years ago.  The home features period furnishings and decorations.  We also picked up the trolley on the square for a tour around town.  The tour is in Spanish.  It is well worth it even if one can\'t understand everything.\n\nDon\'t miss the El Palacio on the Plaza.  On the weekend when we were there, an exceptional light and sound show was projected on the block-long building.  It begins at 8 p.m.  And it is quite stunning with beautiful graphics and dynamic sound and music. The show tells the history of the city and region. It was one of the highlights of our trip.

439513396.name: Lively
439513396.author: a TripAdvisor user
439513396.reviewBody: good place to people watch and to get on the tour bus..well looked after and across the street from the Cathedral.

340728501.name: getting ready for xmas!
340728501.author: a TripAdvisor user
340728501.reviewBody: we were wandering around this colourful unesco town, finding the bastions and gates, and popping into churches, the museum and a garden. near all these sights we came upon this square. the town\'s staff were decorating for xmas, which is always an odd feeling in a tropical town! very well taken care of, clean, some shade. many others seated. a raised platform in the centre. and opposite the beautiful white "our lady of the immaculate conception" cathedral. we enjoyed exploring this town, although one had to watch for holes in the sidewalks where the grates were missing. had a delicious almond croissant along the way, one of the best i\'ve eaten. left here to explore the ruins of edzna before heading to merida.

658722317.name: chevere
658722317.author: a TripAdvisor user
658722317.reviewBody: Muy chevere pero hay mosquitos, hay que llevar repelente la comida mariscos y todo lo demas muy buenos, visiten los caimanes

611235824.name: Viaje en medio de la naturaleza
611235824.author: a TripAdvisor user
611235824.reviewBody:
El humedal más extenso de Norteamérica, con una extensa variedad de plantas y animales de agua de agua dulce. 
La flor del lirio acuático es hermosa 😍 
Te adentras en un recorrido en lancha a través de los manglares y en este vas observando la naturaleza, conoces la diferencia entre el mangle blanco y el mangle rojo, pudimos ver tortugas, patos, realmente muy recomendable para toda la flia. 
Hermosa la vista de los diferentes tonos de colores azules del lugar donde se juntan los ríos Usamacinta y Grijalva. 
Cuando terminamos el recorrido en lancha hicimos un recorrido a pie a través de la selva y subimos al mirador. Hermoso

556500640.name: De paso por Centla...
556500640.author: a TripAdvisor user
556500640.reviewBody: Hola, si est\u00e1n de paso por Centla o est\u00e1n transitando por la carretera federal de Cd. Carmen a Villahermosa y vienen cansados, les recomiendo el Hotel Pen\u00ednsula aun lado de la gasolinera y el BK. Es un hotel c\u00f3modo y limpio, con buenos precios.

551641881.name: Maravilla natural
551641881.author: a TripAdvisor user
551641881.reviewBody: El manejar y atravesar los pantanos de Centla es \u00fanico. Es sorprendente el poder de la naturaleza. Los paisajes son \u00fanicos.

664834435.name: Great Mayan architecture site
664834435.author: a TripAdvisor user
664834435.reviewBody: Check out the Hochob Mayan Architecture and all its buildings.  Make sure you have good walking hiking shoes and long sleeves.  Take lots of cold water to keep from getting dehydrated.  Watch your footing if you climb any of the structures. Rough and rugged terrain all around you.

address.streetAddress: A 87 Km de Campeche Sur la Route 261 Pres de Dzibalchen

606502577.name: Hochob
606502577.author: a TripAdvisor user
606502577.reviewBody: Nice little site consisting of four buildings. Best preserved is Temple II facing the entrance. Its replica is recreated at the  National Museum of Anthropology in Mexico City. A rather steep uphill with a few dozen steps leads  to the site from the parking lot.

address.streetAddress: A 87 Km de Campeche Sur la Route 261 Pres de Dzibalchen

544306165.name: Beautiful, small ruin
544306165.author: a TripAdvisor user
544306165.reviewBody: Hochob has a well-preserved monster mask around the entrance to one of the buildings - some of the teeth are still sticking out below the doorway!  Another large structure has one tower and the remains of another - 2 towers is characteristic of the Chenes style.  It takes about 2 hr to get here from Campeche so you\'re likely to be the only visitors.  You\'ll really enjoy it, if you can get here!

address.streetAddress: A 87 Km de Campeche Sur la Route 261 Pres de Dzibalchen

478089746.name: Small but interestin
478089746.author: a TripAdvisor user
478089746.reviewBody: Very small archaeological site but with a wonderfully decorated building. The road is long and not very good.

address.streetAddress: A 87 Km de Campeche Sur la Route 261 Pres de Dzibalchen

445192820.name: only if you are serious about seeing all of the different types of Maya civilizations
445192820.author: a TripAdvisor user
445192820.reviewBody: This is a beautiful, small site and according to our friend, a historian of ancient Pre-Hispanic Mexican culture, is an important site to see.  That being said, this place is in the middle of NO-where, I think is was nearly a 2 1/2 hour drive from Campeche on tiny roads through remote tiny villages.  The site is beautiful once you get there, and since nobody goes there you are like;y to have the place to yourself as we did.  I am sorry that I cannot remember the name of the type of architecture/civilization that  we saw, but according to our friend it is one of only two such sites...and the better of the two.  We enjoyed our visit because we had Florencio Moreno to tell us what we were looking at.  If you have limited time to visit such sites during your visit, you might consider one of the more easily accessible locations unless you are up for an adventure.

address.streetAddress: A 87 Km de Campeche Sur la Route 261 Pres de Dzibalchen

441245460.name: Amazing Hochob
441245460.author: a TripAdvisor user
441245460.reviewBody: Beautiful small Mayan archeological site.  It is not that easy to arrive there, as signals are not clear marked and there is no internet signal there, but it is worthwhile to visit it if you like archeological Mayan sites. We went first to Edzn\u00e1 and then to Hochob.

address.streetAddress: A 87 Km de Campeche Sur la Route 261 Pres de Dzibalchen

385408066.name: Peaceful, Quiet and Amazing!
385408066.author: a TripAdvisor user
385408066.reviewBody: I recommend booking this tour tour El Tucan Tours part of Los Chenes Route.  Very detailed and full of history!

address.streetAddress: A 87 Km de Campeche Sur la Route 261 Pres de Dzibalchen

333590885.name: Isolated Ruins Worth the Drive
333590885.author: a TripAdvisor user
333590885.reviewBody: Hochob is a smaller ruin located in the middle of the jungle. Tour groups don\'t visit this site, and you\'ll most likely have to drive yourself to get there. Of all the Mayan ruins we saw on our trip (Uxmal, Chichen Itza, Edzna), Hochob was my favorite. It\'s rarely visited, we were the first group in over a week, and has some beautiful carvings. The site sits atop a moss covered plateau and looks like something straight out of an Indiana Jones movie. Its small and won\'t take longer than a couple hours to see, but its well worth the time and effort.

address.streetAddress: A 87 Km de Campeche Sur la Route 261 Pres de Dzibalchen

285114394.name: worth the drive if you are in the area
285114394.author: a TripAdvisor user
285114394.reviewBody: Hochob does have one great "monster mouth" and the hilltop site has a bleak grandeur. The site overall is small and somewhat out of the way, but it makes a nice part of a day if you are visiting sites like El Tabasqueno or Dzibilnocac in the Hopelchen area of northern Campeche. The steps up would not allow wheelchair access, as far as I could see.

address.streetAddress: A 87 Km de Campeche Sur la Route 261 Pres de Dzibalchen

267866518.name: Very tiny site (comparatively) but why not look?
267866518.author: a TripAdvisor user
267866518.reviewBody: If you are driving in that direction, spend 20 minutes at Hochob. It isn\'t big but it has a spectacular monster maw doorway and the remains of some roof combs. Cheap entry. You\'ll have the site to yourself.

address.streetAddress: A 87 Km de Campeche Sur la Route 261 Pres de Dzibalchen

201594874.name: A great Chenes/Puuc Mayan site in Campeche State
201594874.author: a TripAdvisor user
201594874.reviewBody: Hochob is a major and spectacular Mayan site in Campeche State, of the typical Chenes/Puuc style, especially featuring incredibly intricate Monster Mouth masks with what archaeologists call \'cascading mask panels\' on the side. Definitely a must for all Mayan ruins aficionados.

address.streetAddress: A 87 Km de Campeche Sur la Route 261 Pres de Dzibalchen

646401165.name: peque\u00f1o
646401165.author: a TripAdvisor user
646401165.reviewBody: Padre el esfuerzo que hacen por que este museo sea un pilar de la historia de la zona felicito a los que apoyan este recinto

570884382.name: le falta apoyo
570884382.author: a TripAdvisor user
570884382.reviewBody: Por favor las autoridades metanle dinero a estos sitios que garantizan que el patrimonio cultural prevalezca por mucho tiemo

564088955.name: Pequeno mas interessante
564088955.author: a TripAdvisor user
564088955.reviewBody: \u00c9 um local que, guardadas as propor\u00e7\u00f5es, lembra um pouco o Parque Pedras do Sil\u00eancio, em Nova Petr\u00f3polis-RS, avalia\u00e7\u00e3o que, ali\u00e1s, em breve farei aqui no TripAdvisor. Esclare\u00e7a-se que o Pedras do Sil\u00eancio \u00e9 bem maior, a lembran\u00e7a decorre dos entalhes feitos em pedras, aparentemente bas\u00e1lticas, como no Parque existente na Serra Ga\u00facha. Do local situado no Centro de Campeche, \u00e9 isso: simples, diminuto, bonito; interessante de se ver. Tr\u00eas e meia estrelas.

553190503.name: Un peque\u00f1o pero gran museo
553190503.author: a TripAdvisor user
553190503.reviewBody: Muy bien organizado, excelentes piezas, con detalles de cada una f\u00e1cil de recorrer, encantador muy recomendable, precio accesible que se paga con gusto por lo bien que est\u00e1.

326000982.name: Un museo peque\u00f1o pero excelente.
326000982.author: a TripAdvisor user
326000982.reviewBody: Es un museo peque\u00f1o ubicado en un pueblo m\u00e1gico Hecelchak\u00e1n cp 24800, la direcci\u00f3n que se presenta aqu\u00ed es err\u00f3nea el museo se encuentra en el municipio de Hecelchakan, a 40 min de campeche,  carretera Campeche - M\u00e9rida, su recorrido es r\u00e1pido, pero muy educativo.

311562500.name: Museo arqueol\u00f3gico con mucha historia maya
311562500.author: a TripAdvisor user
311562500.reviewBody: Se trata de un peque\u00f1o museo, sin embargo, la calidad de su colecci\u00f3n es realmente excepcional. Quienes conocen medianamente sobre arte maya, saben que Jaina es uno de los lugares donde se han encontrados a los mas bellos exponentes cer\u00e1micos. El museo posee una gran colecci\u00f3n de este tipo de figuras, as\u00ed como varias estelas y dinteles que han sido encontrados en los alrededores de la ciudad.

672587934.name: Small fort that is part of the walls
672587934.author: a TripAdvisor user
672587934.reviewBody: Small fort with some interesting exhibits, the three dimensional map of the old city is well done and can pick out all of the significant structures that still exist.

662951206.name: Most historical piece in town
662951206.author: a TripAdvisor user
662951206.reviewBody: Most historical piece in town. It was unfortunate we couldn\u2019t walk on the wall. You can go through the gate but that was not as satisfactory as it would have been for the pirates who fought their b*lls off to get in. Arrrr.

667310629.name: Pr\u00f3xima parada: underground y periferia.
667310629.author: a TripAdvisor user
667310629.reviewBody: Atravesar la puerta de Central Sureste es como bajarse del tren de la cotidianidad en una estaci\u00f3n que arriba a un mundo doble de contraculturas y subculturas aderezado de harta liminalidad y periferia. Aqu\u00ed el caf\u00e9 o la cerveza, all\u00e1 los camastros para ver ese cine que las salas comerciales no proyectar\u00e1n, m\u00e1s all\u00e1 una biblioteca que poco a poco se va poniendo de pie con un acervo envidiable, todo: una espacio cultural con galer\u00eda integrada y hasta Airbnb del que no querr\u00e1s salir nunca o al que volver se te volver\u00e1 una adicci\u00f3n. \u00a1Feliz viaje!

651410970.name: Pleasantly surprised
651410970.author: a TripAdvisor user
651410970.reviewBody: Our first visit was lovely so we repeated it twice more. It\'s easy to get there on the bus from Campeche. Look for Tec, Lerma on the windscreen. 7mxn for a half hour ride. 100 mxn by taxi takes about the same time. Playa Bonita costs 2mxn to go in. Many palapas to sit under. Sunbeds are cheap to rent. Beach service is excellent. (Thank you, Elian), and of course the sea is refreshing. It\'s a public beach and has super clean bathrooms and showers. \n

647874118.name: By the sea
647874118.author: a TripAdvisor user
647874118.reviewBody:
Campeche is on the water. On the gulf of Mexico to be exact. The city is beautiful and the Malecon is really beautiful but to get a taste of the sea, you have to take a ride of about 1/2 hour and go to Playa Bonita.
There are other beaches but most of the locals will tell you to go there. (Don't go on week ends) 
The beach is very nice sand but when you go into the water, you will fin small rocks that could be a little painful. So wearing beach shoes is a good idea.

There are restaurants and changing areas. This is a fully developed site with rentals for everything. And not expensive.

When in Campeche, you should visit Playa Bonita

675278050.name: Not noteworthy
675278050.author: a TripAdvisor user
675278050.reviewBody: The Campeche Waterfront Promedate offers a nice walk along the sea, but the pomenade has little otherwise to recommend it.

661765639.name: Nice run in the morning
661765639.author: a TripAdvisor user
661765639.reviewBody:
Well maintened street, separated for those who are jogging, walking or driving. A bit busy when sun goes up which is not a big deal.
Clean and a run about 30 Minutes no problem.
Fitness facilities available on the greenery beside the street. 
Good options to do Cross fit as well.
I really enjoyed :)

660913261.name: No real malecon
660913261.author: a TripAdvisor user
660913261.reviewBody: I\'m used to large walkways with charming restaurants and children playing in the sand. Nope, not here. There is one section with 5 nice seafood restaurants. No sand, it is seawalled with dirty gulf of Mexico water. It\'s beautiful to look at, but that\'s all. I\'m spoiled by the Mexican carribbean.

660044677.name: This promenade will be amazing once finished
660044677.author: a TripAdvisor user
660044677.reviewBody: A lengthy, spacious promenade w room to walk or bike. A great place for an evening stroll to enjoy the waves, view, sunset, & seabreeze.

647909889.name: Stroll, recoup, breath
647909889.author: a TripAdvisor user
647909889.reviewBody: We walked for two hours early morning. Other than the people seeking our $ for breakfast at the far end and the traffic whizzing by, it was quite  delightful. We watched birds and dogs. The fishermen were repairing and constructing lines. They didn\u2019t mind when we watched for a few minutes. There was a nice breeze. No one bothered us. There certainly are worse ways to spend time. It was nice and we enjoyed it.

647232931.name: Rather useless.
647232931.author: a TripAdvisor user
647232931.reviewBody:
Why on Earth one would build a 5-km long, 50m-wide track next to the busy 8-lane freeway remains a mystery to me. Surely not for a group of 15 morning joggers or a dozen of bicycles!
No cafes, restaurants or anything else that could possibly attract. To make things worse, a stench from a few of storm water and sewer outfalls makes the walk unbearable. 
No wonder Malecon remains empty at all times - neither locals, nor tourists want to stay here

642713511.name: A great stroll
642713511.author: a TripAdvisor user
642713511.reviewBody: A nice long promenade, one of the best things about Campeche.  It goes fro several miles and you can see fishermen and there are occasionally nice little restaurants.

638801924.name: Nice to stroll the waterfront
638801924.author: a TripAdvisor user
638801924.reviewBody: Nice area to stroll along after dinner or before dinner when the sun is setting. Great views. Make sure to see \u201cLa Novia Del Mar\u201d

610876499.name: Under construction
610876499.author: a TripAdvisor user
610876499.reviewBody: Once finished (in a few more years), this will be a great spot.  The city\'s tourism should be greatly improved once waterfront shops and attractions are added.

596456033.name: Interesting walk
596456033.author: a TripAdvisor user
596456033.reviewBody: Interesting walk. Very hot during the day, but in the morning, you can watch the fishermen going out. Nicely paved walk/jogging area.

596390850.name: Nice promenade
596390850.author: a TripAdvisor user
596390850.reviewBody: It\'s a very nice place for a walk up in the morning or the evening to get some fresh air and enjoy the view.

594136207.name: Very hot walk with no shade
594136207.author: a TripAdvisor user
594136207.reviewBody: We walked an hour each way from the Campeche sign to the Forte. It was exhausting in the sun with not much to look at but it was good exercise to walk off all the food we have been sampling in the area. Take cold water!\n

591415417.name: Beat the Heat
591415417.author: a TripAdvisor user
591415417.reviewBody: One of my favorite things to do in Campeche is take a 30- to 45-minute walk along the malecon in the early morning. It seems half the city is out and about between 6-8am to walk, jog and bike along the paved path that looks out over the calm gulf waters. Plenty of folks use the free workout stations that are available every few hundred yards, as well, and you may even pass a group of folks gathered for Zumba class before the work day begins. Evenings likewise are a lovely time to take a long stroll when it\'s not too hot outside, and odds are, you\'ll catch a beautiful sunset as a bonus.

589760941.name: Seafood and a relaxing walk along the promenade
589760941.author: a TripAdvisor user
589760941.reviewBody: There are several seafood restaurants along the promenade, we ate at "Los Delfines" and enjoyed the food and the view. After that we took a walk looking the sundown and feeling the sea breeze.

583740428.name: Pretty but disappointing
583740428.author: a TripAdvisor user
583740428.reviewBody: While it is a lovely walking/biking/jogging path there are no real restaurants or shops on or even that close to it. You have to cross a very busy street to get to them

581700284.name: Nice waterfront
581700284.author: a TripAdvisor user
581700284.reviewBody: While the waterfront of Campeche lacks any sandy beaches, it does have a nice mal\u00e9con/boardwalk. There are lanes for walking, jogging and cycling. It\u2019s quite long and there are some interesting sights along the way.

577954532.name: Average at best
577954532.author: a TripAdvisor user
577954532.reviewBody: The waterfront has a nice pathway along it but it\'s a pretty bland place. No beach to speak of, no restaurants or bars or shops for that matter. All those are inside the old city wall. You just get buildings and the odd jogger or walker.\n\nHave a look by all means you\'ll be done in 5 minutes.

571572282.name: Walking the Promenade !
571572282.author: a TripAdvisor user
571572282.reviewBody: Dear Friends, You are in Campeche, you like to walk and you love the ocean !  Go to the Promenade ! We love watching the fishermen heading out for the day\u2019s catch !  The sea birds are always looking for a fresh meal. It\u2019s all very calming and then you should head to a seafood restaurant, just to make your day !  Enjoy!  All my Best, Skippyfrizz

570752606.name: Beautiful
570752606.author: a TripAdvisor user
570752606.reviewBody: We took a walk down here every night and watched the world go by. The sunset is amazing and a great way to wrap up a day

568518593.name: Beautiful town
568518593.author: a TripAdvisor user
568518593.reviewBody: Watched a beautiful sunset over the prom..... Only downside.., the very bad odour from the sea.  We hoped it was seaweed or algae!  The town was fabulous.  Pretty coloured buildings and a beautiful square and cathedral.  There were pedestrian streets with the bar and restaurant tables outside the locals mingling with the tourists making for a really good atmosphere

562600484.name: Good place to walk or run
562600484.author: a TripAdvisor user
562600484.reviewBody: Good path but the waterfront was not very active when I was there. Wish I had a nice place like this to exercise though in Merida.

561552989.name: Watch the sunset.
561552989.author: a TripAdvisor user
561552989.reviewBody: Go for a stroll early morning or evening as the sun is near setting to enjoy this family friendly place without the heat.  Locals stroll and enjoy evenings here, giving you a sense of how family interaction is at the center of Campeche\'s culture.  I was here during Carnaval, and it was interesting to observe this patriotic and cultural event among its citizens.  There are not many tourists in Campeche, and locals will not go out of their way to speak to you, but they are respectful.

556508236.name: Lovely stroll
556508236.author: a TripAdvisor user
556508236.reviewBody: We happened upon this nicely kept walk that followed the coast line. It was nicely kept and a pleasant way to walk without the traffic. The streets here in Campeche are very small and most steers are one way so the sidewalks are usually crowed with people. The Waterfront is a nice way to take a leisurely walk.

556273835.name: Great walk!
556273835.author: a TripAdvisor user
556273835.reviewBody: We walked the Promenade for many kms. It is a great place to catch the sea breezes, see different monuments as you stroll along.\nIt\'s a peaceful walk that can be done day or evening. A good place to go for a bike ride as it also has a trail for bikes and one for walking.

554604784.name: Great place for run!
554604784.author: a TripAdvisor user
554604784.reviewBody: Great place for a run or stroll! Don\'t miss the sunsets here!  Also very nice for a run in the morning to join all of the other people exercising!

550415783.name: Lovely promenade
550415783.author: a TripAdvisor user
550415783.reviewBody: Beautiful place along the seaside. Worth walking by and checking it out. Nice breeze and beautiful views.

549206983.name: Walking path and bike lanes
549206983.author: a TripAdvisor user
549206983.reviewBody: We love to walk and the malecon was perfect. It\'s right along the waterfront. It is several kilometres long. There was a lovely breeze which kept us cool.\n

544123928.name: Gathering place by the sea
544123928.author: a TripAdvisor user
544123928.reviewBody: We stayed close to the Malecon and walked there both during the day and in the evening.  Lots of locals are there in the evening.  It\'s a nice place to walk and see, smell, and hear the ocean.

524959417.name: So worth a visit!
524959417.author: a TripAdvisor user
524959417.reviewBody: I loved the scenery here and it felt very elegant, European and obviously a place where Mexicans retire to. Lots of people exercising and just a lovely vibe/place!

521222379.name: Enjoy the breeze and/or sunset.
521222379.author: a TripAdvisor user
521222379.reviewBody: I had a nice walk along the malecon during the day. It\'s a nice space, with sculptures along the way. There\'s a Campeche sign too, if you like to take your photo with them. Also a really nice spot to grab a beer or ice cream and come and watch the sunset.

517820590.name: Very nice
517820590.author: a TripAdvisor user
517820590.reviewBody: Very nice...waterfront long walk to the fish restaurants at the end which were disappointed but worthwhile the stroll roughly _45 minutes from centre nice to see the fishermen boats

499501016.name: A 5 km
499501016.author: a TripAdvisor user
499501016.reviewBody: You can see the local people jogging, or Dom\u00ednguez ejercice or just loo king the view the scenic nice area better en near CAD amurallada

497299556.name: Gorgeous sunset
497299556.author: a TripAdvisor user
497299556.reviewBody: Great place to relax, ride a bike, or go for a run. The sunset is beautiful, and after the sun goes down, the sky if full of colors.

495980117.name: Nice walking spot
495980117.author: a TripAdvisor user
495980117.reviewBody: The Campece malecon runs along the Gulf for a long distance and is quite suitable for walking of running. While you are there, note we various types of fishing boats tied up along the malecon.

493728825.name: Good Malecon
493728825.author: a TripAdvisor user
493728825.reviewBody:
We enjoyed walking along the malecon several times - late afternoon in the rain and early morning. 
Both times it was enjoyable - and hot - and in places there was a lot of trash from the gulf. 
Here: the city would do well to do more cleanups. 

The malecon is nice. 
It's a great place to walk with expansive views of the gulf, many other walkers and joggers and some fisherman selling fresh caught fish. 
The ancient city walls and the city within are the best.

492060237.name: Beautiful walk, sea breeze and very clean
492060237.author: a TripAdvisor user
492060237.reviewBody: We walked along the sea for miles but I nearly melted.  Worth it.  \n\nWill be back for more.  Quiet (ignore the traffic) and very calming.

484971216.name: Lovely Relaxing  Walkway
484971216.author: a TripAdvisor user
484971216.reviewBody: We loved Campeche, it was such a relaxed place with a lovely, friendly vibe. The waterfront is a great place for a stroll with nice views of the water and the city itself.\nPlenty of nice photo opportunities and places to sit and relax, some nice waterfront eateries and bars too - but not too many to make it commercialised in any way. it has a very \'local\' feel and we really like dit.

482791217.name: So refreshing
482791217.author: a TripAdvisor user
482791217.reviewBody: It felt so refreshing after a hot day by walking along the waterfront in the late afternoon. Great view!

481280185.name: Very long, not to be undertaken all at once.
481280185.author: a TripAdvisor user
481280185.reviewBody: This is one of the best and longest promenades I have ever seen and it is great for walking or biking. There are many stops along the way and all with beautiful water views.

473785665.name: nice walk
473785665.author: a TripAdvisor user
473785665.reviewBody: It has a rather extended waterfront- nicely made for walking and biking. Bike riders have their own lane. What distracts from the the beautiful view is the sea weed that washes up. Don\'t walk it when it is hot because there is not shade.

471735423.name: I fell in love!
471735423.author: a TripAdvisor user
471735423.reviewBody: I rollerblade, run and bike and when I saw this gorgeous Malecon, I saw possibilities and many mornings and evening of activities.\n\nA must see!

470564305.name: Just to see the sea
470564305.author: a TripAdvisor user
470564305.reviewBody: Although it\'s a nice promenade it\'s not really attractive to stroll for miles and miles. The road next to it is quite busy. Good for a walk and to take in the fresh seabreeze.

467477565.name: Carnival time
467477565.author: a TripAdvisor user
467477565.reviewBody: A bit of a confusion of modern and not very creative buildings but it comes into its own at Carnaval time, when it should not be missed.

465640367.name: Campeche waterfront
465640367.author: a TripAdvisor user
465640367.reviewBody: No beaches but well planned and executed male con. Locals abound and are friendly. Plenty of places to stop an dress for the loss ambitious. Seperate paved lanes for walkers, bikes and runners.

462108359.name: Great walk and views, ultra popular at night.
462108359.author: a TripAdvisor user
462108359.reviewBody: Bike path, walking and running paths, great place for sunset.  The westward section does smell of rotting fish so be judicious or walk fast. Merida drivers at night outside the historic district are aggressive so be careful heading home.

460429070.name: Walk along the Malecon
