460429070.author: a TripAdvisor user
460429070.reviewBody: Stinky walk. Wind must be blowing in the wrong direction. Smelt of sewer.  Not much of a beach. Not very busy. Lots of room for bikes, runners etc, but didn\'t see any.

460413232.name: Stroll, run, or ride
460413232.author: a TripAdvisor user
460413232.reviewBody:
We walked several miles on the Malecon.  All the way out to Fuerte de San Miguel and back.  Then on another day in the opposite direction to the collection of shore side restaurants (be forewarned that the restaurants located side by side are very persistent in trying to reel you into their particular establishment).

The Malecon is a nice clean pathway along the water to walk, run or ride a bike.  It is, like the historic district, very clean.  There is no beach area along the shore line, showing mud banks at low tide.  But you can see the working fishermen and their boats at various points along the way.  We also found some workout stations along the way. 

Worth a stroll.

458071189.name: Nice malecon for sunset watching
458071189.author: a TripAdvisor user
458071189.reviewBody: This coast line boulevard is good for walking or running in the evening. Sunset is really nice as sun is dropping in the sea providing really nice colors. If you visit Campeche this is definitely worth checking.

455776780.name: Rent bikes
455776780.author: a TripAdvisor user
455776780.reviewBody: We rented bikes from the Pirate shop on 59. We had checked out others but these were 150 pesos for all day. They had baskets and the bikes were in good shape.  We explored the Malecon all day and really enjoyed it.  We even went in the evening when it was cooler and stopped at a seafood restaurant by the wharf. Very clean Malecon as was the whole city.  Great time spent enjoying the scenery.

454822386.name: Must walk
454822386.author: a TripAdvisor user
454822386.reviewBody: Best time to run or take a walk on the waterfront promenade is early morning or at sunset. Not too busy, nice breeze, overlook to the Gulf of Mexico.

454575871.name: Worth a Visit
454575871.author: a TripAdvisor user
454575871.reviewBody: The folks in Campeche have done a lot to make their city beautiful and this is an example. The "malacon" stretches for several kilometres along the gulf. Good for strolling, jogging or biking. A couple of spots along the way have exercise machines. Nice to walk, especially at sundown.

453493722.name: Malecon
453493722.author: a TripAdvisor user
453493722.reviewBody: Otherwise knows by locals as the "Malecon" is an excellent place to run or walk early mornings or afternoons. Beautiful views of the Campeche Bay. Recommended

452763388.name: Four miles of extraordinary and a breezy promenade.  Better at sunset.
452763388.author: a TripAdvisor user
452763388.reviewBody: Worth to take a walk, ride a bike or just sit and see the sunset.  It is refreshing.  Huindreds of people excersising, and enjoying a very well planned urban park next to the sea.

448117744.name: Beautiful and breezy
448117744.author: a TripAdvisor user
448117744.reviewBody: A great place to come for a cool walk in the heat of the day or at sunset. This extends in both directions from the historical centre for quite a ways. Great views of the gulf and for people watching.

447193784.name: Great walk for sunset
447193784.author: a TripAdvisor user
447193784.reviewBody: Optimal use of the promenade as a public space. Lots of people excersizing (jogging + biking + skating) and others just walking to enjoy the ocean view and the breeze. The restaurants are concentrated in the north side, but the distances are considerable from one end to the other.  Loved the fishing boats and birds at sunset.

445707540.name: Deserted for a reason
445707540.author: a TripAdvisor user
445707540.reviewBody: Walked back from stocking up at the excellent Walmart to the city centre via this promenade.  It\'s beautifully kept, but the shoreline is unloved and smelly.  Campeche is in a beautiful seaside location... pity they can\'t make more of it.  Always nice to see pelicans, though.

445465051.name: The sunset... speechless
445465051.author: a TripAdvisor user
445465051.reviewBody: It\'s a very popular plaxe to visit in this city, yo can walk, run or ride a bike in a safe place at any hour. In the evenings the sunset will give you a time for relaxation and introspection. Definitely a must when you come to Campeche.

445433121.name: Nice views but a lot of background traffic noise
445433121.author: a TripAdvisor user
445433121.reviewBody: An evening stroll along the \'malecon\' was not as nice as expected.\n\nYou have the continuous background noise of 4 lanes of traffic and the water is quite polluted with plenty of plastic bottles floating in it.

443350804.name: Nice place
443350804.author: a TripAdvisor user
443350804.reviewBody: The "malecon" of the city Campeche is nice. To walk it takes about 1h. It is 5km, you can take great pictures over there. You will probably not miss this place if you will visit the old city.

442748396.name: Lovely stroll
442748396.author: a TripAdvisor user
442748396.reviewBody: Get some ice cream from the nearby ice cream shop and stroll down the malecon. Locals and tourists alike enjoying the ocean breeze.

441244419.name: Nice promenade
441244419.author: a TripAdvisor user
441244419.reviewBody: It is very nice to walk this promenade. We did it every day, form our Hotel (Ocean View) to downtown. It has a great view over the ocean, and it is very clean and has several monuments. It also has a path for runners.

439260709.name: Excellent
439260709.author: a TripAdvisor user
439260709.reviewBody: Great view, atmosphere,  safe.\nMalecon must take ride on pirate ship around the bay, 9ne hour with friendly staff and guides explains the history.\nCiudad murallada,  is like Cartagena Colombia.

438405385.name: Loved this City
438405385.author: a TripAdvisor user
438405385.reviewBody: WE stayed at Don Gustavo\'s and it was right in the middle of everything\nIt was on the main street  in the old town and only two blocks \nfrom the waterfront.  We were there there on Oct 31  The Day of the Dead !  WOW !

426728718.name: Excellent morning run!!!!
426728718.author: a TripAdvisor user
426728718.reviewBody: Beautiful to watch sunset, and very handy for our morning run, not just us though the locals are out in force exercising, walking, running and just watching the world go by, really liked the place and there\'s multiple things do to along the whole route

425753024.name: Good for exercise
425753024.author: a TripAdvisor user
425753024.reviewBody: Its a nice walk and it is very long but don\'t expect Havana\'s Malecon. In my opinion it is highly under utilized.  A few people milling around but would be infinitely better with a couple vendors. Nonetheless something to do to chew up a bit of time.

425171943.name: Okay
425171943.author: a TripAdvisor user
425171943.reviewBody: This boardwalk is lovely because it is so close to the sea. The paint colour is a bit tacky and there\'s not much more to do than just walk up and down but it\'s quite pretty.

422154231.name: Beautiful promenade
422154231.author: a TripAdvisor user
422154231.reviewBody: The malecon in Campeche is one of my favorite places to walk. Great people watching beside the Gulf of Mexico. Ironic...I have been to the Gulf of Mexico in Florida, but didn\'t know there was another one. I bet Mexico had theirs first. Otherwise. ..\n

421915645.name: Walk close to the see
421915645.author: a TripAdvisor user
421915645.reviewBody: Nice to go for a walk, sit down and enjoy the sun, view over the ocean or relax. Also at night you find a lot of people being around.

397084350.name: Walking along the Waterfront Promenade is a Great Way to Wrap-up your Day
397084350.author: a TripAdvisor user
397084350.reviewBody: This beautiful city offers many sights and the Waterfront Promenade is great to walk after enjoying this walled city.

395075230.name: Evening stroll
395075230.author: a TripAdvisor user
395075230.reviewBody: Lovely, peaceful stroll on excellent pavements. Plenty of places to stop for a cold drink or meal. Do go early morning or evening when it\'s cooler.

394318273.name: Best boardwalk on the Gulf!
394318273.author: a TripAdvisor user
394318273.reviewBody: Campeche city walls opened right to the water in the old days. In more modern times the city has been "built out" into the water to provide more water front property and business areas. Because of that and the geographical location at the bottom of the Gulf of Mexico, there is no beach, but there is a fabulous boardwalk that stretches for miles along the coast. Walking and biking lanes are great for exercise. There are often open air events at different points during the weekends and you can see a fabulous sunset here almost any day of the week. Definitely family friendly as many families come here to walk at sunset for the cool breeze and awesome views.

386235996.name: Its a long walk, but you could rent a bike
386235996.author: a TripAdvisor user
386235996.reviewBody: Campeche waterfront promenade is one of the best in Mexico. There is ample room for walking and running, as well as separate lanes for cyclists. Alas there is NO beach! There is quite a good selection of restaurants as you enter along the highway from Yucatan with a great view of the Bay of Campeche. The one really disgusting note is the way the waiters jostle for business. As you approach from the east they literally jump in front of you car to get you to stop at their place. We pushed through them with some trepidation and stopped at one where the waiters stood quietly on the sidewalk. We chose Los Delfines which I have already reviewed in another post. Dont be intimidated by the disgusting threatening waiters as you approach the restaurant area. Persevere and go to Los Delkfines. Someone needs to report these guys to the city or the local police!!!!

385302666.name: Peaceful with breathtaking views
385302666.author: a TripAdvisor user
385302666.reviewBody: Nice waterfront promenade for walking, jogging, taking pictures, and even exercising as well.  On one side you have the calm and soothing open water from the Gulf and on the other side was the actual city itself.  One start of the waterfront promenade even had a few seafood restaurants.

371315487.name: Not overly amazing
371315487.author: a TripAdvisor user
371315487.reviewBody:
The Malecon is looked after and the plants/statues well maintained. I'd suggest going early for two reasons. 1. It gets really hot from midday onwards with little shade. 2. The wind picks up in the afternoon. 

There is a particular part of the Malecon where it absolutely stinks of sewerage. It's only for about 100 metres of the Malecon that the smell occurs, but it is just overbearing and almost made us heave. 

The sunset was beautiful to watch, just pick an area with a fresh air breeze to sit! The water is greeny browny muddy, not appealing to look at really.

371268489.name: Great walking
371268489.author: a TripAdvisor user
371268489.reviewBody: Early morning or evening when the temps are down is the best. Usually the sea breeze is there to set the scene and make that stroll even nicer

365831117.name: Cycling down the Malecon
365831117.author: a TripAdvisor user
365831117.reviewBody: Early morning before the heat of the day it\'s a great spot for a bike ride, there is even a bike path! Watch the fishermen bring in their catch,prepare it an sell it to the locals

364713766.name: Good walk especially around sunset.
364713766.author: a TripAdvisor user
364713766.reviewBody: Lots of locals and travellers exercising. relaxing to walk/city around sunset. Simple but enjoyable.

358032338.name: Nice to visit
358032338.author: a TripAdvisor user
358032338.reviewBody: When in Campeche a nice walk along the waterfront is nice.  We loved the buildings and colors of the homes. \nIt\'s a nice Spanish colonial town.

357832151.name: Enjoyable
357832151.author: a TripAdvisor user
357832151.reviewBody: I liked the Promenade and it was great for early morning jogging or walking.  The day hours are very hot and sunny and with little shade I\'d avoid that area.  Although I didn\'t stop for the sunset, I heard from friends that it was a nice place to sit and watch it.

356129122.name: Soak in the Mexican Gulf along the Promenade
356129122.author: a TripAdvisor user
356129122.reviewBody: Wide, varied, and well maintained, the seafront promenade is popular with both locals and visitors alike in Campeche. With designated lanes for joggers, cyclists, and those just out for a causal stroll the seaside promenade has something for everyone from the intrepid lone traveller to, couples, to families.

355362285.name: I Wanted to LOVE This, but I Can\'t
355362285.author: a TripAdvisor user
355362285.reviewBody: Stinky. My family of four walked along this at dusk. There were several people and families out, some runners and bikers. There are several nice lanes. However, it\'s really smelly. My daughter and I were covering our noses and mouths for at least half the walk. Additionally, aside from walking, there isn\'t much else. No restaurants. It just feels like it\'s missing. I still want to rent bikes, but the smell has me rethinking this. I grew up near the US coast, so it\'s not a normal water smell.

355061551.name: nice looking
355061551.author: a TripAdvisor user
355061551.reviewBody: Promenade looks nice and it is for a long walk or jogging. But there are no restaurants, pubs, shops nearby to stop. And t can be a long walk on a sunny day.... Sea - ? don\'t even think about swimming. Water is probably poluted and there are usually big waves and wind.

352147627.name: A great place for a stroll
352147627.author: a TripAdvisor user
352147627.reviewBody: The Malecon along the Campeche waterfront is a pleasant place to take a walk.  While fairly plain, it is decorated with the standing Campeche city sign, some old cannons, and some sculptural pieces.  The only challenge is crossing 4 lanes of traffic (with not crosswalks to get there...

351094213.name: Nice area for a leisurely stroll
351094213.author: a TripAdvisor user
351094213.reviewBody: Nice malecon....several good photoshoots of the statues, and water birds.    Good for pedestrian and bicycles.

350647395.name: Good Place to Watch the Sunset
350647395.author: a TripAdvisor user
350647395.reviewBody: The Campeche Waterfront Promenade is a great place for an evening stroll, bike ride or jog. An easy place to view the sunset with seating all along the walkway. It is not a beach and you can not swim there but the walking path and bike path are built upon a sea wall. Monuments, exercise equipment and evening dance exercise class along the way.

347442764.name: We hired bikes and spent a day cycling along the promenade
347442764.author: a TripAdvisor user
347442764.reviewBody: The first time we saw it we were on foot - a lovely wide promenade - virtually empty with multiple paths and cycle lanes. So the next day we hired bicycles and spent the day up and down the promenade - twas lovely!

346760501.name: While the Waterfront is pretty, we spent more time inside the Fort walls exploring the historical buildings!
346760501.author: a TripAdvisor user
346760501.reviewBody: Be sure to check out the walled Fort part of Campeche with all the beautiful historical colonial buildings.  Visit the various gates of the Fort, at least one had a small museum.  There are a couple lovely churches within the walls of the fort too.  Campeche is a beautiful, very clean town.

345075319.name: Very nice long promenade
345075319.author: a TripAdvisor user
345075319.reviewBody: A lovely long promenade with bike and running tracks.  Not much entertainment - a small strip of restaurants a couple of kilometres north of the centre. If thisplace was in Europe, it would be heaving with bars - nice that it isn,t wall-to-wall, but one every couple of hundred metres or so would be nice.

340463215.name: o.k.
340463215.author: a TripAdvisor user
340463215.reviewBody: arrived late afternoon, having driven from cancun. attempting to find our airbnb. stopped to have  look. it did smell as mentioned in other comments. pretty entrance to the town. we walked on it in the early evening and it was quite pleasant, many others doing the same.

340358098.name: Great views but unswimmable beach
340358098.author: a TripAdvisor user
340358098.reviewBody: Great place for a walk and a view of the Gulf of Mexico.  Unfortunately, years of sewage run off have made it a toxic muddy mess.  It doesn\'t smell, just don\'t step in it.

339361669.name: Una bella passeggiata
339361669.author: a TripAdvisor user
339361669.reviewBody: Very good idea, a beautiful bike path with the pedestrian zone, comfortable, large, held very well. A long walk after dinner is ideal. Congratulations.

339203452.name: Pleasant stroll
339203452.author: a TripAdvisor user
339203452.reviewBody: Definitely a must for a evening stroll while in Campeche.  The breezes coming in from the Gulf (at least when we were there) moderated the heat and made being outdoors very pleasant.  A good place to feel part of the local scene.  Try the seafood restaurants at the far northern end of the malecon - food was only average but very nice atmosphere.

339036654.name: Mexican police on Segways ... go figure
339036654.author: a TripAdvisor user
339036654.reviewBody: This is a wonderful place to stroll and get a feel for this rather different Mexican city.  When we first were here in 2011 we were very pleasantly surprised with how prosperous, safe and ordered it felt.  This was probably best exemplified by the police officers we saw there meandering along the malecon on Segways casually interacting with street performers, other locals and the occasional non-Mexican tourist.  On our latest visit we saw an expanded promenade that is still brightly lit, but increasingly less dominated by the old Campeche and more by waterfront developments (across the road) such as casinos and large box stores and hotels.  This is, I guess the "new" Mexico in this place, something they have decided to go with.  Luckily they are also continuing to fund progressive policing as we saw the Segway patrols had been expanded to include the blocks of cobble stoned streets surrounding the old city\'s square using all terrain, larger machines.

337831840.name: A peaceful walk
337831840.author: a TripAdvisor user
337831840.reviewBody: The Campeche Water Front wallk is a place where you can be by yourself as well as with family. It is a relaxing place. I would suggest to go in the evening.

337713221.name: Beautiful Campeche
337713221.author: a TripAdvisor user
337713221.reviewBody: Love every time I am here. Proud of my Mayan and historical heritage. Being here is discovering little new stories about family and ancestors

337088225.name: Lovely, Pleasant, Quiet and Well-Maintained Walkway in Campeche Along the Gulf of Mexico!
337088225.author: a TripAdvisor user
337088225.reviewBody:
I walked along Campeche’s Malecon (otherwise known as the waterfront promenade) during my first morning in Campeche on November 26th, as a solo traveler. I felt completely safe and comfortable here as a solo female as well. 

The waterfront promenade was a beautiful walkway lined with pretty palm trees that ran alongside the Gulf of Mexico. The paved path was well-maintained and was a popular place for runners, joggers and walkers, especially in the morning. 

I started my walk from the Puerta del Mar (the sea gate/opening of Campeche’s wall) and strolled for a long ways north along the Gulf. It was a lovely, pleasant, peaceful and relaxing atmosphere walking here. Along the path, there were large multi-coloured letters that spelled out “Campeche.” It was a popular spot to take photographs or a selfie! 

The views of the Gulf of Mexico from the Malecon were absolutely beautiful and made for great photos. There were a few areas along the path where there were circular jut-outs from the path stretched out over the water. They all differed and some had monuments, artistic pieces and even ancient cannons. There were also benches for resting situated at various points along the path. 

I re-visited the Malecon during the evening of November 27th, my last night in Campeche to watch the sunset. Watching the spectacular and vibrantly coloured orange sunset over the water was an incredible experience! 

The Malecon is a beautiful place to go for a relaxing walk/jog with amazing views of the Gulf of Mexico. It is also the perfect place in Campeche to watch incredible sunsets in the evening. 

The Malecon is something that should not be missed when you visit Campeche!

334945091.name: Malecon- if you can\'t get to Havana
334945091.author: a TripAdvisor user
334945091.reviewBody: This is a pleasant promenade along the Caribbean but in need of some investment. You are off the main tourist trail here some 500 km from Cancun so a far better feel of the real Mexico.  Nonetheless this is still a pleasant place to spend an hour or so.

334467467.name: Stinky!
334467467.author: a TripAdvisor user
334467467.reviewBody: We saw a nice sunset from here but couldn\'t enjoy much more due to the strong smell of raw sewage. It\'s a very nice promenade. With running and bike paths. Perhaps it was the time of year??\n

331801714.name: A Walk Along the Gulf
331801714.author: a TripAdvisor user
331801714.reviewBody: The park along the Gulf of Mexico is very un-exciting and sort of boring.  There is a large "sculpture" that spells Campeche, but that is about all there is that is noteworthy.  It is within walking distance of a few nice restaurants and bars.

328264965.name: Nice Walk, except for the garbage
328264965.author: a TripAdvisor user
328264965.reviewBody: The malecon is great except that where the cement runs out, and there begins a little strip of natural beach and fishing boats, it is horribly compromised with garbage. We are bird watchers and watched beautiful herons and sandpipers foraging for food amid the most awful garbage. Wish I could communicate to the city that they cannot have a beautiful city without a clean beach.  And the answer is not to pave it all over.  The promenade is a great place to walk or run, and they have exercise equipment in at least two places for a full workout.

317867976.name: A nice place for a walk around a great city!
317867976.author: a TripAdvisor user
317867976.reviewBody: Campeche is a great place to visit - especially if you stay in the old city where all the colored houses are.  The waterfront is nice for walking around or if you like to jog.  Its pretty safe from what I saw but I was out there during the day and early evening.

316515998.name: lovely scenery, but area itself is pretty sketchy!
316515998.author: a TripAdvisor user
316515998.reviewBody: bit of a shady area, so it\'s a bit of a shame! didn\'t really want to stop there on our drive through.

312093075.name: Great place for a run!
312093075.author: a TripAdvisor user
312093075.reviewBody: The promenade is a great place to go for a walk or a run. Just inside of the old guns are tracks for running and cycling, and it seems to be a popular place for tourists and locals alike.

286909796.name: it\'s too bad campeche\'s promenade is very smelly
286909796.author: a TripAdvisor user
286909796.reviewBody: We spent five days in Campeche, Campeche. During this time we walked and I jogged a lot on Campeche\'s  promenade. Most of the time was very smelly and dirty. (Looks like it\'s a sewage problem) It\'s too bad because it\'s a pleasure to the eyes to see it. It\'s a promenade not suitable for swimming. \n\nPlaya bonita(bonita beach is Campeche\'s locals beach). It\'s located on Campeche\'s city limits. We visited it a couples of times but, we were not lucky because we couldn\'t swim because of the big amount of seaweed coming out those days. It\'s a beach not suitable for swimming but, you can have fun enjoying a drink or lunch and see the local\'s culture around.

284171978.name: Very Relaxing.
284171978.author: a TripAdvisor user
284171978.reviewBody: After a hot day sightseeing the waterfront promenade was a rush refreshing and refreshing place to walk. Not a lot of people make the most of this great walk though, there is a walking and cycling lane but very few people using it.

277345038.name: Go, take a look and move on to more pleasant sights
277345038.author: a TripAdvisor user
277345038.reviewBody: Not the most exciting thing. Lot\'s of traffic on the road just behind the beachfront makes the walk unpleasant. There are a few cannons to look at. This isn\'t a place to spend more than a moment.

275673299.name: A beautiful morning stroll
275673299.author: a TripAdvisor user
275673299.reviewBody: We went down to the wall early in the morning.  It was a beautiful winter\'s day, is was a pleasant temperature and there wasn\'t a cloud in the sky.  The promenade was wide and clean.  It was well maintained.   The views out to the Gulf of Mexico was beautiful and then on the other side of the road, we could see the city coming to life.  A nice way to have a quiet break and get some fresh air.

273126882.name: Spare your time, not worth it !
273126882.author: a TripAdvisor user
273126882.reviewBody: We have travelled the world and have seen many waterfront promenades from Havana to Los Angeles, from Lisbon to Tel Aviv, but never an ugly one like that.....a highway next to stonewalls, mostly run down, not attractive in any sense. if you love your holidays, spare the time !

270154776.name: A pleasant promenade
270154776.author: a TripAdvisor user
270154776.reviewBody: We had lunch at a restaurant on the promenade, watching the world go by. You can walk for miles in each direction, though beware, there is not much shade. It was +40C when we were here and the sun was searing.

267141113.name: A delightful (but hot) walk
267141113.author: a TripAdvisor user
267141113.reviewBody: Choose a direction and walk as far as you like along the waterfront. The pathway has some interesting places along the way. There is no shade (or extremely little) so bring plenty of water, and go early or late in the day.

262279031.name: Mexico 2015
262279031.author: a TripAdvisor user
262279031.reviewBody: Great place to sit and relax and take in local color.  Campeche people very active along waterfront--running, jogging, walking, biking and often at night music, salsa dancing or zumba

262150558.name: Reliving Spanish Colonial History
262150558.author: a TripAdvisor user
262150558.reviewBody: Great place to enjoy Mexico at its fullest, the price was right, the place serene, historical, lots of activities around the beach to include public concerts, light and sound shows, art galleries, coffee houses, etc. etc.

259955777.name: Good place for an evening stroll.
259955777.author: a TripAdvisor user
259955777.reviewBody: A good place to walk. There were dance classes going on and many other people walking, jogging or cycling in the cool of there evening.

257173587.name: One of the Most Boring Malecons in Mexico
257173587.author: a TripAdvisor user
257173587.reviewBody: Apart from the breeze, there is nothing endearing about this malecon in a country of fantastic waterfront walks. With a busy and noisyroad next to it, nothing but sidewalk and political rallies along side, there is nothing relaxing nor entertaining about this waterfront area. The mayor should go to Veracruz or La Paz to see how it\'s done!

255465642.name: Great walk along the gulf of Mexico
255465642.author: a TripAdvisor user
255465642.reviewBody: Lots of activity and local people I participated in a Zumba class Lots of statues and of course the view and sunsets on the gulf of Mexico

255112054.name: Beautiful
255112054.author: a TripAdvisor user
255112054.reviewBody: This is a long walk along the the maleconGulf of Mexico.  Beautiful.  Both in the morning and evening.  I left later in the day than I planned so I could walk in the morning.

251205054.name: lovely walk
251205054.author: a TripAdvisor user
251205054.reviewBody: pretty and gorgeous views of the ocean. clean and nice. benches here and there if you need to sit and just be. early mornings are best.

251124994.name: Excellent Tourist Malec\u00f3n right at the before the mangroves start!
251124994.author: a TripAdvisor user
251124994.reviewBody:
Excellent Tourist Malecón right at the before the mangroves start! 

There are a line of palapas that sell really good seafood in large portions (we went to Los Delfines) and nice walking and biking paths that lead you along the Malecón and towards the mangroves. You can watch the fishing boats go by as well as a plethora o bird life!

Super cool and worth a stroll!

247696169.name: Good Place for Relaxing Stroll!
247696169.author: a TripAdvisor user
247696169.reviewBody: Every morning I ran the promenade for a couple of miles, then walked it in the evening to people watch, see the Christmas lights, and to relax.  I saw the locals catch fish and then sell them right on the promenade.  We took pictures with the Christmas lights and many statutes.  There were many restaurants to get a bite to eat or something to drink directly across the street. The locals were especially nice and sociable.  Go get that relaxing walk.

242387794.name: Lovely morning and evening strolls
242387794.author: a TripAdvisor user
242387794.reviewBody: Do look for the pedestrian crossings, as there are no stoplights.  Amazingly, if you cross there, all traffic stops and politely waits.

239122443.name: great sunset
239122443.author: a TripAdvisor user
239122443.reviewBody: Walled city and the waterfront are worth visiting when visiting the peninsula.  The sunset was spectacular over the gulf of Mexico

236209096.name: Beautiful and busy
236209096.author: a TripAdvisor user
236209096.reviewBody: This gets really busy at night once the heat subsides but locals use it during the day as well, mostly for exercise it seems. It follows the waterfront for quite a distance and has wonderful art pieces along the way as well as stops for work outs. It can get hot during the day and does not offer much shade so bring hat, water, and sunscreen. Enjoy!

235955066.name: Great views.  Bicycle and Foot Paths along waterfront
235955066.author: a TripAdvisor user
235955066.reviewBody: No waves!  The Gulf of Mexico looks like a gigantic pool. Nice monuments. See it from the tourist "cable car"

233176037.name: Lovely
233176037.author: a TripAdvisor user
233176037.reviewBody: This is a wonderful seafront promenade well-used by local walkers, runners, and cyclists. It is especially pleasant as sun is going down.

232212389.name: Visit it for a nice walk
232212389.author: a TripAdvisor user
232212389.reviewBody: We had an early-morning walk. The colors of the water and lights had us take almost perfect pictures. I can also imagine how go the walk is during sunset. You can decide how much you want to walk.

226983958.name: Great night walk
226983958.author: a TripAdvisor user
226983958.reviewBody: Ideal place for a night promenade in front of the sea. You can walk from the center in few minutes and enjoy a clear night.

224822818.name: Nice walk during sunset
224822818.author: a TripAdvisor user
224822818.reviewBody: A very nice walk during sunset, lots of people running, biking or just walking..  bring insect repellent (just in case)\n\n

218110141.name: you can walk along the sea!
218110141.author: a TripAdvisor user
218110141.reviewBody: Very good city planning.....not many places have protected and made public the water front , a real delight in a hot city like Campeche.

209318926.name: Pleasant but not Outstanding
209318926.author: a TripAdvisor user
209318926.reviewBody: We took an early morning walk along this man made front which means the walls of Campeche which originally went up to the sea are now over a hundred metres inland. Being man made the only breaks from uniformaty are designed in. The front was prevented from being extended for a second time by those who bought properties on the initial reclamation and had paid premium proces for their sea front position. A man made spit and small development out in the bay is the compromise.The walk was enjoyable but it is what it is.

205207187.name: A pathetic shambles.
205207187.author: a TripAdvisor user
205207187.reviewBody: The seaside promenade was a very poor way to spend a morning. It did provide a walk without much worry of dealing with cars, which is always nice. This to me seems that it would be a focal point for the city, a sense of pride, a destination. It is a little used, poorly constructed, and ill-maintained afterthought. The seafront wall is painted with the wrong type of finish, causing every scuff mark and stain to appear. The painters dripped paint all over the sidewalk. The light fixtures that are set along the path are not anchored to the ground properly and are missing in some places. There are electrical wires protruding from these spots where the lights should be. The meeting places along the way - the fountain areas and monuments and rotundas- are stagnant and corroded. Honestly, it is as if this was built, opened to the public, and left alone with no intention to maintain it.  \nThere is nothing to see along the 2 miles we walked. The sea is not endowed with much beauty in this area. Give this one a skip. \n

203590554.name: Great, safe place to walk
203590554.author: a TripAdvisor user
203590554.reviewBody: The promenade was directly across the street from our hotel.  Walk early (7:00 am) , as it gets more hot and humid as the day goes on.

201923842.name: Great bars and view
201923842.author: a TripAdvisor user
201923842.reviewBody: Mid morning, had beer and was brought free chips and seafood. Watching the birds was magical, pelicans, frigate birds and many more. Fishermen relaxing.

196018026.name: Cam Promenade ; Fine views of the sea.
196018026.author: a TripAdvisor user
196018026.reviewBody: the entire length of the promenade offers something for visitors, we always spend time there when we are in the city. At the north end there are several pretty good restaurants, shady seating and patient waiters. At the extreme south end there is a small tienda for refrescos and snacks. At the south end there is an area where there is some sand and rocky outcrops where it is possible to swim, although this area is only about 100 feet wide. The promenade is so long it might be advisable to flag one of the many cabs to reach these extreme limits of the prominade. There are bike rentals at a tourist office near the sea gate. Riding along the prominade makes for an enjoyable and practical way to enjoy this space. Visit the piers along the way, fishermen are pretty friendly, amused that you would be interested in what theyre doing. On a clear evening the sunset is  very memorable, sunsets you will never be able to see on the east side of the Yucatan. All this and the historical district nearby, a rare find in Mexico.

195582424.name: Great Place to walk
195582424.author: a TripAdvisor user
195582424.reviewBody: We are walkers and Campeche\'s Malecon was a great place to walk.  We especially liked that there were three different paved paths - including one for bikes.

192402350.name: A nice walk between an ocean and a big road.
192402350.author: a TripAdvisor user
192402350.reviewBody: Loved the view of the ocean, fisherman, pelicans and other birds. The ocean front is cemented and secured from erosion, don\'t run to the beach looking for seashells! There\'s some nice bronze sculptures and cannons along the route. (For example, the large, bronze woman staring at the ocean and waiting for her pirate lover to come home is along this route.) But it was along a major road. So as long as I faced and focused ocean side, it was fun. But you never really escape the traffic.\n\nWe used it as a long, leisurely walk back from Fuerte de San Miguel (about 4 km). It was safe and direct for that purpose! And I can see that it would make a nice jogging route.

192338336.name: very nice
192338336.author: a TripAdvisor user
192338336.reviewBody: This boardwalk seemed to go on forever,  the view was fantastic. Although this area of the city is very modern, there are glimpess of the historical areas as well. There are a number of statues and we could stop along the way to watch the locals fishing,  however we did no see much catching.

189152977.name: Nicely developed, but average views
189152977.author: a TripAdvisor user
189152977.reviewBody: Very clean, organized, with ample parking, but the water view itself, wasn\'t so impressive. LOTS of people come here, but the water wasn\'t swim worthy, or a "day at the beach" type of place.

187864973.name: Unique and delightful
187864973.author: a TripAdvisor user
187864973.reviewBody: The promenade is not only cool but needed in this heavily trafficked town. It\'s a great place to walk or run against the backdrop of the Gulf of Mexico.

186320133.name: malecon
186320133.author: a TripAdvisor user
186320133.reviewBody: A long, wandering river walkway overlooking the bay. Wide sidewalks, a bicycle / jogging path, places to parkm your car, stores, hotels, restaurants and even a casino across the road. Just a lovely place for a nice long relaxing walk after dinner or just to go for a walk. Also safe - there are enough police cruising around and other people to make it a safe environment. We always spend time on the malecon when we visit Campeche.

185585633.name: The malecon is a great place to watch the sunset
185585633.author: a TripAdvisor user
185585633.reviewBody: One of the best parts about our short visit to Campeche was walking the malecon from the arch near the Plaza principal.  Fun to watch the waves, the birds and the people.

184160355.name: great place for a walk or jog
184160355.author: a TripAdvisor user
184160355.reviewBody: Lovely promenade all along the city\'s waterfront. Great place to catch the sunset or sunrise. Unfortunately the locals tell me it\'s too polluted to swim in but it is very pretty.

181200346.name: Great Place to Relax or Exercize
181200346.author: a TripAdvisor user
181200346.reviewBody: The promenade runs along the Gulf of Mexico for a few miles.  When we visited Campeche a few years ago the air along the promenade had a slight foul smell.  The city has cleaned up their sewage problem and now it is very pleasant to walk, run, ride a bike or simply relax and watch a beautiful sunset there.  My wife and I like many things about Campeche, and the promenade is certainly one of them.

174815464.name: Nicely done
174815464.author: a TripAdvisor user
174815464.reviewBody: Its a great place to sit alongside the Gulf of Mexico and watch people walking / jogging by.  The downside is you have to cross a busy street and the air off the ocean is often hot and sticky.

167449682.name: well planned walkway
167449682.author: a TripAdvisor user
167449682.reviewBody: They  have several pathways which makes walking, running, or riding a bike possible at the same time The statuary, and structural highlights are consistent with the location and attractive.

161012420.name: Stroll along the palm lined boulevard
161012420.author: a TripAdvisor user
161012420.reviewBody: Always a nice breeze in Campeche. There are walking and bike trails along the waterfront. It is well light for an evening walk also.

159575699.name: Amazing city!
159575699.author: a TripAdvisor user
159575699.reviewBody: The most amazing thing about the City of Campeche is that from so many vantage points you can see the old city dating back to the 1500\'s with modern glass skyscrapers in the background.  Confused City?  Hardly!  This is a City that both respects it\'s colorful past and embraces modernity, especially along the Malecon (the waterfront Promenade).  It\'s one of the longest in the Latin world with something for everyone from the tiniest tots (play areas and mini water parks) to older folks who just enjoy strolling in the cool breeze of the evening and appreciating the fountains and the view.  Lots of inexpensive but great eateries at the very northern end (North Americans wouldn\'t call them restaurants as they are simple, family run affairs with great cheap food - sample the coconut shrimp and you\'ll know what I mean).  We live just 3 hours away in Progreso and visit often when we have guests as Campeche is such a unique city - not to be missed!

156735262.name: Great for runners
156735262.author: a TripAdvisor user
156735262.reviewBody: Campeche is a beautiful city and the Malecon adds to it. It is the perfect place for jogging. Go early as heat begins getting bad before 9am.

156685866.name: Campeche - Lovely
156685866.author: a TripAdvisor user
156685866.reviewBody: This is a beautiful old colonial city. Lovely pastel coloured buildings along cobbled streets. The old city walls are still place and the main Plaza is mesmerising. With a Mayan archaeological Museum Campeche has it all. Well worth a stop over. Give yourself a full day to meander around and visit the plaza area at night as it\'s just as stunning.

155625713.name: VILLAGE OF BECAL
155625713.author: a TripAdvisor user
155625713.reviewBody: What a wonderful sleepy village, full of character, lovely people and a lovely place to browse at your own leisure. Speaking of the people they are readily to have a word with you, hand signs are a must, go to see this lovely place

152732028.name: Lovely to walk at night
152732028.author: a TripAdvisor user
152732028.reviewBody: The Malecon is well lit, with a walkway for pedestrians and another for bikes.  There many people out running, walking, biking, rollerblading or just sitting along the wall enjoying the evening.  It is very safe.  Every evening there is at least one fitness class going on and one night people were doing yoga.   On two separate evenings we grabbed a very delicious gelato that we found on a side street just off the Malecon, then walked back to our hotel enjoying every delicious mouthful.  Perfecto!

147608436.name: Campeche
147608436.author: a TripAdvisor user
147608436.reviewBody: We visited this town as a part of a Mayan Tour, and the old town itself is laid out so as to blend in with the more newer side, on the way we visited a typical shop making and selling straw hats, and also the old Pirate strong hold

145269015.name: Excellent
145269015.author: a TripAdvisor user
145269015.reviewBody: Very safe and clean. At night many people are out jogging along the waterfront some small groups are doing dancing and fitness. Feels very good and safe well used by the local populations and clearly a place for fitness and gathering for positive purposes.

139292056.name: Nice spot!!
139292056.author: a TripAdvisor user
139292056.reviewBody: A lovely spot and nice walk in the evening. It winds down the coast and has been very well maintained.

139106642.name: Promenade is too much to describe it
139106642.author: a TripAdvisor user
139106642.reviewBody: It has no bars, restaurants or whatever, no beach, just a pavement between the coast and a noisy street.

138803078.name: A nice very long boardwalk
138803078.author: a TripAdvisor user
138803078.reviewBody: It is a nice place to take a walk or go jogging in the evening. Many locals seem to do this.Great views of the gulf and well lit at nice.

136000570.name: Amazing sunset
136000570.author: a TripAdvisor user
136000570.reviewBody: It was a great place to walk along the water and see the sunset.\nIf you are walking there crossing the street can be a little difficult.

671192739.name: MURALLA DE CAMPECHE
671192739.author: a TripAdvisor user
671192739.reviewBody:
El espectáculo de luz, sonido y actuación de la Muralla de Campeche es Magnifica
Es en La Puerta de Tierra
Con Actores muy jóvenes que dan una explicación detallada de la fundación de Ciudad de Campeche.
También hay una presentación actuada muy buena.
Inicia a las 20 horas, con duración de 1 hora.
Es excelente para conocer mas de esta hermosa ciudad.
